description: NATIONAL HARBOR, Md.  This was Rich Hills moment, up on stage at the winter meetings Monday, back in the uniform of the Los Angeles Dodgers. The team had just agreed to give him $48 million for the next three years, a payday usually impossible for journeyman pitchers who are soon to be 37 years old. Hill slipped into the jersey, sat before a microphone and took a moment to compose himself. His voice cracked as he spoke.

title: Oil and Gas Industry Leaders Eagerly Take Stakes in Mexican Offshore Fields
description: MEXICO CITY  The international oil industry on Monday agreed to pay billions of dollars to the Mexican government for rights to drill in the countrys portions of the Gulf of Mexico.

title: Margaret Whitton, Major League Actress, Dies at 67
description: Margaret Whitton, an avid baseball fan who played the owner who concocts a plan to move the Cleveland Indians to Florida in the 1989 baseball movie comedy Major League, died on Sunday in Palm Beach, Fla. She was 67.

title: Matt Barnes of Sacramento Kings Sought in Assault Inquiry
description: Matt Barnes, a forward with the Sacramento Kings, was being sought by the police for questioning in connection with an alleged assault Monday morning inside Avenue, a nightclub on 10th Avenue in the Chelsea neighborhood of Manhattan.

title: Van Williams, TVs Green Hornet, Dies at 82
description: Van Williams, who played crime fighters on television during the 1960s, most notably the Green Hornet on a short-lived ABC show that later attained a cult following and that introduced American audiences to the martial arts master Bruce Lee, died last week in a care facility near his home in Scottsdale, Ariz. He was 82.

title: Want to Bring Back Jobs, Mr. President-Elect? Call Elon Musk
description: PALO ALTO, Calif.  Donald Trump: Please think about calling Elon Musk.

title: A New Wave of Popular Fury Could Hit Europe in 2017
description: PARIS  For Europe, 2016 has brought a series of political shocks: near-record numbers of immigrants arriving from the Middle East and Africa; a vote by Britain to leave the European Union and renewed threats by Russia to meddle on the continent.

title: Why Does Donald Trump Lie About Voter Fraud?
description: The long-running Republican war against the right to vote has now gone national at the instigation of President-elect Donald Trump, who has promoted the lie that millions of illegal votes were cast in the presidential election.

title: Baseball Hall of Fames View on the Steroid Era Is in Flux
description: Andre Dawson, the Hall of Fame outfielder, suggested on Monday it should remain the task of baseball writers  at least for now  to decide the legacy of players tainted by steroids.

title: Governor Cuomo Orders Investigation of Racial Bias in N.Y. State Prisons
description: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo of New York announced on Monday that he was ordering an investigation into racial bias in the state prison system after an investigation by The New York Times found that black inmates were punished at significantly higher rates than whites, sent to solitary confinement more often and held there longer.

title: District Attorney Asks for Grand Jury in Police Killing of Deborah Danner
description: In a sign of the legal and political stakes surrounding the death of a mentally ill woman killed by the police in October, the Bronx district attorney is asking the state to impanel a grand jury that would hear evidence solely from the fatal shooting.

title: Death of Tamil Nadus Leader Leaves Power Vacuum in Southern India
description: NEW DELHI  A paroxysm of grief began rippling through the southern Indian state of Tamil Nadu on Monday when its longtime leader, an imperious former starlet known by her followers as Amma, or Mother, was pronounced dead.

title: Oaklands Ghost Ship, Site of Fire, Was a Motley Warehouse With a History
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  The first complaint came in 2014. Piles of trash were reported next to the building. Later that year, construction materials blocking the sidewalk drew another complaint. Last month, another was lodged, leading to an investigation of illegal construction inside.

title: Sidewalk Scaffolding, the Unwanted Neighbor, Is Under Scrutiny
description: The scaffolding went up six years ago in front of a rundown apartment building on the Upper East Side of Manhattan. It was supposed to be temporary, to keep loose bricks and debris from raining down.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: Youve got a market economy, a gentrifying real estate market and people feeling that they need to go underground. But you bring it up to code, and suddenly you end up pricing out the people who make Oakland such a great place.

title: Finding Hate Crimes on the Rise, Leaders Condemn Vicious Acts
description: On Monday morning, a man shoved a New York City Transit worker down a staircase at Grand Central Terminal in Manhattan, screaming that she was a terrorist. Two days earlier, in Brooklyn, another man threatened an off-duty police officer with his pit bull, telling her and her son to go back to your country. Both women were wearing hijabs.

title: New York City Correction Officer Fatally Shot in Her Car in Brooklyn
description: A New York City correction officer was fatally shot in her car on Sunday in the Bergen Beach section of Brooklyn, the police said on Monday.

title: The Village Voice Names a New Top Editor, Again
description: The Village Voice, a once-iconic New York newspaper whose tumult in the last several years has overshadowed its journalism, has named a new top editor as it looks to regain its luster.

title: Review: Waiting to Connect in Levittown in The Babylon Line
description: Finding a voice as a writer often involves much throat clearing  false starts, rough drafts, crazy riffs and paralyzing stretches of analysis. Such self-consciousness occupies a lot (and I mean a lot) of stage time in The Babylon Line, Richard Greenbergs new play, which opened on Monday at the Mitzi E. Newhouse Theater at Lincoln Center.

title: Losing the Game
description: TUESDAY PUZZLE  I hate to be the bearer of bad news, but you lose. And the thing is, you might not even have any idea that you were playing a game. I blame the constructor Ed Sessa for this, because up until todays puzzle, I had a pretty good streak going.

title: Review: For The Wolves, the Goal Is to Win and to Be Heard
description: The Wolves, which opened in September 2016, reopened Monday night at Lincoln Centers Mitzi Newhouse Theater, at the Duke on 42nd Street, 229 West 42nd Street, Manhattan; 646-223-3010, playwrightsrealm.org. Here are excerpts from Ben Brantleys review, which appeared in The New York Times on Sept. 12.

title: Facebook and Other Tech Companies Seek to Curb Flow of Terrorist Content
description: SAN FRANCISCO  For all the good that has come from the internet, the online world has also served as a powerful device for recruiting terrorists and spreading their propaganda.

title: Giants Ben McAdoo Wants Calls on Odell Beckham Jr. Reviewed
description: Giants Coach Ben McAdoo did not endorse on Monday the inflammatory comments made a day earlier by wide receiver Odell Beckham Jr., who said after Sundays loss to Pittsburgh that because of past history, the officials overseeing the game should not be permitted to work future Giants games.

title: Yankees Have Their Limits in Pursuing a Closer, Brian Cashman Says
description: NATIONAL HARBOR, Md.  The Yankees pursuit of a proven elite closer will not be as simple as opening up the checkbook.

title: A Timeline From Standing Rock
description: From tear gas to Donald J. Trump: How the Dakota Access Pipeline protests have unfolded over the past several months.

title: Oakland Fire Victims Included Performers, Educators and Lawyers
description: They were musicians, poets, educators and baristas. Thirty-six people were killed in a fire at an electronic dance party at a warehouse in Oakland, Calif., last weekend, and the coroners bureau in Alameda County is releasing their names. It was one of the worst structure fires in the United States in over a decade.

title: Terrorism Conviction of a Wiretapped American Is Upheld on Appeal
description: WASHINGTON  A federal appeals court on Monday upheld the 2013 conviction of a Somali-American man for trying to detonate a bomb at a Christmas tree lighting ceremony in Portland, Ore., rejecting his arguments that the F.B.I. had entrapped him and that the government had unconstitutionally intercepted his emails without a warrant.

title: At the Site of Past Titanic Battles, UConn Edges Syracuse in a Throwback
description: During Madison Square Gardens latest renovation in 2013, an exhibit was installed that paid homage to the 2009 Big East Conference tournament quarterfinal between Syracuse and Connecticut, an epic game that went six overtimes, with the Orange ultimately outlasting the Huskies, 127-117.

title: Ryan Fitzpatrick Is Benched for Good as Jets Fall Meekly to Colts
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  The transition of power came awkwardly, one more fumbled moment as a coda to a long night of them.

title: Manuel Valls, Matteo Renzi, Brexit: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Corrections: December 6, 2016
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: Sometimes Second Can Be the Top Prize in the Champions League
description: MANCHESTER, England  To Pep Guardiola, as to anyone involved in elite sports, the very idea of being second best is anathema. So Guardiola, the Manchester City manager, did not need to pause for thought when he was asked whether, in certain circumstances, there is no difference between coming in second and finishing first.

title: Whats on TV Tuesday: This Is Us and Barbara Walters Presents
description: This Is Us ends the first half of Season 1 with a journey to a Christmas Eve past. Barbara Walters looks back at the affair that changed the way politics are covered. And Fanny and Alexander is filled with some of the most magical holiday scenes ever.

title: Can You Get Too Much Protein?
description: Protein has achieved a venerated status in the dietary world for everything from building muscle to preventing weight gain. But can you get too much of a good thing?

title: Word + Quiz: incarnate
As He Turns 100, John Morris Recalls a Century in Photojournalism
description: As he turns 100, John Morris looks back at a career spent editing some of the most influential photographers of the last century.

title: Confessions Made Under Duress Tarnish Chinas Graft Fight, Report Says
description: BEIJING  Zhang Haiming, an official in eastern China, was led away by Communist Party investigators and months later stood trial, like thousands of other cadres caught in President Xi Jinpings ferocious drive against corruption.

title: A Momentary Setback for Europes Right-Wingers
description: On Sunday, Austrian voters rejected the far-right, anti-immigrant candidate Norbert Hofers bid to become president, handing the Green Party leader Alexander Van der Bellen a decisive victory. Martin Schulz, president of the European Parliament, tweeted that Mr. Van der Bellens victory is a heavy defeat of nationalism and anti-European, backward-looking populism.

title: How the War Ends in Syria
description: TOWNSHEND, Vt.  The civil war in Syria is over. Now it is time to stop the fighting.

title: A Year of Big Ideas in Social Change
description: Conventional wisdom says that by the time a student is flunking ninth grade, its too late to help. (Some people say that about first grade, too.) A program in Baltimore named Thread, which focuses on students in three high schools who are in the bottom quarter of their class, beginning in ninth grade, is proving that wrong.

title: The Stain of Racism in New Yorks Prisons
description: New Yorkers are grimly familiar with state prison horror stories featuring guards who beat and torture inmates, knowing that their union will shield them from punishment and that district attorneys in towns dominated by prisons will look the other way.

title: Team Trumps New Pledge on Tax Cuts
description: CNBC isnt a place people usually go to speak truth to wealth. Its the unofficial television network of Wall Street and the channel that helped launch the Tea Party movement, thanks to a reporters 2009 on-air rant.

title: How Loud Are Your Headphones?
description: Many models of headphones make varying claims about reducing the noise your ears are exposed to. With the help of an audiologist, The New York Times has put together this experiment to demonstrate how much sound your ears may be picking up when you listen to music over headphones.

title: Childrens Headphones May Carry Risk of Hearing Loss
description: These days, even 3-year-olds wear headphones, and as the holidays approach, retailers are well stocked with brands that claim to be safe for young ears or to deliver 100 percent safe listening. The devices limit the volume at which sound can be played; parents rely on them to prevent children from blasting, say, Rihanna at hazardous levels that could lead to hearing loss.

title: What the Renminbi Chart Should Look Like
description: A sudden drop in the Chinese currencys value seems to have been caused by a technical issue, not manipulation.

title: Chinas Currency Didnt Really Drop, Despite Jitters Over Trump
description: HONG KONG  Donald J. Trump has irritated China even before taking office as president, with criticism of the countrys trade and currency practices and an unexpected phone call with the president of Taiwan.

title: As He Turns 100, John Morris Recalls a Century in Photojournalism
description: John Morris may be an avowed pacifist, but his career has been largely defined by war. He was born during WWl, was Robert Capas photo editor at Life magazine during WWll and was the first to put graphic photos of the Vietnam War on the New York Times front page. He is widely considered to be one of the most important editors in the history of photography.

title: Christmas Lights
South Koreas Leader Offers to Quit in April, but Its Unlikely to Be Enough
description: SEOUL, South Korea  South Koreas embattled president, Park Geun-hye, has offered to step down in April, leaders of her party said on Tuesday after meeting with her. But the offer was unlikely to prevent an impeachment vote on Friday over a corruption scandal that has turned the vast majority of the public against her.

title: Is It Wrong to Have a General Run the Pentagon?
Questions for: Harvesting Government History, One Web Page at a Time
description: Article: Harvesting Government History, One Web Page at a Time

title: A Floating Courthouse Takes the Rule of Law to Brazils Frontier
description: ITAMATATUBA, Brazil  As the riverboat anchored at dawn in Itamatatuba, a far-flung outpost of the Brazilian Amazon, the court clerk rose from his hammock onboard. The bailiffs sipped their coffee. The judge rubbed the sleep from her eyes.

title: Justice on a Floating Courtroom
description: Climb aboard a judges riverboat court as it travels through the Amazon.

title: We Dont Talk About Radicalization When an Attacker Isnt Muslim. We Should.
description: Whenever a mass shooting or some other large-scale, incomprehensible attack occurs, the nation collectively holds its breath, waiting to see which set of cultural prejudices can be mobilized to frame the massacre. In the week before the election, when two officers from the Des Moines area were murdered in cold blood, a police spokesman may have gotten ahead of himself when he said that there are some not-so-positive views of law enforcement that a certain segment of our population holds. What was probably being hinted at here was that the shooter had to be black and all worked up by the Black Lives Matter movement  a presumption immediately squelched once the suspect was identified as Scott Michael Greene, a white local who had enjoyed engaging in racial incitement by waving a Confederate flag at a high-school football game.

title: From Michael Lewis, the Story of Two Friends Who Changed How We Think About the Way We Think
description: THE UNDOING PROJECTA Friendship That Changed Our MindsBy Michael Lewis362 pp. W.W. Norton & Company. $28.95.

title: What America Can Learn From Smart Schools in Other Countries
description: Every three years, half a million 15-year-olds in 69 countries take a two-hour test designed to gauge their ability to think. Unlike other exams, the PISA, as it is known, does not assess what teenagers have memorized. Instead, it asks them to solve problems they havent seen before, to identify patterns that are not obvious and to make compelling written arguments. It tests the skills, in other words, that machines have not yet mastered.

title: What Are Your Reactions to President-Elect Trumps Cabinet Appointments?
description: From George Washingtons presidency until today, the president of the United States has always had a cabinet, a group of close advisers who help him make decisions about how to run the country. Since winning the election, President-elect Donald J. Trump has named many of the individuals he will nominate to serve as members of his cabinet.

title: Trump Plans Technology Conference With Silicon Valley Executives
description: President-elect Donald J. Trump plans a technology conference next week with high-profile business executives, many of whom opposed his campaign.

title: Life in Obamacares Dead Zone
description: In the Riverview Gardens apartment complex, roused by the sounds of her neighbors waking, Janet Foy stepped over the anatomy-and-physiology textbook she fell asleep reading and vowed to herself that today would be the day she finally came back to life. That today she could start reclaiming some of the confidence she once felt when she stood onstage at church and sang about forgiveness and redemption and You who make all things new. At 56, Foy was broke, jobless and living with her older sister in public housing in Kansas City, Mo., and she didnt feel much like singing anymore.

title: Hotel Project Would Revive Embodiment of Jet Age at Kennedy Airport
description: In 1962, the architect Eero Saarinens Trans World Flight Center at Kennedy International Airport seemed poised to ascend, its 310-foot-wide concrete wings flexed in hopeful upstroke as a memorable symbol of the globe-girdling Trans World Airlines.

title: Saudis Bankroll Taliban, Even as King Officially Supports Afghan Government
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Fifteen years, half a trillion dollars and 150,000 lives since going to war, the United States is trying to extricate itself from Afghanistan. Afghans are being left to fight their own fight. A surging Taliban insurgency, meanwhile, is flush with a new inflow of money.

title: Roman Polanski Extradition Request Rejected by Polands Supreme Court
description: WARSAW  The Polish Supreme Court on Tuesday rejected a government request to extradite Roman Polanski, the Oscar-winning filmmaker, to the United States over a decades-old conviction for having sex with a 13-year-old girl.

title: On Matteo Renzi
description: Prime Minister Matteo Renzi of Italy tendered his resignation on Monday.

description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Morning Agenda: Italy Adds to Unknowns, Paging Elon Musk, Elliotts Diplomacy
description: For Italians, who have seen 63 governments in 70 years, the resignation of Prime Minister Matteo Renzi was hardly shocking.

title: New York Today: Treasures in Our Waters
description: Updated, 9:23 a.m.

title: Ann Patchetts Guide for Bookstore Lovers
description: The pilgrims have been coming to Nashville for as long as the Grand Ole Opry has been on the radio. They come for Fan Fair and Taylor Swift concerts or just to walk down Lower Broad in cowboy boots. Parents visit their children in college. Conventioneers deplane by the thousands. Nashville is a hip city now, with a food scene, an art scene and two poorly performing professional sports teams.

title: A Bookworms Travel Plan
description: Years ago, while I was in Antigua with my family, disaster struck. I ran out of good books. This was before the age of Kindle, so I didnt have the download option, but even if Id had it, books via pixels arent for me. I need the real thing: a solid slab that I can hold in my hands.

title: The Best Theater of 2016
description: The New York theater talked back this year  to its audiences, to a nation, to the world. This new boldness made international headlines when a cast member of the blockbuster musical Hamilton (still dominating Broadway more than a year after its opening) addressed an audience member from the stage during curtain calls  one Mike Pence, the vice president-elect  on the importance of honoring his countrys diversity.

title: K.K.R., With Deal for Cybersecurity Company, Extends Its Flurry of Activity
description: SAN FRANCISCO  In an ever-crowded field of investors pouring money into the technology industry, Kohlberg Kravis Roberts was among the first. And with a nearly $2 billion deal, the investment giant will extend its multibillion-dollar flurry of activity from the past year.

title: The Far Right Suffers a Defeat in Austria. What Can We Learn?
description: GRAZ, Austria  Following the Brexit referendum in June and the election of Donald J. Trump in November, Austrias presidential election on Sunday was closely watched as an indicator of whether right-wing populists would continue their 2016 winning streak. For now, at least, they havent.

title: Black Workers Suit Accuses Job Agency of Favoring Hispanic Applicants
description: A group of African-American workers filed a class-action lawsuit in federal court on Tuesday against a nationwide job placement agency and several of its clients, accusing them of discriminating against black applicants by favoring Hispanic applicants.

title: Europe Presses American Tech Companies to Tackle Hate Speech
description: European officials pushed on Tuesday for American technology giants to do more to tackle online hate speech across the region, adding to the chorus of policy makers worldwide demanding greater action from the likes of Facebook, Google and Twitter.

title: Were Londons Fashion Awards Really the Oscars-Meets-the-Met-Gala?
description: LONDON  The British Fashion Council has finally introduced its much-hyped, new-look, star-studded Fashion Awards (minus the British, which was bumped off the official moniker to better convey the international identity of the affair). Were the awards on Monday night, as the council had trumpeted when it first unveiled plans this spring for a revamped prize-giving, the Met Gala meets the Academy Awards, only on this side of the Atlantic?

title: Dominic Ongwen, Ugandan Rebel Leader, Denies Charges at I.C.C. Trial
description: A senior commander of the notorious Ugandan rebel group the Lords Resistance Army went on trial on Tuesday to face charges of organizing massacres and kidnapping thousands of children, 11 years after an international warrant for his arrest.

title: California Today: An Outpouring of Support in Oakland
description: Good morning.

title: Did You Change Your Name When You Married?
description: A womans name, and whether it changes after marriage, is deeply personal, but also often influenced by her culture, political environment and sometimes even the law.

title: Beyonc Leads With 9 Grammy Nominations
description: The Grammy Awards may come down to a battle of the superdivas.

title: Google Says It Will Run Entirely on Renewable Energy in 2017
description: MINCO, Okla.  Last year, Google consumed as much energy as the city of San Francisco. Next year, it said, all of that energy will come from wind farms and solar panels.

title: Obama, in Major National Security Speech, Defends Counterterrorism Legacy
description: TAMPA, Fla.  In his final planned address on national security as commander in chief, President Obama said on Tuesday that for eight years, his administration protected the nation against major terrorist attacks from abroad while adhering to American values and the rule of law.

title: Marie Kondo: How to Choose Happiness
description: This is an article from Turning Points, a magazine that explores what critical moments from this year might mean for the year ahead.

title: 2017 Grammy Nominations
description: Record of the Year

title: The Top Political Tweets and Hashtags of 2016
description: Twitter announced on Tuesday the years biggest trending topics and most widely shared tweets in news and politics, and while the election loomed large, several of the most popular discussions were focused on matters of identity and safety.

title: Top Chinese Financier Pleads Guilty to Insider Trading
description: SHANGHAI  One of Chinas best-known financiers, sometimes called his countrys equivalent to Carl C. Icahn, has pleaded guilty to insider trading and stock price manipulation, in a case that forms part of a broader nationwide push against financial improprieties.

title: German Court Upholds Nuclear Exit but Orders Compensation for Power Companies
description: BERLIN  Germanys highest court on Tuesday upheld the governments decision in 2011 to shut its nuclear reactors ahead of schedule, but it ruled that power companies must be compensated for losses incurred as a result of that decision.

title: From the Editors: A Cataclysmic Year
description: This special report contains the fruits of our annual search for turning points, the events, trends, inventions and ideas that will move the compass needles of our lives. We found many, and they all matter, but in the end, 2016 will enter history as a pivot that revealed the depth of the fears, alienation and frustration of our times, abruptly upending many of our assumptions about the future.

title: Instagram Introduces New Tools Meant to Curb Abuse and Expand Privacy
description: Instagram announced on Tuesday that it would be providing more tools for users to protect themselves and others from online abuse by allowing them to remove comments and filter out certain followers.

title: My Proud Pilgrimage to My Homeland
description: The forward trenches in the hills just beyond the abandoned village of Talish, in Nagorno-Karabakh, are reminiscent of World War I: long, endless, slits in the ground, the dirt buttressed by wood, with periodic firing posts and dugouts. Stacked tires packed with dirt stand in for sandbags, but otherwise it looks like the Western Front 100 years ago. Behind the trenches, alongside the road, tanks are angled to counterattack.

title: 1916: Mr. Lloyd George Resigns
description: LONDON  The Government crisis developed to-day with dramatic swiftness. First of all came the news that Mr. Lloyd George had resigned his position as Secretary of State for War owing to the fact that the Premier had firmly declined to accept his proposal for the formation of a War Council from which he, Mr. Asquith, would be excluded. This announcement was followed shortly afterwards by an official intimation that Mr. Asquith had tendered his resignation to the King, and later it was announced that His Majesty had accepted.

title: E.U. Leaders Talk Tough on Brexit and Warn That Time Is Short
description: BRUSSELS  For months, Britains government has suggested that, when the country leaves the European Union, it will be able to retain many of the economic advantages of membership in the bloc.

title: Cancel Order! Donald Trump Attacks Plans for Upgraded Air Force One
description: WASHINGTON  President-elect Donald J. Trump took a shot on Tuesday at one of the nations largest manufacturers, Boeing, sharply criticizing a pending order for a new Air Force One and suggesting that the company was doing a little bit of a number with the cost of the next generation of presidential aircraft.

title: I Want to Kiss America: A Woman Who Fled Nazis, Then Russia, Makes a Life in Brooklyn
description: Under the cover of night, the family crowded into a wagon used to carry animals to flee the Nazi troops marching toward their hometown, Nalchik, in south-central Russia. It was 1942, and Polina Davydovas father had returned from war wounded and requiring crutches to walk. He was now orchestrating the familys escape farther south, to Derbent, a city on the Caspian Sea.

title: Klay Thompson Pours In 60 Points, in Just 29 Minutes
description: It hardly seems fair.

title: Wells Fargo Killing Sham Account Suits by Using Arbitration
description: In congressional hearing rooms and on national television, Wells Fargo has vowed to make things right for the thousands of customers who were given sham accounts.

title: Much-Loved Milwaukee Tearoom Prepares for Its Last Pour
description: MILWAUKEE  When Carrie Matteson heard that the Watts Tea Shop would close at the end of the year after nearly 90 years in business, she knew she had to take her newly married daughter-in-law, Leah, to experience the beloved restaurant before it vanished.

title: Supreme Court Sides With Prosecutors in Insider Trading Case
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court on Tuesday unanimously ruled in favor of prosecutors in a major insider trading case, saying that gifts of confidential information from business executives to relatives violate securities laws.

title: Guggenheim Unveils New Works & Process Lineup
description: Works & Process, the Solomon R. Guggenheim Museum series that provides intimate glimpses behind the scenes of coming premieres, will return in January for a spring season that includes Broadway divas, a reimagined opera at the Met and two new ballets by the celebrated choreographer Alexei Ratmansky.

title: Adding Desktop Icons for Windows 10
description: Q. I want to make Windows 10 appear more like earlier versions of Windows. Is it possible to put an icon for My Computer on my desktop?

title: Coached by the Zen Master, the Knicks Try Mindfulness
description: Derrick Rose had never attempted mindfulness sessions in his first seven years in the N.B.A. There had been moments with his therapist here and there that seemed similar, but nothing overseen by the Chicago Bulls. Just the thought of Tom Thibodeau, his old coach, looming over a meditation setting, his gravelly voice booming as he tried to instill calm, made Rose laugh.

title: Doug Mills, Staff Photographer, Flies West With President-Elect Trump
description: The press pool does not travel on the same plane as President-elect Trump, so the 13-member press pool flew on a small Gulf Stream aircraft ahead of Mr. Trump. Mr. Trumps senior strategist, Stephen K. Bannon, and his son-in-law Jared Kushner descended from the rear of the president-elects plane just moments before Mr. Trump and Mike Pence, the vice president-elect, did.

title: 4 Classic Watches and Their Cheap(er) Alternatives
description: Why hold out for a big-ticket timepiece when less expensive chic abounds?

description: With new silhouettes and artful details, the traditional mens staple takes a subversive turn.

title: Daily Report: Googles Renewable Cloud
description: The next cat video you play on YouTube may help the green energy industry.

title: Derek Jeters No. 2, Last of Yankees Single Digits, to Be Retired
description: The Yankees will retire Derek Jeters No. 2 jersey and honor him with a plaque in Monument Park on May 14, Mothers Day, making official what had been expected long before he retired after the 2014 season.

title: Harry Bensons Photographs
description: A look through the photographers archives.

title: Harry Benson, an Early Photographer of Trump, Looks Back and Forward
description: You may have thought Harry Benson had seen it all.

title: The Lessons From Argentina
description: The United States should not turn away from Latin America as many populist contingents, both Republican and Democratic, have suggested. Instead, we would be well served to model our economic policy off the experiences of an unlikely economic role model: Argentina.

title: A Proposal for a Canadian National Bird Ruffles Feathers
description: OTTAWA  With Canadas 150th anniversary looming next year, a gap was noticed in the countrys roster of patriotic icons. It had a national anthem, a national tree, two national animals, two national sports  but no national bird.

title: The Phrase One Artist Lives (and Works) By
description: In this series for T, the writer and author of Worn Stories, Emily Spivack, interviews creative types about their most prized possessions.

title: Kofi Annan, in Myanmar, Voices Concern Over Reported Abuses of Rohingya
description: HONG KONG  Kofi Annan, the former head of the United Nations, said in Myanmar on Tuesday that he was deeply concerned by reports of human rights abuses in the countrys restive Rakhine State, where dozens of Rohingya Muslims are said to have been killed since October in a crackdown by the military.

title: A Dilemma for Humanity: Stark Inequality or Total War
description: Is there nothing to be done about galloping inequality?

title: A Bigger Economic Pie, but a Smaller Slice for Half of the U.S.
description: Even with all the setbacks from recessions, burst bubbles and vanishing industries, the United States has still pumped out breathtaking riches over the last three and half decades.

title: How to Know What Donald Trump Really Cares About: Look at What Hes Insulting
description: A look at two years worth of messages suggests hes using Twitter much the way he was before becoming a candidate: to react to whatevers in front of him.

title: Supreme Court Gives Samsung a Reprieve in Apple Patent Case
description: WASHINGTON  A unanimous Supreme Court ruled on Tuesday that Samsung may not have to give up $399 million in profits for copying parts of the distinctive look of Apples iPhone.

title: Alia Shawkat Owns Her Curly-Haired Cool
description: Alia Shawkat, known for her role as Maeby Fnke in Arrested Development, grew up working in Hollywood. Now 27, Ms. Shawkat never fell prey to the homogeneous beauty standards imposed by the industry, and she is comfortable with her own curly-haired hipster look. Her new comedy, called Search Party, just had its debut on TBS, and she will appear in the movie 20th Century Women, out later this month. Born in Palm Springs, Calif., she now lives in Los Angeles.

title: Irans President Says Donald Trump Cant Tear Up Nuclear Pact
description: TEHRAN  Irans president said on Tuesday that he simply would not allow President-elect Donald J. Trump to tear up last years nuclear agreement and warned of unspecified consequences if he did.

title: A Muslim Police Officer Attacked in Brooklyn
description: This Week in Hate tracks hate crimes and harassment around the country since the election of Donald Trump. The Southern Poverty Law Center and other groups are keeping detailed counts of harassment and abuse. We will regularly present a selection of incidents to show the scope of the problem.

title: Aska
description: New Nordic flavors have an insistent presence at the chef Fredrik Berseliuss new restaurant in Williamsburg, Brooklyn.

title: At Aska, a Nordic Chefs Vision Bears Fruit (and Lichens)
description: One of the 20 or so courses served to me the first time I ate at the new Aska in Brooklyn was a cluster of nasturtium leaves, next to a bundle of burned herb sprigs and flower stalks, tied up with a string. It looked pretty and pagan at the same time, like a page from a Martha Stewart lifestyle magazine for witches.

title: Climate Change Will Bring Wetter Storms in U.S., Study Says
description: Decades of research (and perhaps your own recent experiences on hot, humid days) have suggested that climate change will lead to an increase in big storms that cause flash floods, landslides and other natural disasters. Now, a new study shows that such intense precipitation will most likely increase across the continental United States, but with important regional variations.

title: Timeline: A History of Insider Trading
description: Trading of securities by company executives based on inside information has been illegal throughout much of the history of corporate America, but enforcement has evolved over time.

title: Saudi Court Orders Executions for 15 Accused of Spying for Iran
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  A court in Saudi Arabia sentenced 15 men to death on Tuesday for spying on behalf of Iran, after a trial that a Western human rights organization characterized as a travesty of justice.

title: David Villa of New York City F.C. Named M.L.S.s Top Player
description: David Villa, the Spanish striker who scored 23 goals this season to lead New York City F.C. to its first playoff berth, was named Major League Soccers most valuable player on Tuesday.

title: The Best New Podcasts of 2016
description: Podcasts are personal. Unlike the wide public broadcast of radio, a podcast begins whenever you touch play, then courses through your headphones and directly into your ears. Listening to a great podcast can feel like falling into conversation with a new best friend or eavesdropping on an infatuating crush. A bad one is like sitting next to the wrong stranger on the subway. Here are 10 good ones that debuted in 2016.

title: Angela Merkel Calls for Ban on Full-Face Veils in Germany
description: ESSEN, Germany  To loud applause, Chancellor Angela Merkel told her party members on Tuesday that Germany should ban full-face veils wherever legally possible and that it would not tolerate any application of Shariah law over German justice.

title: Donald Trump, Angela Merkel, Manuel Valls: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Supreme Court Case Has Bankruptcy World on Edge
description: The Supreme Court will hear arguments on Wednesday in a case that could upend the common practice that ranks lenders, employees and other creditors in order of priority as they try to recover their money when a company files for bankruptcy.

title: Jeff Koons Designs a Snowboard (With an Assist From Plato)
description: Around three years ago, at the urging of his children, the artist Jeff Koons learned how to snowboard. To his surprise, he fell in love with the sport  and it wasnt just shreddin the gnar that captivated him.

title: Deciding Who Should Get First Dibs in Bankruptcy Liquidations
description: The Supreme Court is scheduled to hear arguments in Czyzewski v. Jevic Holding Corp. on Wednesday. At issue is whether a bankruptcy court can approve a settlement that distributes the debtors remaining assets in a way that could not be done under a Chapter 11 plan, at least not without the agreement of all creditors. In this case, some of the parties agreed to settle the case and to pay out the debtors cash to some of the creditors, but they intentionally skipped a class of creditors who were entitled to priority payment under the bankruptcy code.

title: Joe McKnight Shooting: Man Is Charged Days Later in Fatal Road Rage
description: Ronald Gasser, who admitted to the police that he had shot and killed the former N.F.L. player Joe McKnight in Louisiana, was arrested on Monday and charged with manslaughter  four days after the authorities faced widespread criticism for initially freeing him.

title: Brazilian Meat Merchant Plans a Less Complicated I.P.O.
description: JBS, the Brazilian meatpacker, sharpened its carve-up blade. On Monday, the $8 billion company filed papers for an initial public offering of its overseas business, trying again after a government shareholder rejected an earlier plan that could have put the unit under control of a foreign parent. The new deal should lower capital costs, but with fewer complications.

title: Cheerleading and Muay Thai Given Provisional Olympic Status
description: LAUSANNE, Switzerland  The International Olympic Committees executive board voted on Tuesday to recognize cheerleading and the combat sport Muay Thai, meaning that the governing body for each sport will receive at least $25,000 annually from the committee and have the opportunity to apply for additional grants.

title: Why People Overeat
description: To the Editor:

title: Yoga for Everyone
description: Whether you are young or old, overweight or fit, yoga has the power to calm the mind and strengthen the body. Dont be intimidated by yoga terminology, fancy yoga studios and complicated poses. Yoga is for everyone.

title: Ode to Leonard Cohen, From a Fellow Zen Monk
description: When I met Leonard Cohen, I was a failed writer, and I acted like one. We were waiting to bow into the walking meditation line at the Rinzai-ji Zen Center in Los Angeles. I pretended I didnt know who he was and asked him if my Ford Festiva was parked in the right place.

title: For Lukas Graham, 7 Years Changed Everything and Nothing
description: I was in the middle of changing a diaper when I was told that we were nominated for three Grammys, Lukas Forchhammer said this morning from a tour bus, somewhere between Minneapolis and Philadelphia. Completely surreal.

title: Red Sox and White Sox Trade, Seeing Future in Each Others Roster
description: NATIONAL HARBOR, Md.  The Boston Red Sox won the American League East but were swept in the first playoff round. The Chicago White Sox slapped a downward-facing arrow on their ballpark and watched their crosstown rivals win the World Series. These teams, you might say, were ideal partners for the trade that jolted the winter meetings.

title: Help for Victims of Terror
description: To the Editor:

title: Icons: Graham, Cunningham, Taylor Features Works by Dance Giants
description: Works by three titans of dance  Martha Graham, Merce Cunningham and Paul Taylor  will share the stage in a triple bill that has been added to the coming season of Paul Taylor American Modern Dance.

title: A Plea to Electors: Vote Your Conscience
description: To the Editor:

title: Ghana Presidential Vote Hinges on Economic Perceptions
description: ACCRA, Ghana  In the four years that Ghanas president, John Mahama, has been in office, the nations economy has plunged along with oil and commodities prices. The West African country is on track this year to grow at its slowest rate in more than two decades.

title: Dangerous Curves
description: The plus-size women who pole dance.

title: Philippines HP promo slideshow
description: Philippines HP promo slideshow

title: After a Setback, a Season Watching From a Distance
description: It was a year ago, and Tom Thibodeau was still coping with the reality that he was newly unemployed when his phone began to ring.

title: Dangerous Curves
description: Long before my friend Roslyn Mays became a pole-dancing sensation, we were teammates on our high schools soccer field. Even back then Roz was bold and outspoken. I remember her reciting Maya Angelou poems during all-school meetings and leading cheers during soccer games from her position on the defensive line. I was a shy teenager, more comfortable observing people from the sidelines. I was awed by Roz back then and remember wondering what it must feel like to be so self-assured.

title: Oscar Documentary Shortlist Focuses on Politics and Race
description: Weiner, 13th, Eagle Huntress and O.J.: Made in America were among the 15 finalists for the best feature documentary Oscar, according to a shortlist released by the academy on Tuesday.

title: Health Insurers List Demands if Affordable Care Act Is Killed
description: The nations health insurers, resigned to the idea that Republicans will repeal the Affordable Care Act, on Tuesday publicly outlined for the first time what the industry wants to stay in the state marketplaces, which have provided millions of Americans with insurance under the law.

title: Jubilant Libyan Militias Declare Victory Over ISIS in Surt
description: LONDON  Libyan fighters declared victory over the Islamic State at its coastal stronghold of Surt on Tuesday, ending the extremist groups ambitions for a caliphate on the southern shores of the Mediterranean.

title: How Would the Electoral College Dump Donald Trump?
description: Recount battles in Michigan, Wisconsin and Pennsylvania are not expected to yield an Electoral College victory for Hillary Clinton. That leaves one last-ditch opportunity to bar Donald Trump from the White House: the Electoral College vote on Dec. 19, when 538 electors will gather in their respective states to choose the president. On Monday, Christopher Suprun, an elector from Texas, became the first Republican to say publicly that he wont vote for Mr. Trump, who won his state. Mr. Suprun mentioned Gov. John Kasich of Ohio as a Republican he could support. But on Tuesday, Mr. Kasich said he wasnt interested.

title: A Handful of Nuts Is Good for Your Health
description: A handful of nuts a day may be enough to reduce the risk for death from heart disease and other ills.

title: Pistachio Buns
description: These breakfast buns with pistachio paste, strawberry jam and rose-water syrup are the perfect accompaniment to a mug of tea.

title: The Years Best Baking Cookbooks: Radical Ideas, Classic Treats
description: In the world of baking cookbooks, the ones written by pastry chefs are glamorous things, filled with the caramel-spangled drama you would expect to see at the end of a 12-course tasting menu. But however ambitious they are on the page, the recipes often fall short in the kitchen, leaving a frustrated cook amid a trail of fallen souffls.

title: Reviving an Old French Bistro, the American Way
description: When youre behind one of the most praised new restaurants in New York City, perhaps even in the country, what comes next? For Stephen Starr, the megawatt restaurant mogul from Philadelphia, and chef Daniel Rose, a Parisian by way of Chicago, who together opened the highly acclaimed French restaurant Le Coucou over the summer, the answer is to simply open another restaurant. But this time in Paris, in an old bistro that was originally opened in 1958.

title: The Power of Being Human
description: When Martha Bird hangs out at the office, shes not slacking off  shes looking for ways to better connect people with technology. Her work benefits one out of six workers in the U.S.

title: Review: Shut Eye on Hulu Follows a Scamming, Small-Time Psychic
description: The hero of Shut Eye, a new series on Hulu, is a small-time Los Angeles psychic who used to be a big-time Las Vegas magician. In his former life he designed elaborate tricks, one of which he sold to Ford. (The disappearing lion became a disappearing Mustang.) Now he fleeces gullible parlor marks while serving as a bagman for the Roma family that controls the storefront psychic business in the north half of Los Angeles. Like a lot of Americans these days, hes feeling downwardly mobile.

title: Reggie Watts, the Tip of Comedys Absurdist Spear
description: In his endearing HBO comedy special Faces and Sounds, which debuted over the weekend, Pete Holmes makes an unapologetic argument for joy. Thats why youre here, he says. To cash happy checks.

title: Dan Kluger Builds on His Past, at Loring Place
description: LORING PLACE At 43, the chef Dan Kluger, who has worked in the kitchens of many top names, was eager to be on his own and get his new restaurant off the ground. But compromises were not on his agenda, so it wound up taking two years. Even finding a name was, as he put it, a struggle. (Its the street in the Fordham section of the Bronx where his father lived.) The spacious double storefront from 1848, on the increasingly attractive stretch of Eighth Street west of Fifth Avenue, looks as if it was worth the wait. Whitewashed brick walls contain a barroom and a bilevel dining room decorated simply, with a nod to midcentury modern. Mr. Klugers food is seasonal and market driven. And it builds on his experience working with chefs like Floyd Cardoz at Tabla, which shapes the flavors in his suckling pig and on his cauliflower with Indian seasonings, and Jean-Georges Vongerichten at ABC Kitchen, which inspired a vegetable focus on the menu. Local sourcing is so important to him that hes grinding wheat from upstate for pasta extruded in-house. (Opens Saturday): 21 West Eighth Street, 212-388-1831, loringplacenyc.com.

title: Chanel Collection des Mtiers dArt
description: Chanels Mtiers dArt show at the Ritz hotel in Paris.

title: 41 Murder Scenes. 57 Bodies. 35 Days in Manila. A Photographers Perspective.
description: Times Insider delivers behind-the-scenes insights into The New York Times. In this podcast, the Times photographer Daniel Berehulak talks about his reporting on the drug war in the Philippines.

title: Russia Updates Plan to Counter Cyberattacks and Foreign Influence
description: MOSCOW  The Kremlin published a new plan on Tuesday to defend Russia against what it described as stepped-up cyberattacks and information-psychological methods by foreign intelligence agencies bent on influencing its population with online information.

title: An Entertaining Plan to Maximize Mingling
description: A buffet is the driverless car of entertaining. Guests help themselves to dinner, no precisely measured settings required, and when all is well programmed, the host rarely has to grab the wheel.

title: Review: Against Empathy, or the Right Way to Feel Someones Pain
description: Paul Blooms new book, Against Empathy: The Case for Rational Compassion, is too highbrow to be a self-help or parenting manual, but parts of it could be. Its wingspan is too wide to be a simple guide to philanthropy, but parts of it could be that as well. And its a bit too clotted with caveats to be a seamless read, which is a shame, because it could have been, with more shaping.

title: Puccinis Madama Butterfly Returns to the Scene of a Disastrous Opening
description: MILAN  The last time Puccinis original version of Madama Butterfly was performed at the Teatro alla Scala here, it was over a century ago and it was a fiasco. The operas 1904 premiere was met with grunts, growls, gibes, bellows, sneers, one observer recalled, producing a pandemonium, during which it was difficult to hear anything.

title: Doles Role in Trump-Taiwan Relationship
description: The law firm Alston & Bird filed disclosure documents with the Justice Department, as required by law, at the end of November detailing the role that former Senator Bob Dole played in cultivating a relationship between the Taiwanese government and President-elect Donald J. Trump's staff.

title: Bob Dole Worked Behind the Scenes on Trump-Taiwan Call
description: WASHINGTON  Former Senator Bob Dole, acting as a foreign agent for the government of Taiwan, worked behind the scenes over the past six months to establish high-level contact between Taiwanese officials and President-elect Donald J. Trumps staff, an outreach effort that culminated last week in an unorthodox telephone call between Mr. Trump and Taiwans president.

description: The heirs of Alfred Flechtheim, a German-Jewish art dealer and collector, sued the German state of Bavaria on Monday, arguing in court papers that it has refused to turn over works of art that the heirs say were looted by the Nazis before World War II.

description: Sparkling cookies, the year's best baking books and more for the season of celebration.

description: Sometimes, in the middle of a play that is not working, there comes a moment so pure and clear and nakedly affecting that it wakes your soul right up.

description: WASHINGTON  An internal Defense Department study found that the Pentagon could eliminate $125 billion in administrative costs over five years by streamlining its overhead and business operations.

description: Years ago, Kevin J. Arquit and Steven A. Newborn worked side by side as top practitioners of antitrust law.

description: WASHINGTON  President-elect Donald J. Trump on Tuesday fired one of his transition teams staff members, Michael G. Flynn, the son of Mr. Trumps choice for national security adviser, for using Twitter to spread a fake news story about Hillary Clinton that led to an armed confrontation in a pizza restaurant in Washington.

title: Trumps Team Says He Sold All His Stocks in June
description: Since his election a few weeks ago, Donald J. Trump has faced serious questions about the conflicts of interest his vast business empire could create once he enters the White House. There is at least one facet of his holdings that should not be an issue: his stock portfolio.

description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

description: WASHINGTON  Senate Republican leaders, after meeting with Vice President-elect Mike Pence, said on Tuesday that they would move immediately next month to start repealing the Affordable Care Act, despite qualms among some of their members.

title: Man Who Hacked Celebrities Email Accounts Gets 5 Years in Prison

description: New Nordic flavors have an insistent presence at the chef Fredrik Berseliuss new restaurant in Williamsburg, Brooklyn.

title: Brazils Senate Leader Refuses Justices Order to Step Down
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  The head of Brazils Senate refused on Tuesday to obey a Supreme Court ruling ordering him to step down from his post, heightening tensions between the nations Congress and its judiciary.

description: A few minutes late, Logan, 7, charges down a long hallway at the citys Transit Museum and practically dives onto the floor of a classroom.

title: Like Trump, Europes Populists Win Big With Rural Voters
description: KULESZE KOSCIELNE, Poland  The red-tiled roofs of this tiny village cluster around the soaring steeples of St. Bartholomew Church like medieval cottages at the base of a castle, alienated from the cosmopolitan life of cities such as Warsaw by a chasm that is economic, cultural and political.

title: How an Everything-Must-Go Trump Sale Might Look
description: With all the attention on President-elect Donald J. Trumps business and the potential conflicts that it could pose with the White House, one possible  if admittedly unlikely  solution has emerged.
