title: Protests Erupt in Poland Over New Law on Public Gatherings
description: WARSAW  When supporters of Polands governing party met for their monthly gathering last weekend outside the presidential palace to commemorate the 2010  plane crash that killed many of the countrys top leaders, they found that a group of protesters had already commandeered their usual spot.

title: Being Fleabag, From Stage to TV and Back Again
description: LONDON  Within five minutes of the first episode of Fleabag, Phoebe Waller-Bridge is masturbating over President Obama. As he gives a speech on her laptop, her right hand drifts down under the duvet. There will be difficult days along the way, Mr. Obama warns. The screen starts to jiggle.

title: A Potential Hitch in Zuckerbergs Stock Plan for Facebook
description: Mark Zuckerberg wants to give away nearly all his stake in Facebook, and yet still keep control of the company he helped found. Whats a tech billionaire to do?

title: The Best Sellers: Filed Under Sports
description: The best-selling sports books in November 2016, according to the New York Times best-seller list.

title: Wells Fargos Living Will Plan Is Rejected Again by Regulators
description: Wells Fargo has run afoul of banking regulators once again: On Tuesday, for the second time this year, the bank did not pass a key regulatory test that was created after the 2008 financial crisis to reduce the threats that large banks pose to the broader economy.

title: Court Debates Which Cosby Accusers May Testify
description: NORRISTOWN, PA.  A prosecutor on Tuesday accused Bill Cosby of drugging and assaulting 13 women over several decades in a pattern of behavior so similar that he said it should be admitted as evidence in Mr. Cosbys criminal trial for sexual assault.

title: An N.F.L. Executive, Honoring His Lost Sister, Speaks Out About Anorexia
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Paraag Marathes structured, analytical mind has served him well in the offices of Silicon Valley and the National Football League. He figured that he could lean on those traits the first time he spoke publicly about his sister, Shilpa, and how anorexia had taken her life.

title: New York Changes the Way It Keeps Tabs on School Violence
description: New York State education officials voted Tuesday to change the way the state tracks school violence, hoping to improve a system that has been called confusing and inaccurate.

title: Will Rick Perry Be the Energy Departments Undoing?
description: President-elect Donald Trump has picked several people to lead federal departments who are hostile to the work of those agencies. On Tuesday, he went a step further by choosing Rick Perry, the former Texas governor, to head the Department of Energy, an agency that Mr. Perry once promised to eliminate.

title: Mired in 16-Year Title Drought, U.S. Fed Cup Team Turns to a New Captain
description: Despite Serena Williamss domination of the womens tennis tour, and with 16 players in the top 100, the United States has a 16-year title drought in the Fed Cup, an international team competition it once dominated.

title: Letting Go of a Red Balloon
description: Dear Diary:

title: The D.C.C.C. Responds to the Hack
description: Letters from Democratic Party leaders responding to the cyberattack on servers of the Democratic Congressional Campaign Committee and the subsequent release of personal and professional information of lawmakers and staff members.

title: Democratic House Candidates Were Also Targets of Russian Hacking
description: WASHINGTON  South Florida has long been a laboratory for some of the nations roughest politics, with techniques like phantom candidates created by political rivals to siphon off votes from their opponents, or so-called boleteras hired to illegally fill out stacks of absentee ballots on behalf of elderly or disabled voters.

title: Pageant Silences Beauty Queen, a Critic of China, at U.S. Contest
description: After the Chinese authorities blocked the Canadian beauty queen Anastasia Lin from attending the 65th annual Miss World pageant in China last year, the events British organizers offered her a consolation prize, of sorts: They promised to allow her a chance to compete in the 2016 finals, which are currently underway in suburban Washington.

title: Recreational Marijuana? Yes, but Tightly Regulated, Canadian Panel Suggests
description: MONTREAL  Prime Minister Justin Trudeau has promised to legalize the recreational use of marijuana, but that doesnt mean Canada will turn into a giant, smoke-filled set for a Cheech and Chong movie.

title: Thomas C. Schelling, Master Theorist of Nuclear Strategy, Dies at 95
description: Thomas C. Schelling, an economist and Nobel laureate whose interest in game theory led him to write important works on nuclear strategy and to use the concept of the tipping point to explain social problems, including white flight from urban neighborhoods, died on Tuesday at his home in Bethesda, Md. He was 95.

title: We Are the Sport of Jackie Robinson, and We Need to Lead by Example
description: A little over a year ago, Billy Bean, Major League Baseballs ambassador for inclusion, began hearing from people outside the sport who were concerned about a growing phenomenon inside the game.

title: Rolling Back Abortion Rights After Donald Trumps Election
description: Last year, Teresa Fedor, an Ohio state representative, a veteran and a former public-school teacher, told the story of her abortion after a rape in a statement on the House floor. I dare you to walk in my shoes, she said to lawmakers who were supporting a bill to ban abortion as soon as a fetal heartbeat could be detected, as early as six weeks. I understand your story, but you dont understand mine.

title: 10 New York Sites Get Landmark Status as Panel Clears Backlog
description: It has taken more than two years to resolve the bureaucratic quagmire of backlogged buildings at the New York City Landmarks Preservation Commission. Considering that some have been in limbo for four decades, it may have seemed like no time at all.

title: Facing Athletes Boycott, Bobsled and Skeleton Event Is Moved From Russia
description: International sports officials, facing a potential boycott by athletes upset over the Russian doping scandal, have decided to move bobsled and skeleton world championships out of Russia next year.

title: With Second Ave. Subway, Cuomo Has Hands-On Role and Eye on the Future
description: As governor of New York, Andrew M. Cuomo has no shortage of complex problems demanding his attention. But his ire has recently been focused on a small switch in a subway station deep below the streets of Manhattan.

title: ISIS Claims Responsibility for Egypt Church Bombing and Warns of More to Come
description: CAIRO  Egypt faced the prospect of a surge in sectarian bloodshed on Tuesday after the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the bombing of a Coptic cathedral in Cairo that killed 25 people on Sunday. The group warned of more attacks to come.

title: Rex Tillerson, Trumps Secretary of State Nominee, Is a Flexible Pragmatist
description: HOUSTON  Three years ago, Rex W. Tillerson, the chief executive of Exxon Mobil and now President-elect Donald J. Trumps nominee for secretary of state, was probably the man least expected to show up at a town council meeting in North Texas to oppose a local construction project.

title: Extensive Brain Defects Seen in Babies of Mothers With Zika
description: Babies born to Zika-infected mothers are highly likely to have brain damage, even in the absence of obvious abnormalities like small heads, and the virus may go on replicating in their brains well after birth, according to three studies published Tuesday.

title: Large Military Plane Over Manhattan Turns Heads Skyward
description: For New Yorkers accustomed to staring straight ahead and avoiding eye contact with their fellow pedestrians, the appearance on Tuesday afternoon of a large military airplane and two helicopters over Manhattan was cause for confusion and craning upward.

title: U.S. Blocks Arms Sale to Saudi Arabia Amid Concerns Over Yemen War
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration has deepened its rift with its Gulf allies over the ongoing conflict in Yemen, blocking a transfer of precision munitions to Saudi Arabia because of concerns about civilian casualties that administration officials attribute to poor targeting.

title: State Orders Monitor for New York Citys Child Welfare Agency
description: The state has ordered New York City to install an independent monitor to review the citys troubled child welfare agency, the latest fallout from the recent deaths of children who had been the subjects of abuse reports to the agency.

title: Review: The Devil Went Down to Chelsea to See Prudencia Hart
description: In search of merry and bright drinking companions in this dark and sullen winter? You could do a lot worse than raise a shot glass (or two or three) with the rousing band of Scots whove encamped in a pub at the McKittrick Hotel in Chelsea. They sing, dance on tables, discuss post-post-structuralist theory, talk in rhyme. And they tell one hell of a tale.

title: Something to Follow
description: WEDNESDAY PUZZLE  Are you a leader or a follower? Never mind, it doesnt matter. We are all following things in todays New York Times debut by Alan DeLoriea. No cutting in line, please.

title: Judge May Make Public Some Documents Related to Inquiry on Clinton Emails
description: A federal judge in Manhattan indicated on Tuesday that he may partially unseal a government search warrant and supporting documents stemming from the F.B.I.s investigation of a large cache of emails belonging to Huma Abedin, a top aide to Hillary Clinton.

title: Bob Krasnow, Revitalizer of Elektra Records, Dies at 82
description: Bob Krasnow, a well-traveled music executive credited with revitalizing Elektra Records in the 1980s and 90s with a varied roster that included Metallica, Anita Baker and Bjrk, died on Dec. 11 in Wellington, Fla. He was 82.

title: Behind Brooklyn Neighborhoods Rebirth, a Woman Who Joined in a Dream
description: The car coasted down her sisters old block in Brownsville, Brooklyn, and in the front seat Janis Borden glanced out the window and, for an instant, saw not a Monday in December 2016, but an evening in the late 1970s or early 1980s. At the time, Ms. Bordens sister, Carmelia Goffe, had three little sons.

title: From Kanye West to the Midwest, Donald Trumps Presidential Reality Show Rolls On
description: WEST ALLIS, Wis.  President-elect Donald J. Trump said on Tuesday that his nominee for secretary of state, Rex W. Tillerson, would reverse years of foreign policy blunders and disasters, and that his close ties to antagonistic foreign leaders  a potential hurdle to his confirmation by the Senate  was one of the reasons he had picked him.

title: Protests Erupt Across Brazil as Senate Approves Austerity Measure
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Protests flared in cities around Brazil on Tuesday after the Senate approved a 20-year cap on federal spending, a cornerstone of President Michel Temers proposed austerity measures aimed at restoring confidence in the countrys ailing economy.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: This was not something that was done casually, this was not something that was done by chance, this was not a target that was selected purely arbitrarily.

title: Blackhawks Cool Off Rangers and Backup Goalie Antti Raanta
description: There is invariably extra electricity when the Rangers and the Blackhawks meet, especially since they play each other only twice a season.

title: For Taiwan, a Dilemma Over Identity, Economy and China
description: Syaru Shirley Lin, a native of Taiwan, is a political economist who teaches at both the University of Virginia and the Chinese University of Hong Kong. Previously she was a partner at Goldman Sachs, where she was responsible for private equity and venture capital investments in Asia and spearheaded the firms investments in technology start-ups, including Alibaba. Her new book, Taiwans China Dilemma, published by Stanford University Press, focuses on the emergence of Taiwanese national identity and how it has influenced the islands economic policy toward China over the past three decades.

title: K.K.R.-Linked Group Bids for Tatts of Australia, Imperiling Tabcorp Deal
description: HONG KONG  Wall Street money is helping fuel a potential bidding war over gambling in Australia.

title: Alan Thicke, Reassuring Father on Growing Pains, Dies at 69
description: Alan Thicke, the Canadian actor, singer and songwriter best remembered for his portrayal of the ultimate suburban middlebrow dispenser of parental advice on the sitcom Growing Pains, died on Tuesday in Burbank, Calif. He was 69.

title: What Do Teenagers Want? Potted Plant Parents
description: Many parents feel that their adolescents hardly need them anymore. Teenagers often come and go on their own schedules, sometimes rebuff our friendly questions about their days, and can give the impression that interacting with the family is an imposition that comes at the cost of connecting, digitally or otherwise, with friends.

title: On a Japanese Whiskey Tour, Small Batches and Bagpipes
description: One of the many discoveries I made on my first night in Japan nearly 30 years ago were the vending machines that sold beer. As I walked to my new apartment just hours after landing in Tokyo, I found a machine stocked with different sizes of cans and brands. It was a eureka moment.

title: Aleppo, Rex Tillerson, Donald Trump: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Argentine Firm to Pay $112 Million in FIFA Scandal
description: An Argentine sports marketing firm will pay more than $112 million in forfeiture and fines in the FIFA bribery scandal.

title: Corrections: December 14, 2016
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Whats on TV Wednesday: Series Finale of Rectify and a Preview of Star
description: Rectify, the Peabody Award-winning series about the release and redemption of a death row prisoner, ends. Star, the latest creation from Lee Daniels of Empire fame, has a preview. And a new season of the French smash The Bureau crosses the Atlantic.

title: Kylie Jenner and the Year of the Drop
description: Last Friday, on a sunny December morning, chaos descended upon a glossy shopping mall in the Canoga Park section of Los Angeles.

title: Word + Quiz: titular
Legal Financing Rivals to Combine in $160 Million Deal
description: Burford Capital, which finances litigation for corporations and law firms, is acquiring its Chicago-based rival, Gerchen Keller Capital, in a $160 million deal.

title: Secrets of Wildlife on Kenyas Masai Mara
description: Anup Shah waits patiently to capture black-and-white portraits of the wildlife on Kenyas Masai Mara National Reserve, hoping for a glimpse of the animals personalities.

title: Trumps Approach: A Fresh Start or Crazy Reckless?
description: Maybe it will all turn out O.K. If it does, put me down as promising to applaud.

title: Buck Up, Democrats, and Fight Like Republicans
description: On Monday, members of the Electoral College will vote in Donald J. Trump as president. Though he lost the election by nearly three million votes and almost daily generates headlines about new scandals, the Democratic Party is doing little to stop him. If youve been asking yourself Where are the Democrats? youre not alone.

title: Donald Trumps Nominees Are In for a Rough Ride
description: Worried about the corporate gazillionaires whom Donald Trump is naming to his cabinet? Dont fret  it could be months, if ever, before these people set foot inside the federal government. Mr. Trumps transition team is seriously behind  some in Washington say theyve gotten nowhere  on vetting his nominees for potential conflicts of interest. Whatever one thinks of his choices, this does not bode well for a smooth transfer of power.

title: Why We Need a National Monument to Reconstruction
description: Although Americans are already looking ahead to the next presidential administration, President Obama retains the power to shape his legacy and our nation in his remaining weeks in office. He has already used his final months to create several  national monuments, and we urge him to create another, one that will speak as much to the nations present and future as it does to its past: the first national monument dedicated to Reconstruction  the turbulent, misunderstood era after the Civil War  in Beaufort, S.C., which has one of the countrys highest concentrations of Reconstruction-related sites.

title: Should I Tell My Students I Have Depression?
description: The new class I was teaching  Composing Disability: Crip Ecologies  was one of several first-year writing seminars offered at George Washington University. Given the focus, it was likely to be a challenge for at least some of the students. And it was presenting a particular challenge to me.

title: Money and Happiness
No Change in U.S. Commitment to Asia-Pacific Under Trump, Admiral Says
description: SYDNEY, Australia  The commander of United States military operations in the Asia-Pacific region said on Wednesday that Americas commitment to the region would continue after Donald J. Trump became president, as would its opposition to Chinese expansion in the South China Sea.

title: Secrets of Wildlife on Kenyas Masai Mara
description: I just came back from seeing elephants, Anup Shah said over the phone from Kenya on a recent Saturday. Now, for anyone else that might be the highlight of the year, if not a lifetime. But for Mr. Shah, a wildlife photographer, it was just another day. When he wakes up in a tent on Kenyas Masai Mara National Reserve, his day begins with animals. When the birds start calling, he said, I get up, and off I go just before dawn.

title: Japan, Looking for Money, Removes Ban on Casino Gambling
description: TOKYO  Japan is dealing itself into the multibillion-dollar casino industry.

title: Questions for: Use of E-Cigarettes by Young People Is Major Concern, Surgeon General Declares
description: Article: Use of E-Cigarettes by Young People Is Major Concern, Surgeon General Declares

title: A Stonehenge in Brazils Jungle
description: Visit 1,000-year-old megaliths discovered on a cattle ranch in Brazil. The site sheds new light on how indigenous people of the Amazon may have lived.

title: Krista Tippett Thinks We Cant Change One Anothers Minds
description: People say to never discuss religion or politics with others in public, but do you think that we should be talking about these topics more openly now? Coming out of this election year, I think what we absolutely have to find a way and a place and a vocabulary to talk about is moral imagination: the human effects of policies and the question of how we create common life and who we are to one another. We dont necessarily need religious or political doctrine to answer those questions.

title: What Should You Do When Customers Make Racist Remarks?
description: I grew up in New York and moved to a small Pacific Northwest ski town a year and a half ago. I work as a bookseller-manager at an independent bookstore. I love my job, but this election cycle brought out some heated feelings.

title: Letter of Recommendation: Dan Fogelberg, Same Old Lang Syne
description: Let us resist, as another year slides darkly toward its death, the creeping fascism of holiday music. It is not normal; it is not a public good. Holiday music is sonic propaganda, crackling down at us from ancient mall sound systems and pouring point-blank from the mouths of horrible neighbors. It erodes our humanity with its cheerful clichs. Resist the elves and the messiahs, the apple-cheeked grandmothers and the man-size golems of sentient snow; resist the melodies that jump and flip like windup toys. Resist the fa and the la and the la la la. We are grown-ups. Lets look at life, for once, full in the face.

title: Does Your School Reflect the Changing Diversity of the United States?
description: What is the racial, ethnic and economic makeup of your school? Are there students with very different financial situations? Are there many students who speak languages other than English at home, or come from other countries? How integrated is your school?

title: A Stonehenge, and a Mystery, in the Amazon
description: CALOENE, Brazil  As the foreman for a cattle ranch in the far reaches of the Brazilian Amazon, Lailson Camelo da Silva was razing trees to convert rain forest into pasture when he stumbled across a bizarre arrangement of towering granite blocks.

title: Americas First Offshore Wind Farm Spins to Life
description: Until this week, all of the wind power generated in the United States was on land.

title: French Terrorism Suspects Appeared Anything But
description: STRASBOURG, France  One was a well-liked elementary school assistant. Another was a hard-working cargo handler. The third was a friendly grocer. They were longtime friends in their quiet suburban neighborhood, and they joked with teenagers and greeted children with a smile.

title: The Great A.I. Awakening
description: Late one Friday night in early November, Jun Rekimoto, a distinguished professor of human-computer interaction at the University of Tokyo, was online preparing for a lecture when he began to notice some peculiar posts rolling in on social media. Apparently Google Translate, the companys popular machine-translation service, had suddenly and almost immeasurably improved. Rekimoto visited Translate himself and began to experiment with it. He was astonished. He had to go to sleep, but Translate refused to relax its grip on his imagination.

title: For Dissidents, a Phone Hack to Foil Spying Eyes: Cover the Camera
description: Its the stuff of urban legend, filtered through a 21st-century nightmare: A shadowy organization surreptitiously turns on the camera and microphone of your smartphone, changing an essential and trusted device into an insidious surveillance tool.

title: Atlanta Treads Cautiously in a Clash of Hip-Hop and Neighborhood
description: ATLANTA  When Trentavious White, a rising rap star known to the world as Bankroll Fresh, was fatally shot here outside Street Execs Studios, the brightest stars in the hip-hop firmament offered their condolences: Big Boi, Lil Wayne, T.I., 2 Chainz.

title: Living in Pound Ridge, New York
description: The northeastern Westchester town has a spacious, open feel  and no traffic lights.

title: Pound Ridge, N.Y.: A Bucolic Feel and a Sense of Community
description: Back in the 1970s, Steven DiFlora had an unrequited crush on Doriane Lucia, a high school classmate in New Jersey. Decades later, after each had married and divorced, they reconnected, fell in love and last year began searching for a house. We were starting our life together, Mr. DiFlora said, and the first step was to purchase a home.

title: Twitter Has the Right to Suspend Donald Trump. But It Shouldnt.
description: If Twitter wanted to, it would be well within its rights to suspend Donald J. Trumps account.

title: Morning Agenda: The Financial Crisis, Living Wills and Lawsuits
description: Wells Fargo is, once again, in a sticky spot with regulators.

title: Federal Reserve, Syria, Alan Thicke: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Convicted of Sodomy, Malaysian Opposition Leader Loses Bid for Freedom
description: HONG KONG  A Malaysian court on Wednesday upheld a sodomy conviction for Anwar Ibrahim, the jailed leader of the countrys opposition, bringing to a close a prolonged legal battle and sidelining a charismatic official ahead of an election in which he had hoped to challenge the scandal-ridden prime minister.

title: In the Badlands, Where Hope for the Nations First Tribal Park Has Faded
description: There are countless ways to experience America. You could tackle blockbuster destinations like Niagara Falls or New York or California. You could get lost in its natural wonders, like the Rockies or the Everglades.

title: How to Be Mindful With Your In-Laws
description: How we relate with our in-laws deeply affects the overall harmony and well-being in our families and in our life. For many, this becomes most obvious during the holidays. This year, let mindfulness help you navigate potential conflict and nourish these key relationships.  Tara Brach, author of Radical Acceptance.

title: How to Plan a Weekend Getaway
description: Cant take time off for a weeklong vacation? Getting away for a weekend is still a way to recharge your batteries, said Shawna Huffman Owen, the president of Huffman Travel, a travel consultancy based in Chicago. If you plan well, she said, a quick trip can be a great break and even feel longer than it is.

title: Running as the Thinking Persons Sport
description: Running seems to require a greater amount of high-level thinking than most of us might imagine. The sport seems to change how the brain works in surprising ways, according to a new report.

title: Rogue One Takeaways: Vader, Droids and a Stunning Planet
description: Does Darth Vader have a cameo or a more substantial role? Is Jyn Erso a heroine for the ages? How are the new droids  and the music without John Williams? Rogue One, the first Star Wars stand-alone movie, will begin storming multiplexes on Thursday night, and those questions will finally be answered. The Times chief film critic A.O. Scott has weighed in with his review here. And below  without giving too much away  our senior editor for movies, Mekado Murphy, offers some key takeaways after finally laying eyes on the film.

title: Uber Expands Self-Driving Car Service to San Francisco. D.M.V. Says Its Illegal.
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Uber made a big splash in its hometown on Wednesday when it started offering self-driving car service to passengers here, making San Francisco the second city in the world where the ride-hailing company provides autonomous vehicles for public use.

title: The Oakland Fire: What We Know About Fire Inspections and the Neighborhood
description: New York Times reporters are investigating the devastating fire that killed 36 people this month at a warehouse called the Ghost Ship in Oakland, Calif. Were also doing something new: providing regular updates on our findings. Do you have information, advice or feedback? Send an email to oaklandfire@nytimes.com.

title: Tony Bennett at 90: I Just Love What Im Doing
description: Early Thanksgiving morning, Tony Bennett woke up in a strange bed on the wrong side of Central Park.

title: One Mans View Into the Last Days in Rebel-Held Aleppo
description: Messages posted to a WhatsApp group by an English teacher in Aleppo describe what he saw in the shrinking rebel-held territory, as Syrian forces and their allies waged an assault to retake the city.

title: Amid Rain of Shells, Aleppos Civilians Offer Final Scream
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Families, medical workers, insurgent fighters and wounded people were packed and ready Wednesday morning to vacate the ravaged rebel-held neighborhoods of the Syrian city of Aleppo under a deal between Russia and Turkey. Then the resumed booms of incoming artillery shells from pro-government forces sent them into hiding or running for their lives.

title: For Chinas State Media, Trump Victory Cant Cure American Disease
description: BEIJING  Donald J. Trump isnt Mr. Popular in Beijing lately. But Chinas ruling elite seems to be consoling itself with the idea that the American president-elect will take charge of a country staggering into decline and disunion.

title: The Race for Self-Driving Cars
description: There are increasing signs that autonomous cars have arrived  and may be driving on our city streets sooner than we think.

title: Will the Trump Era Bring Higher Interest Rates? Dont Count On It
description: Higher interest rates are on the way. That, anyway, is the prediction increasingly baked into financial markets. Donald J. Trumps policy agenda  big tax cuts and new infrastructure spending  seems to point in that direction. And the Fed raised its benchmark interest rate by a quarter of a percentage point on Wednesday, with plans for more increases next year.

title: Mario, Nintendos Mustachioed Gaming Legend, Arrives on iPhones
description: SEATTLE  What happens when one of the best-selling games in history comes to the most popular category of electronic devices in the world? A mustachioed plumber in overalls is about to reveal the answer.

title: California Today: Housing Fight Hits San Diego
description: Good morning.

title: Democrats and Feds in Dispute on Trumps D.C. Hotel Lease
description: The General Services Administration disputed House Democrats on President-elect Donald J. Trumps need to sell off his Washington hotel.

title: Chauffeur, Shootaround and Boneless Chicken Wings: Living Large With the Nets
description: My friend and I were at a Nets game the other night, being ushered between exclusive locations by our personal concierge, when suddenly we strayed into an area full of normal fans waiting in line to buy their own food.

title: 5 Times Drones Told the Story
description: The Times has used drones to give readers a sky-view perspective on some of the years most visual stories, from Chinas rapidly growing deserts to a secretive island of graves in New York City. Here are some of our favorite stories told by drones in 2016.

title: Obama Bars States From Denying Federal Money to Planned Parenthood
description: WASHINGTON  Mindful of the clock ticking down to a Trump presidency, the Obama administration issued a final rule on Wednesday to bar states from withholding federal family-planning funds from Planned Parenthood affiliates and other health clinics that provide abortions. The measure takes effect two days before the Jan. 20 inauguration of Donald J. Trump.

title: What You Get for ... $900,000
description: A contemporary in Dallas, a 1936 house in Maryland and a riverfront cabin in Wisconsin.

title: $900,000 Homes in Dallas, Maryland and Wisconsin
description: DALLAS

title: In Major Step for Drone Delivery, Amazon Flies Package to Customer in England
description: When Jeff Bezos, Amazons chief executive, first said that the e-commerce giant wanted to use drones to deliver packages directly to customers homes, many people thought he was crazy.

title: Museum Pieces on Loan From Crimea Belong to Ukraine, Dutch Court Rules
description: AMSTERDAM  A court in Amsterdam ruled on Wednesday that hundreds of ancient Crimean treasures on loan to a museum in the Netherlands are the property of Ukraine and should not be sent to Russian-controlled Crimea, after a two-and-a-half-year legal battle over their ownership.

title: Bana al-Abed on Twitter: Proof of Life in a War Zone
description: Times Insider delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how news, features and opinion come together at The New York Times.

title: A Colonial House in the Heart of Granada
description: The six-bedroom house, built in the 1750s, is on the market for $1.3 million.

title: House Hunting in ... Nicaragua
description: A COLONIAL HOUSE WITH A COURTYARD IN THE CENTER OF GRANADA

title: How to Keep Your Office Holiday Party From Going Off the Rails
description: The office party can be a chance for co-workers to get together in a relaxed setting to celebrate the holidays. Or it can be a memorable event for all the wrong reasons.

title: There He Is, Mr. Cabinet Secretary
description: Call it cabinet selection as beauty pageant. As President-elect Donald J. Trump assembles his cabinet and prepares to govern, he is drawing on an underestimated asset: showmanship honed over years of television pageantry.

title: Gathering Intelligence Is Dangerous. So Is Not Reading It.
description: Donald J. Trump has so far chosen to receive only one intelligence briefing each week. His decision is an extraordinary departure from the practices of his predecessors who received a briefing every day, with the exception of Richard M. Nixon, who had extensive foreign policy experience before his 1968 election victory.

title: Rauschenberg Foundation Chief Moving to Sothebys
description: Moving more aggressively onto the turf of commercial galleries, Sothebys is hiring Christy MacLear, the chief executive of the Robert Rauschenberg Foundation and before that the executive director of the Philip Johnson Glass House, to expand the auction houses advisory services for living artists and for artists estates and foundations.

title: For Republican Russia Hawks, a Dilemma Named Rex Tillerson
description: WASHINGTON  Congressional Republicans face a vexing dilemma with the impending presidency of Donald J. Trump: Will they maintain the tough line on Russia that has been central to their foreign policy for decades, or cede that ground to Democrats?

title: Sense8: A Christmas Special Is Coming to Netflix
description: When last we saw the alluring, transcendentally attuned global citizens of Netflixs Sense8, they were sailing into the North Atlantic on a fishing boat. But wherever they landed, trouble was sure to follow. And in Sense8: A Christmas Special (debuting Friday, Dec. 23)  a two-hour gift from the Wachowskis and J. Michael Straczynski, the masterminds of the series  it has. The stars are back in their own worlds, and in one anothers minds: Nomi (Jamie Clayton) hides in San Francisco; Riley (Tuppence Middleton) drugs Will (Brian J. Smith) in Amsterdam; life is upended for Lito (Miguel ngel Silvestre) in Mexico; Sun (Doona Bae) languishes in a South Korean prison; Capheus (Toby Onwumere) tinkers with his bus in Nairobi; and Kala (Tina Desai) cant keep Wolfgang (Max Riemelt), in Berlin, out of her marital bed in Mumbai. And the henchman Mr. Whispers (Terrence Mann) lurks. Meanwhile, there are birthdays and holidays to celebrate with raves, orgies and unconditional support  a joyful excuse to keep fans sated until Season 2 in May.

title: The Magic Flute, Trimmed Down, at the Metropolitan Opera
description: We wouldnt want to be the ones to trim an hour of Mozarts sublime The Magic Flute. But several years ago, the Metropolitan Opera took up the scissors, creating a 100-minute English-language version tailored to families around the holidays.

title: Mos Def Bids Goodbye to Music and Acting, at the Apollo
description: Yasiin Bey, the rapper best known as Mos Def, announced earlier this year that he will retire from music and acting, and hes following through. His farewell concerts in his hometown, New York City, will take place Wednesday, Dec. 21, and Thursday at the Apollo Theater before he moves on to the Kennedy Center in Washington. The Apollo is an appropriate spot, steeped in the African-American heritage and sense of community that Mos Defs raps have constantly invoked, both with Talib Kweli in Black Star and in diverse projects on his own. Politics, history and a sense of cultural responsibility have always informed his work, usually with a touch light enough to avoid being didactic. With luck, hell continue getting his message across in other media. (212-531-5300, apollotheater.org)

title: Your Best Eats of 2016
description: Good morning. For all the good cheer and pine-scented sidewalks, there is something ghostly and wistful about these December days, as we cast our eyes back toward the year that was. Pete Wells wrote about his top 10 restaurants of the year, and about the best dishes he ate for the Food section we blue-bagged and delivered to doors, porches and bushes this morning. (For those dining on the cheap in New York City, Ligaya Mishan offered her own list of bests.)

title: A Trump Cabinet Pick and the Ties That Bind
description: Tuesday began as most days do when Donald Trump is announcing a cabinet pick. At precisely 6:43 a.m. the president elect sent out a tweet announcing that he would nominate Rex Tillerson, C.E.O. of Exxon Mobil, to be the next secretary of state.

title: Inquisitive Child Inspires Her Tutor to Start a New Path
description: An innocent question posed by a young girl led Naivon Lake Jr. to chart out a new course in his life.

title: Abortion Is Found to Have Little Effect on Womens Mental Health
description: Its an idea that has long been used as an argument against abortion  that terminating a pregnancy causes women to experience emotional and psychological trauma.

title: The Works of Lucinda Childs, Online and Absorbing
description: The Lucinda Childs Dance Company recently wrapped up a two-week season at the Joyce Theater, surveying several decades of its founders mesmerizing minimalism. If you missed it  or even if you didnt  the next best thing is A Steady Pulse, an absorbing digital archive published last year by the Pew Center for Arts and Heritage. Late Decembers dance lull (various versions of The Nutcracker notwithstanding) is the perfect time to dive into this collection, which offers a close look at eight works created by Ms. Childs between 1963 and 1978.

title: Toms Saraceno at the San Francisco Museum of Modern Art
description: In The Empire Strikes Back, we learned that a city in the clouds was not such a great idea. Ive had supply problems of every kind  Ive had labor difficulties, grouses Lando Calrissian, the dashing administrator of the movies gravity-defying metropolis.

title: Christies Chief Executive to Step Down and Hand Reins to Guillaume Cerutti
description: In yet another jolt to the auction world, coming just one week after Christies top business-getter, Brett Gorvy, announced his departure, the house announced that its chief executive, Patricia Barbizet, was also stepping down, as of Jan. 1, after two years at the helm.

title: Veterans Help Make San Diego a Hub for Start-Ups
description: SAN DIEGO  For decades, politicians lobbied to bring military bases to their districts for one reason: jobs. A base is akin to a corporate headquarters, bringing with it jobs in related businesses.

title: Christmas Is a Drag Dresses Up for the Holidays
description: How can you not feel holiday spirit when standing up at the Laurie Beechman Theater, swaying your arms and singing Let There Be Peace on Earth with the drag queen Ginger Minj? Such was my enviable lot recently, and while that show is over, the monthlong Christmas Is a Drag series at the Beechman continues this week with some of the most offbeat holiday entertainment youll find.

title: The Farming Life in an Older Italy, at Film Forum
description: The Tree of Wooden Clogs, Ermanno Olmis farsighted view of Italian farm life in the late 19th century, immerses you in what feels like an unchanging preindustrial world. The beautiful three-hour film, which won the Palme dOr at Cannes in 1978, follows the lives of four peasant families laboring on the estate of an absentee landlord in the province of Bergamo. The actors, all residents of the area, speak in their native dialect.

title: Trump Firm Quits Brazil Hotel Project That Was Named in Criminal Inquiry
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  The Trump Organization says it is pulling out of a troubled hotel project in Rio de Janeiro, just weeks after a federal prosecutor opened a criminal investigation that included the hotel and another Trump venture in the city.

title: Our Favorite Travel Photography of 2016
description: A collection of some of our favorite photography from this year, including a road trip through Namibia and Irelands gorgeous lighthouses.

title: Biggest Tech Failures and Successes of 2016
description: If you love technology, it may be time for a group hug: This year has been rough for consumer technology.

title: Rodrigo Duterte on Killing Criminal Suspects: I Used to Do It Personally
description: President Rodrigo Duterte of the Philippines, overseer of a contentious and bloody crackdown on drug dealers and users, boasted on Monday about having personally killed criminal suspects when he was mayor of Davao City.

title: Four Not-to-Miss Photography Shows
description: From kitchen sinks to chancellors and immigrants to burlesque queens, these four photography shows light up the season. Three are by contemporaries working in color, and one by a gifted amateur recording Americas diversity in the early 20th century.

title: Fantasy Football: Players to Start in Week 15
description: The Sablich brothers have provided award-winning fantasy football advice for The New York Times since 2010. See their weekly player rankings and visit 5thDownFantasy.com for more fantasy analysis. You can also ask them questions through their Twitter account, @5thdownfantasy.

title: National Film Registry Adds The Lion King and Thelma and Louise
description: Somewhere in the Library of Congress the Breakfast Club will always be meeting for a Saturday mornings detention, a young lion named Simba will perpetually have no worries for the rest of his days and Thelma and Louise will be forever holding hands as they speed toward the Grand Canyon. The motion pictures that made these characters memorable are among the 25 that have been selected for preservation in the librarys National Film Registry.

title: SAG Nominees Include Viggo Mortensen and Other Surprises
description: The Screen Actors Guild entered the awards season fray with its nominations on Wednesday, which included a few surprises:

title: 2016 in Review: The Years Best Apps
description: MORE than four million software programs are available in the Apple and Google app stores, including games, productivity tools and weather apps.

title: Pain Relievers Tied to Hearing Loss
description: Long term use of pain relievers may increase the risk for hearing loss, according to new findings.

title: Leggings in a Kaleidoscope of Patterns, for Almost Every Occasion
description: In pursuit of the perfect legging print, Zara Tisch has baked and photographed chocolate chip cookies, used a tweezer to set crystals in a skull shape, and spent a year arranging and rearranging cassette tapes to figure out the most leg-lengthening configuration.

title: A New Japanese Restaurant With an Artists Sensibility
description: In Japanese, the word bessou refers to a second house thats used for vacations or quick getaways  a home away from home. In New Yorks NoHo neighborhood, its the name of a new restaurant from Maiko Kyogoku, a Japanese-American restaurateur who worked with the contemporary artist Takashi Murakami before opening Bessou.

title: Times Critics Top Books of 2016
description: The Italian writer Italo Calvino defined a classic as a book thats never finished saying what it has to say. This year, The Timess daily critics reviewed nearly 250 titles. What follows are their lists of the fiction and nonfiction books that most moved, excited and enlightened them in 2016  books that, in their own ways, are perhaps not finished saying what they have to say.

title: To Protect Civilians, Pentagon Tightens Rules on Combat
description: The Pentagon has revised a 2015 manual for waging combat while obeying the international laws of war, tightening rules for when it is lawful to fire on a military target even though civilians  from human shields to workers at weapons factories  are nearby.

title: Israels Parliament Draws a Line on Short Hemlines
description: JERUSALEM  How short is a short skirt and who gets to decide?

title: The Quest for Your Dream Streamer
description: Q. There seems to be quite a range of prices on streaming video set-top boxes and sticks. What more do you really get with the more expensive ones priced at $150 or more, compared with the plug-in sticks that cost $30 to $40?

title: Daily Report: When Cars and Tech Repeatedly Collide
description: Technology is sweeping through cars, and cars are sweeping through the tech industry. Both of those forces were abundantly on display this week.

title: BBC and ITV to Offer Streaming Service of British Shows in U.S.
description: Frustrated that you cannot watch the latest British dramas or soap operas on television?

title: Jewelry That Draws From a Japanese Technique  and Constructivist Sculpture
description: Coming from different, and multiple, milieus, the close friends Yolande Batteau and Randi Mates meet in the middle  that is, 82nd Street and Fifth Avenue. We have a mutual devotion to the Metropolitan Museum of Art, particularly the study rooms, says Batteau, a painter and co-founder of the noted interiors studio Callidus Guild, of Mates (herself a classical goldsmith and Aesa jewelry founder). The level of our mutuality is such that we can go to a museum together, separate to wander for an hour and then come together only to find we have taken photos of the same exact pieces, Mates adds. Its a rare and thrilling experience to find another person who is as wholly enamored by history, the minutiae of objects and the deep physicality of materials as I am.

title: One Small Step for NASA, One Giant Leap for GIFs
description: Last week, NASA announced that it would open an official account at Giphy, a GIF database and social media platform, bringing the space agency up to speed with the way young people communicate in the internet age.

title: Rodrigo Duterte, Aleppo, Donald Trump: Your Morning Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Go to the Wrong Hospital and Youre 3 Times More Likely to Die
description: Not all hospitals are created equal, and the differences in quality can be a matter of life or death.

title: GoFundMe Says It Has Helped Campaigns Raise $3 Billion
description: Three days after a 28-year-old man took an AR-15 rifle into a Washington pizzeria to investigate false reports of a child trafficking ring, an online fund-raising effort for the business was already underway.

title: How the Feds Interest Rate Increase Can Affect You
description: The Federal Reserve raised its benchmark interest rate on Wednesday for just the second time since the 2008 financial crisis.

title: Fed Raises Key Interest Rate, Citing Strengthening Economy
description: WASHINGTON  The Federal Reserve raised its benchmark interest rate Wednesday for just the second time since the financial crisis of 2008, saying the American economy is expanding at a healthy pace and setting itself up as a counterweight to President-elect Donald J. Trumps push for considerably faster growth.

title: Baftas So White, but Theyre Working on It
description: LONDON  It isnt just the Oscars that are so white; and it isnt just the Oscars that are trying to fix it.

title: Italian Parliament Approves New Government, for Now
description: ROME  A week after Matteo Renzi resigned as prime minister of Italy, the former Foreign Minister Paolo Gentiloni took his place, winning the support of both chambers of Parliament in back-to-back confidence votes on Tuesday and Wednesday.

title: Review: The Bodyguard Is Shadowed by a Stalker, and a Superstar
description: MILLBURN, N.J.  The stage version of The Bodyguard isnt the worst musical made from the boiled bones of a movie. In fact, Im not sure it would make the top five (or do I mean bottom five?), although aside from a couple of shudder-worthy disasters, memory has expunged the details of many such shows.

title: Spared by Gunman in Charleston, Churchgoer Describes Night of Terror
description: CHARLESTON, S.C.  Polly Sheppard, a 72-year-old retired nurse and longtime stalwart of Emanuel African Methodist Episcopal Church, dived under a table as the gunfire began and did the only thing she could think to do: She prayed aloud. She could see the bullet casings skittering across the floor of the fellowship hall and the young mans boots approaching. Dylann S. Roof told her to shut up, then asked menacingly if he had shot her yet.

title: Swimming With the Mysterious Sardine Disco Balls of the Philippines
description: Thousands to millions of sardines emerge from a coral wall in cobalt waters just a few yards from the shores of Cebu Island in the Philippines. They move in a single undulating cloud of silver that twists, turns, shrinks, expands and wraps itself around any object that gets in its way. At times, it becomes a thundercloud, blocking out the sun or clapping violently as it suddenly flips its formation to evade a predator.

title: Thursdays N.F.L. Matchup: Los Angeles Rams (4-9) at Seattle Seahawks (8-4-1)
description: 8:25 p.m. Eastern, NBC and NFL Network  Line: Seahawks by 16

title: How to Have a Dinner Party: Friends Not Required
description: Over roast chicken and autumn vegetables, our dinner party was rolling through the requisite topics  concerns about the rise of the far right in Germany, what it really takes to make a marriage work, where to get the best Vietnamese food in New York City  but still, the awkwardness was unshakable.

title: A Law to Tape Interrogations in New York
description: To the Editor:

title: The Eerie Tragedy of Emmett Tills Father, Told by John Edgar Wideman
description: WRITING TO SAVE A LIFEThe Louis Till FileBy John Edgar Wideman193 pp. Scribner. $25.

title: As Progress Eludes Him on Social Issues, De Blasio Finds Success Elsewhere
description: Inside a jewel-box building dedicated to biomedical research on the East River, Mayor Bill de Blasio on Tuesday described his plan for expanding the citys biotech industry. About an hour later, he took broader questions, including several on the latest in a string of high-level departures from health and human services departments.

title: Text to Text: John Miltons When I Consider How My Light Is Spent and Todays Exhausted Superkids
description: Browse all our Text to Text lesson plans.

title: Where Do the Democrats Go From Here?
description: To the Editor:

title: Tell Investors of Climate Risks, Energy Sector Is Urged
description: A coalition of the worlds most powerful bankers, regulators and even executives at some heavy polluters have a message for oil and gas companies: Be more forthcoming about the risks posed by climate change.

title: In Jazz, Listen to the Timeless Elders
description: Among the things often said of Ron Carter  that hes one of the most influential and widely recorded bassists in history, a distinguished professor of music, a multiple Grammy winner and a National Endowment for the Arts Jazz Master  theres one that may not be said often enough. The man knows how to wear a suit.

title: Notes on the Macroeconomic Situation
description: So the Fed has raised rates. It was, Id argue, a mistake, although not as severe a mistake as it would have been a year ago. Anyway, it seems like a good time to review where I think the economy stands, and what it means for monetary and fiscal policy.

title: Im Here to Help, Trump Tells Tech Executives at Meeting
description: The meeting between President-elect Donald J. Trump and the nations tech elite was hyped as something out of The Apprentice: The new boss tells his minions to shape up. It turned out to be a charm offensive, a kind of Dancing With the Silicon Valley Stars.

title: Getting a Drone as a Gift? Check Your Insurance
description: MANY people will receive drones as gifts this holiday season. But before heading to the nearest field to fly the devices, recipients may want to check their insurance coverage.

title: For Josh Groban, a Boot Camp for Broadway
description: Josh Groban has sold more than 30 million records, making him a household name all over the world. But when he began talking to the producers and creators behind the Broadway-bound musical Natasha, Pierre & the Great Comet of 1812, it was clear hed need to learn a few things.

title: Jacobs Pillow Dance Festival Unveils 2017 Season
description: A tap program organized by Michelle Dorrance, a site-specific work by the troupe Pilobolus and rare visits from Cuban and Canadian companies are in store for the 85th season of Jacobs Pillow Dance Festival.

title: Memorable Theater of 2016: Twining Twins, Bathroom Sex and Cod Kisses
description: Hamilton continued its remarkable reign. Even the vice president-elect checked it out  though maybe he wishes he hadnt. We end the year still thinking about the searing performances, challenging stagecraft and oddball experiments that make theater anything but a safe space. Here New York Times writers, editors and critics single out moments to remember.

title: Civilians Trapped in Aleppo as Deal Falters
description: Shelling resumed Wednesday in rebel-held neighborhoods of Aleppo, Syria, halting a planned the evacuation of thousands of civilians. A ceasefire reached the night before, involving Russia and Turkey, seemed to have fallen through.

title: Harsh Facebook Posts, Jail and Now Death: A Mans Fate Angers Algeria
description: TUNIS  The Algerian government is coming under criticism for its treatment of a freelance British-Algerian journalist, Mohamed Tamalt, who died in a hospital on Sunday after being imprisoned under a draconian new law that criminalizes offending the president and state institutions.

title: Russian Hackers and the 2016 Election
description: To the Editor:

title: 2 Former Drug Executives Charged With Price Fixing
description: Two former executives at a New Jersey pharmaceutical company were charged with conspiring to fix prices on generic drugs, the Justice Department said Wednesday.

title: Can Trump Get Tough With China?
On Patriots Day: Love Will Defeat Evil
description: Heres something Oscar voters and regular folks probably dont think theyll want or need this year: a movie all but guaranteed to make them cry.

title: For Trumps Wealthy Cabinet, Prospect of a Sweet Tax Break
description: There are many dewy-eyed reasons a wealthy and powerful business executive would choose to give up a throne in the private sector and move to Washington for an important government job. There is the chance to give something back to your country through public service, the belief that you have some serious expertise to offer the incoming president and his administration, and a feeling that the country has been on the wrong course and that every American could benefit from some new thinking. Plus, when you get asked to serve the president of the United States, well, you do it.

title: Reissues: Dylans 66 Tour, A-Trak and Leon Redbone
description: The 1966 Live Recordings (Columbia, 36 CDs)

title: How to Get Janelle Mones Chic Holiday Look
description: The style star is taking her signature black-and-white look to a glam new level.

title: Warner Bros. Promotes One Executive as Another Departs
description: LOS ANGELES  Warner Bros. streamlined its film operation on Wednesday, consolidating filmmaking power under one executive and parting ways with another, a move that comes after a highly profitable but creatively inconsistent stretch for the studio.

title: A Hotline for Americans and Russians to Avoid Catastrophe in Syrian Skies
description: DOHA, Qatar  Not long after the government-held city of Palmyra in central Syria fell to Islamic State fighters, the United States and Russia both scrambled warplanes on Wednesday to attack militant targets there.

title: On Twitter, a Battle Among Political Bots
description: On social media, our political battles are increasingly automated.

title: Putin Is Waging Information Warfare. Heres How to Fight Back.
description: PRAGUE  Welcome to 21st-century conflict, more Machiavellian than military, where hacks, leaks and fake news are taking the place of planes, bombs and missiles. The Russian interference in the United States presidential election is just a taste of more to come.

title: Drug 85 Times as Potent as Marijuana Caused a Zombielike State in Brooklyn
description: When emergency medical technicians were called to a mass casualty event in Brooklyn last summer, dispatchers used a word more associated with apocalyptic Hollywood movies than medical emergencies: zombies.

title: Alan Thickes Dr. Seaver Didnt Know Best. That Was His Charm.
description: Chat boards and social media have been full of memories and tributes to Alan Thicke and his Growing Pains character, Dr. Jason Seaver, since Mr. Thickes death on Tuesday at 69. Alan Thicke will forever be a better dad than me, Blair Herter, the TV personality, wrote in a representative tweet.  Thanks for the memories, Dr. Seaver.

title: New Hertz Chief Faces a Tough Road
description: The new Hertz Global chief executive, Kathryn Marinello, faces a tough drive out of the ditch. She has a great rsum. The problem is that she is the $2 billion rental car outfits third boss in two years  and the activist investor Carl C. Icahn is in the back seat, fidgeting with a 35 percent stake. Moreover, the companys engine is sputtering, despite her predecessors attempts to get it firing more smoothly.

title: Yahoo Says 1 Billion User Accounts Were Hacked
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Yahoo, already reeling from its September disclosure that 500 million user accounts had been hacked in 2014, disclosed Wednesday that a different attack in 2013 compromised more than 1 billion accounts.

title: Jim Lowe, Radio D.J. and Singer, Dies at 93
description: Jim Lowe, who played standards for more than 50 years as a disc jockey, most notably at WNEW-AM in New York, and in 1956 had a No. 1 record of his own, The Green Door, died on Monday at his home in East Hampton, N.Y. He was 93.

title: Women Are Making Opera. And Its Not Easy.
description: For the first time in over 100 years, the Metropolitan Opera is presenting an opera by a woman. Listen to the work of some of the many female composers working today.

title: Donald Trump, the Fed and You
description: If you think of the economy as a car, the Federal Reserves decision today to raise the benchmark interest rate is its way of applying the brake.

title: A Holiday Block Party in SoHo, and Its Open Late
description: On the fifth day of Christmas, my true love sent to me: five golden Hoorsenbuhs rings. On Thursday, the jewelry house, based in Santa Monica, Calif., will open a SoHo gallery space where youll find the new Chassis series in 18-karat yellow, rose or white gold and diamonds (starting at $2,000), artwork by Damien Hirst, a custom gold vault and a bronze and leather lounge chair inspired by the companys signature negative space designs. At 458 Broome Street.

title: Donald Trump, Aleppo, Yahoo: Your Wednesday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Suns Behind Him, Jeff Hornacek Coolly Contemplates Whats Next
description: PHOENIX  It was business as usual Tuesday night for Jeff Hornacek, who didnt flinch when his starting guard Derrick Rose hit the floor hard after being fouled in the first quarter and left the game soon after with back spasms.

title: Arrow Star and a Former MTV Executive: Just 2 Guys, Selling Wine
description: HOLLYWOOD  We usually start with some sparkling just because its morning, said Andrew Harding, a founder of the Nocking Point wine club. It was a recent Monday, and Mr. Harding, 39, was in the castlelike home of his friend and co-founder, Stephen Amell, 35, the star of the television drama Arrow.

title: At Goldman, Top Departure Opens a Door for the Next Generation
description: Goldman Sachs promoted a new generation of leaders on Wednesday, as Gary D. Cohn, its longtime No. 2 executive, leaves the Wall Street bank to join President-elect Donald J. Trumps incoming administration.

title: Review: The Only Big Name Here Is Still J. Coles
description: Each of J. Coles three major label albums to date has gone platinum, but as his online defenders will never fail to remind you, the most recent one, 2014 Forest Hills Drive, went platinum with no features  that is, with no other big-name guests. The phrase became a rallying cry and eventually a meme. The subtext was that Mr. Coles vision is singular, his work not a by-committee agglomeration: He managed to take their honor while playing by his rules.

title: Man Gets 20-Year Sentence for Hate Crimes at a Queens Mosque
description: He called the mosque in Queens and left threatening messages, and when a door was smashed in, the man was also the culprit, the authorities said. Then, early one morning in 2012, prosecutors said, the same man waited as a worshiper unlocked the mosques front door and then stabbed the worshiper repeatedly.

title: Review: No Knives in the Kitchens of This City Describes a Syrian Hell
description: Aleppo has essentially fallen. The images have been unignorable, calamitous: of residents wandering numbly through burning city streets; of parents sobbing over dead children; of the strong wheeling away the weak. On Tuesday, a United Nations official described the massacre of fleeing civilians as a complete meltdown of humanity. Residents have been tweeting out their goodbyes. Tens of thousands have already been displaced or perished.

title: To Help Women in Opera, Several Institutions Arise
description: With the presentation of Kaija Saariahos LAmour de Loin this month, the Metropolitan Opera finally broke a 113-year streak of not performing any operas written by women. It remains a difficult landscape for female composers, but there are institutions that advocate for them.

title: Justices to Hear Cases on Withheld Evidence and Bad Advice
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court on Wednesday agreed to decide whether the convictions of seven defendants in a notorious 1984 murder must be set aside because prosecutors withheld evidence about another suspect. The court also said it would hear a case on the consequences of bad legal advice about whether a criminal conviction would lead to deportation.

title: The Oakland Fire: Tenants Living in Warehouses Face Eviction
description: New York Times reporters are investigating the devastating fire that killed 36 people this month at a warehouse called the Ghost Ship in Oakland, Calif. Were also doing something new: providing regular updates on our findings. Do you have information, advice or feedback? Send an email to oaklandfire@nytimes.com.

title: Fox News Names New Head of Human Resources
description: Fox News has appointed a new head of human resources in the aftermath of a sexual harassment scandal that led to the ousting of the networks chairman and exposed a culture of inappropriate behavior toward women.

title: Joe Ligon, Gospel Singer With the Mighty Clouds of Joy, Dies at 80
description: Joe Ligon, whose raspy, throbbing vocals and preaching style helped make the Mighty Clouds of Joy one of the most successful gospel quartets of all time, died on Sunday. He was 80.

title: A Man Is Shot in the Back, and Only the Police Are Kept in the Dark
description: On a warm Tuesday night in the Bronx, a couple of dozen young people took refuge from their stuffy apartments in a courtyard between two redbrick towers in the Melrose Houses. They laughed, drank and smoked freshly rolled blunts as a speaker pumped out rap music.

title: For Toronto Maple Leafs Star Young Forwards, a Reality Check
description: TORONTO  As the Toronto Maple Leafs rebuild around young players, they sometimes take one step forward and two steps back.

title: Donald Trump Names Top Michigan Official to Senior G.O.P. Committee Post
description: WASHINGTON  President-elect Donald J. Trump announced Wednesday that Ronna Romney McDaniel, the chairwoman of the Michigan Republican Party, would serve as the senior official of the Republican National Committee, rewarding a loyalist from a crucial state and retaining a firm grip on his adopted party.

title: Muslim Woman Made Up Hate Crime on Subway, Police Say
description: An 18-year-old Muslim woman who claimed that three men attacked her on a Manhattan subway this month and tried to pull off her hijab was charged on Wednesday with filing a false report, the police said.

title: N.B.A. and Players Union Agree to New Labor Deal
description: At a time of enormous popularity and prosperity for the N.B.A., the league and the players union reached an agreement in principle Wednesday on a seven-year collective bargaining agreement that ensures labor peace through the 2023-24 season.

title: Bishop Javier Echevarra, Leader of Opus Dei, Dies at 84
description: Bishop Javier Echevarra, the last of the original generation of clerics to lead Opus Dei, the disciplined and influential global Roman Catholic organization, died on Monday in Rome. He was 84.

title: News Media Blame Christie for Bill That Could Devastate Newspapers
description: Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey has made no secret of his disdain for the news media, so when legislation that could hurt the states newspapers appeared suddenly this week, fingers pointed at the governors office.

title: Lost and Found on a Summer Garden Night
description: Dear Diary:

title: Loath to Meddle in Election, Obama Delayed Blaming Russia for D.N.C. Hack
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration spent months deliberating whether to blame Russia for a cyberattack on the Democratic National Committee, with action delayed in part because President Obama did not want to be blamed for politicizing intelligence, the White House said on Wednesday.

title: Investors Sharpen Focus on Social and Environmental Risks to Stocks
description: Pfizer stock was riding high in June 2015, up 128 percent in five years, making it the second-most valuable American drug maker. Nine out of 10 Wall Street research analysts recommended that investors hold it in their portfolio, if not buy more.

title: How to Protect Your Personal Information Online
description: Runa Sandvik, The New York Timess director of information security in the newsroom, and Nicole Perlroth, who writes about cybersecurity and privacy, answered reader questions about cybersecurity.

title: Miss World Contestant Who Challenged China Is Allowed to Speak Once More
description: Anastasia Lin, the Miss World contestant whose advocacy for victims of human right abuses in China has infuriated Beijing, appears to have regained her voice.

title: Photographer Rodney Smith
description: Rodney Smiths whimsical work invited comparisons to the Belgian surrealist Rene Magritte.

title: N.F.L. Owners Pave Way for Chargers and Raiders to Move
description: IRVING, Tex.  N.F.L. owners on Wednesday showed signs of grudging support for allowing the San Diego Chargers to move to Los Angeles and the Oakland Raiders to leave for Las Vegas, with plans for stadiums in the teams current cities having all but vanished.

title: Exxon Mobil Taps Darren Woods to Replace Rex Tillerson
description: HOUSTON  Exxon Mobil wasted no time in announcing on Wednesday that Darren W. Woods, the company president, would succeed Rex W. Tillerson as chairman and chief executive now that Mr. Tillerson has been nominated to head the State Department.

title: To Combat Trump, Democrats Ready a G.O.P. Tactic: Lawsuits
description: One attorney general, Eric T. Schneiderman, is already investigating Donald J. Trump over possible violations of New York State law at his charity foundation.

title: Empire Season 3, Episode 9: The Enemy Within
description: The phrase midseason finale is televisions most egregious neologism. Essentially marketing-speak for the last episode of the year before we take a few weeks off around the holidays, because were not just airing the whole season in a row the way cable shows do, it carries with it an oxymoronic promise of finality. But this weeks Empire is the rare (sigh) midseason finale that lives up to the moniker. An effective wrap-up of a half seasons worth of story lines, it sets up the show to start anew next year, bigger and better.

title: Aleppos Destroyers: Assad, Putin, Iran
description: Watching the fall of the ancient Syrian city of Aleppo has been excruciating. Civilians who survived weeks of intense shelling have reportedly been slaughtered by the forces of the Assad government as they have fled the battle zone, some shot in house-to-house searches. Thousands more are trapped with no food, water or shelter. This is a message from someone saying farewell and who could face death or arrest at any time, a medic wrote on a messaging service. The United Nations called the catastrophe a complete meltdown of humanity.

title: 40 Port Authority Officers Could Be Disciplined in Neglect of Duty
description: More than 40 police officers with the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey could face disciplinary charges after an internal investigation found that they had neglected their duties by avoiding work in break rooms and missing patrols, authorities said Wednesday.

title: G.O.P. Resistance Builds to John Bolton as State Dept. Deputy
description: WASHINGTON  President-elect Donald J. Trumps extended deliberations over assembling a team to run the State Department are reviving some of the same debates that consumed the years of war and strife in the administration of George W. Bush. And in some cases, the cast of rivals is even the same.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: The whole project knows about it. The only one theyre not telling is me.

title: Rodney Smith, Whimsical Photographer, Dies at 68
description: Rodney Smith, a prominent photographer whose whimsical work invited comparisons to that of the Belgian surrealist Ren Magrittes, died on Dec. 5 at his home in Snedens Landing, N.Y. He was 68.

title: How the World Closed Its Eyes to Syrias Horror
description: The faces of the besieged stare into the camera, at us and at death, pleading for help, describing the atrocities outside their bedrooms or just on the other side of the door. They are baffled by our indifference to the slaughter.

title: A Deer Ventures to Harlem
description: A white-tail deer has recently taken up residence in Jackie Robinson Park.

title: Christmastime Refrain
description: THURSDAY PUZZLE  You might not have noticed, but its almost Christmas (and Hanukkah, which begins on Christmas Eve this year).

title: Pregnant Women Warned to Avoid Brownsville, Tex., Because of Zika
description: Federal health officials warned pregnant women on Wednesday to avoid visiting Brownsville, Tex., because of the threat of infection with the Zika virus.

title: North Carolina G.O.P. Moves to Curb Power of New Democratic Governor
description: RALEIGH, N.C.  Republicans in the North Carolina legislature on Wednesday took the highly unusual step of moving to strip power from the incoming Democratic governor after a bitter election that extended years of fierce ideological battles in the state.

title: Zombie Outbreak and Synthetic Marijuana
description: A study published Wednesday in the New England Journal of Medicine offers the first detailed look at a powerful drug that has caused dozens of people to overdose.

title: Unusual New Resident of Manhattan Has People Talking
description: On Wednesday morning, Rosie Copeland was out with her uncle Luke near Jackie Robinson Park in Harlem when they saw a crowd gathered near a chain-link fence, snapping photos. They went to see what the fuss was about.

title: Designated Survivor Season 1, Episode 10: Fireworks
description: There are treasure hunts, and then there is Hannah Wellss insane, labyrinthine journey through the midseason finale of Designated Survivor.

title: Cosbys Lawyers Argue to Block Accounts of Other Accusers
description: NORRISTOWN, Pa.  Lawyers for Bill Cosby on Wednesday attacked the credibility of 13 women who said they were sexually assaulted by the entertainer decades ago, arguing that their accounts should not be used as evidence in Mr. Cosbys coming criminal trial on charges of aggravated indecent assault.

title: Chinas Meitu, an Aspirational Beauty App, Goes Public
description: HONG KONG  Your phone can make your face whiter. A touch can taper your jaw. It can slim your cheeks. Widen your eyes. Of course, it can make you thinner.

title: Corrections: December 15, 2016
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: Aleppo, Donald Trump, Brexit: Your Thursday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: 36 Hours in Nairobi
description: From giraffe kisses to country music, spend some time with the delights of Kenyas capital.

title: 36 Hours in Nairobi, Kenya
description: Nairobi, the capital of Kenya, calls itself the City in the Sun, and a visit can be as pleasant as that sounds. Most outsiders drop in for two reasons: business and animals. A short flight from spectacular wildlife parks such as the Maasai Mara, Nairobi has also become a magnet for some of the worlds biggest corporations trying to gain a foothold in Africa. The city is surprisingly beautiful with flowering trees and the perfect climate: 70s and 80s, sunny, low humidity  almost every day. Its a palpably multicultural place, encapsulating what is happening in Africa better than any other city on the continent. Picture new construction, a lot of people, intense traffic, and more and more Western businesses. Yet you can still feed giraffes and baby elephants from within the city limits and see Maasai warriors ordering lattes in red-checkered blankets.

title: Jameis Winston and Woman Who Accused Him of Rape Settle Lawsuits
description: Quarterback Jameis Winston has settled a dispute involving two federal lawsuits with a woman who accused him of rape, an allegation that ultimately touched off a national debate over a matter in which Winston was never prosecuted or disciplined.

title: Whats on TV Thursday: Nashville on CMT, and Jingle Ball 2016
description: Sing it! Nashville debuts on its new home, CMT. The Jingle Ball rocks Madison Square Garden. And Trinity Wall Street streams Handels Messiah.

title: The Gingerbread of Torun, Poland
description: A spicy cookie from the Middle Ages continues to draw visitors to this medieval city.

title: 36 Hours in Nairobi, Kenya
description: Intense traffic, a strong multicultural vibe, big global businesses  and yet you can still feed giraffes and elephants within the city limits.

title: Five Places to Go in Pristina
description: Pristina swims in superlatives. With a population of 200,000, Kosovos chief metropolis is also the hub of Europes youngest national population; the average age of a Kosovar is 28. The vortex of this energetic destination is the pedestrian-only Bulevardi Nene Tereza (Mother Teresa Boulevard). Radiating from the promenade, named for the recently canonized Albanian nun and bookended by the Yugoslavian-era Grand Hotel and National Theater, is a tangle of streets crowded with cafes, boutiques, fashionable locals, in-the-know internationals and the case for yet another superlative: coolest neighborhood in the Balkans.

title: Word + Quiz: unwarranted
Calling All Party People in Times Square
description: Jane Dicksons subway mosaics of New Years revelers in Times Square are seen  and photographed  by countless passers-by each day. Now, Lens is asking that you stop and take a picture of them.

title: Donald Trumps Denial About Russia
description: No matter how divided our politics and our times, Americans can agree that our status as a strong, democratic nation rests on the bedrock of free and fair elections. That confidence is what was targeted when Russia, one of our oldest, most determined foreign adversaries, invaded American computer networks and released thousands of pages of documents to undermine the legitimacy of the 2016 election.

title: Why G.O.P. Electoral College Members Can Vote Against Trump
description: With the Electoral College set to meet next week, millions of Americans horrified by the prospect of a Donald J. Trump presidency have implored red-state electors to vote for Hillary Clinton or an establishment Republican. Millions of Americans supportive of Mr. Trump find these efforts galling. But both sides agree on what to call such electors: faithless.

title: Coal Miners Lose Their Appalachian Champion
description: Ken Hechler was an extraordinary, long-lived politician who arrived fresh from the New Deal in the coal hollows of West Virginia six decades ago as a carpetbagger from New York. He soon became the ultimate antagonist of Big Coal for its neglect and abuse of miners, serving as their voice in Congress for nine terms.

title: For Mitt Romney, Dinner and a Kiss-Off
description: Farewell, Mitt Romney, farewell.

title: Favorite Mobile Games
Why Islam Gets Second-Class Status in Germany
description: Religion in Germany is not a private affair. Government at all levels recognizes religious communities as public institutions, and encourages participation in them  Germans who register with the state as Roman Catholics, Protestants or Jews pay a religion tax, which the government then sends to their respective institution. Religious groups are also allowed to give faith-based instruction in public schools: Its not uncommon for a small-town pastor, priest or lay person to have a spot on the local high school faculty.

title: No, Settlers Dont Control Israeli Politics
description: JERUSALEM  A government that is repeatedly described, with only partial justification, as Israels most right wing ever is about to evacuate a Jewish settlement in the West Bank named Amona.

title: Calling All Party People in Times Square
description: Jane Dickson just cant get away from Times Square. She started out as a designer working the big animated billboard in the 1970s, participated in the groundbreaking Times Square art show in 1980 and finally moved there in 1981 with her husband, the filmmaker Charlie Ahearn. One New Years Eve soon afterwards, the artist was pregnant and cooped up in her loft. Against advice  and maybe common sense  she braved the growing crowds and went out to photographs the revelers.

title: Donald Trumps Alt-Reality
description: Since Election Day there has been an abundance of liberal hyperbole about the dangers of a Trump administration.

title: Questions for: Turkeys Free Press Withers as Erdogan Jails 120 Journalists
description: Article: Turkey's Free Press Withers as Erdogan Jails 120 Journalists

title: Have You Ever Given, or Received, a Perfect Gift?
description: Have you ever gotten a spectacularly awful gift that you wanted to toss in the trash? Have you ever received a gift and then re-gifted it, only to be somehow discovered in the process? Have you ever been completely stressed out about selecting a gift for someone important to you, or someone you barely knew?

title: Pork-and-Chive Dumplings That Offer a Taste of Home
description: At her home in the Riverdale section of the Bronx, Helen You made dumplings and told her children stories about growing up in China. About how when she was a little girl, she would visit her father  their grandfather  in a prison, far from home, on an island that turned pitch dark after sundown.

title: Is It Possible to Make a Less Allergenic Peanut?
description: In the summer of 1987, Wesley Burks, a pediatric allergist in Little Rock, decided to enroll in a graduate-level biochemistry course at the University of Arkansas. Twice a week, instead of driving to his laboratory at the Arkansas Childrens Hospital, he headed to the medical-school campus about a mile away. There, he joined some 20 students learning to pipette liquid extracts into gels and stain them with pigments to figure out which protein molecules they contained. Burks had only recently completed his medical fellowship, where he studied why some children have allergic reactions to milk and eggs. Now he was throwing himself into biochemistry so he could be the first to figure out what it was about peanuts that made people so allergic. Its easy to say you want to do something thatll change kids lives, Burks says. But you have to focus on an area to really get it done.

title: The Upper East Side: When Location Isnt Everything
