description: After her graduation from Wesleyan University 20 years ago, Elena Pavloff moved to the East Village in Manhattan and shared a studio with a friend. They had a makeshift bunk-bed setup  one futon and one loft.

title: What Caused Poison-Ivy-Like Blisters All Over This Mans Hands?
description: They didnt itch, but they drove the patient crazy  and hed had them on and off for decades.

title: Review: Beneath the Bombast, Fences Has an Aching Poetry
description: By the end of Fences, we will have learned a lot about Troy Maxson  about his hard Southern childhood, his time in prison and the Negro Leagues, his work ethic, his sexual appetites and his parenting philosophy  but the first and most important thing we know about the man is that he is one of the worlds great talkers. He enters the screen on a tide of verbiage, jawing with his friend Bono (Stephen McKinley Henderson) and bantering with his wife, Rose (Viola Davis). The audience quickly grasps what Rose and Bono have known for years. Troy is by turns funny, provocative, inspiring and hurtful, but one thing he will never be as long as he draws breath is silent.

title: Once Accepted, Soon Rejected? New Yorks Young Immigrants Uncertain Under Trump
description: Vanessa Luna arrived in New York as a 10-year-old from Peru, and grew up as an undocumented immigrant. While her parents worked at cleaning jobs, she hid her status in high school until a guidance counselor helped her get into the State University of New York at Binghamton to study American history.

title: Democrats at Crossroads: Win Back Working-Class Whites, or Let Them Go?
description: WASHINGTON  Sounding like a frustrated Cassandra, Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. lamented last week that Hillary Clinton had not done enough to reach white working-class voters in the presidential campaign. Even more egregious to Mr. Biden, some fellow Democrats had concluded that blue-collar whites were not even worth pursuing.

title: Congregants Quiet Agony at the Dylann Roof Trial
description: CHARLESTON, S.C.  Each morning they flowed into Courtroom Six, escorted by federal officials from a holding room reserved for survivors and families of the victims. The accused, Dylann S. Roof, never turned from the end of the defense table to acknowledge the parents, widows and widowers, children, grandchildren and fellow congregants of the nine African-Americans he confessed to killing in June 2015 at Emanuel African Methodist Episcopal Church.

title: The Years Top Stories From the Fashion World
description: Fashion may never quite recover from 2016. The most memorable thread of the last 12 months had less to do with clothes than existential self-doubt. When Jeremy Scott literally put a smoking  O.K., not a gun, but a dress  on his Moschino runway, it proved to be the metaphor for the whole darn year. In the end, much of what we thought we knew was in question, and all we actually knew was to expect the unexpected. It came in many different shapes, and styles.

title: Heat, Hunger and War Force Africans Onto a Road on Fire
description: The men and boys on the migrant trail out of countries like Niger and Mali say fickle rains and hotter days leave them no option but to risk their lives to gain a livelihood.

title: Aleppo Evacuation Effort Restarts, and Assad Calls It History in the Making
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  After months of fierce bombardment and failed diplomacy, the Syrian government began removing residents from the last rebel-held districts in the city of Aleppo on Thursday, a process that solidifies President Bashar al-Assads control over the countrys largest city.

title: Morning Agenda: Another Yahoo Hack, Executive Shifts, the Investment Climate
description: When a company is the target of two of the largest-known data breaches ever, you have to ask questions.

title: Aleppo, Donald Trump, Yahoo: Your Thursday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: From Street Theater to Wagner on the Opera Stage
description: On a recent morning, the stage director lex Oll was supervising a chorus rehearsal for Richard Wagners The Flying Dutchman in an upstairs room of the opera house here.

title: New York Today: The Return of Winter
description: Updated, 7:12 a.m.

title: Steinbrenners and Andrettis Team Up in Auto Racing Venture
description: Hank Steinbrenner, who has been in the shadows in recent years while his younger brother, Hal, has run the Yankees, is joining another sports scion  the retired racecar driver Michael Andretti  to make an entry into auto racing.

title: Unforgettable Cultural Moments From 2016
description: Its the end of the year, which means a lot of parties that can end in sloppiness and chagrin. For us, it means jotting down what culture mattered this year and talking about that. We invited four pals to join us on Still Processing to talk about what they jotted: Bill Simmons, the chief executive of The Ringer and host of the Bill Simmons Podcast; Ezra Edelman, director of the documentary O.J.: Made in America, the movie Wesley thinks is the best of 2016; and Tracy Clayton and Heben Nigatu, who host the podcast Another Round. Their lists are published below, but their energy and explanations you have to hear for yourself. Next week, well share our own lists.

title: Taiwan Is Both Exhilarated and Unnerved by Trumps China Remarks
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan  Lin Fei-fan led the charge nearly three years ago when hundreds of students occupied Taiwans legislature to protest a trade deal with China. With the islands economy increasingly tied to the mainlands, and Beijings global influence on the rise, he worried that Taiwans independence was at stake  and might be a lost cause.

title: Ruling Paves Way for Transfer of Art Trove Including Nazi-Looted Works
description: BERLIN  A German man who had stashed a trove of art that included works stolen by the Nazis was of sound mind when he bequeathed his fathers collection to the Museum of Fine Arts in Bern, Switzerland, a Munich court ruled on Thursday. The decision paves the way for the 1,500 artworks to be transferred.

title: Congressman Proposes National Surveillance Program After Trump Meeting
description: Representative Peter T. King meets with President-elect Donald J. Trump, and emerges afterward to suggest a national surveillance program modeled on one that ran afoul of the law in New York City.

title: You Had Them at Jerry Maguire: This Art Exhibit Stocks Just One Movie
description: A Los Angeles art gallery will play host early next year to an exhibit in the form of a videotape rental store with nothing but thousands of VHS copies of the Tom Cruise film Jerry Maguire.

title: Dont Call It Smog in Beijing, Call It a Meteorological Disaster
description: BEIJING  Is smog a natural disaster? Beijing officials appear to think so.

title: He Wont Actually Take Away My Insurance, Will He?
description: This article is part of the Opinion Today newsletter. You can sign up here to receive more briefings and a guide to the section daily in your inbox.

title: California Today: Tracking the Bullet Trains Progress
description: Good morning.

title: Feeling a Chill? Blame the Polar Vortex. And Global Warming.
description: On Thursday, temperatures on the East Coast are expected to plummet, and some people  fellow journalists and weather broadcasters, were looking at you  may start talking about a polar vortex.

title: Connie Britton on Brains, Beauty and Changes to Nashville
description: In Season 4 of Nashville, Rayna Jaymess story line played out like an album of sad country songs, with her fractured family and flailing record label.

title: Historian Donates Velzquez to Prado
description: BARCELONA, Spain  The Prado museum in Madrid has announced that it received a royal portrait recently attributed to Velzquez as a donation from an American art historian.

title: U.S. Halts Aid Package to Philippines Amid Drug Crackdown
description: MANILA  The United States said on Thursday that it had deferred giving economic aid to the Philippines because of concerns about the rule of law as the brutal campaign on drugs under President Rodrigo Duterte appears to show no signs of slowing down.

title: How to Back Up Your Social Media Feeds
description: Q. My photos posted on Instagram (along with my captions) function like a visual diary of my years. Is there a safe way to preserve them  off my phone, maybe even to transfer them to hard copy? I would be devastated if they disappeared because of hacking, changes in the program, my account ending, etc.

title: Driven | Nissan Rogue Hybrid
description: Nissan's new crossover offers the form factor that buyers want along with good fuel economy. Gas might be inexpensive now, but efficiency is always in fashion.

title: American Universities in a Gulf of Hypocrisy
description: WASHINGTON  Cyberespionage may be the new normal, but you wouldnt think that an American graduate student would be a target for state-level spyware and surveillance. Apparently, though, I am.

title: Video Review: Nissans Rogue Joins the Toyota RAV4s Hybrid S.U.V. Club
description: TRENDS ebb and flow in the automotive world. A decade back, being seen in a Prius was trs chic. Now, with gasoline cheaper than bottled water, Americans are accessorizing their driveways with S.U.V.s and crossovers.

title: Rodents Run Wild in Paris. Blame the European Union.
description: PARIS  On chilly winter mornings, most Parisians hurry by the now-locked square that is home to the beautiful medieval Tour St. Jacques. Only occasionally do they pause, perhaps hearing a light rustle on the fallen leaves or glimpsing something scampering among the dark green foliage.

title: Driving Down Memory Lane in the Original Minivan
description: ALLENTOWN, Pa.  Minivans are the automotive equivalent of the comedian Rodney Dangerfields routine about not getting any respect. Theyre uncool at any speed.

title: Oh, Rats! A Quiz
description: There are billions of rats around the world, they feature in movies and songs, and they provoke fear and revulsion in many of us. But how well do you know our rodent companions?

title: Charlie Sykes on Where the Right Went Wrong
description: MILWAUKEE  After nearly 25 years, Im stepping down from my daily conservative talk radio show at the end of this month. Im not leaving because of the rise of Donald J. Trump (my reasons are personal), but I have to admit that the campaign has made my decision easier. The conservative media is broken and the conservative movement deeply compromised.

title: 21st Century Fox Reaches $14.8 Billion Deal for Remainder of Sky
description: LONDON  Rupert Murdochs 21st Century Fox said on Thursday that it had reached a deal to take full control of the British satellite television giant Sky, paying about $14.8 billion for the rest of the shares it does not already own.

title: Review: Dreamgirls Makes an Overdue British Debut
description: The cry from the heart is still there. No, make that the gut or someplace deep within our capacity to process grief and heartache, so that it rises up in a tsunami of untrammeled emotion.

title: Hanks Long Suffering
description: In a year when a number of notable books (and editorials and electoral analyses) focused on the history and fate of the white working class in America, Mark Ribowskys Hank: The Short Life and Long Country Road of Hank Williams is a timely biography, though its subject died nearly 64 years ago. Like his old man, Ribowsky writes, Hank was brought up believing he was white trash  and this sensibility was his means of finding success, not by pushing it away but by turning it into engaging commercial appeal. (I Saw the Light, a biopic starring Tom Hiddleston as the crooner, was released earlier this year.)

title: Trumps Meeting With Tech Leaders Turns Into a Charmfest
description: After plenty of buildup, President-elect Donald J. Trump met with executives from some of the biggest tech companies on Wednesday. It was billed as a potential slugfest between the president-elect and the tech industry because there had been little love lost between both sides during the presidential campaign.

title: Stock Surge Presents Risks for the Trump Administration
description: The big, fat, ugly bubble in the stock market that President-elect Donald J. Trump so astutely identified during his campaign now becomes one of the greatest potential liabilities of his presidency.

title: Will Democracy Survive Trumps Populism? Latin America May Tell Us
description: LEXINGTON, Ky.  Will Donald J. Trump follow the populist script for concentrating power by cracking down on critics? Or are the foundations of American democracy and the institutions of civil society strong enough to resist such an action? For answers, Americans should take a look at Latin America, where, starting in the 1940s, elected populists undermined democracy.

title: They Paid to See LeBron James. They Got Kay Felder.
description: The tickets that fans bought for Wednesday nights game in Memphis promised a matchup between the Cleveland Cavaliers and the Grizzlies. And the paying customers did indeed get to see a game between the Cavaliers and the Grizzlies.

title: 9 Ways to Improve Your Love Life
description: A guide for having better relationships, culled from 2016s most popular Modern Love columns.

title: The Best Architecture in New York of 2016
description: For the ribbon-cutting at the Washington Heights Library this month, the son of a former custodian returned to his old home. He grew up in what used to be the caretakers apartment on the third floor. While his father shoveled coal at night to heat the place, he would go downstairs to read about boat building and navigating by the stars. Ronald Clark went on to become the first in his family to graduate from high school and college, and decades later he built himself a boat and navigated by the stars that he had learned about in the library under him.

title: Americans Hearing Loss Decreases Even With Ubiquitous Headphones
description: As concern rises over the effect of continuous use of headphones and earbuds on hearing, a new paper by federal researchers has found something unexpected. The prevalence of hearing loss in Americans of working age has declined.

title: U.S. Blocks Mine Planned Near Boundary Waters in Minnesota
description: The Obama administration on Thursday blocked development of a copper and nickel mine near a popular wilderness area in northern Minnesota, saying the project could poison the vast web of lakes, streams and wetlands that crosshatch the region.

title: Egypt Says Traces of Explosives Were Found on Bodies From Paris Flight
description: CAIRO  Egypt said Thursday that explosive traces had been detected on the bodies of passengers retrieved from EgyptAir Flight 804, which plunged into the Mediterranean Sea in May and killed all 66 people on board.

title: 1966: Mrs. Kennedy Set to Endure Horrible Trial Over Book
description: NEW YORK  Mrs. Jacqueline Kennedy, claiming she faces a horrible trial, said today that she will file suit to prevent publication of William Manchesters controversial book, The Death of a President.

title: Pablo Larran on His Latest Films, Jackie and Neruda
description: How risky is it to make a movie about a real-life historical character audiences think they already know? Filmmakers do it all the time, of course, with varying degrees of skill and success. But its rare to attempt it twice at the same time, with two strikingly different movies filmed in different languages and set in different countries, as the 40-year-old Chilean director Pablo Larran has just done.

title: Lidocaine Numbs the Pain of Infant Shots
description: A bit of sugar on the tongue may help distract a baby from the pain of an injection, and cuddling and cooing probably helps, too. But according to a new study, the most effective way to reduce the infants pain is to apply lidocaine cream at the injection site as well.

title: What Events Most Shaped America in Your Lifetime? A Pew Survey Tries to Answer
description: As divided as the American public may seem, there are still some things on which most people agree.

title: The Market and the Trump Effect: What Do the Tea Leaves Say?
description: So much for the January barometer.

title: The Obama Economy Has Unfinished Business
description: You can be forgiven if its hard to remember just how dark the economic future looked exactly eight years ago. The mind, after all, has a way of blocking out memories of trauma.

title: China Suggests It Has Placed Weapons on Disputed Spratly Islands in South China Sea
description: BEIJING  China signaled on Thursday that it had installed weapons on disputed South China Sea islands and would use them like a slingshot to repel threats, compounding tensions with the incoming Trump administration.

title: Brexit Talks Could Stretch 10 Years, British Official Warns
description: LONDON  Struck off the guest list for dinner at a European Union summit, Britains prime minister, Theresa May, faced a second embarrassment on Thursday, over warnings that trade talks on quitting the bloc could last a decade, and even then might fail.

title: Scientists Say the Clock of Aging May Be Reversible
description: At the Salk Institute in La Jolla, Calif., scientists are trying to get time to run backward.

title: Mets Pitcher Jeurys Familia Has Domestic Violence Case Dismissed
description: FORT LEE, N.J.  A domestic violence charge against Mets reliever Jeurys Familia was dismissed on Thursday by a municipal court judge in Fort Lee, N.J., after a prosecutor indicated that there was not enough evidence to move the case to trial.

title: Looking for Love? Put On a Cat Sweater
description: For those searching for a soul mate, the how-to website WikiHow offers an 11-step plan that could be of help. It tells the lovelorn about fruitful places to look for a mate and instructs them to do things such as make a list of the traits sought in a partner and to start looking.

title: The Desk Wants to Know
description: Times Insider shares historical insights from The New York Times.

title: The Man in the High Castle: An Alternative America Hits Home
description: Before the premiere of The Man in the High Castle last fall, Amazon upset New York City subway riders with an advertising campaign that plastered train cars with Nazi imagery. This year, Amazon promoted the series, set in an America under fascist rule, with billboards depicting the Statue of Liberty, her arm thrust out Sieg Heil fashion.

title: Milwaukee Officer Charged in Shooting That Set Off Riots
description: MILWAUKEE  A Milwaukee police officer fatally shot a man in August just after the man had thrown his gun away and lay on the ground unarmed, the authorities said on Thursday as they charged the officer with homicide.

title: Ex-Rikers Island Guard Is Found Guilty in Inmates Death
description: A former correction officer on Rikers Island was convicted on Thursday of violating the civil rights of a seriously ill inmate who died after the officer kicked him repeatedly in the head while other officers pinned him facedown on the floor.

title: Help Through Foster Care, Toward a Career of Helping Others
description: Shaqueana Peopless mother quit on her when she was 15.

title: 20 States Accuse Generic Drug Companies of Price Fixing
description: A wide-ranging investigation into generic drug prices took its most significant turn yet on Thursday, as state attorneys general accused two industry leaders, Teva Pharmaceuticals and Mylan, and four smaller companies of engaging in brazen price-fixing schemes  and promised that more charges were coming.

title: Its Like a Miracle: Woman Gives Birth Using Ovary Frozen Since Childhood
description: LONDON  A woman has made medical history by giving birth after having had an ovary removed and its tissue frozen at age 9, before reaching puberty.

title: When Your Holiday Is Chrisnukkah
description: This year, when Hanukkah arrives on Christmas Eve, I will remember the holidays back in 2011. At that time, my doctors believed I had only a year or so to live.

title: Facebook Mounts Effort to Limit Tide of Fake News
description: For weeks, Facebook has been questioned about its role in spreading fake news. Now the company has mounted its most concerted effort to combat the problem.

title: To Protect the Land, Jared Sternberg Turned to Tourism
description: The New Orleans resident Jared Sternberg, 30, started Gondwana Ecotours in 2013, the same year he graduated from Tulane University Law School in that city. He studied environmental and human rights with the idea of helping indigenous and underserved populations preserve land and resources, but after completing service work in locations including Ghana, Ecuador, Alaska and Nicaragua, Mr. Sternberg became convinced that tourism could achieve the same goals. This year, Gondwana offered trips to six destinations on three continents. (The name Gondwana refers to an ancient landmass.)

title: Pata Cafe
description: A not-so-secret clubhouse dedicated to plain-spoken Thai dishes in Elmhurst, Queens.

title: At Pata Cafe, Few Ingredients but a Mlange of Thai Flavors
description: At Pata Cafe in Elmhurst, Queens, a tree climbs from the floor through the ceiling. Its as if youd popped through a trap door into a secret clubhouse. A stuffed monkey lounges on a branch, a homage to Bua Noi (Little Lotus), a gorilla who has spent her life in the rooftop zoo of the Pata department store in Bangkok.

title: Dylann Roof Found Guilty in Charleston Church Massacre
description: CHARLESTON, S.C.  Dylann S. Roof, a self-radicalized young white supremacist who killed nine black parishioners last year when he opened fire during a long-planned assault on Emanuel African Methodist Episcopal Church, was found guilty by a federal jury here on Thursday.

title: What E.U. Leaders Are Wrestling With at the End of a Tough Year
description: BRUSSELS  The European Union has had a rough year, buffeted by terrorism, Brexit, far-right populism and lethargic growth, and leaders of its member states were tiptoeing through a geopolitical minefield on Thursday during their end-of-year summit meeting in Brussels. The migration crisis has abated, but only slightly, and collective decision-making is harder than ever. Referendums, like Britains June 23 vote to leave the European Union and Italys Dec. 4 decision to reject constitutional changes, have made life harder for democratically elected leaders. The war in Syria, aggression and meddling by Russia and the election of Donald J. Trump as the United States president have added to the complexity.

title: Anatomy of a Scene | Arrival
description: Denis Villeneuve narrates a scene from "Arrival," featuring Amy Adams.

title: Lagarde Case Is Weak, French Prosecutor Says, Raising Chances of Acquittal
description: PARIS  The prosecutor in the trial against Christine Lagarde, the head of the International Monetary Fund, raised the chance that she would be acquitted of criminal charges linked to the misuse of public funds, after he called the case very weak on Thursday.

title: Aleppo, Donald Trump, EgyptAir: Your Morning Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Denis Villeneuve Narrates a Scene From Arrival
description: In this scene from Arrival, a linguist (Amy Adams) and a team of experts try to communicate with aliens who have planted their ships in several spots around the world. In an interview, the director Denis Villeneuve discussed why he and his production designer decided against using green screen, and how puppeteers were used to mimic the movement of ailens. Here are excerpts from that conversation.

title: Lois Weber, Eloquent Filmmaker of the Silent Screen
description: Once upon a Hollywood time, one of filmdoms biggest directors was Lois Weber. Woodrow Wilson was president, and women couldnt have voted for him even if they had wanted to, but inside the movie industry, women thrived, and Weber thrived above all others. An auteur before that word entered the cinematic lexicon, she wrote, directed and edited films and was admired for her sensitive work with actors, her on-set meticulousness and her stories about women. Her name was invoked alongside the likes of D. W. Griffith, yet, like most female directors of that era, she faded into obscurity.

title: Man, 73, Shot Dead by Officer Had a Crucifix, Not a Gun, Police Say
description: An unarmed man who was fatally shot in Bakersfield, Calif., by an officer who thought he had a gun was actually carrying a crucifix, the police say.

title: What to See in New York Art Galleries This Week
description: Through Dec. 22. ZieherSmith, 516 West 20th Street, Manhattan; 212-229-1088, ziehersmith.com.

title: The Fight for Native Americans Welfare Isnt Over
description: To the Editor:

title: A Plea to the Electors
description: To the Editor:

title: Steven Johnson: By the Book
description: The author of Wonderland says that for a long period, he concentrated on science and technology. But right around when I turned 40, I found myself needing the companionship of novels.

title: North Carolinas Partisan Rift Widens in Fight Over Governors Powers
description: RALEIGH, N.C.  There have been four years of civil disobedience, reputation-bruising boycotts over bathroom access, and legal battles over voting laws and gerrymanders. The election for governor, fraught with Republican challenges, took a month to settle.

title: Halfdan Mahler, Who Shifted W.H.O.s Focus to Primary Care, Dies at 93
description: Halfdan Mahler, a Danish physician who led the World Health Organization as it shifted its focus to primary care but acknowledged that its response to the AIDS crisis had been far too slow, died on Wednesday in Geneva. He was 93.

title: Donald Trumps Choices: Energy and Environment
description: To the Editor:

title: Donald Trumps Choices: Education
description: To the Editor:

title: Obama Says U.S. Will Retaliate for Russias Election Meddling
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama said on Thursday that the United States would retaliate for Russias efforts to influence the presidential election, asserting that we need to take action, and we will.

title: 3G Capital Is Expected to Be in a Buying Mood in 2017
description: The Brazilian billionaires at 3G Capital that turned Kraft Heinz and Anheuser-Busch InBev into mega-acquisition machines will dive back into the buying business in the coming year. Their next target should be Mondelez International, the $66 billion food conglomerate that failed to coax the chocolate maker Hershey into a sale in 2016. A deal will require some unusual ingredients.

title: Like Drinking Cocktails at Home, in L.A.
description: Reza Fahim designed Tenants of the Trees, a nightclub in the Silver Lake neighborhood of Los Angeles, for the new generation of Hollywood stars that relishes privacy: Its surrounded by 14-foot high concrete walls. Within the cramped, labyrinthine corridors of Tenants, on the smallest dance floor in Los Angeles, Frank Ocean swayed incognito on the night his long-anticipated second album, Blonde, dropped last August. And on a recent Thursday night, the burgeoning London rockers the Big Moon claimed a cabaret stage to play a secret concert to close their first North American tour; unbeknown to them, the band served as an opening act for an impromptu two-hour set by Dave Chappelle.

title: Can I Stay at a Hotel When Visiting My Crowded Family Home?
description: I am 55 and the oldest of four siblings. We all congregate at our parents home (with spouses and kids) over the holidays. Their place has many bedrooms but only two baths. The commotion is fun during the day, but at night, the house is overcrowded and noisy. For a few years, I have gotten a hotel room three blocks away. I only use it for sleeping and showering. But sleeping there, instead of on the couch, causes resentment in the family, especially from my mother. How can I explain that I dont mean offense?

title: Evacuations Underway in Aleppo
description: Hundreds of people are leaving opposition-held parts of Aleppo, Syria, in a renewed effort to evacuate civilians.

title: Shopping List for Champagne
description: The bigger producers of Champagne are producing excellent, distinctive celebratory wines, even at the entry level. Here are 10 big brands well worth seeking out, and a glossary to help you navigate the selections.

title: For Swimmers With Ice Water in Their Veins, an Event to Match
description: BURGHAUSEN, Germany  Burghausen Castle, perched on a hill high above this scenic Bavarian town, was still bathed in a white morning fog when the first swimmers of the day approached the Whrsee, a sickle-shaped lake that curls along the medieval fortifications western flank.

title: Q. & A.: How to Give Back During the Holidays
description: Donations to charitable organizations can make a difference in your community and also reduce your tax burden. But how do you decide what to give and to which organizations, and what does it mean for your taxes? Your Money columnist Ron Lieber, reporters from The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund and social work experts gathered for an hourlong live chat to discuss the best ways to give back during the holidays.

title: Russia Turns Over American Cybertheft Suspect to the U.S.
description: MOSCOW  Russian authorities have deported to the United States an American cybercrime suspect who is one of the United States most wanted men, even as the two countries are at loggerheads over politicized hacking.

title: $100 Million Deal to Save Pier 40 in Manhattan Is Approved
description: Its a twofer.

title: U.S. Faces Tall Hurdles in Detaining or Deterring Russian Hackers
description: WASHINGTON  When a suspected Russian cybercriminal named Dmitry Ukrainsky was arrested in a Thai resort town last summer, the American authorities hoped they could whisk him back to New York for trial and put at least a temporary dent in Russias arsenal of computer hackers.

title: With Champagne, Big Can Be Beautiful, Too
description: Over the last 15 years, the rising appeal of grower Champagne, wine produced by small farmers who grow their own grapes, has transformed our notion of what the regions wines can be.

title: To Understand Trump, Learn Russian
description: The Russian language has two words for truth  a linguistic quirk that seems relevant to our current political climate, especially because of all the disturbing ties between the newly elected president and the Kremlin.

title: For Joyce Pensato, Its Not the Same Without the Ambient Muck
description: Its getting there, the painter Joyce Pensato said. Hands on her hips, she was scrutinizing the cluttered, paint-splattered length of a studio in Bushwick, Brooklyn, that she moved into about a year ago, after the building that housed her previous studio, a spiritual sanctuary for more than 30 years, was sold. I need to get this a lot dirtier, a lot more stuffed. But it takes time to trash something up just the way you want it.

title: Captured Harlem Deer Gets a Reprieve, but Faces Death Hours Later
description: The white-tailed deer of Harlem will live  but most likely only for a few hours.

title: Students Advised to Be Wary of College-Sponsored Debit Cards
description: Debit cards marketed on many college campuses often arent designed with students best interests in mind, a new report has found.

title: The Call to 911
description: Polly Sheppard, a church member, reported the shooting to a 911 operator.

title: Chefs Table at Brooklyn Fare Set to Open a Manhattan Branch
description: When the opening of a Manhattan branch of the high-end supermarket Brooklyn Fare was announced in 2013, a satellite of its acclaimed restaurant was supposed to follow in the store soon after. Now, three years later, it is about to open.

title: Craig Sager, Colorful N.B.A. Sideline Reporter, Dies at 65
description: Craig Sager, an exuberant sideline reporter for National Basketball Association television broadcasts who was as well known for his outlandishly garish outfits as for the questions he asked coaches and players, died on Thursday in Atlanta. He was 65.

title: No Retirement for a Jewel Thief With a Seven-Decade Career
description: For Doris Payne, an international jewel thief whose criminal career spans seven decades, old habits are hard to kick, if police records are any indication.

title: Review: The Wasted Times, a Hopscotching Shanghai Crime Tale
description: Set against the backdrop of the second Sino-Japanese War, The Wasted Times has the outward appearance of being a sweeping gangland epic. But by employing a nonlinear structure, Cheng Er  who wrote, directed and edited this film  severely diffuses the storys dramatic impact. To think back through the narrative, which spans more than a decade, is to wonder what was gained by withholding details only to reveal them later in flashbacks.

title: Where to Stream the Best Movies of 2016
description: Tis the season for big family films and Oscar hopefuls. But as the film critics for The New York Times remind us, there were plenty of great movies that opened in the years other 11 months. If you happened to miss any, their lists of the best movies of the year should help.

title: 12 Faces of Cate Blanchett: A Chameleon in the Armory
description: If the art world gave out Oscars, Cate Blanchett should win for her tour de force of starring roles in Manifesto, at the Park Avenue Armory. This toweringly ambitious, if occasionally pretentious film installation is the creation of Julian Rosefeldt, its writer, director and producer, a German artist drawn to complex narratives and fusions of real and cinematic space. His latest effort consists of 13 short films whose scripts are stitched together from nearly 50 manifestoes mostly by 20th-century artists, composers, architects and filmmakers. From Futurism to Pop Art and beyond, the writings layer knowledge, language and style into head-spinning densities. Some of these treatises were important turning points in art history; others are nearly forgotten.

title: Review: Two Lovers and a Bear Walk Onto Some Arctic Ice
description: Two Lovers and a Bear begins with two-thirds of the title characters  the lovers  sledding to a frozen body of water, where they then drill holes and do some ice fishing. Passing time while waiting for a bite, the male lover talks about the fact that there are only two musicians that he likes.

title: Bereaved Texas Town Finds Comfort in a State High School Title Game
description: ARLINGTON, Tex.  Even in the discomfort of back and neck braces, Katie Kent, 15, wore her cheerleader uniform on Wednesday morning for a pep rally to send her brother and his teammates off to the state championship game.

title: Review: From Bon Iver, Concerts Tailored to the Spaces
description: Even in the digital era, physical space deeply affects music: a proposition that Bon Iver, Justin Vernons band, affirmed this month with 10 concerts in and around New York City. I saw three of them, all in Brooklyn.

title: Review: Solace Enlists Anthony Hopkins as a Psychic in a Serial-Killer Case
description: Solace was filmed before either of its primary leads, Anthony Hopkins and Jeffrey Dean Morgan, had become highly visible fixtures on two of this falls most hyped television shows. And after seeing Mr. Morgan strut and slaughter as the latest big bad on The Walking Dead, and Mr. Hopkins sneak and scheme as the spider at the center of Westworld, accepting them as this movies white-hat heroes is quite the challenge.

title: Never Too Old to Be an Organ Donor
description: Old age is not necessarily a barrier to kidney donation.

title: Review: Matter-of-Fact Mayhem Strikes in The Hollow Point
description: In The Hollow Point, a grimy, hyperviolent drug drama, death and damage arrive out of nowhere, zipping into the frame by car, bullet, machete and sword. So unexpected are these incidents, and so economically realized, that the movie becomes a lesson in how to build tension without the usual assists of a screaming soundtrack and a deranged camera. Here, mayhem is matter-of-fact.

title: Donald Trump Should Know: This Is What Climate Change Costs Us
description: Last week, Donald J. Trumps transition team sent a startling questionnaire to the Department of Energy. Among other things, the questionnaire asked for the names of all employees and contractors who attended meetings of the Interagency Working Group on the Social Cost of Carbon, as well as all emails associated with those meetings, and the departments opinion on the underlying issues  a request it essentially refused.

title: Review: A Race to Raise Awareness in The Ataxian
description: A couple of years back, the ice bucket challenge was a social-media sensation, raising an estimated $115 million for research into amyotrophic lateral sclerosis, or Lou Gehrigs disease.

title: Review: Kevin!!!!!, a Multimedia Sendup of Home Alone
description: It takes audacity and energy to satirically sabotage a holiday film as revered as the 1990 comedy Home Alone. But in Kevin!!!!!, a multimedia sendup at the Peoples Improvisational Theater, the troupe Recent Cutbacks displays plenty.

title: Beloved Childrens-Book Characters, in Their Own Immersive World
description: During her lifetime, the artist, author and cartoonist Tove Jansson earned fame far beyond her native Finland for her childrens books featuring the Moomins, a race of hippo-like, bulbous-nosed creatures driven by abundant curiosity. Their intrepid exploits, as well as Janssons formidable inventiveness, inform the spirit of the exhibition Adventures in Moominland, which opens tomorrow at Londons Southbank Centre.

title: Review: Mother Africa: My Home Melds Acrobatics and Drumming
description: Life may hold no guarantees, but unless the roof falls in at the New Victory Theater, youre pretty much assured a swell time at Mother Africa: My Home.

title: Adventures in Moominland
description: An immersive new exhibition at Londons Southbank Centre features sketches and other artworks by Tove Jansson, the author and illustrator who created the Moomin series.

title: Review: A Short Stay, but Long Stuck in a Rut
description: Of the many words that might describe Mike (Mike Maccherone), the protagonist of Ted Fendts dour, poker-faced comedy, Short Stay, deadbeat and slacker are two that immediately come to mind.

title: Review: Lots of Plastic in the Face of Collateral Beauty
description: The five stages of grief sometimes seem applicable to movie reviewing, except that I usually skip denial, rarely get around to acceptance and generally just settle into anger, which is where I am with Collateral Beauty. Many of the words that I would like to use to describe this waste of talent and time, which riffs on Dickenss eternal A Christmas Carol and tries to manufacture feeling by offing Tiny Tim, cant be lobbed in a family publication. So, instead, I will just start by throwing out some permissible insults: artificial, clichd, mawkish, preposterous, incompetent, sexist, laughable, insulting.

title: How Facebooks Fact-Checking Partnership Will Work
description: To fight the spread of fake news, Facebook on Thursday said it was trying a series of tests to limit the false articles, including working with several news organizations like The Associated Press, PolitiFact and Snopes. Those groups have formed a coalition to fact-check some of the items flagged as fake news across the social network.

title: Aleppo, Donald Trump, Dylann Roof: Your Thursday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Review: Before Barack, There Was Barry
description: Abraham Lincoln remains the most hallowed of our screen presidents, but it wouldnt be surprising if Barack Obama  another historic, divisive, lanky colossus  eventually followed. In Barry, a satisfying slice of neo-Americana, the future 44th president of the United States is a seeker who enters his journey into the self at a critical juncture, much like the hero in John Fords Young Mr. Lincoln. Lincolns road to discovery puts him on the back of a mule to Springfield; Barry just takes a plane to New York.

title: Review: Lord Buckley, Remembrance of a Hipster Past
description: Few things age as fast as slang  just imagine a play entirely in Valley Girl-ese. At least it could bank on familiarity, which is not the case with His Royal Hipness Lord Buckley, a show built on the half-forgotten verbal quirks of an entirely forgotten personality from the 1940s and 50s. Dig the swinging world of the hip? Solid!

title: Mexican Report Says Investigators Botched Search for 43 Students
description: MEXICO CITY  The Mexican government has refused to release an internal review that found investigators broke the law in their search for 43 missing students, a conclusion that threatens the legal foundations of a case that has roiled Mexico.

title: Hanukkah Event at a Trump Hotel Highlights a Rift Among Jews
description: As President Obama hosted his final Hanukkah celebration at the White House on Wednesday, an umbrella organization of major Jewish groups was co-hosting another Hanukkah party less than a mile away  at the Trump International Hotel.

title: DeVry University Will Pay $100 Million for Students Loans and Tuition
description: DeVry University, a for-profit school that offers courses online and at dozens of locations nationwide, has agreed to a $100 million settlement of a federal lawsuit alleging that it falsely advertised the success of its graduates, the Federal Trade Commission announced on Thursday.

title: Review: Remembering a Happier Holiday Among Many That Were Sad in The First Noel
description: A soft snow was falling outside the Apollo Theater as the crowds arrived late Sunday afternoon, and the lobby inside was decked out for the holidays. When the lights dimmed in the gilded auditorium, and a small choir walked onstage to sing The First Noel, the a cappella sound was glorious.

title: Review: Neruda Pursues the Poet as Fugitive
description: Neruda, Pablo Larrans semifantastical biopic, is a warmhearted film about a hot-blooded man that is nonetheless troubled by a subtle, perceptible chill. Blending fact with invention, it tells the story of a confrontation between an artist (the Chilean poet Pablo Neruda) and an emerging dictatorship, and more generally illuminates the endless struggle between political authority and the creative imagination. For anyone who believes that poetry and democracy spring from the same source and provoke the same enemies, this movie provides both encouragement and warning.

title: Ideas for Productive Discussion: Reflections on Our Civil Conversation Challenge
description: This fall, we invited teenagers to weigh in on some of the most divisive issues of this election and challenged them to have the kinds of respectful, productive discussions across ideological divides that, it seemed, many adults were unable to.

title: This Weeks Movies: Dec.16, 2016
description: The New York Times film critics review Rogue One, Fences and Neruda.

title: 8 New Books We Recommend This Week
description: December has an unwarranted bad reputation in the book world. The so-called big books do tend to come out earlier in the fall (though this year many were pushed later to avoid competing for attention with the election). In December, the book world goes kind of quiet. But heres the unsung part of the month: the little books. Not small in terms of quality  but the niche books, the hidden gems, the books that focus on perhaps a slightly narrower slice of life. Here are eight we think are deserving of (bigger) attention.

title: Whats New in NYC Theater
description: Our guide to plays and musicals coming to New York stages  and a few last-chance picks of shows that are about to close. Our reviews of open shows are at nytimes.com/reviews/theater.

title: The Best Classical Music Recordings of 2016
description: It is a preposterous notion: choosing a mere five albums for a list of the years most remarkable, out of the dozens, even hundreds, of memorable ones that land on a music critics desk over 12 months. So if this collection of 20 (technically, 21) favorites is by no means complete  indeed, it is by its nature almost arbitrary  it is at least a guide to four writers tastes and passions. (Though, coming from a group including devoted opera lovers, it is a strange guide that contains not a single complete opera recording.)

title: Comedy in NYC This Week
description: Our guide to stand-up, improv and variety shows.

title: Hispanic Surnames on the Rise in U.S. as Immigration Surges
description: Taylor and Thomas are out. Lopez and Gonzalez are in. Six of the 15 most common surnames in the United States were of Hispanic origin in 2010, compared with four of 15 in 2000 and none as recently as 1990.

title: Before That Gilded Tower, Another President-Elect Had a Manhattan Home Base
description: At the stately age of 108, the handsome double-width townhouse at 47-49 East 65th Street bears no resemblance to a certain tower of gilt, glitz and high security just 12 blocks away.

title: Film Series in NYC This Week
description: Our guide to film series and special screenings. All our movie reviews are at nytimes.com/reviews/movies.

title: Builders Tried to Rig a Vote and Take Over a Village, U.S. Indictment Says
description: As prosecutors painted it, the scheme seemed logical enough: If a rustic village in upstate New York would not approve a townhouse development that would more than quadruple its size, then bring in new residents, register them to vote and elect a new village board.

title: Cuisinart Recall Just Screwed Up the Holidays for a Lot of People
description: A recall of blades in more than eight million Cuisinart food processors, the workhorse of many American kitchens, could not have come at a worse time for home cooks. With Hanukkah and Christmas less than two weeks away, there are potatoes to grate, nuts to chop and doughs to mix.

title: Bernard Fox, Actor on Classic 60s Sitcoms, Dies at 89
description: Bernard Fox, a Welsh-born actor who spotted the iceberg that sank the Titanic in A Night To Remember and went on to play memorably daffy characters on the sitcoms Bewitched and Hogans Heroes, died on Wednesday in Van Nuys, Calif. He was 89.

title: Pop, Rock and Jazz in NYC This Week
description: Our guide to pop and rock shows and the best of live jazz.

title: Ambiance for a Victorian Spirit at a Bar Called Oscar Wilde
description: Stepping into the cavernous space is a bit like walking into the great hall of the mansion in Citizen Kane. Classical marble sculptures, elaborately carved wooden animals and panels covered with painted rosebuds are everywhere. Though the place is still under construction, the haphazard collection of antiques already here raises the question: What exactly is going on?

title: A Manhattan Yoga Studio for Bad Backs
description: In the era of hip-hop yoga and handstands on Instagram, its easy to associate yoga with impossibly lithe and limber young people. Those with chronic back pain, arthritis or a bum hip might not feel so welcome in a power vinyasa class.

title: California to Regulate Energy Use of Desktop Computers and Monitors
description: Computers, long a symbol of the digital age, are now moving into a more earth-friendly future: Californias state energy agency voted unanimously Wednesday to approve new regulations for energy efficiency in desktop computers and monitors.

title: Sign of a Real Estate Slowdown as Queens Clock Tower Changes Hands
description: Things are getting choppy in New Yorks once-rocketing residential real estate market.

title: Therapy Cats for Dementia Patients, Batteries Included
description: Lou Ann Wyckoff cradled the gray-and-white cat in her lap. She scratched the back of its head and the cat purred, eyes closed. When she stopped petting the cat, it opened its green eyes and meowed for more.

title: Before the Tents Folded
description: Photographs by Vincent Tullo of the final season of the Big Apple Circus, which announced in July that it had run out of money.

title: The Last Days of the Big Apple Circus
description: Heres another way that 2016 feels like a break in the space-time continuum: The Big Apple Circus tents are absent from Lincoln Center this holiday season. After almost four decades, the nonprofit announced in July that it had run out of money, and that a desperate $2 million fund-raising drive had fallen woefully short. Which means there are a lot of sad clowns out there. Children who dream of running away to join the circus will have to Google another roadshow.

title: Classical Music in NYC This Week
description: Our guide to the citys best classical music and opera.

title: Awe-Struck by a Sidewalk Shell Game
description: Dear Diary:

title: The Revolution Upstate: Saratogas Role in Forging the U.S.
description: Tipping Point at Saratoga might sound like a good wager at the majestic upstate New York racetrack, but its an even better bet as the subtitle to 1777 (Oxford University Press, $34.95), a book about the decisive battle that year, which turned the tide of the American Revolution.

title: Santas a New Yorker. You Got a Problem With That?
description: If a guy on Broadway in wraparound shades and a Santa hat insisted to you that Santa is really a New Yorker, you might slip him a buck and make a quick escape to your office party.

title: Germany Didnt Know Migrant Held in Killing Had Violent Past in Greece
description: BERLIN  An Afghan migrant accused of raping and killing a medical student in Germany had been convicted of attempted murder in Greece and had violated parole there, but the German authorities were not aware of his criminal past when he entered the country, the governments top security official said Thursday.

title: Sued by Sumner Redstone, Ex-Girlfriend Answers by Suing His Daughter
description: Its dj vu in the land of the Redstones.

title: Dance in NYC This Week
description: Our guide to dance performances.

title: New Union Contract for New York City Area Airports Does Not Cover Wages
description: After seven months of negotiations, thousands of airport workers in New York and New Jersey have come to terms on their first union contract. But it does not address an impending anomaly that will leave workers on opposite sides of the Hudson River earning different pay for doing the same work.

title: How Danelle Morgan, Radio City Rockette, Spends Her Sundays
description: In her 11th season as a Rockette, Danelle Morgan spends much of her weekends during the holiday season with 35 other high-kicking dancers onstage at Radio City Music Hall. The Christmas Spectacular Starring the Radio City Rockettes, which runs through Jan. 2, offers up to five shows on Sundays alone, several featuring Ms. Morgan, 31. She grew up in Highland Park, N.J., where she studied dance under Mary Frangione, a former Rockette, and later graduated with honors from the Ailey/Fordham B.F.A. dance program. She lives in Manhattan with her husband, Edouard Darres, and their dog, Lula.

title: F.B.I. Monitored Muhammad Ali Connections to Nation of Islam
description: The F.B.I. monitored Muhammad Ali and his ties to the Nation of Islam, newly released documents from 1966 show.

title: A Brazen Power Grab in North Carolina
description: Having lost the governorship of North Carolina, Republicans there are resorting to a novel strategy to subvert the will of the voters: They are trying to strip the new governor of some of his powers.

title: G.O.P. Plans to Replace Health Care Law With Universal Access
description: WASHINGTON  House Republicans, responding to criticism that repealing the Affordable Care Act would leave millions without health insurance, said on Thursday that their goal in replacing President Obamas health law was to guarantee universal access to health care and coverage, not necessarily to ensure that everyone actually has insurance.

title: Success Academy Buys Space in Manhattan Tower for 2 New Schools
description: Success Academy, New York Citys largest charter school operator, has purchased commercial space in a new high-rise building on Manhattans Far West Side for $67.7 million.

title: Art and Museums in NYC This Week
description: Our guide to new art shows  and some that will be closing soon.

title: Available to the Highest Bidder: Coffee With Ivanka Trump
description: WASHINGTON  Ozan M. Ozkural, a London-based investment manager, found a creative way to gain one-on-one access to the new first family: He bid nearly $60,000 to have a cup of coffee with Ivanka Trump for a charity event she was hosting.

title: Despite Wake Forest Leak, Coaches Code Is Stronger Than Stolen Xs and Os
description: In the fall of 1999, Gerry DiNardo, Louisiana States head football coach at the time, got a call from Jim Donnan, his counterpart at Georgia, before a game between the teams in Athens, Ga.

title: Events for Children in NYC This Week
description: Our guide to cultural events in New York City for families with children and teenagers.

title: The Trials of a Boxing Romantic
description: In a glowing underpass in Central Park one night last month, a man and woman danced through a boxing routine. They skipped rope and sparred. He swung and she ducked. Echoing through the space, playing on a cellphone, was a piano composition by the Cuban composer Ernesto Lecuona. It had the feel of a dirge, possibly because Fidel Castro had died three nights earlier.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: He is not a part of my life anymore. Forgiveness has freed me of that, of him completely. Im not going to make him a lifetime partner.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: You can indict 400 people. They dont care.

title: Review: The Trocks Delight With Fabulous Charm
description: Ballet is a completely absurd art  and we love it to pieces: thats what Les Ballets Trockadero de Monte Carlo proclaims with every move. The divas and cavaliers of this all-male troupe are  as they present themselves to us in performance  fabulously stupid, artificial, hammy, clichd, superficial, dated, monstrous. But they simply adore dancing and their audiences, even more than they love makeup and costumes. So, while you laugh at their demented antics, you find yourself watching them with a special tenderness. Youre on their side.

title: Bill Usery, Who Settled Wide Range of Labor Disputes, Dies at 92
description: Bill Usery, an indefatigable and gregarious negotiator who helped avert or settle strikes by railway and postal workers, coal miners and football players as a federal mediator and as the secretary of labor under President Gerald R. Ford, died on Saturday in Eatonton, Ga. He was 92.

title: Grand Juries Said to Hear Testimony on Inquiries Into de Blasio Fund-Raising
description: Two separate grand juries in Manhattan have begun hearing testimony in connection with federal and state criminal investigations into Mayor Bill de Blasios campaign fund-raising, according to several people with knowledge of the matters.

title: U.S. Examines Whether Orange County Violated Defendants Rights
description: LOS ANGELES  The Department of Justice opened a civil rights investigation on Thursday into whether the Orange County district attorneys office improperly used jailhouse informants and withheld evidence.

title: Editors Defend Coverage of Stolen Emails After News of Russian Hacks
description: When WikiLeaks and other websites published troves of hacked emails from the Democratic National Committee and Hillary Clintons campaign during the final months of the presidential election, the American news media enthusiastically seized on the documents to illuminate the inner workings of a political party and its standard-bearer.

title: Hacked Yahoo Data Is for Sale on Dark Web
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Some time around August 2013, hackers penetrated the email system of Yahoo, one of the worlds largest and oldest providers of free email services. The attackers quietly scooped up the records of more than 1 billion users, including names, birth dates, phone numbers and passwords that were encrypted with an easily broken form of security.

title: Calling the Shots
description: FRIDAY PUZZLE  Martin Ashwood-Smith, also known as He Who Builds Quad Stacks, is back with a collaboration with George Barany, and today they offer us a 16x15 grid that has been stretched a bit. Theyve done this to up the long-entry ante with an additional pair of 15-letter entries, the second of which made me laugh out loud. Last. Because it was at the bottom of the grid.

title: Princeton Is Latest Ivy League School to Suspend Team Over Vulgar Materials
description: Princeton University suspended the season of its mens swimming and diving team after the discovery of material on its electronic mailing list that was vulgar and offensive as well as misogynistic and racist, the university said Thursday.

title: Its So Sad, Donald Trump Says of Syria, Promising Safe Zones
description: HERSHEY, Pa.  President-elect Donald J. Trump said on Thursday that the United States would create safe zones in Syria, his first reference to such an American role in the war there since he was elected, and one that comes as the Syrian government has all but recaptured the rebel stronghold of Aleppo.

title: De Blasio Is Fined $48,000 for Campaign Finance Violations
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio was fined nearly $48,000 on Thursday by the New York City Campaign Finance Board for improper spending and other campaign finance violations recorded during the 2013 mayoral race.

title: Minnesota Football Players Pledge Boycott Over Teammates Suspensions
description: The University of Minnesota football team pledged on Thursday to boycott all football activities, including a coming bowl game, to protest the suspensions of 10 players in connection with a sexual assault investigation.

title: Trump Chooses Hard-Liner as Ambassador to Israel
description: WASHINGTON  President-elect Donald J. Trump on Thursday named David M. Friedman, a bankruptcy lawyer aligned with the Israeli far right, as his nominee for ambassador to Israel, elevating a campaign adviser who has questioned the need for a two-state solution and has likened left-leaning Jews in America to the Jews who aided the Nazis in the Holocaust.

title: Corrections: December 16, 2016
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: The Face of Roma
description: Francesco Tottis image can be found all over Rome  on walls large and small, in businesses, on banners in packed soccer stadiums.

title: A Roman to the Core, and the Core of Roma
description: ROME  Armed with spray cans, the vandals last descended on Via della Madonna dei Monti, a dead-end alley not far from the Colosseum, about six months ago. They come to this corner of Rome quite often, according to the streets weary residents. They are sick of seeing their walls daubed with slogans, but they are resigned to it now.

title: Aleppo, Donald Trump, EgyptAir: Your Friday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Old-School Charm at Jims Shoe Repair
description: On a recent Thursday afternoon, Jims Shoe Repair, at 50 East 59th Street between Park and Madison, was packed. Customers  surrounded by old-school shoeshine chairs with brass pedestals and other objects from bygone eras like an oversize gold register from the 1940s  waited to speak with Joe Rocco, 58, or his son Andrew Rocco, 27. Interactions were unhurried and convivial.

title: Plan to Reduce Medicare Drug Costs Is Withdrawn After Bipartisan Criticism
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration said on Thursday that it had scrapped one of its most significant efforts to rein in spending on prescription drugs: a plan for a nationwide experiment in which Medicare would have reduced payments for many drugs given to patients in doctors offices and hospital clinics.

title: Seattle Seahawks Clinch N.F.C. West Title With Win Over Rams
description: Russell Wilson threw three touchdown passes, Tyler Lockett had 130 yards receiving and a score, and the Seahawks won the N.F.C. West title with a 24-3 victory in Seattle over the Los Angeles Rams on Thursday night.

title: Whats on TV Friday: The Man in the High Castle and Barry
description: The Man in the High Castle, whose second season debuts today, continues the story of an occupied America. Barry imagines Barack Obama in his college days. And the violinist Joshua Bell makes beautiful music with some Cuban collaborators.

title: Golden State Warriors Take Advantage of Carmelo-Less Knicks
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  Carmelo Anthony is 32 years old. By conventional actuarial tables, he is in the prime of his adult life. In N.B.A. terms, however, Anthony is grizzled beyond his years  a fact that was thrown into sharper relief Thursday, when the Knicks announced hours before tipoff that he would sit out the teams marquee matchup against the Golden State Warriors.

title: The Week in Pictures: Dec. 16, 2016
description: Photos by The New York Times and by photographers from around the world.

title: Word + Quiz: introvert
The Week in Pictures: Dec. 16, 2016
description: Photos by The New York Times and by photographers from around the world.

title: Enough Conflicts to Fill the White House
description: Thursday was to be the day Donald Trump told America that hes leaving his business to focus on the presidency. He trumpeted that welcome news in a Twitter riff two weeks ago:

title: Will 2017 Be the Year of Criminal Justice Reform?
description: Its no wonder criminal-justice reformers woke up from Election Day 2016 with a sense of existential gloom.

title: Expect a Cozy Trump-Telecom Alliance
description: During the campaign, Donald Trump railed against powerful corporations and promised to prevent  blockbuster mergers like the proposed $85.4 billion deal between AT&T and Time Warner. That was then. Since the election, Mr. Trump has been decidedly less interested in constraining the power of big companies, especially those in the telecommunications industry.

title: The Narcotic of Trump
description: You would think forcing Mitt Romney to eat frog legs, while swallowing his dignity, would have been enough humiliation during the dinner segment of his failed tryout for secretary of state. You would think.

title: Useful Idiots Galore
description: On Wednesday an editorial in The Times described Donald Trump as a useful idiot serving Russian interests. That may not be exactly right. After all, useful idiots are supposed to be unaware of how theyre being used, but Mr. Trump probably knows very well how much he owes to Vladimir Putin. Remember, he once openly appealed to the Russians to hack Hillary Clintons emails.

title: The Whatchamacallit Economy
description: Its a hip, fast-growing sector of the economy, filled with headline-grabbing companies: Uber, Lyft, Airbnb, Task Rabbit. But theres a gnawing problem: People arent sure what to call it. Many critics dislike the term most commonly used, the sharing economy, because there often isnt much actual sharing going on. Others prefer to call it the on-demand economy, peer-to-peer economy, crowd-based economy, gig economy or collaborative economy.

title: Is Donald Trump a Threat to Democracy?
description: Donald J. Trumps election has raised a question that few Americans ever imagined asking: Is our democracy in danger? With the possible exception of the Civil War, American democracy has never collapsed; indeed, no democracy as rich or as established as Americas ever has. Yet past stability is no guarantee of democracys future survival.

title: Inspiration From an Illustration
Questions for: How the World Closed Its Eyes to Syrias Horror
description: Article: How the World Closed Its Eyes to Syria's Horror

title: We Visited the Place the World Has Forgotten
description: Yemen is mired in conflict, with rebels holding the capital and Saudi Arabia bombing them, with American help. Our reporters witnessed the devastating effects.

title: With Homeless Issue, Christine Quinn Gets Back in the Conversation
description: On Sept. 11, 2013, Christine C. Quinn, who had just suffered a rough and at one time entirely unimaginable defeat in New York Citys Democratic primary race for mayor, headed downtown to the National September 11 Memorial and turned off her phone. A few hours later, she realized she had missed several calls from Hillary Clintons office. Mrs. Clinton had phoned to extend her sympathies to a female candidate who had received only 16 percent of the vote among women, had been criticized for an abrasive demeanor, a grating voice, a poorly managed campaign and a failure to telegraph a resonant message that could speak to the fear and disgust surrounding the rise in economic inequality. Only in the rear view, of course, do we see this as preamble.

title: A Grim Discovery in El Mozote
description: Many assumed I died in the massacre of December 1981, when government soldiers killed hundreds of people in El Mozote, my village in El Salvador. The victims were accused of collaborating with left-wing guerrillas, but most of them were women, children and old people. Soldiers tortured my family, poured gasoline on them and set my childhood home on fire. But I survived, because I was in San Salvador, working and studying for my accounting degree. It was only years later that I had thoughts of moving back.

title: Judge John Hodgman on Santa Claus Conspiracies
description: Spencer writes: I believe that Santa Claus is an elf. In The Night Before Christmas, Santa is described as a right jolly old elf. He is also said to travel by miniature sleigh led by eight tiny reindeer, suggesting he is elf-size. My co-worker Elena believes, as many others do, that Santa is a kind of superpowered human. Who is right?

title: How Do You Protect Your Personal Information From Hackers?
description: Take this Times quiz on how many times your personal information has been exposed to hackers.

title: How to Arm Wrestle
description: You need a thick wrist and a big hand and a long forearm, says Kent Damore, a 27-year veteran of pulling, which is what the pros call arm-wrestling. Endurance also plays a big role. Cardio helps a lot, he adds. Thirty seconds of arm-wrestling is equivalent to a round of boxing. He recommends starting with hand- and wrist-strengthening exercises like fingertip pull ups and push ups, as well as wrist curls.

title: A Year In, and Still Trying to Say the L Word
description: The fortuneteller was wrong. Of course, I didnt know it at the time.

title: A Charity Auction for Coffee With Ivanka Trump Appears to Be Canceled
description: In other transition news:

title: The 12.4.16 Issue
description: RE: FIRST WORDS

title: Home Force, Presumption of Death ...
description: As the title indicates, this poem is an erasure of Floridas Stand Your Ground law. The poet has eliminated most of the laws existing text, leaving phrases, words and even parts of words in order to locate within the statute a kind of ghost poem. Such erasures can reveal a deeper poetic truth within texts never designed to be poetry. Selected by Matthew Zapruder.

title: Suburban Buyers Ask: Can I Walk to Town?
description: Andrew and Jeanine Gillette wanted to bring a bit of city living with them when they decamped to the suburbs from a two-bedroom rental in Manhattan late last year. For more than $1.6 million, they bought a six-bedroom house close to the main shopping streets and in walking distance of a Long Island Rail Road station in Garden City, on Long Island.

title: Napping in Public? In Japan, Thats a Sign of Diligence
description: In most countries, sleeping on the job isnt just frowned upon, it may get you fired.

title: Friday Mailbag: The Veil, Storm Troopers and False Equivalence
description: This week, the mailbag has gone international. Well begin in Aleppo, where a pro-Syrian government offensive was forcing civilians to flee. The Times captured the ongoing escape with the lead photo of the Dec. 13 issue carrying the caption: A man fleeing to rebel-held areas of Aleppo, Syria, on Monday, carrying a child with an IV drip. Readers took issue with the fact that the caption did not note the woman in the photo.

title: When It Became Cool to Be Cool
description: Seating was limited at the most anticipated fashion show of 2016, as you would expect. The invitations, printed primly with each attendees name and affiliation, no larger than a pack of gum and eminently lose-able in the dark hole of a handbag, were in short supply. If there was a no-show or an empty seat in the padded television studio where Demna Gvasalia was showing his first collection for Balenciaga, I didnt see it.

title: The New Suburbia: More Urban
description: Some suburbs around New York City are becoming decidedly less suburban, as new apartment buildings and condominium communities close to mass transit help expand the downtowns of these villages and towns. Multifamily housing is also popping up near highways and main thoroughfares.

title: The Boy, the Ambassador and the Deadly Encounter on the Road
description: MOKONG, Cameroon  All life travels the ribbon of asphalt that cuts through this remote village.

title: Catching Big Air at Copper Mountain
description: Big air will be a new event at the Winter Olympics in Pyeongchang, South Korea in 2018. Soar with Red Gerard, a 16-year-old member of the United States snowboarding team during a practice jump.

title: Aleppo Evacuation Halted Amid Confusion and Concerns About Killings
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  The evacuation of residents from the last rebel-held section in the devastated Syrian city of Aleppo broke down on Friday with thousands of people still trapped inside, as concern escalated about their fate.

title: Teaching With: Caines Arcade
description: Caine Monroy, 9, created an elaborate cardboard arcade in his fathers auto parts shop in Los Angeles. The Times reported on how Caines Arcade, a 2012 film about the boy, became an internet sensation.

title: China Has Made Strides in Addressing Air Pollution, Environmentalist Says
description: In his offices in central Beijing on a recent afternoon, Ma Jun, the director of the Institute of Public and Environmental Affairs, a nongovernmental organization, moved his mouse over a computer screen showing a map of real-time air emissions from more than 4,600 Chinese factories. The red rectangles, one for each factory, overlapped one another like badly laid mosaic tiles.

title: President Obama, Aleppo, Climate Change: Your Friday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Morning Agenda: Murdoch Empire Grows, Yahoo Data, Market Tea Leaves
description: Rupert Murdochs already vast empire now encompasses even more of the British media.

title: Wishing Away the Wish List
description: Ive buried my phone at the bottom of my purse so I can try to ignore the calls, emails and texts from well-meaning relatives, all of whom are asking: Where is the Christmas list?

title: How the Concierge Endures in an Internet World
description: Michael Polovich is not one to skimp on research. An assistant attorney general for Tennessee, he applies the same level of meticulousness to leisurely excursions as he does to his casework. So when he and his girlfriend took a trip to Charleston, S.C., this past summer, he had assembled a robust dossier of intelligence on his destination.

title: Is Hot Yoga Good for You?
description: Question:

title: New York Today: Subway Squabbling
description: Updated, 8:34 a.m.

title: A Boston Area Restaurant Both Contemporary and Comfy
description: Theres wood-fired pizza, lots of fried snacks and house-made pasta. But theres also seafood, a sexy absinthe bar and sleek dcor. It is a place vibrant enough for a happy hour pop-in, yet intimate enough for after-dark canoodling over caviar and cocktails. Waypoint, whose name means a stopping point in a journey, is all of these things  and a destination unto itself.

title: Out of His League, But Not for Long
description: When Ben Gliklich met Jessie Della Femina, he thought she was too classy for him. But Ms. Della Femina knew he was her person. They were married Nov. 12 in New York.

title: Of All the Taco Bells in All the Towns ...
description: One night in 2001, when she was just 15, Jessie Della Femina threw what was meant to be a private party at her Hamptons home. The precocious Ms. Della Femina was a fashion upstart who that summer ran a trunk show with a friend, who had diabetes, to raise money for research. She ended up with a clothing line in more than 300 stores.

title: Pax Americana Is Over
description: The thing about The Apprentice is you could turn it off. Now we get to watch Donald Trump all the time. Theres nowhere to hide. I was in Papua New Guinea recently. His name kept coming up.

title: A New Front Against Domestic Abuse: The Hairstylists Chair
description: In the two decades that Angela Smith has been a hairstylist in Chicago, she has heard countless intimate stories from the women who have sat in her chair. Most times the banter is carefree. But sometimes, there are whispers of mistreatment by spouses or partners, of being choked, chased or emotionally abused.

title: Naomie Harris Explains How Moonlight Avoided Crack-Addict Stereotypes
description: Barry Jenkins has drawn tremendous reviews (and the top spot on a number of years best lists) for his tender film Moonlight, about a young black boy, Chiron, who is gay, growing up in the impoverished Liberty City neighborhood of Miami. One of the performers singled out for extra praise is Naomie Harris, who plays Chirons crack-addicted mother, Paula.

title: Biden, Sanders, Warren: Too Soon for 2020?
description: Nate Cohn, The Upshots elections analyst, and Toni Monkovic, an Upshot editor, peeked ahead to 2020 and back at the recent election, posting a lightly edited transcript of their written exchange.

title: As Trump Signals Climate Action Pullback, Local Leaders Push Forward
description: The incoming Trump administration appears determined to reverse much of what President Obama has tried to achieve on climate and environment policy.

title: Dear America, Why Did You Let Us Down?
description: SYDNEY, Australia  On the other side of the world from you, we are living in two time zones. One regulated by the rise and fall of the sun, the other regulated by the American news cycle. In our early afternoon you go to bed, in our late evening you wake again and news breaks afresh. We examine the entrails of the tweets of your president-elect for news of our common future.

title: Six Ways to Give the Gift of Generosity to Children and Teenagers
description: This is not a guilt trip. Pile the presents to the sky, by all means.

title: Boomerang Boom: More Firms Tapping the Skills of the Recently Retired
description: CALL them boomerang retirees: people who exit gracefully after their career at a company, then return shortly afterward to work there part time.

title: Meeting Between Japan and Russia Ends With Stalemate on Disputed Islands
description: TOKYO  The Japanese news media gave breathless coverage to President Vladimir V. Putins two-day visit to Japan this week, training television cameras on the airport in Yamaguchi Prefecture where the Russian leader arrived more than two hours late. Schoolchildren in Nagato, Prime Minister Shinzo Abes hometown, ate borscht and piroshki in honor of Mr. Putins trip to hot spring baths there. In Tokyo on Friday, Kodokan, the premier judo school, received the Russian leader, a black belt, for a demonstration and a meeting with Olympic medalists.

title: Zika Fears Fading, Renewed Interest in Caribbean and Mexico
description: For hotels in the Caribbean and Mexico, the news came in time for their peak season: On Nov. 18, the World Health Organization declared that Zika was no longer a global health emergency and should be considered a dangerous mosquito-borne virus.

title: California Today: What Stinks in Huntington Beach?
description: Good morning.

title: Beijing, Bracing for 5 Days of Heavy Pollution, Issues Red Alert
description: BEIJING  A thick layer of deep gray smog swept into Beijing on Friday afternoon, bringing what the authorities said would be five days of the worst air pollution in a year.

title: Tips on Doorman Tipping and Other Holiday Traditions
description: We are now in the season of little cash-filled envelopes for the doorman. This is also the season of oversize packages overwhelming the mailroom. And of lobby Christmas trees outshining humble menorahs. For millions of New Yorkers who live in apartment buildings, these things are as much a part of their holiday traditions as plum pudding and potato latkes.

title: Yuchun Lee of Allego: The Value of a Daily Mistake
description: This interview with Yuchun Lee, C.E.O. and co-founder of Allego, a Boston-area start-up focused on sales education, has been edited for space and clarity.

title: Why Russias Cyberattack Wasnt Stopped
description: WASHINGTON  It was utterly avoidable. In retrospect, anyway.

title: Assad Leads the Way
description: President Bashar al-Assad is edging closer to victory in Syria.

title: Jeopardy! Champion Dies Before She Could See Her Triumph on TV
description: There cant be many Jeopardy! champions easier to root for than Cindy Stowell.

title: The Weekly Health Quiz: Zombie Drugs, Failing Diets and Restroom Lines
description: Test your knowledge of this weeks health news.

title: Building a Community, and an Empire, With a Gay Dating App in China
description: BEIJING  Ma Baoli was accustomed to secrets.

title: Babies Everywhere, but Not for Us
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  It was about a month ago that I realized I may never have children.

title: Science News That Stuck With Us in 2016
description: As the year ends, the Science desk of The New York Times asked its reporters to look back at the news they reported on that was the most memorable. These are their selections, with a focus on archaeology, biology, physics and space.

title: Medical and Health News That Stuck With Us in 2016
description: As the year ends, the Science desk at The New York Times asked its reporters to look back at the news they reported on that was the most memorable. These are the selections, with a focus on health and medicine news.

title: Daily Report: Facebook Joins Fight Against Fake News
description: Pope Francis endorsed Donald J. Trump for president. Hillary Clinton ran a child trafficking ring out of a Washington pizzeria. Both of these were actually fake news articles that circulated widely online, including on the worlds biggest social network, Facebook.

title: Choosing a Childs First Smartphone
description: Q. In regard to parental supervision, which mobile platform is best for a childs first smartphone  Android or iOS?

title: Hillary Clinton Addresses Supporters
description: The former Democratic nominee addressed the loss of the presidential campaign and Russias role in the election.

title: Across Age Groups, Whites Fared Worse in Employment Rates
description: To what extent did whites miss out on the economic recovery?

title: Extinguishing Free Expression in Algeria
description: For many years, Algerias 79-year-old president, Abdelaziz Bouteflika, suppressed dissent through a combination of generous public subsidies and political repression.
