title: Israel Reaches Agreement to Relocate Amona Settlers
description: AMONA OUTPOST, West Bank  With just days to go before a looming deadline for a court-ordered dismantling of this illegal Israeli settler outpost, Amonas residents agreed on Sunday to a government proposal to relocate many of their homes to an adjacent plot of land on the same West Bank hilltop  a solution critics have denounced as just as illegal.

title: Turkey and Irans Dangerous Collision Course
description: Todays competition between Turkey and Iran is the latest iteration of an old power game: a struggle their progenitors, the Byzantine and Persian empires, started over the control of Mesopotamia  todays Iraq and Syria. While the rivalry outlived their transformation from empires to nation-states, they have managed to keep the peace between themselves for nearly 200 years.

title: Arsenal Cant Avoid Collapse, or Paying Its Stars
description: MANCHESTER, England  It is late in coming, but it has at last arrived.

title: Hong Kongs Leader, Loyal to a Fault
description: Hong Kong  In the quiet of a recent Friday afternoon, Hong Kongs hard-line leader, Leung Chun-ying, announced in a subdued, sometimes hesitant, voice that he would not seek a second term as chief executive. He cited the need for more time with his family: One of Mr. Leungs daughters has long been afflicted with mental-health issues.

title: Heng on Australias Refugee Policy
description: Australia has lowered global standards on how to deal with refugees, shifting the boundaries of what nations now find acceptable.

title: Indonesias Dire Need for Engineers Is Going Unmet
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia  Like many college students, Abdul Hamid is not thinking too much about life after graduation.

title: Al Pacino and Judith Light to Star in Play About Tennessee Williams
description: Al Pacino and Judith Light  two award-winning stalwarts of the stage and screen  will star as Tennessee Williams and his close friend in Dotson Raders God Looked Away at the Pasadena Playhouse in California, ahead of a possible Broadway run.

title: Beckhams Score Helps Giants Beat Lions in a Showdown of Top Teams
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  So often already in his young N.F.L. career, Odell Beckham Jr. has seemed to lift the Giants to victory with his exceptional receiving gifts.

title: Commerce Dept. to Revise Growth Figures; Nike and FedEx to Announce Earnings
description: Heres a look at whats coming up this week.

title: Patti Smith, in Surprise Appearance at MoMA, Says Whats on Her Mind
description: A week before Christmas, in the midst of a Midtown Manhattan decked in its holiday finery, Patti Smith, New York Citys punk poet laureate, gave an unannounced performance before a fast-gathering crowd of several hundred in the lobby of the Museum of Modern Art.

title: The Mosque Next Door: City Law vs. Houses of Faith
description: BERNARDS TOWNSHIP, N.J.  Mohammad Ali Chaudry, a retired financial officer, has lived in this prosperous town for 40 years. It is where he raised his three children and where he served as mayor, and before that, as a member of the school board. It was also where Mr. Chaudry, an observant Muslim, always wanted to pray.

title: As Prices for Classical Scores Soar, One Beethoven Is in Question
description: When a 232-page handwritten score of Mahlers epic Second Symphony (Resurrection) sold for $5.6 million at Sothebys in London last month, it shattered a nearly 30-year record for the highest price paid at auction for a musical manuscript.

title: Review: Debriefing the President Tears Into the C.I.A.
description: Most C.I.A. memoirs are terrible  defensive, jingoistic and worst of all, tedious. Others are doomed by the C.I.A.s heavy-handed and mandatory censorship.

title: Review: Paul Taylors Tracer Recalls a Dance and an Artist
description: The choreographer Paul Taylor, who is preparing his next premiere for March, has been making dances since 1954. But theres one curious divide within his output, too little discussed. Between 1954 and 1962, he made a series of 17 works with designs by the artist Robert Rauschenberg; the last of these was Tracer.

title: Inside the Ku Klux Klan, With an A&E Documentary Series
description: The setup is warm and fuzzy. Girls, I got yall some gifts, says Steven Howard, presenting his two young daughters with prettily wrapped packages, which they eagerly rip into. The cameras then reveal whats inside: the distinctive pointed hoods of the Ku Klux Klan.

title: Review: Mytho? Lure of Wildness Teases the Senses
description: Pale flesh is the first thing we see, examined at very near range by the eye of a video camera. In the opening moments of Anna Kohlers Mytho? Lure of Wildness, it roves over breasts and belly as a fingertip touches this body, which is neither firm nor svelte.

title: New Game Shows for a Fractious Age
description: If you watch game shows just to test your wits, congratulations on your kind heart; on Jan. 1, ABC rolls out a second season of its revamped version of To Tell the Truth just for you. If, on the other hand, you watch game shows in the hope of seeing relationships destroyed, heart attacks induced and humanitys less-appealing instincts courted, three new shows might hit your sweet spot.

title: All This Talk of Voter Fraud? Across U.S., Officials Found Next to None
description: [Read more about fake ballots, mail-in voting and voter fraud.]

title: Santa Player
description: MONDAY PUZZLE  The winter holidays are a week away and, like Santas arrival at the end of the Macys Thanksgiving Day Parade, we welcome his arrival to The New York Times Crossword.

title: Forget Pat the Bunny. My Child Is Reading Hemingway.
description: Alice Hemmers favorite part of Jack Kerouacs novel On the Road doesnt involve the drug-addled cross-country road trips, encounters with prostitutes in Mexico or wild parties in Manhattan. Alice, who is 5 and lives in a Chicago suburb, likes the part when Sal Paradise eats ice cream and apple pie whenever he feels hungry.

title: When Donald Trump Partied With Richard Nixon
description: HOUSTON  They still talk about the Saturday night here 27 years ago when Donald J. Trump partied with former President Richard M. Nixon.

title: Selling Jewelry With a Crowdfunding App and Dash of Social Sharing
description: What happens when you throw together an entrepreneurial supermodel, a charitable crowdfunding app, lots of glittery gems and the odd paper-flower crown? David Yurman is hoping that the answer will be holiday brand-building magic.

title: Zsa Zsa Gabors Lavish Life
description: The Hungarian actress Zsa Zsa Gabor played the femme fatale in dozens of film and television roles.

title: Zsa Zsa Gabor, Actress Famous for Her Glamour (and Her Marriages), Dies at 99
description: Zsa Zsa Gabor, the Hungarian actress whose self-parodying glamour and revolving-door marriages to millionaires put a luster of American celebrity on a long but only modestly successful career in movies and television, died on Sunday in Los Angeles. She was 99.

title: A Jewish Players 1914 Baseball Card Triggers a $125,000 Dispute
description: More than a hundred years after Guy Zinn last appeared in a major-league game, his baseball card is causing a commotion.

title: Zsa Zsa Gabors Life
description: The Hungarian actress Zsa Zsa Gabor played the femme fatale in dozens of film and television roles.

title: With Comic Book, Celebrities Pay Tribute to Orlando Victims
description: The comic book author and screenwriter Marc Andreyko felt unfathomable horror when he heard the news of the June 12 mass shooting at the Pulse nightclub in Orlando, Fla. Feeling compelled to help, he posted on Facebook a suggestion to create a comic book that would benefit the victims.

title: Hungry, Thirsty and Bloodied in Battle to Retake Mosul From ISIS
description: ISTANBUL  After two months, the battle to retake the Iraqi city of Mosul from the Islamic State has settled into a grinding war of attrition. The front lines have barely budged in weeks. Casualties of Iraqi security forces are so high that American commanders heading the United States-led air campaign worry that they are unsustainable. Civilians are being killed or injured by Islamic State snipers and growing numbers of suicide bombers.

title: In Sag Harbor, a Beloved Cultural Oasis Is Lost
description: The program scheduled at the Sag Harbor Cinema over the weekend was typically offbeat: It included a French film about a philosophy professor facing a midlife crisis and a documentary about a Dutch immigrant who turned an old plow horse into a show jumping champion.

title: By Attacking the Press, Donald Trump May Be Doing It a Favor
description: The answer to all the troubling new questions about the future of the news business  how to make money, stop the spread of fake news and reassert a uniform view of reality  appeared last week in a plate of flaccid, gray Szechuan dumplings.

title: 57 Years Later, Even the Library Had Stopped Counting the Fines
description: In her 20th-floor apartment on the East Side of Manhattan, on a recent Saturday afternoon, Barbara Roston was busy explaining that she was definitely not a thief.

title: Snapchat Plays Hard to Get With Celebrities and Influencers
description: SAN FRANCISCO  The musician Jay Sean has visited the headquarters of YouTube, Facebook and Twitter. Instagram has reached out to tutor him on the best time to post photos for maximum impact.

title: Margot Wallstrom on Feminism, Trump and Swedens Future
description: UNITED NATIONS  Margot Wallstrom, Swedens top diplomat, has sought to advance what she calls a feminist foreign policy. What does that mean?

title: Proud to Be a Sanctuary City
description: If the next presidents immigration agenda includes a pitched battle over sanctuary cities, a term Donald Trump uses with disgust, the proper response from places like New York will be: Bring it on.

title: A World of Surveillance Doesnt Always Help to Catch a Thief
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Earlier this year, I had a beer in one of the more budget-conscious bars in the Mission district. My wallet stayed a little later than I did.

title: A (Short) Lifetime Spent Preparing for the Family Business
description: With a baby face that belies even his tender age, Alexandre Tanguay is still occasionally stopped by security personnel in opposing arenas and asked to present his bona fides.

title: Clashes in Chechen Capital Leave at Least Seven Militants Dead
description: MOSCOW  At least seven militants were killed and three hospitalized with gunshot wounds after two clashes with special forces rocked the mountain republic of Chechnya over the weekend.

title: Roger Federer Welcomes the End ... Of a Layoff, Not His Career
description: The Federer family has shared many a road trip, but in this unusually settled period, the patriarch and primary breadwinner has been fielding more and more questions.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: They dont look like polar bears. But it does not matter. I will Photoshop them when I get home.

title: The N.B.A.s Back-to-Back Problem: Rest? Its Your Job, Man!
description: Lee Winfields teammates can still remember him coming to their homes in his Volkswagen van. It was the signal of the start of another trip for the Buffalo Braves in the early 1970s, back when N.B.A. players flew with the general public, washed their own uniforms and endured bone-crushing schedules.

title: Treasury Auctions Set for the Week of Dec. 19
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Mondays regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.

title: Senators Push to Broaden Inquiry on Election Hacking
description: WASHINGTON  Pressure mounted on Sunday for a broader congressional investigation of Russian cyberattacks aimed at influencing the American election, even as a top aide to President-elect Donald J. Trump said there was no conclusive evidence of foreign interference.

title: Mondays N.F.L. Matchup: Carolina Panthers (5-8) at Washington Redskins (7-5-1)
description: 8:30 p.m. Eastern, ESPN Line: Redskins by 6

title: So Order the Tongue
description: Dear Diary:

title: William Hudnut, Mayor Who Transformed Indianapolis, Is Dead at 84
description: William H. Hudnut III, who in his four terms as mayor of Indianapolis revitalized the citys downtown with a focus on professional sports, died on Sunday in Chevy Chase, Md. He was 84.

title: Cardinal Paulo Evaristo Arns Dies at 95; Fought Torture in Brazil
description: Cardinal Paulo Evaristo Arns, whose advocacy of human rights in Brazil placed him in opposition to a military dictatorship that engaged in systemic torture, died on Wednesday in So Paulo. He was 95.

title: Review: The Songs of Nol Coward, With Lightness and Bite
description: No matter how festive your holiday party season may be, it is unlikely to reach the heights, or depths, described in Nol Cowards irresistibly funny song I Went to a Marvelous Party, a highlight of Life Is for Living, a tribute to Coward created and performed by Simon Green and his accompanist at the piano, David Shrubsole.

title: A Sneak Peek at the 2nd Avenue Subway
description: As the citys newest train line nears completion, we take you into the stations along the route that will house the artwork of Chuck Close, Sarah Sze, Vik Muniz and Jean Shin.

title: The Affair, Season 3, Episode 5: Back to Block Island
description: Like salmon heading upriver to spawn, Noah and Alison got back on the boat to Block Island on Sundays nights episode of The Affair. They had sailed this route before  in Season 1, Episode 4  with momentous results: the consummation of their affair and the first complete account of the death of Alisons son, the Eros and Thanatos from which everything in the show has flowed.

title: Devils Lose More Ground With Shootout Loss to Rangers
description: Two hours before he played his third road game in four days, Devils center Travis Zajac strode to the work bench outside the teams dressing room at Madison Square Garden on Sunday and tinkered with his stick, lightly tapping it on the floor to make sure it felt just right.

title: Aleppo, China, Zsa Zsa Gabor: Your Monday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Sylvester Stallone Suggests He Would Decline Trump Arts Role
description: Sylvester Stallone suggested on Sunday that he was not interested in taking a top arts leadership role in the Trump administration, including as chairman of the National Endowment for the Arts.

title: Whats on TV Monday: Michelle Obama on An Oprah Winfrey Special
description: Michelle Obama speaks with Oprah Winfrey about her legacy as first lady. HBO explores the risks of too much holiday imbibing. And LeBron James oversees a different kind of ballgame in The Wall.

title: Word + Quiz: funereal
description: : suited to or suggestive of a grave or burial

title: Kerings Latest Luxury: A Generous Parental Leave Policy
description: Kering, the French luxury-good group that owns the brands Alexander McQueen, Saint Laurent and Gucci, among others, and has made something of a mission out of championing womens rights  with initiatives like the Chime for Change campaign for female empowerment, the Women in Motion talks for film industry professionals and a partnership with the United Nations Women French National Committee  has put its human-resources policy where its cause is.

title: Russian Military Plane Carrying 39 Crashes in Siberia
description: A Russian military plane crashed early Monday in eastern Siberia, according to the official Tass news agency, which said 16 of the 39 people on board were seriously injured.

title: Eight Creative People Recommend Their Favorite Classic Books
description: Despite the influx of new things to read this holiday season, theres nothing quite like curling up with a classic. Every week, creative people share the 10 titles they would most want with them if they were marooned on a desert island  a part of the editor Aaron Hicklins ongoing project OneGrandBooks.com. Here, eight recommend the classics that have stuck with them.

title: Deadly Remnants of Asbestos in Italy
description: Asbestos was banned by the end of the 20th century, but people exposed to it in the 1970s and 1980s continue to be cut down by cancer and other illnesses related to the once-common material.

title: What Are Your Thoughts on Riding the School Bus?
description: Do you ride a school bus? If not now, did you ever ride the bus to and from school? What is behavior like on your bus? What, if anything, would you change about the experience of riding the bus?

title: Indefinite
description: In Britain, some immigrants face a future of indefinite detention.

title: The Drumbeat of Bad News on the Opioid Toll
description: To the Editor:

title: A Root Cause of the Oakland Fire: The Rental-Housing Crisis
description: To the Editor:

title: On College Campuses, Does Liberal Mean Illiberal?
description: To the Editor:

title: Donald Trump, This Is Not Normal!
description: This is my last column of the year.

title: How Republics End
description: Many people are reacting to the rise of Trumpism and nativist movements in Europe by reading history  specifically, the history of the 1930s. And they are right to do so. It takes willful blindness not to see the parallels between the rise of fascism and our current political nightmare.

title: The Role of Fear in U.S. Foreign Relations
description: To the Editor:

title: For Immigrants, the Threat of Indefinite Detention
description: The New York Times Op-Docs is presenting a virtual reality film, Indefinite, about the indefinite detention of immigrants in Britain. To view it, either watch in the video player or for the full experience use the NYT VR app on your mobile device. (To download the app, go here for Android, and here for iPhone.)

title: The Teens Guide to the Trump Presidency
description: Lots of adults started paying attention to Teen Vogue recently. It started with an opinion article by Lauren Duca, the magazines weekend editor, called Donald Trump Is Gaslighting America. Gaslighting is a form of psychological abuse that causes the victim to question his or her own sanity, Ms. Duca writes, and thats precisely what Trump is doing to this country.

title: Will Trump Play Spy vs. Spy?
description: In recent days, President-elect Donald J. Trump has rejected the C.I.A.s conclusions that Russian hackers attempted to sway the American elections, and has accused unnamed officials within the agency of trying to undermine him. And he has rejected the tradition of receiving the intelligence communitys daily briefing, implying that he would rather rely on information and analysis from his inner circle of advisers.

title: Google Wants Driverless Cars, but Do We?
description: Love was in the air at President-elect Donald J. Trumps summit meeting last week with tech executives. Alphabet, Googles parent company, was really feeling it, coming as it did a day after the company announced that its self-driving technology was ready for commercialization. The meeting was a giant green light for an industry and the multitrillion-dollar investment it will represent, the cost largely to be borne by consumers and government.

title: Ben Carsons Warped View of Housing
description: Antigovernment ideologues resent the Department of Housing and Urban Development even when they know nothing about it. Ben Carson, Donald Trumps choice to run HUD, is a fine case in point.

title: The Season to Be Stressful
description: MONTREAL  Red Bull? Check. Late-night delivery on speed dial? Check. Pringles? Check.

title: How to Live Without Irony (for Real, This Time)
description: Four years ago, shortly after the re-election of Barack Obama, I published an essay in The Stone called How to Live Without Irony. In it, I argued that the surplus of apolitical irony in a certain segment of American culture  most clearly expressed in the rise of hipsterism but visible in many other forms  had a dangerous potential. It represented a surrender to commercial and political forces that could lead to an emptiness of both the individual and collective psyche. Historically, vacuums eventually have been filled by something, I wrote, more often than not, a hazardous something.

title: Your Holiday Traditions
Questions for: In Turkeys Home of St. Nick, Far From North Pole, All Is Not Jolly
description: Article: In Turkeys Home of St. Nick, Far From North Pole, All Is Not Jolly

title: Donald Trump and the C.I.A.
Deadly Remnants of Asbestos in Italy
description: Although Italy joined asbestos-producing nations in banning the carcinogenic material at the end of the 20th century, thousands of people working in factories and living in public housing had already been exposed. In other words, as the Italian photographer Cinzia Canneri explained, the damage had been done by the 1980s.

title: A Healing Unicorn Latte, From Brooklyn of Course
description: The plant-powered potions on offer as of this week at the End, a cheerful new Williamsburg coffee bar with roots in Montauk, are as psychedelic as you can get without using drugs, laughs Madeleine Murphy, a partner there. Some of the drinks are stained sea blue, others dusted with a shimmery yolk-colored powder. And all promote wellness  from soothing anxiety to offering energy via sources beyond caffeine.

title: Fifteen Interesting New Brands We Discovered in 2016
description: From a swimwear brand that actually celebrates swimming to a Munich-based company that finds vintage fabrics and dyes them black, its been a great year for emerging talent on T. Here, 15 standout creators (featured in our weekly On the Verge series) worth knowing.

title: Chinese, Spending Freely, Become Ever-Larger Tourism Force in New York
description: New York Citys tourism officials have solved the riddle of how to attract the Chinese. The challenge now may lie in impressing them once they arrive.

title: Being an Afghan General Is Nice Work if You Can Get It. And Many Do.
description: Afghanistan may struggle to recruit enough soldiers for its armed forces, but its swimming in generals.

title: Turning Your Vacation Photos Into Works of Art
description: Its the season for family travel and photos  and perhaps enlarging some of those images of snowy landscapes or tropical getaways to decorate your home.

title: Electoral College, Mosul, Zsa Zsa Gabor: Your Monday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: The Cough That Doesnt Go Away
description: Love, and a cough, cannot be hid, the English metaphysical poet George Herbert wrote 400 years ago. It can be hard on parents to live with a child who keeps coughing  sometimes maybe harder on the parents than on the child.

title: New York Today: Lessons Beyond Latkes
description: Updated, 8:27 a.m.

title: Morning Agenda: Bullish Forecasts, Free Cash, Women in Law School
description: Its that time of year again.

title: Donald Trump Completes Final Lap, Electoral College, to White House
description: Right Now: The Electoral College has affirmed Donald J. Trump as the nations 45th president, pushing him past the 270-vote threshold for election, with scant evidence of the anti-Trump revolt among electors that some of his critics had hoped would occur.

title: Trumps and Xis Differences Magnify Uncertainties Between U.S. and China
description: BEIJING  Both came to power vowing to restore their nations to greatness. But Americas loud, ad-libbing president-elect, Donald J. Trump, and Chinas guarded, calculating president, Xi Jinping, are glaring contrasts as politicians, and their pairing has injected new unpredictability into relations between their governments.

title: Beware: Winter Is Coming
description: Most of the Northern Hemisphere is now in the throes of the deadliest time of the year. Cold kills, and I dont mean just extreme cold and crippling blizzards. I mean ordinary winter cold, like that typically experienced, chronically or episodically, by people in every state but Hawaii from late fall through early spring.

title: Flocks of Sheep, Seven Stories Tall, at the Crossroads of the World
description: In the city that never sleeps, most people could not be bothered to count the sheep that for three minutes every night this month have been filling more than 20 electronic billboards in Times Square.

title: U.N. Will Send Monitors to Aleppo, as Evacuations Resume
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  With Russias backing, the United Nations Security Council voted on Monday to send United Nations observers  to monitor evacuations from the besieged Syrian city of Aleppo and to report back regularly.

title: Price Transparency Is Nice. Just Dont Expect It to Cut Health Costs.
description: You probably know where to pump the cheapest gas and how to get price comparisons online in seconds for headphones and cars. But how would you find the best deal on an M.R.I. or a knee replacement? No idea, right?

title: Thailand Takes Small Steps Forward After Longtime Kings Death
description: BANGKOK  More than two months after the death of Thailands long-serving king, Bhumibol Adulyadej, the country is still in mourning for him, with most people wearing black, and black billboards carrying tributes in the place of advertising.

title: The Stock Market Looks Awfully Expensive Since the Trump Rally
description: A new president wont take office for another month, but the financial markets early verdict on the Donald J. Trump era is in, and it is straightforward.

title: Climate Change News That Stuck With Us in 2016
description: As the year ends, The New York Times asked reporters who have focused on climate change, global warming and the environment to choose the news they reported on that was the most memorable. These are their selections, ranging from sea level rise to the phenomenon of rolling coal to local actions to confront a warming planet.

title: California Today: An Arts District Redesign, Down by the River
description: Good morning.

title: Raiders Move Up, Chargers Move Down and Both May Be Moving Out
description: SAN DIEGO  As the final seconds ticked off the clock in Sundays game between the San Diego Chargers and the Oakland Raiders, the scoreboard and each teams fans affirmed what had become abundantly clear over the course of this season: The two longtime rivals were headed in different directions.

title: Why Trump Had an Edge in the Electoral College
description: With an expected win in the Electoral College today, Donald J. Trump will seal his presidential victory  despite losing the national popular vote by a significant margin.

title: The Most-Read Stories of 2016
description: Unsurprisingly, the majority of the most-read stories this year were about the 2016 election. The topic of this years most-read article, like last years, is love  this time Why You Will Marry the Wrong Person. (Spoiler alert: The author thinks we all do.)

title: I.M.F. Stands by Christine Lagarde, Convicted of Negligence
description: The International Monetary Fund threw its support behind its leader, Christine Lagarde, on Monday despite her conviction in a French court on charges of misusing public funds.

title: Norway and China Restore Ties, 6 Years After Nobel Prize Dispute
description: LONDON  China and Norway announced on Monday that they would normalize relations, six years after the decision to award the Nobel Peace Prize to the imprisoned democracy advocate Liu Xiaobo opened a rift between the countries.

title: In Spain, New Restaurants Nourish the Needy, and the Soul
description: MADRID  ngel Castillo once worked as a restaurant cook. But after losing his job and struggling with alcoholism, he has been sleeping on the streets for most of the last 16 years. It has been a while since he has worked in a restaurant, let alone eaten at one.

title: A V.I.P. Nets Package Offered Free to The Times
description: The Brooklyn Nets havent exactly been filling the seats at Barclays Center this year. Their 7-19 record puts them near the bottom of the NBAs Eastern Conference. Box seats remain unsold. And rare is the day when a Nets game makes the front of The New York Timess sports section, much less a splashy presence on the websites home page.

title: The C.I.A., Just Another Liberal Enemy
description: This article is part of the Opinion Today newsletter. You can sign up here to receive more briefings and a guide to the section daily in your inbox.

title: Give the Windows 10 Start Menu a Classic Look
description: Q. I have heard that the Classic Shell program makes a Windows 10 computer look more like a Windows 7 system. I dont see it in the Windows Store, though. Is it safe to download the software from the web?

title: Daily Report: No Special Perks on Snapchat for Celebrities
description: Ah, the life of the celebrity. Between the red carpets and mansions and perks in the hottest nightclubs, there is coddling by social media services eager to capitalize on all that attention.

title: Art Underground: A First Look at the Second Avenue Subway
description: When a city has been waiting for a badly needed new subway line since 1929, public art is probably far down the list of expectations, well behind accommodations like a) working trains, b) lights and c) some means of entrance and egress.

title: Reality TV Populism
description: This Washington Post article on Poland  where a right-wing, anti-intellectual, nativist party now rules, and has garnered a lot of public support  is chilling for those of us who worry that Trumpism may really be the end of the road for US democracy. The supporters of Law and Justice clearly looked a lot like Trumps white working class enthusiasts; so are we headed down the same path?

title: Amoris Laetitia and Everything After
description: Time for another intervention on matters Catholic, Im afraid. Last week Austen Ivereigh, author of a very fine Pope Francis biography and frequent defender of the pontiffagainst conservative critics, wrote a piece for Crux announcing that the debate over Amoris Laetitia and communion for the remarried is essentially over, that intransigent conservatives are now as much dissenters from the papal magisterium as any liberal agitating for the ordination of women under John Paul II and that long after the cardinals questioning Francis are no more than a footnote in the history of this papacy, long after Ross Douthats predictedschismfrom the columns of theNew York Timeshas failed to materialize, the next generation of priestswill be applyingthe magnificent teaching of Amoris Laetitia, and the noisy, angry strains of dissent will have fadedinto a distant memory.

title: The Year in Reading
description: In this season of giving, we asked some notably avid readers  who also happen to be poets, musicians, diplomats, filmmakers, novelists, actors and artists  to share the books that accompanied them through 2016.

title: A Dickensian Divide, but United in Holiday Cheer
description: Marley was dead: to begin with. There is no doubt whatever about that, said John Galazin, quoting not only the opening lines of Charles Dickenss A Christmas Carol  which, of course, these are  but also a bookstore clerk who blurted out those lines when Mr. Galazin asked recently for a copy of the book.

title: Platinum Hedge Fund Executives Charged With $1 Billion Fraud
description: For years, the little-known New York hedge fund Platinum Partners stood out for double-digit investment returns that rivaled some of the biggest names in the industry.

title: How the War on Christmas Controversy Was Created
description: Its that time of year again, folks. Its time for the War on Christmas.

title: In Russia, Dozens Die After Drinking Alcohol Substitute
description: MOSCOW  Dozens of people in the Siberian city of Irkutsk died after drinking cheap surrogate alcohol over the weekend, evoking memories of the poverty and social depression that came after the collapse of the Soviet Union.

title: A Do It Kind of Woman Waits for the Strength to Get Back to Being Herself
description: Try as she might, Carolyn Davidson knows she can no longer deny that at 67, she is starting to feel her age, especially the past few months. Her body aches, colds linger, her steps more deliberate, her energy easily sapped.

title: My Year in Reading
description: This year we asked some notable writers, musicians, actors and others to tell us about their year in reading.

title: Pregnancy Changes the Brain in Ways That May Help Mothering
description: Pregnancy changes a womans brain, altering the size and structure of areas involved in perceiving the feelings and perspectives of others, according to a first-of-its-kind study published Monday.

title: Recipes for the Holidaze
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: Cancer-Free: One Recovery Inspires Another  and Could Help Thousands
description: Times Insider delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how news, features and opinion come together at The New York Times. In this story, the science reporter Denise Grady provides human backstory about her  article about a woman who, remarkably, recovered from colon cancer after treatment with cells from her own immune system.

title: 2nd Avenue Subway Will Open on Jan. 1, M.T.A. Says
description: After nearly a century of delays and disappointment, the first phase of the Second Avenue subway is finally opening to the public on Jan. 1, officials at the Metropolitan Transportation Authority said on Monday.

title: Russian Meddling and Europes Elections
description: While revelations about  Russian involvement in the American presidential election rock the United States, there are ominous signs that Russia is spreading propaganda and engaging in cyberattacks in Europe in advance of several national elections next year.

title: Russian Ambassador to Turkey Is Assassinated in Ankara
description: ISTANBUL  Russias ambassador to Turkey was assassinated at an Ankara art exhibit on Monday evening by a lone Turkish gunman shouting God is great! and dont forget Aleppo, dont forget Syria! in what the leaders of Turkey and Russia called a provocative terrorist attack.

title: The Fantasy Version of Brexit
description: The truncated visit by Prime Minister Theresa May of Britain  to the European Union  summit meeting in Brussels on Thursday underscored just how hard it will be for Britain to quit the bloc anytime soon, if ever.

title: The Post Offices Busiest Week: We Plan All Year for This
description: Pity the poor letter carrier: This week will be a long one.

title: The Year's Most Popular Recipes
description: These were the most saved recipes in 2016 from NYT Cooking.

title: Guilty Verdict for I.M.F. Chief Christine Lagarde: A Primer
description: Christine Lagarde, the head of the International Monetary Fund, has been found guilty of criminal charges linked to the misuse of public funds dating to her time as Frances finance minister.

title: Bid for Star Wars Religion Is Shot Down
description: LONDON  The Star Wars spinoff Rogue One trounced the competition at the weekend box office, but on Monday the franchise suffered a defeat: The Charity Commission for England and Wales published an official ruling that Jediism does not count as a religion.

title: Red Wine Hot Chocolate Is a Thing, and Its (Surprisingly) Delicious
description: Fros? Thats a summer drink. Hot toddies, eggnog, mulled wine? Please, those are for your parents.

title: Fewer Journalists Were Killed on the Job This Year, Group Reports
description: Deaths of journalists in the line of duty fell sharply in 2016 compared with the year before, a news media advocacy group said Monday, attributing the decline to fewer intentional killings of journalists.

title: Stanfords Christian McCaffrey Is Latest Star to Skip Bowl Game
description: For a century, the culmination of a college football players season has been playing in a bowl game on or around New Years Day.

title: 4 Your Eyez Only Delivers J. Coles Fourth No. 1 Debut
description: The two albums this year that made the biggest splashes, by far, on the Billboard chart were Drakes Views and Beyoncs Lemonade. But as 2016 draws to a close, there has been a close contest for the bronze. Late last month Metallica notched it, then the Weeknd. Now its J. Coles turn.

title: Communal TV Screens in a Binge-Watching Age? Wont Do, Airlines
description: What airline passenger hasnt felt the letdown?

title: A Country Ham Legacy
description: Two Kentucky families continue a holiday tradition.

title: A Kentucky Ham Tradition Endures, From the Back of a Truck
description: MURRAY, Ky.  The indecision flickered in Richard Knights eyes as soon as the white Ford pickup pulled into the empty used-car lot on a chilly Saturday morning this month. He was midconversation with some out-of-towners in this small western Kentucky town, where hospitality is a point of pride.

title: Donald Trumps Choice for Envoy to Israel: Clashing Views
description: To the Editor:

title: Louis Harris, Pollster at Forefront of American Trends, Dies at 95
description: Louis Harris, the nations best-known 20th-century pollster, who refined interpretive polling methods and took the pulse of voters and consumers through four decades of elections, wars, racial troubles and cultural revolutions that ran from tail fins to the internet, died on Saturday at his home in Key West, Fla. He was 95.

title: Let 2017 Be the Year of Working Hard and Resting Hard
description: Im tired  really tired  and Im tired of being tired. In fact, it feels like Ive been tired ever since I read Andrew Groves book Only the Paranoid Survive a decade and a half ago.

title: Bigotry in Literature
description: To the Editor:

title: Vale of Brazil Sells Fertilizer Business to Mosaic for $2.5 Billion
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  The Brazilian mining giant Vale has reached an agreement to sell much of its fertilizer assets to the Mosaic Company of the United States in a deal worth $2.5 billion, the companies said on Monday.

title: The Baby Is Getting Fed  but What?
description: Baby food is sold in every country on Earth, but in poor and middle-income countries, its quality is completely unpredictable, a new study has found.

title: Aleppo, Berlin, Russia: Your Morning Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Top Travel Articles of 2016
description: From Majorca to the Great Lakes, we guided readers around the globe in 2016. In addition to our always popular annual Places to Go list, here are some of our most-popular features and 36 Hours columns.

title: An N.B.A. Gift on Christmas: Warriors at Cavaliers
description: The N.B.A. and its players union reached a new collective bargaining agreement last week and  Oh my god, are you falling asleep already?

title: Yellen Tells College Graduates That Value of a Degree Is Rising
description: BALTIMORE  The unemployment rate among Americans with college degrees was just 2.3 percent in November, a number that suggests employers are now competing for well-educated workers. Janet L. Yellen, the Federal Reserve chairwoman, went to the University of Baltimore on Monday to congratulate graduates on joining that fortunate group.

title: Trump Administration Puts the U.S. at a Crossroad for Global Health Aid
description: The United States is the pillar of global health aid, donating billions of dollars annually  more than any other country  to fighting disease in the worlds poorest countries.

title: Cache of Weapons Suggests Gunmen in Jordan Were Planning Multiple Attacks
description: KARAK, Jordan  Gunmen involved in a rare terrorist attack in Jordan on Sunday had a large cache of weapons, explosives and suicide vests in the apartment where they had been living, the countrys interior minister said on Monday.

title: North Carolina Limits on Transgender Rights Appear Headed for Repeal
description: The North Carolina legislature plans to hold a special session Wednesday to consider fully repealing the contentious law curbing legal protections for lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender people. The move comes after the Charlotte City Council rescinded a local anti-discrimination ordinance on Monday that had prompted passage of the statewide law in March.

title: Whats the Matter With North Carolina?
description: Charlotte, N.C.  In recent days, folks from outside North Carolina have been asking me what, exactly, is wrong with my state. After a vicious governors race in which the Democrat, Roy Cooper, squeaked past the incumbent Republican, Pat McCrory, the state General Assembly drew up and passed a series of bills that greatly restrict the power of our incoming chief executive  bills that Mr. McCrory has signed.

title: Harnessing the U.S. Taxpayer to Fight Cancer and Make Profits
description: Enthusiasm for cancer immunotherapy is soaring, and so is Arie Belldegruns fortune.

title: M.S.G.s New Organ
description: Lets Go Rangers on Madison Square Gardens new organ.

title: The Champion Logo, in the Hands of Fashions Provocateurs, Is Reborn
description: Late last year, the high-fashion radical pranksters of Vetements released what would become one of the brands signature pieces: a misshapen hoodie with a logo on the chest that played off the traditional Champion script logo, rotating the oversize C 90 degrees to make a V.

title: Canadas Deal Maven Is Hands-On, Hands-Off
description: Canadas busy deal maven is, in a sense, both hands-on and not. The Fairfax Financial boss Prem Watsa has drafted an airtight policy for the insurance companys $4.9 billion deal to buy its Swiss rival Allied World. And BlackBerry, where Mr. Watsa is both the lead director and a major investor, is trying to parlay its smartphone history into hands-free driving success.

title: Defining Ethnicity
description: Hey, its Logan (@loganjaffe), Bayet (@BayeteKenan) and Saleem (@KidEthnic), embedded mediamakers with the Race/Related team at @nytimes in collaboration with @POVDocs.

title: Berlin Crash Is Suspected to Be a Terror Attack, Police Say
description: BERLIN  The Berlin police said early Tuesday that the killing of at least 12 people and the wounding of dozens more when a truck plowed through a Christmas market on Monday night was a suspected terrorist attack.

title: 2016s Top Real Estate Stories
description: Catch up on the most popular stories of the year.

title: Not Your Average Subscription Box
description: I am not a fan of curated boxes of goods, as inevitably there is stuff in them that I do not want. But here is an exception. Zo Capdevila and Bertrand Corp, a French couple living in Oakland, Calif., are assembling assortments of shelf-stable French items grouped around breakfast, drinks and dessert. The Parisian aperitif box contains a jar of onion confit spread, duck rillettes, Dijon mustard, cornichons, duck and pork pt, crackers flavored with cheese, and little toasts, all of which Im happy to have on hand for that next impromptu cocktail hour. Monthly subscriptions are available: Bon Apptit Boxes, $30 to $130, bonappetitbox.com.

title: A Historic Number of Electors Defected, and Most Were Supposed to Vote for Clinton
description: Results of the U.S. electoral vote.

title: 3-D Printing the Young Universe as a Lumpy Softball
description: If youve been watching the HBO series Westworld, you might suspect 3-D printers are starting to do some amazing things. Recently, I journeyed to Brooklyn to watch a whole universe come out of a printer  our own universe, actually, when it was a baby at just 380,000 years old.

title: American Woman Abducted in Afghanistan Issues an Appeal to Obama
description: WASHINGTON  An American woman and her family who have been held hostage for four years in Afghanistan pleaded with President Obama to secure their release before he leaves office next month, according to a video that was made public Monday.

title: Who Was Andrey Karlov, the Russian Ambassador Killed in Turkey?
description: Russias ambassador to Turkey, Andrey G. Karlov, was killed by a gunman on Monday in Ankara, the capital.

title: Witness Describes Fatal Crash At Berlin Market
description: A truck plowed into a Christmas market in Berlin on Monday evening, leaving at least twelve people dead and many more injured, according to the police. A British tourist who witnessed the incident described what she saw.

title: A French Cookbook From the English Countryside
description: There are nicely wrought seasonal recipes in this lavish book about Le Manoir aux QuatSaisons near Oxford, England, written by its chef and owner, Raymond Blanc. Born in France and self taught, he opened the Manoir in Great Milton in 1984, and has used its 27 acres to grow fresh vegetables, berries and herbs for his kitchen. Over time, Mr. Blancs cooking, which has earned two Michelin stars, has evolved, with a broader, global palette of seasonings. But what makes this beautifully illustrated volume more than just a gift-worthy showpiece is that many of the recipes should inspire a home cook. Try chicken with morels, asparagus with chervil, salmon with spinach and watercress, poached egg on tomato fondue, Jerusalem artichoke soup, hake Grenobloise, and more: Le Manoir aux QuatSaisons: The Story of a Modern Classic by Raymond Blanc (Bloomsbury, $75).

title: China Machado, Breakthrough Model Until the End, Dies at 86
description: China Machado, one of the first non-Caucasians to appear in the pages of an American glossy fashion magazine and a model who helped break not only the race barrier but also the age barrier, died on Sunday in Brookhaven, N.Y., on Long Island. She was 86.

title: Good Luck, Served in 6 Courses, on New Years Day
description: To call on the new for the new year, try a restaurant feast that is traditional in Japan but uncommon in the United States. Osechi is a six-course menu of foods thought to bring good luck, good health and all of that. At Hakubai in the Kitano Hotel New York, the meal includes symbolic foods like white and red fish cakes for purity and to protect against evil, and herring roe for fertility, along with sashimi and Wagyu beef. The brunch is served on Jan. 1 and 2, with seatings throughout the day starting at 10:30 a.m., $200 per person. Reservations are required. Free sake will be served in the lobby on Jan. 1: Hakubai, 66 Park Avenue (38th Street), 212-885-7111, kitano.com.

title: old rangers organ
description: old rangers organ

title: Before There Were Kardashians, There Was Zsa Zsa
description: Long before the Kardashians, there were the Gabors. Before Paris Hilton, Ivanka Trump and other blondes with an air of effortless wealth and exaggerated glamour, there was Zsa Zsa Gabor.

title: Champagne Marshmallows for That Special Someone
description: Do not use these for your smores. Luxurious gold-dusted marshmallows with a soupon of wine in their flavor deserve to adorn a holiday mince pie, a festive roulade or an ice cream confection. Set them adrift on steaming mugs of celebratory hot chocolate spiked with brandy, and they will leave golden traces as they melt: Wondermade Gold and Champagne Marshmallows, $24 for 16, mouth.com.

title: A Modernist Bche de Nol
description: Who left the bche de Nol out in the snow? Thomas Padovani, the new pastry chef at Benoit, has abandoned the traditional-looking log of cake garnished with meringue mushrooms for a sleeker, sparkly, slightly angular winter-white version. Inside, the cake is chocolate and scented with almond and citrus, flavors he relates to a Provenal candy, the calissons dAix. It will serve six to eight: Bche de Nol, $38, with 24 hours notice, Benoit, 60 West 55th Street, 646-943-7373, bistrot@benoitny.com.

title: How to Respond to Russias Hacking
description: To the Editor:

title: Graphic Content: The Shooting and Its Aftermath
description: Andrey G. Karlov, the Russian ambassador to Turkey, at an art gallery in Ankara on Monday, moments before he was shot. A man believed to be the gunman is behind him at left.

title: A Gluten-Free Appetizer Thats Easier Than Gougres
description: Breadbaskets all over Brazil often tempt with warm, crusty rolls oozing cheese. Now you can serve bite-size po de queijo, the Portuguese answer to gougres, fresh from the oven. That they are gluten-free enhances their appeal. Kikas Treats ships them frozen, and all they take to achieve a party-ready burnish is about 20 minutes in the oven without defrosting. Let them rest a few minutes before serving: Brazilian Cheese Bread (Po de Queijo), $12 for a dozen, kikastreats.com.

title: new rangers organ
description: new rangers organ

title: Austrias Far Right Signs a Cooperation Pact With Putins Party
description: BERLIN  The leader of the Austrian far-right Freedom Party has signed what he called a cooperation agreement with Russias ruling party and recently met with Lt. Gen. Michael T. Flynn, the designated national security adviser to President-elect Donald J. Trump of the United States.

title: Judge in Stanford Sexual Assault Case Is Cleared of Misconduct
description: Aaron Persky, the judge who gave a former Stanford University swimmer a sentence that was condemned as too lenient for a sexual-assault conviction, was cleared of misconduct on Monday by a California panel.

title: Bana al-Abed Escapes Aleppo
description: Bana al-Abed, a 7-year-old Syrian girl whose Twitter account made her a face of the suffering in Syria, has been evacuated from eastern Aleppo along with thousands of other displaced citizens.

title: Study Tied to Food Industry Tries to Discredit Sugar Guidelines
description: A prominent medical journal on Monday published a scathing attack on global health advice to eat less sugar. Warnings to cut sugar, the study argued, are based on weak evidence and cannot be trusted.

title: Water at New York City Schools Will Be Retested for Lead
description: New York education officials said on Monday that they would retest all public school buildings in the city for unsafe levels of lead after the initial testing process was questioned.

title: Sheryl Lee Ralph and Ben Harney on the Long Reach of Dreamgirls
description: On Dec. 20, 1981, Dreamgirls opened at the Imperial Theater, bringing a seismic emotional jolt to Broadway, as the critic Frank Rich wrote in The New York Times. Written by Henry Krieger and Tom Eyen and directed by Michael Bennett, the musical followed the path of a Supremes-style girl group and its driven, unscrupulous manager.

title: Donald Trump, Aleppo, Russia: Your Monday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Penetrating Storm Walls With 8 Powerful New Eyes
description: Jettisoned from the belly of a plane, a Pegasus rocket blasted into space last week carrying eight hurricane-hunting microsatellites.

title: Prosecution Wont Use Suspects Statement in New York Bombing Case
description: A federal prosecutor in Manhattan said on Monday that the government had decided not to introduce at trial an extensive statement by the man accused of recent bombings in New York and New Jersey as it tries to keep to a schedule a judge has set for a trial in March.

title: Ethics in the Real World, Peter Singers Provocative Essays
description: In his influential memoir, Hillbilly Elegy (2016), J. D. Vance explains why some middle-class Americans turned against Michelle Obama. The first lady, he writes, tells us that we shouldnt be feeding our children certain foods, and we hate her for it  not because we think shes wrong, but because we know shes right.

title: Gunman Wounds 3 at Muslim Prayer Center in Zurich
description: LONDON  A gunman opened fire in a Muslim prayer center in Zurich, the largest city in Switzerland, late on Monday afternoon, wounding at least three people, according to the police.

title: Bana al-Abed, Child Who Became Aleppos Civilian Face, Is Evacuated
description: Bana al-Abed, a 7-year-old Syrian girl who became the face of the civilian plight in eastern Aleppo through social media, has finally been evacuated. Bana and her mother, Fatemah, arrived in Al Rashideen, an opposition-held area in the countryside of western Aleppo Province, on Monday, along with thousands of others displaced from the city they called home.

title: Review: Peering Behind the Whimsically Ghoulish Gorey
description: Its usually wise to avoid assumptions based on an artists work. Actors so convincing as violent psychos go home to minivans and soccer lessons. Gilbert & Georges paintings can be provocatively outr, but they live routine lives in their conservative suits.

title: Whyd You Do That? Running a Photo of a Killer on the Home Page
description: Several readers have already written in to protest The Timess use of a particularly graphic photograph on the home page on Monday. It showed a gunman, in suit and tie, standing beside the body of Russias ambassador to Turkey, whom the shooter had killed moments earlier. I asked Phil Corbett, associate masthead editor for standards and ethics, who was involved in the decision to use the photo, to explain the editors thinking.

title: The Trail of the Suspect in the Berlin Attack
description: Maps and photos of the manhunt for the attacker at a Christmas market in Berlin.

title: A Master Work, the Ghent Altarpiece, Reawakens Stroke by Stroke
description: GHENT, Belgium  Layers and layers of paint have been virtually and physically removed from the 15th-century Ghent Altarpiece, a renowned work of biblical figures on wood panels, revealing for the first time in hundreds of years the individual brush strokes of the original paintings.

title: With Cabinet Nominees, a Challenge to See Which Master Is Served
description: The Bible says that no one can serve two masters. In federal law, this admonition is embodied in statutes that prohibit government officials from receiving any outside compensation for their work and bar them from acting in ways that favor their own financial interests.

title: Jordanian Officials Find Large Stockpile of Weapons
description: The Jordanian authorities uncovered a stockpile of weapons, explosives and suicide vests, suggesting that multiple attacks were being planned.

title: Transcript of Robert Dursts Interview With Prosecutors
description: A transcript of a three-hour interview between Robert Durst and prosecutors was released by the Los Angeles district attorney on Friday. In the interview, the real estate scion speculated about a plea deal in his coming trial for the 2000 killing of a confidante.

title: Robert Durst Suggests He Would Accept Plea Deal in Transcript From 2015
description: Toward the end of an extraordinary three-hour interview with prosecutors in Los Angeles, Robert Durst, the real estate scion accused of murder, speculated that he might accept a plea deal in a case surrounding the killing of a friend in California in 2000.

title: Vincent Viola, Billionaire Businessman, Is Trumps Choice to Lead the Army
description: WASHINGTON  President-elect Donald J. Trump plans to nominate Vincent Viola, the billionaire founder of a high-frequency trading company, as secretary of the Army, the Trump transition office said.

title: Book Deal for Pantsuit Nation, Facebook Page Supporting Hillary Clinton
description: Pantsuit Nation began in late October as a secret Facebook group for supporters of Hillary Clinton (and pantsuit enthusiasts). After the election, it became a place for members to commiserate over their shock and disappointment.

title: Dear Evan Hansen Is Shaping Up to Be a Hit
description: The new musical Dear Evan Hansen grossed more than $1 million at the box office last week, crossing the symbolic milestone for the first time and suggesting that the show is on its way to becoming a rare Broadway hit.

title: Columbia Challenges Vote by Graduate Students to Unionize
description: The battle over whether graduate students at universities can unionize entered a new phase on Friday, when Columbia University filed a challenge with the National Labor Relations Board over the recent vote by its graduate assistants to unionize.

title: Esther Wilkins, Who Set Standards for Dental Hygienists, Dies at 100
description: Dr. Esther M. Wilkins, whose comprehensive textbook for the study of dental hygiene standardized how the field is taught worldwide, died on Dec. 12 at her home in Hudson, N.H. She was 100.

title: Rail Crossing Warnings Are Sought for Mapping Apps
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Following directions from Google Maps on a smartphone last year, Jose Alejandro Sanchez-Ramirez turned a Ford truck, hauling a trailer, where he thought the app was telling him to go. But he ended up stuck on the railroad tracks at a poorly marked California crossing.

title: An Unplanned Stop at the Rockefeller Center Tree
description: Dear Diary:

title: Trumps Treasury Pick Moves in Secretive Hedge Fund Circles
description: As a hedge fund manager, Goldman Sachs trader and bank chief executive, Steven T. Mnuchin has long been a member of the financial elite.

title: Blue Jackets on a Roll Behind Tortorella and Bobrovsky
description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia  When the Columbus Blue Jackets beat the Vancouver Canucks in overtime on Sunday for their ninth straight victory, they tied the franchises record winning streak. They also continued to confound the experts.

title: Japanese Mogul Starts on Vow to Trump to Create 50,000 U.S. Jobs
description: SAN FRANCISCO  The Japanese business mogul Masayoshi Son pledged to President-elect Donald J. Trump nearly two weeks ago that he would invest in the United States and create about 50,000 jobs.

title: Gina Quattrochi, Who Helped Provide Housing for AIDS Patients, Dies at 63
description: Gina Quattrochi, who turned Bailey House into the nations largest provider of housing to people with AIDS and a model for similar organizations around the United States, died on Dec. 13 in Manhattan. She was 63.

title: Obamas 78 Pardons and 153 Commutations Extend Record of Mercy
description: WASHINGTON  Just weeks before leaving office, President Obama on Monday issued 78 pardons and commuted the sentences of 153 prisoners, extending his acts of clemency to a total of 1,324 individuals, one of the larger uses of the presidential power to show mercy in modern presidential history.

title: Climate Change and the Incoming Trump Government
description: The people President-elect Donald J. Trump has chosen for his administration and the influence they could have over climate change.

title: Time to End the Electoral College
description: By overwhelming majorities, Americans would prefer to elect the president by direct popular vote, not filtered through the antiquated mechanism of the Electoral College. They understand, on a gut level, the basic fairness of awarding the nations highest office on the same basis as every other elected office  to the person who gets the most votes.

title: Turkey, Russia and an Assassination: The Swirling Crises, Explained
description: Turkey and Russia, whose up-and-down relationship has helped shape the Syrian war and its related crises, shared a new trauma on Monday after an off-duty Turkish police officer assassinated Russias ambassador.

title: In a Book, an Ex-N.F.L. Player Details Consequences of Concussions
description: MINNEAPOLIS  Getting readers to spend $25 on a book about athletes and concussions can be a hard sell. The topic isnt uplifting, and the biggest audience for sports books  people who are fans  typically prefers to read about famous coaches and players.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: China is a dragon. America is an eagle. Britain is a lion. When the dragon wakes up, the others are all snacks.

title: New Orleans Settles Katrina-Era Police Brutality Cases for $13.3 Million
description: NEW ORLEANS  Surrounded by victims families, City Council members and senior police leaders, Mayor Mitch Landrieu of New Orleans announced Monday that the city had reached $13.3 million in civil settlements pertaining to three major police brutality cases from the weeks before and after Hurricane Katrina. The settlements ended what the mother of one victim called an awful, long and rough road, beginning with acts of grim and pointless violence and continuing through an 11-year legal journey.

title: Success Academy May Have Overcharged City for Special Education Services, Audit Says
description: A financial audit released on Monday by Comptroller Scott M. Stringer said that Success Academy, New York Citys largest charter school operator, was lax in its oversight and record keeping and understated its administrative costs while billing the Education Department for special education services it could not document were delivered.

title: Obama Administration Intends to Transfer 17 or 18 Guantnamo Detainees
description: WASHINGTON  When Prime Minister Matteo Renzi of Italy visited the White House in October for a state dinner, he made a commitment to President Obama: Italy, which resettled a Yemeni detainee from Guantnamo Bay last summer, would take one more person on the transfer list. But before the deal was completed, Mr. Renzi resigned.

title: Electoral College Settles Donald Trumps Victory, but Little Else
description: WASHINGTON  In Florida, protesters swarmed the Capitol rotunda, one hoisting a Trump Is Too Rusky sign featuring a hammer and sickle. In Wisconsins statehouse, a heckler shouted, Were all going to go to war and die thanks to you, during the formal meeting of the Electoral College.

title: Judge Orders Release of Some Documents Related to Clinton Email Inquiry
description: A federal judge in Manhattan has ordered the partial unsealing of a government search warrant and supporting documents stemming from a federal inquiry into emails belonging to Huma Abedin, a top aide to Hillary Clinton.

title: Coaching Transition at Syracuse Puts Bumps on Recruiting Trail
description: Oshae Brissett, a highly regarded prospect from Mississauga, Ontario, enjoyed a brush with Carmelo Anthony that could be seen as the passing of the torch from one of Coach Jim Boeheims brightest stars at Syracuse to a promising young player headed there next season.

title: Christmas Markets Are Beloved Tradition, but a Challenge to Protect
description: PARIS  In France this year, the annual Strasbourg Christmas market opened under heavy security. Instead of the usual gleam of holiday decorations in the central square, dominated by a 100-foot pine tree, the authorities left it mostly bare  in case they needed to set up a field hospital.

title: A New Fund Seeks Both Financial and Social Returns
description: There is a lazy mindedness that we afford the do-gooders.

title: Derrick Roses Value to Knicks Shows When Hes Sidelined
description: When the Knicks acquired point guard Derrick Rose from the Chicago Bulls last summer, they were at risk of taking on damaged goods. After several injury-plagued years, Rose, the N.B.A.s most valuable player in 2011, was no longer the star he once was.

title: Review: The Wedding Guest as Hot Mess in Bright Colors and Bold Patterns
description: Gerry, the madly chattering fellow whos the sole character in Drew Droeges hilarious show Bright Colors and Bold Patterns, is either your ideal wedding guest or your worst-nightmare wedding guest.

title: How the Drinks Are Served
description: TUESDAY PUZZLE  I am always impressed by the generosity of our puzzle constructors.

title: Obama Expected to Ban Offshore Drilling in Some Federal Waters
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama is expected to announce as soon as Tuesday that he will use his executive authority to permanently ban new offshore drilling in parts of federally owned waters off the Atlantic coast and in the Arctic Ocean, according to people familiar with the decision.

title: Deadly Berlin Christmas Market Episode Is Latest in Europe
description: A truck driver barreled into a crowded Christmas market in Berlin on Monday night, killing at least 12 people and injuring scores more. The police believed it to be an attack, but the identity of any attackers and their motives were not immediately clear.

title: Roger Federer on Family Time and Following the Tour
description: Summer is coming, the Australian summer, and Roger Federer is preparing to return to competitive tennis in January at the Hopman Cup in Perth after a six-month injury break, the first such extended break of his career.

title: Berlin, Russia, Aleppo: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Corrections: December 20, 2016
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Whats on TV Tuesday: Tony Bennett Celebrates 90 and The Year: 2016
description: Fantastic! Tony Bennett celebrates the big 9-0 by making music with friends at Radio City Music Hall. And Robin Roberts and her ABC colleagues recount the years top stories.

title: Morbid Anatomy Museum Closes Its Doors
description: The Morbid Anatomy Museum, a showcase for unusual taxidermy, natural history specimens and other objects at the intersection of art, science and beauty that opened to much fanfare in Brooklyn in 2014, abruptly shut down on Sunday after the failure of a last-ditch fund-raising effort.

title: Chinese Navy Returns Seized Underwater Drone to U.S.
description: BEIJING  The Chinese Navy on Tuesday handed back an American underwater drone it had seized, returning the device to the United States after days of contention that drew the ire of President-elect Donald J. Trump.

title: The Heartbeat of Our Being, in Black and White
description: Adger Cowans lyrical images portray life as resonant with feeling.

title: The American Dream
description: A recent article in the Upshot was headlined The American Dream, Quantified at Last, and this was the chart at the top of the piece.

title: Which Trump Will the World See?
description: One of the basic themes of Donald J. Trumps election campaign was that the United States was being ripped off by foreign countries and that his administration would reduce our trade deficit.

title: Liberal Zionism in the Age of Trump
description: For weeks now, Jewish communities across America have been troubled by an awkward phenomenon. Donald J. Trump, a ruthless politician trafficking in anti-Semitic tropes, has been elected to become the next president, and he has appointed as his chief strategist Stephen K. Bannon, a prominent figure of the alt-right, a movement that promotes white nationalism, anti-Semitism, racism and misogyny. Though Bannon himself has expressed zero tolerance for such views, his past actions suggest otherwise; as the executive chairman of Breitbart News for the past four years, he provided the countrys most powerful media platform for the movement and its ideologies.

title: The Climate Refugees of the Arctic
description: The polar bear, the largest bear of them all and a fearsome predator, is the poster animal of climate change, and for good reason: While most threatened animals, such as the rhinoceros, are victims of localized threats like poaching or human encroachment, the polar bear is threatened most gravely by global emissions of greenhouse gases.

title: The Heartbeat of Our Being, in Black and White
description: The pictures accompanying Adger Cowans essay in a new monograph on his work are not his professional photos, but snapshots from his personal life: his childhood home, a group portrait of his mothers relatives in their Sunday best, and Mr. Cowans cradling his godchild.

title: Scouts Honor, Texas Style
description: HOUSTON  Oops! Just when I thought it was safe to come out as a Texan again  you cant pin Donald J. Trump on us  the president-elect goes and nominates two of my countrymen to his cabinet. And not just any Texans, but two of the most quintessential Texans on the planet: Rick Perry, our former governor, as secretary of energy, and Rex W. Tillerson, the Exxon Mobil chief executive, to head the State Department.

title: Democrats Had a Knife, and the G.O.P. Had a Gun
description: President Obama and Gov. Pat McCrory of North Carolina dont agree on many policy questions. But they have found themselves facing a similar political situation this year. And their very different reactions capture the deep  and alarming  differences between our two political parties right now.

title: Venezuelas Currency Madness
description: President Nicols Maduro of Venezuela made a baffling announcement on Dec. 11, saying that his government intended to yank the 100 bolvar note from circulation in three days to thwart a supposed plot to hoard Venezuelan currency abroad. Any 100 bolvar bills that were not exchanged at the central bank within 10 days would become worthless. The result of this reckless decision was predictable.

title: Drinking on Antidepressants
description: So why did you stop drinking? my friend Brad asked recently when we were out for dinner. You never seemed to have a drinking problem.

title: The Everyday Anxiety of the Stutterer
description: There at the register, the frustration welled up in me. Again. And it was only morning. The cashier waited for my response, but my mouth hinged open, lock-jawed and gaping for the whole world to see. And as usual, nothing came out.

title: Can Trump's Infrastructure Plan Work?
The Cramped Quarters of a Migrant Boat
description: Abandoned boats, once used by migrants crossing the Mediterranean to reach Europe, lie in a junkyard on the Italian island of Lampedusa.

title: Searchers for Malaysia Jet Say They May Have Looked Too Far South
description: SYDNEY, Australia  Weeks away from ending their search of a remote stretch of the southern Indian Ocean for debris from a Malaysian jet that vanished in 2014, investigators acknowledged on Tuesday that they might have spent the past two years looking too far south.

description: Before you could read on your own, did you enjoy being read to? Did you have favorite books? How about after you became a reader? What were your favorites then?

title: Daily Report: An Autonomous Car Future Needs Better Maps
description: We are assured by the technologists of Silicon Valley that one day in the maybe not-so-distant future, robots will do most of the driving for us. Google, for example, has been testing autonomous cars for several years. Uber is also testing them with passengers in Pittsburgh and  for the moment  San Francisco.

title: The Many Meanings of the Pantsuit
description: Question: When is a pantsuit not just a pantsuit?

title: Berlin Market Attack Mars Square Where Three Eras Coexist
description: The German authorities were at first typically cautious about describing it as an attack, as opposed to an accident. They now say that it was very likely an act of terrorism. Like similar episodes, it involved a public space, an emblem of common ground and open society. But in this case, the symbolism of the site ran even deeper.

title: Reflecting on a Hungary Escape 60 Years Ago, and on a Refugees Plight
description: LONDON  After his first guitar lesson in the fall of 1956, Tom Leimdorfer made his way across Budapest, the capital of Hungary, to attend a peaceful demonstration outside the Parliament building.

title: Los Angeles Drivers on the 405 Ask: Was $1.6 Billion Worth It?
description: LOS ANGELES  It is the very symbol of traffic and congestion. Interstate 405, or the 405, as it is known by the 300,000 drivers who endure it morning and night, is the busiest highway in the nation, a 72-mile swerving stretch of pavement that crosses the sprawling metropolis of Los Angeles.

title: Lloyds to Buy Bank of Americas British Credit Card Business
description: LONDON  Lloyds Banking Group will buy Bank of Americas British credit card business for about $2.4 billion, signaling a major turning point for Lloyds eight years after a government bailout.

title: 6 Standout Restaurants in Los Angeles Strip Malls
description: I lived in, and loved, Los Angeles for about nine years, so I can get away with saying this: Very little is more Los Angeles than a strip mall. These asphalt-dominated bastions of cheapness and parking sum up so much about what I love and hate about the city. Theyre ugly and kitschy, yet they leave room for weird, unexpected, often wonderful surprises, hidden right under your nose.

title: London Stock Exchange Group in Talks to Sell French Clearing Arm
description: LONDON  The London Stock Exchange Group said on Tuesday that it was in exclusive talks to sell the French arm of its majority-owned clearing business to Euronext, part of the British-based companys efforts to win regulatory approval for a merger with Deutsche Brse.

title: Gunman Who Shot 3 at Zurich Islamic Center Is Found Dead, Police Say
description: ZURICH  A gunman who wounded three people attending prayers at  an Islamic center in Zurich has been found dead, apparently after committing suicide, the Swiss police said on Tuesday.

title: Germany Releases Berlin Attack Suspect as ISIS Claims Involvement
description: BERLIN  For a Germany that likes to see itself as meticulous, the slip-up was startling: Hours after the authorities said they had grabbed a suspect in the deadly truck rampage at a Christmas market in Berlin, they acknowledged they may have detained the wrong man and began a desperate search for the actual driver.

description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)
