description: I just wish I could do what he does.

title: Pedals the Bear Blurred a Line Between Species
description: By walking on two legs, he made us rethink the divide between human and animal.

title: The Lives They Lived
description: Remembering Muhammad Ali, Gwen Ifill, David Bowie, Natalie Cole and more of those we lost in the past year.

title: Miss Cleo Went From Joke to Legend
description: Late at night, she offered advice to the anxious and the lovelorn.

title: The Rooms They Left Behind
description: After the deaths of these 10 notable people, The New York Times photographed their private spaces  as they left them.

title: David Bowie in Eternity
description: Extracts from an endless list of reasons to appreciate an endlessly restless artist.

title: What Josephine Del Deo Saved for Us
description: She fought to preserve public land  and also some tarpaper shacks.

title: Nigel Farage Called a Disgrace for Remarks About Berlin Attack
description: LONDON  Blunt speaking made Nigel Farage, a former leader of the populist, right-wing U.K. Independence Party, one of Britains best-known politicians and it helped him persuade Britons to vote to quit the European Union.

title: Why Venezuela Should Default
description: New York  Guess which country has recently shown the greatest willingness to weather hardship in order to pay its foreign bondholders? Paradoxically, its the country that has been among the most vocal in its anticapitalist rhetoric. Venezuela continues to pay despite an economic crisis that would have stymied other sovereign borrowers long ago. Riots prompted by a shortage of cash are just the latest example of the countrys economic crisis. Although reallocating funds from debt service to the importation of much-needed food and medicine is tempting, the government fears that subsequent lawsuits could actually leave less money for imports.

title: Germany Seeks Tunisian Tied to Berlin Christmas Market Attack
description: BERLIN  Investigators undertook a Europe-wide manhunt on Wednesday for a young Tunisian ex-convict with multiple aliases who had been denied asylum in Germany and was considered a security risk, linking him to a deadly truck rampage through a Berlin Christmas market.

title: A Contemporary House in Vilnius
description: The five-bedroom villa, built in 2013, is in a gated development bordering a lake.

title: The Long-Term Jobs Killer Is Not China. Its Automation.
description: The first job that Sherry Johnson, 56, lost to automation was at the local newspaper in Marietta, Ga., where she fed paper into the printing machines and laid out pages. Later, she watched machines learn to do her jobs on a factory floor making breathing machines, and in inventory and filing.

title: Chinas New Ride-Hailing Rules Focus on Where Drivers Call Home
description: BEIJING  Fresh from school with a degree in hotel management, Luo Haichao left his hometown and moved to Beijing to look for a bigger paycheck. He eventually found one in a different sector: driving cars. China has created its own local versions of Uber and Lyft, and the ride-hailing business is booming.

title: California Today: Cast Your Vote for Californian of the Year
description: Good morning.

title: What You Get for ... $1,100,000
description: A converted church in Savannah, Ga., a rowhouse in Philadelphia and a contemporary in Phoenix.

title: $1,100,000 Homes in Georgia, Pennsylvania and Arizona
description: SAVANNAH, GA.

title: House Hunting in ... Lithuania
description: A CONTEMPORARY HOME IN NORTHERN VILNIUS

title: Donald Trump, Seeking Ambassadors, Sorts Through Competing Priorities
description: President-elect Donald J. Trump appears to believe he owes little to the Republican establishment donor set, a majority of whom opposed him. He also ran a campaign that challenged longstanding shibboleths of American diplomacy.

title: Smog Grips China, but Exam Goes on Outdoors
description: BEIJING  As the grimy, gray smog spreading across northern China settled on the town of Linqi, its schools received a red alert notice to cancel classes and protect children from the acrid haze. But Linqi No. 1 Middle School decided it would go ahead with exams it holds outside.

title: Executions Hit 25-Year Low and Support Is Falling, Report Finds
description: Executions, new death sentences and public support for capital punishment in the United States all fell this year to their lowest levels in decades, continuing sharp declines underway since the 1990s. States carried out fewer executions in 2016 than they had in 25 years, and juries imposed fewer death sentences than in any year since 1972, when the Supreme Court struck down all of the death penalty laws then on the books.

title: Gilded Age Ballroom Installation Coming to Central Park
description: The Public Art Fund will celebrate its 40th year with a Central Park installation by the sculptor Liz Glynn that recreates a Gilded Age ballroom.

title: Berlin Attack Poses Toughest Test in Merkels 11 Years in Power
description: BERLIN  She faced down a euro crisis that turned into an existential crossroads for the European Union. She confronted a Russian land grab in Ukraine. Virtually alone among her peers, she welcomed into her country roughly a million migrants who flooded across Europes borders.

title: After Searching the World for a Cure, a Mother Seeks Normalcy
description: When a Russian oncologist called her 3-year-old daughters brain tumor untreatable, Elena Romanova researched alternatives through the night.

title: We Trust You
description: In the early 1980s, Toyota transformed one of the worlds worst auto plants into one of the best, using the exact same workers. In the second installment of The Art of Better series, Charles Duhigg sheds light on the importance of entrusting workers with responsibility and authority.

title: Sony Executive to Lead Vienna Opera
description: The aria has a familiar ring to it: One of the worlds leading opera houses reaches outside the tight-knit world of opera impresarios for new leadership, choosing a Sony record executive with no experience running a theater to guide it through uncertain times.

title: The Best Recipe for Flan
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: Yaa Gyasi on Her Favorite TV Show of 2016: Insecure
description: We asked some of this years notable authors, actors and showrunners about the TV they enjoyed most in 2016. Their responses will run over the next two weeks. Come back to Watching, The New York Timess TV and movie recommendation site, to read them all.

title: The Juice Crew: A Rap History Reunion
description: By New York standards, the New Years Eve options are thin, so get your fix earlier in the week with a rap-history field trip: a reunion of the Juice Crew, the Queens collective responsible for so much essential music in the mid-to-late 1980s. Anchored by the producer Marley Marl, it included a wide range of provocative rappers. Big Daddy Kane was mercilessly smooth, Kool G Rap a rough-edged storyteller. Craig G was wildly improvisational, and MC Shan and Masta Ace were hard boasters. In Roxanne Shant, they had one of raps foundational tough women, and in Biz Markie, one of raps foundational comedians. Individually, their careers took wildly different directions, but their collective legacy remains strong. These reunion shows, on Thursday, Dec. 29, and Friday, will provide a rare opportunity to see The Symphony, the 1988 Juice Crew posse cut that set a high-water mark for the form, performed live and in full. (Thursday, B. B. King Blues Club & Grill, bbkingblues.com; Friday, Wellmont Theater, Montclair, N.J., wellmonttheater.com.)

title: Flamenco With a Difference: Hip-Hop and Antigone, Too
description: The remarkable Noche Flamenca enlists the typical elements of flamenco music and dance  pathos and passion, catharsis and tension  yet part of what makes this company so absorbing is its intimacy. Formed in 1993 by a husband-and-wife team, the director Martn Santangelo and the dancer Soledad Barrio, Noche Flamenca returns with a five-week season at the West-Park Presbyterian Church that features its acclaimed dance-drama Antigona, an adaptation of Sophocles Antigone starring the fiery Ms. Barrio. Its a part she was born to play.

title: Escaping the Shadow of Suicide in Every Brilliant Thing
description: The holiday season can be both a time to count blessings and a period that heightens feelings of sadness, which makes this a fitting moment for Every Brilliant Thing, a filmed version of the one-man stage show that the British comedian Jonny Donahoe has been performing for several years.

title: Erdogan Embraces Bana al-Abed, Who Brought Childs View of Aleppo to Twitter
description: President Recep Tayyip Erdogan of Turkey has embraced  quite literally  a 7-year-old Syrian girl from Aleppo, famous for her Twitter messages describing life in a war zone.

title: What Salvation Looks Like in Jack T. Chicks Cartoons for Christ
description: The fundamentalist zealot whose cartoons also inspired underground comics.

title: A New Work From Wynton Marsalis at David Geffen Hall
description: Though the week after Christmas is usually a slow period for classical music, the New York Philharmonic has a worthy program. On Wednesday, Dec. 28, Alan Gilbert conducts the combined forces of the Philharmonic and the Jazz at Lincoln Center Orchestra in the world premiere of Wynton Marsaliss The Jungle (Symphony No. 4), a Philharmonic commission. The concert also offers William Bolcoms Trombone Concerto, a lively, inventive piece that Mr. Gilbert and the orchestra introduced in June; its written for Joseph Alessi, the orchestras principal trombone, who is again the soloist. The program opens with Coplands Quiet City. (7:30 p.m. Wednesday and Thursday, 8 p.m. Friday, and 7:30 p.m. on Jan. 3; David Geffen Hall, nyphil.org.)

title: Talking Why Him? With Bryan Cranston, James Franco and Keegan-Michael Key
description: BEVERLY HILLS, Calif.  A behind-the-scenes look at the coming comedy Why Him? is available on YouTube. The video features a lot of hugging, the smiling faces of the stars Bryan Cranston, James Franco and Keegan-Michael Key, and, often, a happy, playful vibe. When asked if the on-set atmosphere of Why Him? ever turned circuslike, Mr. Key, sitting alongside Mr. Franco and Mr. Cranston, paused for a second. A circus? he said in a thoughtful, measured tone. Hmmm. Yes, thats about right.

title: How Katherine Dunn Wrote the Cult Novel on So Many Artists Bookshelves
description: She couldnt have guessed how passionately misfits would embrace Geek Love.

title: YouTube Stars Say They Were Removed From Delta Flight for Speaking Arabic
description: Two Muslim American YouTube stars who were returning home to New York after a world tour said they were removed from a Delta Air Lines flight in London on Wednesday after other passengers expressed discomfort with their presence on the plane.

title: Out of the Box Explores the Rise of the Sneaker
description: The complex life of the worlds most ubiquitous footwear may flash before the eyes in Out of the Box: The Rise of Sneaker Culture at the Oakland Museum of California. Organized by the estimable Bata Shoe Museum of Toronto with the American Federation of Arts in New York, the exhibition promises nearly 150 examples of this indispensable item. Some date to the first half of the 19th century and the onset of pre-vulcanized rubber overshoes. From there, the show traces the sneakers ascent; its role in sports, hip-hop and mens style; and its evolving technology and breakthroughs.

title: Sports in 2016: Winners, Losers and Cheaters
description: From a baseball player turned hit man to the amazing ability of Simone Biles, a look at some of the most compelling stories of the year.

title: A Deep Dive Into Laikas Animated Worlds
description: The Metrograph  the more-than-welcome downtown repertory cinema, complete with a bookstore and restaurant, and home to inventive film series  scores again with From Coraline to Kubo: The Magic of Laika, a tribute to the growing Hillsboro, Ore., animation studio. Creatively, Laika has challenged Pixar and DreamWorks Animation with its skilled blending of digital imagery and stop-motion, evident in films like ParaNorman, The Boxtrolls and, this year, Kubo and the Two Strings, which the program offers in 3-D.

title: Fiddler on the Roof Revival Has Its Final Notes
description: On Facebook recently, the gifted cabaret singer Liz Callaway posted that she was going to see Fiddler on the Roof for the very first time. Friends chimed in, with some registering surprise. (She posted the next day that she adored it.) We all  even critics  have a surprising gap or two in our theatergoing histories. But if you, like Ms. Callaway, are still a Fiddler virgin, you have but a week to see the exquisite Broadway revival of this classic musical, directed by Bartlett Sher, which closes on New Years Eve.

title: August Wilsons Fences Makes Its Movie Debut
description: A star-studded party for the film comes 11 years after the death of the plays author.

title: Youre an Adult. Your Brain, Not So Much.
description: Leah H. Somerville, a Harvard neuroscientist, sometimes finds herself in front of an audience of judges. They come to hear her speak about how the brain develops.

title: A Fences Celebration, Missing August Wilson, the Guest of Honor
description: At the Time Warner Center on Monday night, a red carpet area teemed with reporters. Sandy Kenyon of WABC-TV was at one end. A reporter from E! was at the other.

title: Risks of E-Cigarettes
description: To the Editor:

title: Official Took Bribes to Steer Pension Funds to Brokers, U.S. Says
description: A former portfolio manager who was responsible for investing $53 billion in New York State employee retirement funds took over $100,000 in bribes in exchange for steering more than $2 billion in fixed-income business to two brokers, earning them and their firms millions of dollars in commissions, federal authorities said on Wednesday.

title: The Imagination of A Monster Calls
description: J. A. Bayona has made a specialty of slyly inserting family dramas into genre films. This Spanish filmmaker spun a creepy horror movie with a family drama at its center for his first feature, The Orphanage. And he staged a destructive tsunami that pulls a family apart (and together) in the thriller The Impossible. In A Monster Calls, in theaters Friday, Dec. 23, he returns to family drama again, this time mixing in fantasy to tell the story of how the 12-year-old Conor copes with his mothers terminal illness when he is visited by a treelike monster.

title: Ways to Tap Into the Force, and Beam Up Your Inner Trekkie
description: THE newest film in the Star Wars franchise, Rogue One, is out in theaters. Several excellent science-fiction-themed TV shows are on the air. And there are more sci-fi and fantasy films expected soon.

title: From Yamaclaus to Menorah Bong: Hanukkah Goods That Can Hold a Candle
description: Lots of people make a living from the seasonal business of Christmas  lights, trees, stocking stuffers, artery-clogging eggnog  but the much-more-niche business of Hanukkah products is tougher. Some entrepreneurs have made it work (or are trying), with quirky products whether earnest (like the Star of David tree topper) or mildly subversive (like the Santa Claus yarmulke or a menorah-shaped bong).

title: Vatican Museums Get First Female Director
description: Pope Francis has chosen Barbara Jatta as the first woman to direct the Vatican Museums. Currently the museums deputy director, Dr. Jatta, 54, will take over on Jan. 1, 2017, becoming the highest-ranking female administrator in the Vatican, where most senior positions are reserved for cardinals and bishops.

title: The Sharing Economy
description: To the Editor:

title: The Long, Lonely Fall of a Heisman Trophy Winner
description: BOULDER, Colo.  Through the darkness, Rashaan Salaam drove his run-down Suzuki sedan. He was, as usual, alone.

title: Esports Sees Profit in Attracting Female Gamers
description: Mark Religioso, a brand manager for the video game publisher Bandai Namco Entertainment, wants more women to be involved in the professional gaming arena known as esports, where players compete in video game tournaments to win thousands of dollars in prize money.

title: Syrian Refugees in Canada
description: To the Editor:

title: After the Electoral College Vote
description: To the Editor:

title: Whats the Best Book, New or Old, You Read This Year?
description: In this special year-end edition of Bookends, our columnists share their favorite reading experience of 2016.

title: Spanish Banks Ordered to Repay Customers Over Unfair Mortgages
description: MADRID  Europes highest court ruled on Wednesday that customers of banks in Spain can reclaim billions of euros because lenders did not pass on savings from interest rate cuts on variable-rate mortgages, sending shares in several of the countrys top lenders crashing.

title: Lydia Polgreen on Leaving to Lead Huffington Post: Hardest Decision Ive Ever Made
description: Lydia Polgreen, who until last week was the editorial director for The New York Times Global, has been named as the editor in chief of the Huffington Post.

title: Daily Report: Using Fake Users and Sites to Steal Real Money
description: A parent or teacher might wonder at the world of cyberthieves and hackers and think, If only they used all that brain power for something positive.

title: Donald Trump and the British Monarchy
description: To the Editor:

title: Use Labels to Sort Messages in Gmail
description: Q. Can I make folders in the web version of Gmail so I can sort messages?

title: Led by Rockets, N.B.A. Is Shooting Even More 3-Pointers
description: If there is a limit to how much a team can rely on 3-pointers to drive its offense, the N.B.A. has yet to find it.

title: Former BlackRock Manager Sentenced in Insider Trading Case
description: LONDON  A former fund manager at BlackRock was sentenced to one year in prison on Wednesday after he pleaded guilty to insider trading charges in November.

title: Berlin, Russia, Narendra Modi: Your Morning Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: The Tragic Death of Zymere Perkins
description: To the Editor:

title: Erdogan Says Follower of Gulen, His Rival, Killed Russian Envoy
description: President Recep Tayyip Erdogan of Turkey said on Wednesday that he had no doubt the assassin of Russias ambassador had belonged to the outlawed Turkish organization of Mr. Erdogans rival, Fethullah Gulen.

title: A First Look at the New Branch of Chefs Table at Brooklyn Fare
description: Chefs Table at Brooklyn Fare, a celebrated restaurant in a Brooklyn supermarket where the chef Csar Ramirez serves his tasting menus, has finally opened an outpost in the grocerys Midtown Manhattan store.

title: Johnson & Johnson and Actelion Confirm Merger Talks Are Back On
description: Johnson & Johnson has resumed acquisition talks with Actelion Pharmaceuticals, the $20 billion Swiss biopharmaceutical company, after announcing just last week that it was severing discussions over a deal.

title: Trump Organization Moves to Avoid Possible Conflicts of Interest
description: In its latest effort to defuse a major public relations problem that might have loomed over Donald J. Trumps presidency, the Trump Organization on Wednesday announced union accords at two major hotel holdings.

title: Taliban Attack Lawmakers Kabul Home
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Taliban gunmen attacked the Kabul home of a prominent lawmaker on Wednesday, killing at least seven people in an overnight assault that lasted nearly 10 hours, Afghan officials said.

title: Did ISIS Carry Out Those Terrorist Attacks? And Does It Matter?
description: The Islamic State claimed responsibility for attacks in four countries this week.

title: Sometimes, a Merger Just Doesnt Pay Off
description: As the most recent merger boom winds down, the broken promises of overeager corporate executives will begin to emerge in earnest. Contrary to the Wall Street spin, one plus one rarely amounts to more than two. The progress of three transactions from the start of the current cycle illustrates the ways investors will be let down in 2017.

title: Hyundais U.S. Chief Is Out, as Automaker Seeks to Rekindle Growth
description: Just four months ago, Hyundai Motor was celebrating a key achievement  the introduction of a new line of luxury cars sold under the name Genesis.

title: Romania Set for First Female, and First Muslim, Prime Minister
description: BUCHAREST, Romania  In a surprise move, Romanias largest political party nominated a woman from the countrys Tatar minority for prime minister on Wednesday. If she wins approval from the president and Parliament, she will be both the first Muslim and the first woman to hold the post.

title: Statin Drugs Tied to Better Surgery Outcomes
description: Taking statins, the widely used cholesterol-lowering drugs, may make surgery safer.

title: Winning Reviews from Our 2016 Student Contest
description: For the second year in a row, we challenged teenagers to go out and experience works of culture that were new to them and then write up their reactions and opinions for our  Student Review Contest. Over 1,250 students submitted entries.

title: Thursdays N.F.L. Matchup: Giants (10-4) at Philadelphia Eagles (5-9)
description: 8:25 p.m. Eastern, NBC and NFL Network

title: Investors Worry as Financial Picture of Italys Oldest Bank Deteriorates
description: LONDON  Investors are increasingly sounding the alarms over Monte dei Paschi di Siena, the beleaguered Italian lender, as concerns mounted on Wednesday about its ability to raise new capital and avoid a government bailout.

title: Chris Botti Plays His Trumpet, but No Holiday Music
description: For each of the last 12 years, Chris Botti has spent the holidays at the Blue Note Jazz Club, bringing his trumpet, his high-gloss production values and his ace touring band. What began as a standard booking at the club has expanded into a monthlong residency, full of surprise drop-ins and celebrity cameos.

title: New York City Should Keep ID Data for Now, Judge Rules
description: A key component of New York Citys inclusive approach to immigrants under Mayor Bill de Blasio was on trial in a Staten Island courtroom on Wednesday.

title: Florida Woman Charged in Death of Infant in Co-Sleeping Case
description: Early on Oct. 6, Erin Piche-Pitts was awakened by the sound of her baby crying. She later told the authorities in Florida that she had picked him up from a bassinet, prepared some formula in a bottle and settled back into bed with him, propping him up with a pillow and nestling his head in the crook of her arm. Then she dozed off.

title: Hezbollah Is Using U.S.-Made Military Vehicles in Syria, Israel Says
description: TEL AVIV  A senior Israeli military official said on Wednesday that Hezbollah militants fighting in Syria were using American-made armored personnel carriers that were originally supplied to the Lebanese Army.

title: Joakim Noah Gives Knicks Hope After Disappointing Start
description: At a time of growing criticism and waning support from the paying public, Joakim Noah found some solitude before Tuesday nights game against the Indiana Pacers.

title: Spiking Temperatures in the Arctic Startle Scientists
description: A spate of extreme warmth in the Arctic over the past two months has startled scientists, who warn that the high temperatures may lead to record-low ice coverage next summer and even more warming in a region that is already among the hardest hit by climate change.

title: Norm Macdonalds Often Funny, Always Fabulist Based on a True Story
description: In May 2015, Norm Macdonald appeared on the fourth-to-last episode of Late Show With David Letterman. He did about six minutes of stand-up comedy, and then choked up when recalling the first time he saw Mr. Letterman perform. Finally, unsuccessfully fighting back tears, he turned toward the hosts desk and told him, I love you.

title: Odebrecht, Together With Its Co-Conspirators, Paid Approximately $788 Million in Bribes
description: Odebrecht, the construction company that built Miami International Airport, settled bribery charges in a case stemming from a global investigation.

title: The East Lobs a Blockbuster-Hopeful to the West With The Great Wall
description: LOS ANGELES  The Great Wall, an epic fantasy film that cost at least $150 million to make, opens with Matt Damon fleeing on horseback through red stone formations in Northwest China. A snarling swarm of razor-toothed green monsters is hot on his heels.

title: On Patrol With Police as Philippines Battles Drugs
description: MANILA  Officer Kathlyn Domingo walked through a maze of narrow alleys, ducking under jumbles of electrical wires and hanging laundry to the open doorway of a flimsy two-story house made of found wood and rusty nails.

title: The Most-Read Food Stories of 2016
description: These are the articles and columns that Food section readers found most compelling in 2016.

title: Is American Baking Really Limited to Fruitcake and Gingerbread?
description: American baking is a jumble of double-crust pies, babkas and pastelitos, of red bean buns, coconut layer cakes and sourdoughs. In home kitchens along a single cul-de-sac, chocolate chip cookies may evolve with more defining characteristics than Darwins finches.

title: Health Exchange Enrollment Jumps, Even as G.O.P. Pledges Repeal
description: WASHINGTON  About 6.4 million people have signed up for health insurance next year under the Affordable Care Act, the Obama administration said Wednesday, as people rushed to purchase plans regardless of Republican promises that the law will be repealed within months.

title: Want the Scoop on Team Trump? Pay Attention to Cindy Adams
description: There are no names here, the longtime New York Post columnist Cindy Adams complained.

title: Bowie and a Flooded Amusement Park: What Inspired Ride the Cyclone
description: No, the Off Broadway musical Ride the Cyclone, which follows a group of teenagers who meet a deadly fate on an amusement park roller coaster, isnt a riff on the movie Final Destination 3, where characters meet a similar end. And no, the plot  which has the kids singing in a kind of purgatory  wasnt inspired by the musical Forever Plaid, where a quartet performs a concert from the afterlife after being killed in an accident. Nor by Cats, with which it shares some narrative threads.

title: A Book Deal for Pantsuit Nation, and Then a Backlash
description: When Libby Chamberlain, the creator of the pro-Hillary Clinton Facebook group Pantsuit Nation, announced this week that she plans to publish a Pantsuit Nation-themed book, she framed the publication deal as a collective victory for the group.

title: Finding Answers in a Ship Full of Migrants Bodies
description: Professor Cristina Cattaneo attempts to determine the identities of the bodies of migrants who died at sea.

title: Keeping the Lights On for Migrants in Rome
description: Andrea Costa, the director of the Baobab migrant camp, addresses a group of migrants in Rome.

title: Running the Mediterraneans Trauma Ward
description: Dr. Pietro Bartolo tends to newborn twins flown to Lampedusa island on Aug. 29, the largest single day of sea rescues of migrants in the history of the Italian Coast Guard.

title: Italy Overwhelmed
description: The Aegean route is mostly closed, but the migrants keep coming, from Eritrea, Ethiopia and elsewhere. They cross the Mediterranean to Italy, a country struggling to deal with the influx. A political crisis is blooming, and the countrys institutions are straining to keep up.

title: On New Years Eve, We Wear Glitter
description: Some unexpected ways to shine for the last bash of the year.

title: Sam Sifton and Tejal Rao: How The Times Covers Food
description: Times Insider delivers behind-the-scenes insights into news, features and opinion at The New York Times.

title: Full Course of Antibiotics Is Best for Infant Ear Infections, Study Finds
description: When babies have an acute ear infection, they tug at their ears, get cranky and struggle to sleep through the night. Ear infections are the most common reason doctors prescribe antibiotics to children.

title: Monsieur Vogue Is Leaving Trumpland
description: CHAPEL HILL, N.C.  Andr Leon Talley is eating a biscuit.

title: Confirm or Deny: Andr Leon Talley
description: Maureen Dowd: You have gorgeous stuff in your house in White Plains, but you dont entertain.

title: 2 Sides Spar Over Patz Suspects Competence and Validity of His Confession
description: The detectives tried to draw Pedro Hernandez out by appealing to his religious faith, telling him that he had shown the strength of the Lord. They called him Pap, and patted his head and his back as the interview wore on.

title: Berlin, Russia, Donald Trump: Your Wednesday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Viacom Executive Who Oversaw Comedy Central Is Leaving
description: The executive shake-up at Viacom continues.

title: The Oscar Season Sizzles, Strictly by Design
description: Over the past few months in New York, invitees of a specific sort have had a choice selection of star-strewn events to attend.

title: Trump Taps Peter Navarro, Vocal Critic of China, for New Trade Post
description: WASHINGTON  President-elect Donald J. Trump on Wednesday named a strident China critic, Peter Navarro, to lead a new White House office overseeing American trade and industrial policy, in the latest sign that Mr. Trump is moving to reshape relations between the worlds two largest economies.

title: To Judge Teachers, City Will Rely More on Students Daily Work
description: The de Blasio administration announced a deal on Wednesday that would change how teachers and principals are evaluated, relying more on the work students do every day in the classroom.

title: To Slow Global Warming, We Need Nuclear Power
description: If 20 fire marshals came around and told us our houses were about to burn down, wed buy some fire insurance. So when the leading science academies in 20 developed countries, along with several major American corporations and the national security community, all tell us that burning fossil fuels is causing dangerous changes to the climate, we think its time for the United States to get serious about clean energy. It also means supporting safely operating nuclear power plants that produce carbon-free electricity.

title: Its Beginning to Sound a Lot Like Christmas
description: Kacey Musgraves

title: When New Yorks Nightclubs Were Secret Empires
description: The most valuable and also vexing thing about nightclubs is that you cant get in. Not to the good ones, at least. Not unless you are in the know, or in good standing with people who are, or are diligent and passionate and perhaps willing to part with a bit of cash. Nightclubs are not for public consumption  there is a clear demarcation line of knowledge and access, and the mythology of a great club is built as much by the curious kept on the outside as the revelers doing damage on the inside.

title: In Kansas, Where Republicans and Fiscal Woes Reign, Democrats Made Inroads
description: OVERLAND PARK, Kan.  Brett Parker, an elementary school teacher and rookie politician, was a Democrat running against a Republican incumbent in a Republican state that the Republican presidential candidate, Donald J. Trump, clinched by 20 percentage points.

title: Jeopardy! Run Ends for Cindy Stowell, Cancer-Stricken Champion
description: Cindy Stowell had Stage 4 colon cancer when she recorded episodes of Jeopardy! in August and September, competing on painkillers and developing a fever that caused makeup artists to rush onstage during commercial breaks to clean up her sweat.

title: Member Charged in Arson of Black Church With Vote Trump Scrawled on Side
description: The authorities charged a man on Wednesday with setting fire last month to a predominantly African-American church in Greenville, Miss., where Vote Trump was found spray-painted on the side of the building.

title: Italy Overwhelmed
description: Italy is overwhelmed by the influx of migrants. But three citizens are making a difference in migrants lives, and even in their deaths.

title: Week 16 Playoff Trees: Explore Every N.F.L. Contenders Path to the Postseason
description: Exploring the playoff chances and potential seedings of every N.F.L. team that hasnt been eliminated.

title: Polands Tragic Turn
description: The dire warning issued by the departing president of Polands highest constitutional court was one that should frighten not only the Poles, but people of all democratic nations in which populist rulers have taken or threaten to take power. Andrzej Rzeplinski, whose term expired on Monday, said that the governing Law and Justice Party is systematically weakening the checks and balances provided by the courts, the press and other institutions, and is leading the country on the road to autocracy.

title: Trump Meets Boeing and Lockheed Executives After Assailing Them on Jet Costs
description: After attacking Boeing and Lockheed Martin on Twitter over the costs of military contracts, President-elect Donald J. Trump met Wednesday with the chief executives of the two aerospace companies, saying his goal was to try to bring costs down.

title: Jaywalking While Reading a Book
description: Dear Diary:

title: Prominent Antiquities Dealer Accused of Selling Stolen Artifacts
description: One of New Yorks most prominent antiquities dealers was arrested Wednesday on charges that she obtained millions of dollars in stolen artifacts from international smugglers and sold them illegally  often through major auction houses  by creating fraudulent documents to camouflage their history.

title: U.N. Inquiry Alludes to Russia and Syria as Bombers of Aid Convoy
description: A United Nations panel concluded in findings made public Wednesday that warplanes had bombed a humanitarian aid convoy in Syria three months ago, an episode the head of the world body called, at the time, a possible war crime.

title: Calpers Cuts Investment Targets, Increasing Strain on Municipalities
description: The board of Californias state public pension system, Calpers, voted Wednesday to lower expectations for future investment returns, a step that will increase pressure on the budgets of towns and cities across the state.

title: A Call-Ups Story: Years in the Minors, Four Days in the N.H.L.
description: BUFFALO  Erik Burgdoerfer was two rungs below the N.H.L., riding buses from Bakersfield, Calif., to Boise, Idaho, and spending the night in Econo Lodge hotels as the Bakersfield Condors slid further down the ECHL standings. This was three seasons ago, when Burgdoerfer played defense for the Condors and the team was off to a 1-10-0-1 start.

title: Leaving the Arctic Alone
description: President Obamas decision to forbid oil and gas drilling in nearly all United States waters in the Arctic is in itself a spectacular environmental gift, offering protection to what he accurately described as a sensitive and unique ecosystem that is unlike any other region on earth.

title: Despite Blast in Mexico, a Clamor to Rebuild Fireworks Market
description: TULTEPEC, Mexico  As forensic workers picked through the scorched ruins of the fireworks market on Wednesday morning, Mara Centeno stood outside the yellow cordon, reliving moments etched in her memory by the explosion.

title: After The Shot, Villanovas Kris Jenkins Sets His Sights Higher
description: VILLANOVA, Pa.  Kris Jenkins doesnt want to think too much about his most memorable day of 2016. At home, he knows better than to even bring it up.

title: Secret Unit Helped Brazilian Company Bribe Government Officials
description: At Latin Americas biggest construction company, bribing government officials around the world became so common that a division was created devoted to tracking and facilitating kickbacks.

title: F.B.I. Agents News Leaks May Doom Federal Case Against William Walters
description: A major insider trading case against the Las Vegas sports bettor William T. Walters is in danger of unraveling, after it was revealed that a federal agent leaked confidential information to reporters.

title: Clinton Backers Cry Foul Over What F.B.I. Considers Common Procedure
description: WASHINGTON  After a federal judge unsealed a search warrant this week that the F.B.I. had used to examine emails related to the previously closed inquiry into Hillary Clintons private server, some of her backers said it proved their contention that the warrant should never have been sought because it would not have changed the outcome of that investigation.

title: Trump Suggests Berlin Attack Affirms His Plan to Bar Muslims
description: WASHINGTON  President-elect Donald J. Trump seemed to suggest on Wednesday that the deadly truck attack on a Christmas market in Berlin vindicated his proposal during the presidential campaign to bar Muslims from entering the United States.

title: Berlin Attack Sets Off Hunt for a Tunisian in Germany
description: BERLIN  Searching the cab of the tractor-trailer that plowed through a Christmas market in Berlin, the authorities made two startling discoveries: a badly bruised body with stab and gunshot wounds, and the wallet of a Tunisian labeled a security threat who was supposed to have been deported months ago.

title: Officer Is Cleared in Fatal Shooting of Unarmed Man in Yonkers
description: An investigation by the state attorney generals office has cleared a New York City police officer in the fatal shooting of an unarmed man after a wild car chase in the Bronx ended in a confrontation in a wooded area of Yonkers last year.

title: Construction Material
description: THURSDAY PUZZLE  That reminds me ... I need to power-wash my house one of these days.

title: Trumps Son, Fearing Quagmire, to Stop Soliciting for Charity
description: WASHINGTON  Eric Trump said on Wednesday that he had decided to stop directly soliciting contributions for his charitable foundation, which supports causes like the fight against childhood cancer, because he now recognizes that his status as the president-elects son means that donors could try to use him to gain access to his father.

title: In a Retreat, Uber Ends Its Self-Driving Car Experiment in San Francisco
description: Ubers grand experiment of a self-driving car service in its hometown officially lasted only a week.

title: North Carolina Fails to Repeal Bathroom Law That Prompted Boycotts
description: RALEIGH, N.C.  After more than nine hours of closed-door meetings, jawboning and complicated legislative stratagems, North Carolina legislators went home in frustration Wednesday after failing to repeal the state law that has prompted economic boycotts, lawsuits, political acrimony and contributed to the defeat of the Republican governor.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: There is an ambient prickliness. We could end up picking fights with three-quarters of the world.

title: LeBron James Delivered on His Promise in 2016
description: LeBron James was present at two Game 7 thrillers in 2016 but played in only one of them.

title: Sports in 2016: Upsets and the Upsetting
description: It was a year of time travel in global sports. While revisiting the past was often a downer, with the McLaren reports and Olympic retesting confirming the grand scale of recent cheating, living in the moment was routinely a joy ride.

title: A Look at the Years Winners and Losers
Corrections: December 22, 2016
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Berlin, Uber, Syria: Your Thursday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: The Year in Pictures 2016
description: A selection of the years most riveting photographs.

title: Whats on TV Thursday: A Very Harold & Kumar 3D Christmas and Brooklyn
description: How do you like your holidays? Get a yuletide high with Harold and Kumar, traipse after Buddy the would-be elf or weep at a Christmas soup kitchen in 1950s Brooklyn.

title: Word + Quiz: flay
Choosing The New York Times Pictures of the Year
description: How do you sort through 180,000 images to find a handful that sum up the year? Jeffrey Henson Scales explains.

title: Bored, Broke and Armed: Clues to Chicagos Gang Violence
description: CHICAGO  The young men who call themselves Gangster Disciples skirted by an empty lot. They marched past a Stop the Violence mural painted on a corner store, coming to a halt when they saw members of a rival gang, the Black Disciples.

title: A Seasonal Scene
description: The scene in this photograph is from Italy and dates from the 18th century. Look at it or at this larger-sized version closely. What do you see in it? Why is an article about it, and scenes like it, particularly appropriate this time of year?

title: Rex Tillersons Special Friend in the Kremlin
description: MOSCOW  Its June 2014. War is underway in eastern Ukraine, and Russia has recently annexed Crimea. Western countries are introducing sanctions against Russian companies and the people in President Vladimir V. Putins inner circle. It seems that Russia will soon be completely isolated from the rest of the world.

title: Invasion of the Agency Snatchers
description: At first glance, everything looked the same. It wasnt. Something evil had taken possession of the town.

title: Investigate Russian Hacking the Right Way
description: President-elect Donald Trump will assume office next month dogged by the question of whether a covert ploy by the Russian government had a decisive effect on his election.

title: The Senate Bathroom Angle
description: We are sorely in need of some cheerful news out of Washington, so Im going to tell you Barbara Mikulskis story about the Senate bathrooms.

title: Super Mario Runs Not-So-Super Gender Politics
description: Last week, after a wait of almost a decade, the worlds most popular video game series, Super Mario Bros., finally came to the worlds most popular video game machine: the iPhone. Nintendos Super Mario Run went immediately to the top of the App Store charts, above mainstays like Facebook, Snapchat, Instagram and YouTube. According to one estimate, the game was downloaded 37 million times in its first three days.

title: How Social Isolation Is Killing Us
description: My patient and I both knew he was dying.

title: One Problem for Democratic Leaders Is Democratic Voters
description: Leaders on the Democratic left who want to represent the have-nots face an obstacle: their own voters.

title: Since the Fall of the Soviet Union
Choosing the New York Times Pictures of the Year
description: The New York Times 2016 Pictures of the Year is posted online today and is scheduled to appear in print on Sunday. Jeffrey Henson Scales of the Sunday Review, who was the lead photo editor, spoke with James Estrin about the challenge of encapsulating 365 days in a few photos. Their conversation has been edited for brevity and clarity. They also talked on Facebook live  watch their discussion here.

title: The Dancer Shamel Pitts on Coming Home
description: TEL AVIV  The day he turned 30, Shamel Pitts put on a show.

title: Questions for: In Turkey, a Capstone to a Violent Year. In Germany, a Realization of Fears
description: Article: In Turkey, a Capstone to a Violent Year. In Germany, a Realization of Fears

title: Egypts Cruelty to Christians
description: CAIRO  The Dec. 11 bombing of a church in the Cairo cathedral complex  the seat of the Coptic pope  has been claimed by the Islamic State, although the Egyptian government has blamed the Muslim Brotherhood. Whoever planted the bomb that killed 27 people, including a 10-year-old girl, when it ripped through a church full of Sunday worshipers understood well how endemic bigotry in Egypt has left Christian lives at the whim of a regime that pays lip service to protecting them, armed Islamists who actively seek them harm, and a public that largely does not care.

title: Financial Vetting Goes Slowly for Trumps Wealthy Cabinet Picks
description: WASHINGTON  Some of President-elect Donald J. Trumps most prominent cabinet nominees  with their millions in assets and complex business arrangements  are moving unusually slowly through the governments arduous financial disclosure examinations, threatening the quick start promised for the new administration and raising Democratic concerns that their confirmations could short-circuit customary ethical safeguards.

title: Woody Allen Reviews a Graphic Tale of a Scandalous Starlet
description: MARY ASTORS PURPLE DIARYThe Great American Sex Scandal of 1936By Edward SorelIllustrated. 167 pp. Liveright Publishing. $25.95.

title: Lynda Carter Deflects Critics of Wonder Woman
description: Is Wonder Woman a pinup girl or a feminist icon? The question dogged a United Nations campaign that featured the superhero as a symbol of self-empowerment for girls and women.

title: 36 Hours in Puerto Vallarta, Mexico
description: With its inventive food scene, excellent beaches and Night of the Iguana mystique, the city makes the perfect weekend getaway.

title: Love the Place, Hate the View
description: Nine years ago, Jeremy Jankowski moved to New York from his native Florida, landed a job as a media buyer and found a place with roommates in the Bushwick section of Brooklyn, later moving to Williamsburg.

title: Your Liver Doesnt Know Its the Holidays
description: Over the holidays, many of us will drink, stay up past bedtime, eat an extra slice of pie and sleep in. Fun as they are, these activities can tamper with our circadian rhythms, the feedback loops that sync our bodys functions to our external environment.

title: A New York Holiday Tradition to Count On? Big Crowds
description: Bruna Gomes has made the holiday rounds in New York City. The glittering windows at Macys. The Radio City Rockettes high-kicking with Santa. The pilgrimage to the Christmas tree at Rockefeller Center.

title: Sit With Santa at the Arctic Circle
description: Santa Claus Village in Finland attracts half a million visitors a year. Join the elves (postal workers) as they sort through some 700,000 letters to Santa.

title: Tragedy Made Steve Kerr See the World Beyond the Court
description: The last time Steve Kerr was in Beirut, his birthplace, with the bombs pounding the runway and the assassination of his father six months away, he left by car.

title: What Would You Name a New Star or Planet?
description: Are you a stargazer? Do you like to think about questions such as whether there is life on other planets? Do you think humans will travel to Mars in your lifetime? What are your hopes and ideas about other worlds in the celestial heavens?

title: How Hard Is It to Get Rid of a Cabinet Department? Pretty Hard
description: Donald J. Trump and his cabinet nominees have called for the elimination of several federal departments. History suggests it may not be easy.

title: North Carolina, Berlin, Delta: Your Thursday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Discounts at New Hotels, From Mexico to Orlando
description: Often to gain traction in a competitive market, new hotels open with attractive rates in their initial season. Grab a deal before the paint dries at the following:

title: What Rachael Ray Cant Travel Without
description: The chef and television star Rachael Ray is always starting projects (TV shows, magazines, now a home furnishings collection), but she is a creature of habit when it comes to travel.

title: Out of Sorts Around the Holidays? It Could Be Family Jet Lag
description: The holidays mean large extended family gatherings, hours of cooking and a group of people who dont typically interact in person, all confined to one location and trying to act festive. Its the reality show version of your family.

title: Charles Johnson: By the Book
description: The author of Middle Passage and, most recently, The Way of the Writer agrees with Sartre: If literature isnt everything, its not worth a single hour of someones trouble.

title: With Streaming, Musicians and Fans Find Room to Experiment and Explore
description: Something unexpected happened near the top of the album charts this year: Pop stars were acting like artists. That is to say, they werent desperately chasing the broadest possible audience with the most surefire formulas; they werent calculating what would fit radio formats best. Instead, some of them grew eccentric and adventurous, impulsive and experimental, instinctive and personal  at times, bordering on avant-garde. And they found that listeners were willing to pay attention.

title: Review: A Monster Calls, Offering a Boy a Lifeline
description: The formidable creature looming over A Monster Calls is one of the more unnerving, impressive special-effects creations of the year. Whether it and the movie in general are too intense for younger children is something parents need to ask themselves. A PG-13 rating is sometimes an overreaction to a curse word or two, but here its a useful caution.

title: Instant Chemistry, Caught on Video
description: At the wedding of Smriti Keshari and Matthew Danzico, which took place on Nov. 19 at Basilica Hudson in Hudson, N.Y., the groom mounted a horse and led a parade of guests who sang and danced their way to the site, in an Indian tradition known as a Baraat. A Hindu priest lit a fire to symbolize the illumination of the mind, knowledge and happiness. And the groomsmen and groomswomen wore top hats and cartoonish striped socks.

title: Apple Music: Platform? Promoter? Both.
description: By all modern metrics, Drake was far and away the most listened-to artist of 2016, a year when music consumers further abandoned CDs and paid downloads, and turned increasingly to streaming services.

title: Ten Models We Loved a Lot This Year
description: From new faces to ones we know well, the names that caught Ts attention in 2016.

title: Morning Agenda: New Trade Policy, F.B.I. Leaks, Calpers Cuts Targets
description: President-elect Donald J. Trump wants to shake up both relations with China and regulatory issues, and hes not doing it by halves.

title: Review: Why Him? Better Yet, Why This Movie?
description: From the moment we spy the dead-moose art installation that graces the home of Laird (James Franco) in Why Him?, we suspect that the glass tank of urine in which it floats will at some point crack and douse one or more characters. Its no fun at all being right.

title: New York Today: The Most Engaging Articles of 2016
description: Updated, 9:28 a.m.

title: Beautiful Gardens We Escaped to This Year
description: From eastern Long Island to the countryside of northern Morocco, some of the prettiest patches of green we saw in 2016.

title: Alibaba Faces Growing Pressure Over Counterfeit Goods
description: BEIJING  Alibaba has a fakes problem.

title: Chinese Propaganda Video Warns of Wests Devilish Claws
description: BEIJING  The ominous images in the video pile up, set to darkly urgent music. Refugees fleeing failed uprisings in the Middle East. Western diplomats and politicians cast as puppet masters of subversion in China. Chinese lawyers abjectly confessing to subversion in show trials. Protests erupting in Hong Kong.

title: Its Our Turn to Make a Best-of-2016 List!
description: The end of the year tends to turn people reflective. They want to take stock of places they traveled, people they met, things they accomplished. So they make lists.

title: Becoming a Pack Leader of Dogs and Donkeys
description: In the weeks after Sherman joined our family, we were doing our best to heal his body, but his mind needed care as well.

title: What Doctors Can Learn From Looking at Art
description: It was a welcome change to find my eyes glued not to the endlessly frustrating loop of the Krebs cycle, but instead to a portrait of 19th-century aristocrats in top hats and ball gowns. The afternoon, spent at a museum of British art, wasnt a stolen escape from medical school. It was a required class.

title: The 12.11.16 Issue
description: RE: OBAMACARE

title: The Best Photo Books of 2016
description: The term photo book is a bit of a catchall. Is a photo book a book consisting entirely or predominantly of photographs? Or is it a book that advances its argument largely by means of photographs? Do the photos have to have been taken with the intent of making art, or are other kinds of photographic documents permissible? If you want to make a fair-minded assessment, you have to consider small, self-published items as well as large, scholarly catalogs produced by mighty institutions. The good news is that all across this spectrum, there are pleasures to be discovered. For more than a month now, Ive been sifting through the enormous pile of photo books that Ive bought or received this year. Here are 10, in no particular order, that I found outstanding.

title: U.S. Returns Some Okinawa Land to Japan, but Unease Endures
description: TOKYO  Amid rising tensions over the American military presence on Okinawa, the United States officially returned nearly 10,000 acres of land on the northern part of the island to Japan on Thursday. It was the largest transfer of land since the United States returned Okinawa to Japan in 1972, at the end of postwar occupation.

title: Growth of U.S. Population Is at Slowest Pace Since 1937
description: The United States population grew by 0.7 percent in the last year, its smallest annual expansion in 80 years, the Census Bureau said this week.

title: Czech, Israeli, Italian, Polish and Ukrainian Citizens Were Among Victims of Berlin Attack
description: The terrorist attack on a Christmas market in Berlin on Monday evening killed 12 people and wounded at least 48 others, many of them gravely. Seven of the dead were German citizens, and one was Ukrainian. Below are brief portraits of the victims known so far.

title: Addressing Past Criticism, Right or Wrong, in an Annual Review
description: I just completed my first year at a large company, or rather, at an affiliate that operates in a different market. I am relatively autonomous. My immediate supervisor has an understanding of my work, but the head of the overall business unit, by his own admission, has almost no idea what I actually do. In my midyear review, this higher-up made passing references to my excellent work but then focused on my adjustment to company culture, which he said needed improvement.

title: A Small African Nation Severs Ties with Taiwan, and Beijing Applauds
description: HONG KONG  Before this week, few Chinese citizens had probably heard of So Tom and Prncipe, an island nation off the west coast of Africa. But the country has risen into their good graces after deciding to sever diplomatic ties with Taiwan, a self-governing island that China regards as a breakaway province.

title: California Today: A Water Crisis on the Central Coast
description: Good morning.

title: South Korean Court Begins Hearings on Park Geun-hyes Impeachment
description: SEOUL, South Korea  South Koreas Constitutional Court, which will decide whether President Park Geun-hye is permanently removed from office, on Thursday ordered Ms. Park to respond to one of the most contentious accusations against her: that she neglected her duties on the day in 2014 when hundreds died in the sinking of a ferry.

title: Columnist Secret Santa: An Invitation to the Resistance, Humility and Meatloaf for All
description: Its the yearly office conundrum: What do you get your colleague for Secret Santa? Our Op-Ed columnists agreed to participate in a virtual Secret Santa this year. Some knew what their gifts would be immediately. Others stressed about it for days. Many procrastinated about their selections until the very end.

title: Gails Family Meatloaf Recipe
description: Merry Christmas, Frank Bruni! Heres my family meatloaf recipe, just in case you need a backup.

title: Vouchers, Charters and DeVoss Blind Spot
description: This article is part of the Opinion Today newsletter. You can sign up here to receive more briefings and a guide to the section daily in your inbox.

title: Obama to Dismantle Visitor Registry Before Trump Can Revive It
description: The Obama administration is dismantling a dormant national registry program for visitors from countries with active terrorist groups  a program that President-elect Donald J. Trump has suggested he is considering resurrecting.

title: Why the Ghost Ship Was Invisible in Oakland, Until 36 Died
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  The charred, roofless shell of the Ghost Ship, the warehouse where 36 people perished on a chilly Friday evening in early December, is clearly visible from the driveway of Oakland firehouse No. 13.

title: Automakers Prepare for an America Thats Over the Whole Car Thing
description: FOR decades, automakers have been able to count on a fundamental fact of American life: You pretty much need a car to get around.

title: Who Tossed On the First Tinsel? Two Baltic Capitals Disagree
description: RIGA, Latvia  In the Baltics, there may be no war on Christmas but theres a pretty prickly one over the tree.

title: A City Living Under the Talibans Shadow
description: How the northern Afghan city of Kunduz has retained a remarkable sense of calm despite the threat of Taliban assault.

title: Its Not Easy Being Santa
description: At Macys, the department store of Miracle on 34th Street fame, Santa, whoever he is, remains surrounded by corporate gatekeepers. The identity of the Santa who graces ABC Carpet & Home? His identity is off the record, too.

title: 1891: Woman Weds Her Sisters Husbands Son
description: WASHINGTON  A few years ago, when Mrs. W. C. Whitney was at the social helm, musicales were so numerous and fashionable that the two leading spirits in this revival of artistic taste were obliged to give their own at ten oclock in the morning. Generally they were engaged somewhere else at every other seasonable hour of the day or evening.

title: Ikea Reaches $50 Million Settlement Over Deadly Furniture Accidents
description: Ikea has reached a tentative settlement to pay $50 million to three American families whose young children were killed after the Swedish furniture companys furniture fell on them, lawyers for the families said on Wednesday.

title: Trump Pressures Obama Over U.N. Resolution on Israeli Settlements
description: JERUSALEM  President-elect Donald J. Trump thrust himself into one of the worlds most polarizing debates on Thursday by pressuring President Obama to veto a United Nations resolution critical of Israel, the newly elected leaders most direct intervention in foreign policy during his transition to power.

title: Six Showrunners on Their Favorite TV of 2016
description: We asked some of this years notable authors, actors and showrunners about the TV they enjoyed most in 2016. Their responses will run through next week. Come back to Watching, The New York Timess TV and movie recommendation site, to read them all.

title: Things We Learned in 2016
description: The Today I Learned subreddit a forum within the website Reddit  is a quirky destination that highlights random and sometimes surprising facts. In that spirit, reporters and editors from The New York Times compiled a list of some of the most interesting things they learned from Times stories this year.

title: 2007 | Birth of a Literary Landmark
description: Times Insider shares historical insights from The New York Times.

title: The Great Wall: What Critics and Filmgoers Are Saying in China
description: BEIJING  What if the Great Wall was built not to keep out northern invaders but to defend against mythical monsters?

title: Muhammad Ali: Drawn, Painted and Photographed
description: Muhammad Alis death in June was a reminder of what a brilliant muse he was, especially to photographers. He told us he was pretty, and he was right. But he was more than that. As images from his half-century of renown revealed anew, he had created an astonishing canvas simply by smiling, or by flicking a jab, preaching at a mosque, hitting the speed bag, glistening with sweat, rejecting entry into the military, goofing with the Beatles, screaming in mock-lunacy at Sonny Liston, taunting Joe Frazier and rope-a-doping with George Foreman. He rarely seemed to be offstage  or to take a bad picture.

title: How Does My Browser Recognize Malware?
description: Q. How does my web browser know that a site could be malicious?

description: Prepare to enter another world: the world of Madeira.

title: Daily Report: WhatsApp Is Embraced by Worlds Immigrants
description: The technology industry is full of immigrant success stories. There is Intels Andy Grove, the chief executive who helped guide the computer industry into its modern era. Google has Sergey Brin. Microsoft? Satya Nadella. Run through nearly any big tech company and youll find its executive ranks filled with people who were born outside the United States.

title: The Profound Modesty of Good Dolcetto
description: Few would dispute the contention that dolcetto is a modest wine. But the meaning of modest is open to interpretation.

title: After 72 Die, Putin Tightens Limits on Consumer Products High in Alcohol
description: MOSCOW  President Vladimir V. Putin has ordered his government to more tightly restrict the production and sale of consumer products containing significant amounts of alcohol, after the deaths of 72 people in the Siberian city of Irkutsk who drank a product that purported to be scented bath lotion but was actually a cheap surrogate for liquor.

title: Hark! The Drunken Angels Sing
description: Thank you for all the flowers and kind notes when I was in the psych ward last week. Yes, the rumors were true: I did indeed try to cut off my ear when I heard Fairytale of New York for the 27,056th time.

title: Justice, if You Can Afford It
description: To the Editor:

title: Newly Discovered Prehistoric Bird Lived Near a Balmy North Pole
description: The North Pole wasnt always a winter wonderland. Rewind 90 million years, and scientists think it was probably as warm as parts of Florida.

title: The Nutcracker for the Holidays
description: Family-friendly toasts for the School of American Ballet and the New Victory Theater Family Benefit.

title: Facebooks Problem Isnt Fake News  Its the Rest of the Internet
description: Last Thursday, after weeks of criticism over its role in the proliferation of falsehoods and propaganda during the presidential election, Facebook announced its plan to combat hoaxes and fake news. The company promised to test new tools that would allow users to report misinformation, and to enlist fact-checking organizations including Snopes and PolitiFact to help litigate the veracity of links reported as suspect. By analyzing patterns of reading and sharing, the company said, it might be able to penalize articles that are shared at especially low rates by those who read them  a signal of dissatisfaction. Finally, it said, it would try to put economic pressure on bad actors in three ways: by banning disputed stories from its advertising ecosystem; by making it harder to impersonate credible sites on the platform; and, crucially, by penalizing websites that are loaded with too many ads.

title: Painting Damnation: Celebrating 500 Years of Bosch
description: In case you missed it, were coming to the end of Bosch Year 2016, the quincentenary celebration of the death of the late-medieval Dutch master known for his surrealistic images of the hereafter, and particularly for the fantastical hybrid demons that populate his hell.

title: The Man Turning Tulsa Into Beta City, U.S.A.
description: Cassidy McDonald is the 2016 win-a-trip winner. In the fall,she traveled with Nicholas Kristof through Arkansas and Oklahoma to report on domestic poverty. Her last piecefocused on alternatives to incarceration for women.

title: The Nutcracker for the Holidays
description: The New York City Ballet and the School of American Ballet held the Nutcracker Family Benefit at Lincoln Center on Dec. 10. Guests mingled with the sugarplum fairy and other dancers after the classic holiday production of George Balanchines The Nutcracker. And the New Victory Theater Family Benefit, which helps introduce live theater to schoolchildren, was on Dec. 11. The historic Times Square theater was transformed into a bazaar inspired by its current show, Mother Africa: My Home.

title: Fantasy Football: Players to Start in Week 16
description: The Sablich brothers have provided award-winning fantasy football advice for The New York Times since 2010. See their weekly player rankings and visit 5thDownFantasy.com for more fantasy analysis. You can also ask them questions through their Twitter account, @5thdownfantasy.

title: Review: Hidden Figures Honors 3 Black Women Who Helped NASA Soar
description: Hidden Figures takes us back to 1961, when racial segregation and workplace sexism were widely accepted facts of life and the word computer referred to a person, not a machine. Though a gigantic IBM mainframe does appear in the movie  big enough to fill a room and probably less powerful than the phone in your pocket  the most important computers are three African-American women who work at NASA headquarters in Hampton, Va. Assigned to data entry jobs and denied recognition or promotion, they would go on to play crucial roles in the American space program.

title: Trump Transition Seeks Gender Information From State Dept.
description: President-elect Donald J. Trump's transition team sent an email to State Department employees requesting information on staffing and funding of gender-related positions and programs. The New York Times has redacted the information of personnel listed on the email.

title: Transition Teams Request on Gender Equality Rattles State Dept.
description: WASHINGTON  President-elect Donald J. Trumps transition team asked the State Department this week to submit details of programs and jobs aimed at promoting gender equality, rattling State Department employees concerned that the incoming administration will roll back a cornerstone project of former Secretary of State Hillary Clinton.

title: Life in China, Smothered by Smog
description: Parts of China have for days been experiencing smog so thick that highways and businesses have been shut down, and dozens of flights have been canceled. Amid dangerously unhealthy air quality levels, people in Beijing and elsewhere in the country tried to go about their daily routines.

title: Should I Stay Silent During One Childs Populist Taunt of Another?
description: My husband and I went to a Hanukkah party, where I witnessed the hosts son (about 12) tease a younger girl whose mother is Latina. Pack your bags, he said. Trump is going to send you back to Mexico. The girl told her mother, who confronted the hosts; the boy denied it. And it was left as a misunderstanding. I didnt report what I had heard. It felt like bad manners to elevate a childrens fight to the center of the party. My mother always said, Theres a time and place for everything. But my husband was horrified when I told him later. You?

title: Good, Bad and Mad: Andrew Rosenthal on the News
description: Times Insider delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how news, features and opinion come together at The New York Times. In this podcast, Andrew Rosenthal, a Times opinion columnist, talks about the news  the good, the bad and that which makes him mad.

title: Shaken but Undaunted, Berliners Return to Christmas Markets
description: BERLIN  The looming black semi with its shattered windshield was gone. The splintered boards and toppled Christmas tree had been cleared from the street and the square.

title: Spiced Potted Shrimp
description: The addition of anchovies, lemon zest, thyme and garlic brings a new twist to this buttery British classic.

title: Butter and Shrimp Make Holiday Magic
description: Before I ever tucked into a dish of potted shrimp, Id always imagined it to be the kind of thing a British vicar might be offered when he stopped to call on a pair of elderly sisters for tea. Wholesome and nourishing, but not at all sexy.

description: To the Editor:

title: Trump Rewards Kellyanne Conway With a Top White House Staff Slot
description: WEST PALM BEACH, Fla.  Kellyanne Conway, the Republican pollster and strategist who helped guide Donald J. Trump to victory in November, on Thursday was appointed counselor to the president, becoming the highest-ranking woman at the White House and one of his principal messengers to the public.

title: After the Crisis, This Wall Street Lawyer Turned Fanboy Toy Maker
description: The financial crisis of 2008 shook the nation and forced many on Wall Street to take stock of their careers. For Jordan Schwartz, a lawyer at the 224-year-old law firm Cadwalader, Wickersham & Taft, the turmoil led him to embrace his inner nerd.
