title: Turning Point in Syria as Assad Regains All of Aleppo
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  The evacuation of civilians and fighters from the last rebel-held part of Aleppo concluded on Thursday after long delays because of frigid weather, putting all of Syrias industrial capital back in the hands of President Bashar al-Assads forces for the first time since 2012.

title: Hedge Fund Math: Heads We Win, Tails You Lose
description: When do 1.5 and 16 add up to 72?

title: Aleppo, Berlin, Donald Trump: Your Morning Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: The Tunisian Man Sought in Berlin Attack
description: German authorities have named Anis Amri, a 23-year-old Tunisian, as the main suspect in an attack that left 12 dead and 48 injured. Officials say his fingerprints were found in a truck that plowed into a Christmas market Monday.

title: Pete Wentz and His D.I.Y.-Inspired Art Collection
description: LOS ANGELES  Pete Wentz, the bassist for Fall Out Boy and an avid collector of contemporary art, adorns the walls of his Spanish-style home here with works that betray his roots as a graffiti-obsessed punk aspirant growing up in suburban Chicago.

title: Anis Amri, Suspect in the Berlin Truck Attack: What We Know
description: BERLIN  Anis Amri, a Tunisian man who turned 24 on Thursday, is the chief suspect in a Europe-wide investigation into Germanys worst terrorist attack in decades. His fingerprints and identity document were found inside a tractor-trailer that plowed into a Christmas market in Berlin on Monday, killing 12 people and injuring about 50 more. Here is a timeline of events in Mr. Amris life, drawn from government statements, interviews with officials and relatives, and news media accounts.

title: Historys Lessons for America Today
description: To the Editor:

title: Hows the Economy? Just Look at How Much Celebrating The 12 Days of Christmas Will Cost
description: As far as the economy goes, the literal meaning of holiday songs is hardly a typical indicator of consumer sentiment.

title: Ubers Value to Riders Is Clear. To Investors, It May Prove More Elusive.
description: Will Uber Technologies ever make money? The ride-share giants recent exit from the cutthroat Chinese market should help, but it may still lose $2.8 billion in earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortization, or Ebitda, this year, according to figures reported by The Information on Monday. Economic theory suggests Uber is handing its passengers lots of value. Turning a profit for investors, though, is a different story.

title: The Red Shoes Takes the Stage
description: LONDON  Why do you want to dance? the lordly impresario Boris Lermontov asks the young, beautiful dancer Victoria Page. Why do you want to live? she pipes back courageously. These are perhaps the most famous lines in perhaps the most famous ballet film of all: Michael Powell and Emeric Pressburgers 1948 The Red Shoes, a tale about the burning need to dance, the obsessive drive to create art and a heroine who is ultimately driven mad by those demands.

title: Justice Breyer and the Death Penalty
description: To the Editor:

title: Review: Welcome to the Neighborhood Underworld in Trollhunters
description: Guillermo del Toros best work  in films like Pans Labyrinth and Hellboy 2: The Golden Army  combines rousing storytelling with a rarely equaled visual splendor. Trollhunters, the new series he created for Netflix (based on a book he wrote with Daniel Kraus), signifies two firsts that both seem suited to Mr. del Toros protean imagination: his first work in animation and his first project for children.

title: Rodrigo Duterte of Philippines Calls U.N. Human Rights Chief an Idiot
description: MANILA  President Rodrigo Duterte of the Philippines called the United Nations human rights chief an idiot on Thursday, days after the diplomat suggested that Mr. Duterte be investigated for murder.

title: Driven | Infiniti QX30
description: The QX30 was born of a partnership with Daimler, although Infiniti made the platform theirs by changing the suspension, steering and transmission calibration.

title: 2017 Infiniti QX30 AWD
description: AUTOMAKERS are in the business of manufacturing cars. But as with any company, its really all about making money. And because every new model is a gamble, car companies need every advantage possible.

title: Romeo and Juliet, Flushed and Feverish at the Met Opera
description: At a recent rehearsal at the Metropolitan Opera, a clich unfolded in the middle of a passionate duet. As a soprano nestled in a tenors arms, the rooms temperature seemed to rise a couple of degrees.

title: A New Gilded Age, for Artists Who Would Rule Forever
description: Read Roberta Smiths review of this exhibition.

title: Review: If Our Bodies Could Talk, Our Spleens Probably Wouldnt Be Funny
description: Aint you glad, Little Milton sang, that things dont talk? Especially our bodies. In the 1960s and 70s Readers Digest printed a series of first-person essays with titles like I Am Joes Lung. These were popular, and weird.

title: The Lives They Loved
description: As part of the magazines annual The Lives They Lived issue, we invited readers to contribute a photograph and a story of someone close to them who died this year.

title: Irish Artists Help Open Homeless Shelter
description: Well-known Irish artists are among a group of "concerned citizens" who seized a disused office block and opened a homeless shelter. The High Court ruled that  in spite of the trespassing  the shelter can remain open over the holiday period.

title: Three Classic Musical Scenes Evoked by La La Land
description: Its no secret that La La Land, the new movie from director Damien Chazelle (Whiplash) is a tribute to the flashy musicals of yesteryear. But the film is set in the present, following Mia, a would-be actress (Emma Stone) and Seb, an ambitious jazz musician (Ryan Gosling), both of whom are struggling to achieve their dreams in Los Angeles.

title: Trump Says the U.S. Should Expand Its Nuclear Capacity
description: WEST PALM BEACH, Fla.  President-elect Donald J. Trump said on Thursday that the United States should greatly expand its nuclear capability, appearing to suggest an end to decades of efforts by presidents of both parties to reduce the role of nuclear weapons in American defenses and strategy.

title: Holiday Movies to See (or Skip)
description: Make your movie list, check it twice and master your multiplex. Below, weve sifted through the many movie options this season to give you a few ideas on what to go see (and what to avoid) over the holidays.

title: Da Silvano, a Celebrity Favorite in Greenwich Village, Closes After 41 Years
description: Done in by high rent, Silvano Marchetto closed his long-running restaurant, Da Silvano in Greenwich Village, on Tuesday night. It was a decision, he said, he had made just two days before.

title: Happy Holidays: Things to Read, Watch, Write About, Create and Debate Over Winter Break
description: Merry Christmas, happy Hanukkah, joyous Kwanzaa and happy New Year.

title: Syrian Government Declares It Has Retaken Aleppo
description: The evacuation of civilians and fighters from the last rebel-held part of Aleppo ended on Thursday after a week of stops and starts. Freezing weather caused long delays, but President Bashar al-Assads forces announced complete control of the city for the first time since 2012.

title: Gouthire at the Frick: Gilding the Lily (and Everything Else)
description: Read a feature article about the master gilder Pierre Gouthire.

title: For Yasiin Bey, Once Known as Mos Def, a Comeback With the Finish Line in Mind
description: Yasiin Bey walked onto the Apollo Theater stage on Wednesday night and spread out white and red rose petals from a bag. I wont front like Im not nervous, he said. Im too old for fronting. It does not go with my wardrobe.

title: Trump Seeks Path for Mexico Barrier. But Will It Be a Big, Beautiful Wall?
description: President-elect Donald J. Trumps transition team has asked federal border protection officials for guidance on where a new wall separating the United States from Mexico  a signature promise of Mr. Trumps campaign  can be erected, according to a Democratic congressman from Texas who opposes the idea.

title: Berlin, United Nations, Trump: Your Thursday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: This Weeks Movies: Dec. 23, 2016
description: The New York Times film critics review Hidden Figures, Silence and Live by Night.

title: Review: In Toni Erdmann, Dads a Prankster Trying to Jolt His Conformist Daughter
description: Early in Toni Erdmann  by a wide margin the funniest almost-three-hour German comedy you will ever see  there is a brief discussion, conducted in a sterile modern office building in Bucharest, about the meaning of the English word performance. For Anca (Ingrid Bisu), a young Romanian employed by a global consulting firm, it refers to the way she does her job and, more than that, her ability to obey the norms and protocols of the corporate workplace. Her boss, she explains, gives her a lot of feedback, which is clearly a euphemism.

title: Review: Questions and Prayers Go Unanswered in Scorseses Silence
description: Martin Scorseses Silence is a story of faith and anguish. It tells of a Portuguese Jesuit priest, Father Rodrigues, who in 1643 heads into the dark heart of Japan, where Christians are being persecuted  boiled alive, immolated and crucified. Rodrigues (Andrew Garfield) sets out to help keep the church alive in Japan, a mission that perhaps inevitably leads to God. The films solemnity is seductive  as is Mr. Scorseses art  especially in light of the triviality and primitiveness of many movies, even if its moments of greatness also make its failures seem more pronounced.

title: Review: I, Daniel Blake, Stuck on the Bureaucratic Hamster Wheel
description: Anyone who has spent 48 minutes on the phone waiting for a customer service representative can identify with the mounting impatience of the title character in Ken Loachs scalding cinematic outcry, I, Daniel Blake.

title: Review: He Pledges Allegiance Only to His Tommy Gun, in Live by Night
description: In Live by Night, Ben Affleck plays one of those romanticized antiheroes that movie stars love to suit up for, sometimes with a fedora. Over the decades these types have changed their looks and histories, but theres a sameness to how they escape the law and the routine hum of everyday life; how they use guns ruthlessly or reluctantly; skip out on church yet live by their own moral code; and inevitably rise to become masters of their worlds, as well as of the most beautiful women in the room. Theyre fantasies of power partly because no matter how hard this type falls, his power never truly corrupts.

title: What to See in New York Art Galleries This Week
description: Through Jan. 15. JTT, 191 Chrystie Street, Manhattan; near Rivington Street, Manhattan; 212-574-8152, jttnyc.com.

title: Trumps Nuclear Weapons Tweet, Translated and Explained
description: Mr. Trump, in a Twitter post on Thursday, appeared to announce his new nuclear strategy. Here is what he might have meant.

title: Review: A Fathers Dreams, Recast by His Daughters in Dangal
description: Let it never be said that if youve seen one inspirational sports movie, youve seen them all.

title: Senator Looks to Expand Protections for Whistle-Blowers
description: WASHINGTON  Senator Claire McCaskill, responding to what she has called troubling weaknesses in protections for whistle-blowers, has asked federal agencies to provide information on senior managers who may have retaliated against employees who reported wrongdoing.

title: Anatomy of a Scene | Patriots Day
description: Peter Berg narrates a scene from the film featuring Mark Wahlberg.

title: Behind Brooklyn Walls: A World of Sound
description: Some crazy things have been happening behind the walled courtyard on the corner of Dean and Smith Streets in Boerum Hill, Brooklyn: The sounds of a Liberian tuk-tuk pass by, a childrens swing creaks, Lizzie Borden insists she didnt kill her parents, and Meryl Streep has been coming and going for nine days.

title: Carolina Herrera and Oscar de la Renta Clash Over Young Talent
description: The fashion designers Carolina Herrera and Oscar de la Renta were longtime friends, socializing with their respective spouses in New York and in Mr. de la Rentas native Dominican Republic in the years before he died in 2014.

title: Peter Berg Narrates a Scene From Patriots Day
description: The thriller Patriots Day dramatizes the 2013 Boston Marathon bombing. This scene takes place later when the F.B.I. used the Black Falcon warehouse to recreate the crime scene. In an interview in New York, Mr. Berg explained how the F.B.I. helped him in constructing his set similar to the way they did on for the bombing.

title: How Poppy King, Founder of Lipstick Queen, Spends Her Sundays
description: As the founder of the cosmetics brand Lipstick Queen, Poppy King, 44, is always looking for inspiration, even on the weekends. Theres not an experience that I have where Im not potentially looking to spark a lipstick concept, she said. I never turn off that lens: I can be in the subway or walking down the street and am still thinking of lipstick ideas. The entrepreneur, born in Melbourne, Australia, has lived in a one-bedroom apartment on a leafy NoLIta street for the past 14 years.

title: What Happens to Food Seized at the Airport?
description: Q. Im a frequent traveler, and Ive noticed that airport security agents seem to confiscate a lot of food, liquor and other items at checkpoints. What do the airports do with these items?

title: The Best Poetry of 2016
description: When you think of American poetry over the past year, the question that comes to mind is: Will Donald Trump limit himself to a single inaugural poet? And if so, will that poet be Ted Nugent? And if so, will he do a reading of Cat Scratch Fever? And if so, will this cause the seas to rise, the skies to darken, the mountains to tremble and the events of Ragnarok to unfold, with the great wolf Fenris devouring Odin the All-Father and even mighty Thor brought low, after slaying the world-encircling Midgard serpent? And if so, will Trump declare this to have been Sad!?

title: At Rudys Bakery and Cafe, Venturing Beyond the Strudel
description: Even as Ridgewood, Queens, undergoes rapid transformations as one of New Yorks neighborhoods du jour, Rudys Bakery and Cafe, on Seneca Avenue, remains loyal to its old-school identity. The soda-shop signage and unflashy storefront seem to be working just fine for this 82-year-old business.

title: New Ebola Vaccine Gives 100 Percent Protection
description: In a scientific triumph that will change the way the world fights a terrifying killer, an experimental Ebola vaccine tested on humans in the waning days of the West African epidemic has been shown to provide 100 percent protection against the lethal disease.

title: London Plane: A Tree With Gritty Roots
description: The London plane tree is able to withstand the many assaults of urban life. It is often found squeezed tightly into tree pits surrounded by impermeable asphalt and concrete, making rain absorption difficult. Despite their potential size when fully grown, the trees adapt remarkably to cramped quarters, even while overshadowed by buildings and other structures. Often, they are pruned to within an inch of their lives to fit under phone lines or to avoid streetlights. They survive not only runoff from salted roads but also a consistent barrage of raw fertilizer by neighborhood cats and dogs.

title: Ivan Nova Is Said to Agree to 3-Year Deal to Stay With Pirates
description: In the flurry of moves the Yankees made this summer, the last one, which came minutes before the Aug. 1 deadline, seemed the most inconsequential: The team sent Ivan Nova to the Pittsburgh Pirates for two minor leaguers to be named later.

title: Gentrification and Junk Food: Chopped-Cheese Edition
description: Were we to review the year in terms of gastronomic controversies, we might begin and end with the debate over chopped cheese. If your life in New York is purposely dull and cloistered, confined to the Caviar meal-delivery service, Showtime and the obsessive monitoring of Brooklyn real estate listings, then the furor over the sandwich  alternately known as chopped or chop cheese  may have escaped your notice entirely. If that is the case, you are, in effect, part of the problem, as disconnected as the reporter who ventured uptown and discovered the sandwich, a longtime offering at bodegas in the Bronx and Harlem, with the surprise of someone coming upon a new moon near Uranus.

title: Whats New in NYC Theater
description: Our guide to plays and musicals coming to New York stages  and a few last-chance picks of shows that are about to close. Our reviews of open shows are at nytimes.com/reviews/theater.

title: House Report, Evidence Redacted, Ties Snowden to Russian Agencies
description: WASHINGTON  The House Intelligence Committee on Thursday released a 33-page report portraying the former intelligence contractor Edward J. Snowden, who in 2013 disclosed classified files about American surveillance operations, as a habitually disgruntled worker who damaged national security and has been in contact with Russian intelligence services in Moscow.

title: Italian Court Sentences Americans Killer to 30-Year Term
description: ROME  A court in Florence on Thursday convicted a Senegalese migrant of murdering an American woman who was strangled and beaten in her Florence apartment early this year.

title: After Decades Out of View, Navy Deserter Hopes to Rally a New Antiwar Generation
description: LAS VEGAS  Nearly a half-century ago, Craig W. Anderson took a highly visible stand against what he considered an unjust war.

title: Anthony Stolarz, First N.H.L. Goalie From New Jersey, Excels With Flyers
description: VOORHEES, N.J.  Before Anthony Stolarz became the first New Jersey-born goaltender to play in an N.H.L. game, he had to stand through two national anthems because his Philadelphia Flyers were hosting the Calgary Flames.

title: In Israel, Arrest of Arab Lawmaker Stokes Debate on Loyalty
description: JERUSALEM  An Arab member of Israels Parliament was arrested on Thursday after being accused of smuggling cellphones to Palestinian prisoners, capping days of fractious debate that raised questions about the nature of loyalty and identity in a predominantly Jewish state.

title: Cuomos Proposal for an Executive-Branch Prosecutor Is Called a Scheme
description: ALBANY  As negotiations continue over the possibility of a special legislative session, concern has spread here over the prospect of last-minute gifts that Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo and state lawmakers might exchange.

title: Surfing and Sondheim: Whats on Josh Radnors Mind
description: Talking with the actor Josh Radnor, now starring Off Broadway in The Babylon Line, is a discursive experience, his conversation peppered with enthusiastic references to books, films and music. Here, in alphabetical order, are some he raved about recently.

description: This weeks efforts to repeal a cruel and discriminatory North Carolina law were procedurally confusing and politically confounding.

title: When Art Conservation Means Repairing TVs, Not Canvases
description: After triggering a pop of electricity by touching a screwdriver to metal in a disassembled cathode ray tube monitor, Chi-Tien Lui issued a warning to visitors gathered in his cluttered workshop on a recent Friday morning. That voltage doesnt kill you, he said. But it really hurts you.

description: Our guide to film series and special screenings. All our movie reviews are at nytimes.com/reviews/movies.

description: A few days before Christmas two years ago two tractor-trailers wended through the snow from the Hamptons on Long Island to the tiny mountain town of Tannersville, N.Y., squealing to a stop on Main Street.

title: Ex-Prisoners Get an Advocate From Their Own Ranks
description: Richard Lipsky was a prominent lobbyist in New York, representing bodega owners, grocers and other small businesses, until he was felled five years ago in a public corruption scandal that also brought down Carl Kruger, a powerful Brooklyn state senator, and others.

description: David Berry, a playwright and screenwriter best known for the play and film The Whales of August, died on Dec. 16 at his home in Brooklyn. He was 73.

description: Our guide to pop and rock shows and the best of live jazz.

title: Airbus Will Sell 100 Planes to Iran After Similar Boeing Deal
description: The European aircraft manufacturer Airbus completed a deal on Thursday to sell 100 jetliners to Iran, a move described by both sides as a major step toward revitalizing Irans aged commercial fleet after years of sanctions and economic isolation.

title: Apple and Nokia Battle Over Cellphone Patents
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Apples iPhone is a technological marvel. You can watch streaming video on it, download apps, take photos with its camera and give voice commands to Siri, its digital assistant. You can even make old-fashioned voice calls on it.

title: Capturing the American Fantasy of Dyker Lights
description: Franck Bohbot is a photographer from Paris who has shot grand spaces  sumptuous theaters, the Louvre  and when he moved to New York a few years ago he brought the same gravitas to a local architectural attraction: the houses of Dyker Heights, Brooklyn, which every December become what is known as the Dyker Lights.

title: Plot? Put That Aside in the Films of Marcel Hanoun
description: Now let us shed light on the undeservedly obscure. Originally associated with the French New Wave, later relegated to the fringe of the cinematic avant-garde, Marcel Hanoun (1929-2012) is the subject of a new box set, The Seasons, available from the French distributor Re:Voir.

title: Viselike Defense Adds Teeth to Golden State Warriors Buzz-Saw Offense
description: The Nets feasted on open jumpers and transition layups, turning one of the N.B.A.s most unsung defensive units into a flimsy strip of cellophane. It was a remarkable first half of basketball at Barclays Center on Thursday night.

title: Classical Music in NYC This Week
description: Our guide to the citys best classical music and opera.

title: The Long, Long Road to Building Fences
description: In 1991, The New York Times reported on the tortuous path of August Wilsons Pulitzer Prize-winning play Fences to the screen. The headline was Did Hollywood Sit on Fences? I wrote that article, concluding that after four years of false starts the project was at last getting closer to production.

title: Coming to Newark Archdiocese: A Different Kind of Cardinal
description: INDIANAPOLIS  For about a year, the guys at the gym just called him Joe. He lifted weights in the early mornings wearing a skull-printed do-rag. He worked out on the elliptical, wiping it down when he was done.

title: Dance in NYC This Week
description: Our guide to dance performances.

description: LONDON  United States authorities have accused the British bank Barclays and two former executives of fraudulently misleading the public in the sale of tens of billions of dollars in securities backed by home mortgages.

description: Our guide to new art shows  and some that will be closing soon.

title: Sidney Drell, Who Advised Presidents on Nuclear Weapons, Dies at 90
description: Sidney D. Drell, a physicist who served for nearly half a century as a top adviser to the United States government on military technology and arms control, died on Wednesday at his home in Palo Alto, Calif. He was 90.

title: Events for Children in NYC This Week
description: Our guide to cultural events in New York City for families with children and teenagers.

title: Ordered Deported, Berlin Suspect Slipped Through Germanys Fingers
description: BERLIN  He left Tunisia, his family said, with dreams of making money and buying a car. After arriving in Italy, he was a violent inmate who spent time in six jails. In Germany, he was one of some 550 people identified as dangers to the state and placed under special surveillance.

title: 1MDB Case Hangs Over Goldman Sachs as Investigators Dig for Answers
description: Even as Goldman Sachs is gaining a more prominent profile in the administration of Donald J. Trump, the Wall Street investment firm is undergoing scrutiny in an investigation in a sprawling international money laundering and embezzlement scheme.

title: Jens Risom, Modernist Designer Whose Furniture Still Has Legs, Dies at 100
description: Jens Risom, the Danish furniture maestro who helped bring midcentury modern design to the United States through his work with Knoll Studio, died on Dec. 9 at his home in New Canaan, Conn. He was 100.

title: Trump Pits Boeing Against Lockheed to Cut Costs of New Fighter Jets
description: President-elect Donald J. Trumps latest missive on military spending suggests that Boeing has perhaps swayed him more than its rival Lockheed Martin. Now, he is preparing to pit one off the other to try to decrease the cost of new fighter jets, military analysts said on Thursday.

title: For Knicks Carmelo Anthony, a Bad Day Continues Into Night
description: It is not that fun to be Carmelo Anthony these days. It should be, of course. He is in the midst of a possibly rare season: one that ends in a playoff appearance for the Knicks. He has emerged as a spokesman not just for the team, but for the N.B.A. And he finally has help: With Kristaps Porzingis and Derrick Rose, Anthony is no longer the lone star in the Knicks universe.

title: Florida Ruling Upends More Than 100 Death Sentences
description: Well over 100 death sentences in Florida are invalid and must go back to trial courts for resentencing, the State Supreme Court ruled on Thursday, potentially placing a major burden on prosecutors, defense lawyers and the courts.

title: Franca Sozzani Dies at 66; Gave Italian Vogue a Daring Look and Voice
description: Franca Sozzani, under whose 28-year direction Italian Vogue reigned as a daring and often impious iconoclast on the newsstand, died on Thursday in Milan. She was 66.

title: Rockettes Will Perform at Donald Trumps Inauguration
description: The Radio City Rockettes will perform at the inaugural celebration of Donald J. Trump next month, a spokesman for the presidential inaugural committee said Thursday.

title: Michle Morgan, the First Best Actress at Cannes, Dies at 96
description: Michle Morgan, an elegant actress who escaped occupied France for Hollywood and went home to win the best actress award at the first Cannes Film Festival, in 1946, died on Tuesday in Meudon, France, just outside Paris. She was 96.

title: Lets See What Youve Got
description: FRIDAY PUZZLE  Ive said this before and Ill say it again, for the benefit of newer readers: If you are hesitant to push past your day-of-the-week comfort level because you think you cant solve the late-week puzzles, do it anyway.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: Its a 14th-century solution to a 21st-century problem.

title: Australia Says It Foiled a Terrorist Plot
description: SYDNEY  A terrorist plot to attack the Australian city of Melbourne with explosives, knives and guns  possibly on Christmas Day  is believed to have been headed off with the arrest of five people, Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull said on Friday.

title: Deutsche Bank to Settle Mortgage Inquiry for $7.2 Billion
description: Deutsche Bank announced late on Thursday that it had reached a tentative $7.2 billion deal to resolve a federal investigation into its sale of toxic mortgage securities, capping months of negotiations that weighed heavily on the banks stock price and reputation.

title: After Spending One Half as Warriors Equal, Nets Return to Reality
description: Barclays Center rocked hard on Thursday night, compared with the more complacent norm. There were even several minutes of astonishment in store for a capacity crowd of mixed allegiance.

title: Corrections: December 23, 2016
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Berlin, Uber, Donald Trump: Your Friday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: A Bronx Garden For All Seasons
description: Battling health issues, the Young family found solace in restoring a run-down community garden. Step inside as the family, a recipient of The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund, creates a winter wonderland.

title: Giants, on the Verge of a Playoff Berth, Fall to the Eagles
description: PHILADELPHIA  To a man late Thursday night, the Giants understood the opportunity squandered. In a season of unforeseen accomplishments, the Giants arrived in Philadelphia as one of the hottest teams in the N.F.L. Their opponents Thursday night entered the game having lost five consecutive times.

title: A Garden Helps Heal a Family
description: On the morning of her scheduled brain surgery, Sheila Young woke up and glanced over at her husband, always the early riser, and was surprised he was still in bed. She nudged him.

title: Tales From Asia: A Holiday Reading List
description: Here are some of our favorite tales from Asia in 2016 by some of our finest writers. Enjoy.

title: Whats on TV Friday: Shakespeare Live! From the Royal Shakespeare Company and Sense8: A Christmas Special
description: The Royal Shakespeare Company toasts the 400th anniversary of the playwrights death, and Benedict Cumberbatch, Judi Dench and Prince Charles show up. 20/20 remembers the great ones who died in 2016. And Sense8 celebrates Christmas with sex, drugs and rave music.

title: Stalins Lengthening Shadow
description: PARIS  In 1987, at the height of Mikhail S. Gorbachevs glasnost, I sat down in a Moscow theater with a few hundred others to watch a just-released somber film. Shot three years earlier by the Georgian director Tengiz Abuladze but immediately shelved, the film, Repentance, was a powerful allegorical critique of Stalinism in which a corpse refuses to stay buried. In the audience there was not a single dry eye. Finally the monstrosity of Joseph Stalins terror could be openly discussed. Sitting in the dark, I realized how painful those secrets, kept so long by millions of Soviet families, had been.

title: Christmas Where Its Hot
description: SYDNEY, Australia  Our Christmas smells like pine needles and chlorine. My children help decorate the traditional tree at their grandparents house, then run outside to leap into the swimming pool. They sun themselves in the humid air of an Australian summer.

title: Christmas Morning at Trump Tower
description: Do you hear what I hear?

title: Toy Trends
Word + Quiz: grill
description: The word grill has appeared in 533 New York Times articles in the past year, including on Nov. 2 in The Secret Lives of Hotel Doormen by Noam Scheiber:

title: Tatts of Australia Rejects Bid from K.K.R.-Linked Group
description: HONG KONG  An Australian gambling company has rejected a bid worth as much as $5.5 billion from a consortium that includes major Wall Street money, saying the figures underpinning it are at turns too low and too high.

title: Credit Suisse to Pay $5.3 Billion to Resolve Mortgage Inquiry
description: LONDON  Credit Suisse said on Friday that it had agreed to pay $5.3 billion to settle an investigation by the United States authorities into the packaging and sale of mortgages ahead of the global financial crisis eight years ago.

title: Was Barack Obama Bad for Democrats?
description: President Obama will be remembered as a thoughtful and dignified president who led a scrupulously honest administration that achieved major changes.

title: Red State Hope for Democratic Blues
description: For the longest nights of the year, there is no better place to be than on snow-crusted ground, staring up at Montanas big empty sky. Democrats across rural America must know the feeling, this Christmas week, of looking into a black void and feeling so very alone.

title: Populism, Real and Phony
description: Authoritarians with an animus against ethnic minorities are on the march across the Western world. They control governments in Hungary and Poland, and will soon take power in America. And theyre organizing across borders: Austrias Freedom Party, founded by former Nazis, has signed an agreement with Russias ruling party  and met with Donald Trumps choice for national security adviser.

title: Clinging to Power in Congo
description: Under the Democratic Republic of Congos Constitution, President Joseph Kabilas second and final term of office ended at midnight on Monday. But, Mr. Kabila did not step down, plunging Congo into chaos.

title: An Alliance to Worry the West
description: ISTANBUL  When a Turkish police officer assassinated Andrey G. Karlov, Russias ambassador to Turkey, on Monday, it felt for a moment as if the whole world shook. The killing took place at a time of global uncertainty and reminded some observers of the start of World War I.

title: Why Its Not Wrong to Wish Muslims Merry Christmas
description: ISTANBUL  Billions of Christians around the world are excited to celebrate Christmas this weekend. Those in the worlds second-largest religious community, Muslims, dont share quite the same excitement. In a few Muslim-majority countries, like Saudi Arabia, Brunei and Somalia, Christmas celebrations are banned. In Turkey, my country, they are not illegal, but some Islamist groups still organize annual protests against Christmas trees and Santa Claus costumes, which they consider Western impositions.

title: Stoking Tensions With China
description: For the foreseeable future, no relationship is more vital to international stability than that between the United States and China. Yet Donald Trump and the Chinese authorities have foolishly introduced dangerous new uncertainties into the equation.

title: Am I a Christian, Pastor Timothy Keller?
description: What does it mean to be a Christian in the 21st century? Can one be a Christian and yet doubt the virgin birth or the Resurrection? I put these questions to the Rev. Timothy Keller, an evangelical Christian pastor and best-selling author who is among the most prominent evangelical thinkers today. Our conversation has been edited for space and clarity.

So when the team not only is undefeated and ranked No. 2 in the country, but also has begun to resemble the Golden State Warriors on training wheels  averaging nearly 100 points per game, leading the nation in assists and showcasing a pair of precocious freshman stars  whats not to like?

title: The Christmas Pickle: A Tradition Taken With a Pinch of Salt

title: When the Sun Sets Early, Its a Race to Prepare for Shabbat

title: Vladimir Putin, Unsurprised by Trumps Remarks, Says Russia Wants No Nuclear Arms Race
description: MOSCOW  President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia said on Friday that a statement by Donald J. Trump, the American president-elect, that the United States should expand its nuclear abilities was not a surprise because he had said the same thing during the election campaign.

title: Viggo Mortensen Talks (and Talks) About Captain Fantastic
description: The Bagger was pretty amped to chat with Viggo Mortensen  even if it was by phone from Madrid, where he lives  because hes just that cool.

title: Fostering Civility in a Time of Disrespect
description: Just in time for the season of giving, Christine Porath, a Georgetown University management professor, brings us Mastering Civility: A Manifesto for the Workplace (Grand Central), a slender, but compelling, guide to treating others respectfully and protecting oneself from those who dont.

title: How the Obama Coalition Crumbled, Leaving an Opening for Trump
description: It is entirely possible, as many have argued, that Hillary Clinton would be the president-elect of the United States if the F.B.I. director, James Comey, had not sent a letter to Congress about her emails in the last weeks of the campaign.

title: Katherine Power of Clique Media: Think Like an Entrepreneur
description: This interview with Katherine Power, chief executive of Clique Media Group, a media and marketing agency, has been edited for space and clarity.

title: Hijacking Ends Peacefully After Libyan Airliner Lands in Malta
description: CAIRO  When two Libyans hijacked a passenger jetliner on Friday and forced it to land in Malta, they claimed to be acting in the name of the countrys former ruler, Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi.

title: Caroline Kennedy Dances in a Christmas Video, and Japan Cant Get Enough
description: HONG KONG  The Japanese public pays careful attention to the words and deeds of Caroline Kennedy, the United States ambassador to Japan and one of the State Departments best-known diplomats.

title: In Indonesia, an Islamic Edict Seeks to Keep Santa Hats Off Muslims
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia  Apit Abdullah does not believe in Santa Claus.

title: No Trial for Beijing Officers Over Death of Environmentalist
description: BEIJING  Five law enforcement officers in Beijing will not stand trial over the death of a Chinese environmentalist, even though prosecutors found that they broke the law by misusing force, delaying medical care and lying about the circumstances of his death, officials said on Friday.

title: California Today: Stunning Views on the Train to Tahoe
description: Good morning.

title: 1916: Peace May Be Near, President Wilson Suggests
description: President Wilson has astonished the world by sending a note to all the belligerents suggesting in substance that the time has come for paving the way to peace. He considers that an early occasion should be sought for an avowal of their respective views as to the terms on which hostilities might be concluded and the arrangements which would be deemed satisfactory as a guarantee against their renewal.

title: Inside a Report on Slavery and Its Legacy
description: Times Insider delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how news, features and opinion come together at The New York Times. In this article, Rachel Swarns provides a behind-the-scenes look at the reporting she did on a story about life insurance policies that allowed slave owners to recoup their slaves value in the event of the slaves untimely death.

title: Christmas Holiday Hours for Some Major Stores
description: Christmas is upon us! But perhaps you have run out of wrapping paper. Or you have to do some last minute shopping. Or you really need a cup of coffee that wasnt made by someone you are related to. What do you do? Where can you go? Which stores are even open?

title: Alec Baldwin, in His Own Words, on Playing Trump
description: How exactly did Alec Baldwin construct his mischievously exaggerated, hyper-gesticulating, searingly funny portrayal of Donald J. Trump on Saturday Night Live?

title: A Bruised Investor Seeks Justice for Chinas Market Turmoil
description: SHANGHAI

title: Co-Working Spaces Add a Perk for Parents: Child Care
description: Toddlers make terrible office mates, particularly if your office is in the living room of a railroad-style apartment. They are also not reliable companions at the neighborhood coffee shop, as Jacqui Smith, a publicist, discovered when her son had a meltdown while she tried to get some work done at Variety, a popular Brooklyn coffee roaster.

title: The Weekly Health Quiz: Winter, the Brain and Drinking on Antidepressants
description: Test your knowledge of this weeks health news.

title: Stephen Root Is Just the Man for a Cubicle or a Castle
description: Youve seen Stephen Root far more than you might think. Hes the shape-shifting character actor you know you recognize, but cant place. Of course, theres his unforgettable creation from the cult classic Office Space: Milton, the stapler-obsessed arsonist hidden under extremely thick glasses, stilted speech and a pocket protector. But Mr. Root has mined a number of idiosyncratic veins over the past several decades, with memorable parts in films like No Country for Old Men, TV shows as disparate as NewsRadio, Louie and Boardwalk Empire, and voice work in animated ones like King of the Hill and Adventure Time.

title: Josh Radnor Is Existentially Restless. And Thats O.K.
description: Posing for a photographer in the lobby of the Rubin Museum of Art one December afternoon, the actor Josh Radnor was plainly ill at ease. He may have spent nine seasons starring in the hit CBS sitcom How I Met Your Mother, but Mr. Radnor  in town from Los Angeles to play the lead in Richard Greenbergs new comedy The Babylon Line at Lincoln Center Theater  has yet to learn to be comfortable having his picture taken.

title: A House That Inspired a British Novelist
description: Bury St. Edmunds, England  Making a statement right at the heart of the English cathedral town of Bury St. Edmunds, Northgate House has more than one story to tell.

title: When Water Balloons Hit a Bed of Nails and Dont Pop
description: Is it possible to bounce a water balloon off a bed of nails? Surprisingly, yes.

title: A Doomed Battle for Hong Kong, With Only Medals Left 75 Years Later
description: BARRIE, Ontario  John Lawson has only a few tokens to remember his father by: military medals, a couple of dog tags and a silver ID bracelet that encircled his fathers wrist as bullets did their work in Hong Kong one terrible winter day 75 years ago this week.

title: United Way Searches for Its Place in a World of One-Click Giving
description: Ever since 1991, when The Chronicle of Philanthropy started publishing its annual list of the United States nonprofits that raise the most money from private sources, United Way has topped the list every year except for two.

title: Trump Says U.S. Would Outmatch Rivals in a New Nuclear Arms Race
description: WEST PALM BEACH, Fla.  President-elect Donald J. Trump on Friday intensified his threat to expand Americas nuclear arsenal, saying he was willing to restart a nuclear arms race even as he released a letter from President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia that pointed toward the possibility of a pragmatic set of understandings between Washington and Moscow.

title: Ohio States Kelsey Mitchell Got an Early Start on a Dash to Stardom
description: HARTFORD  Womens college basketball uses a 30-second shot clock. More often than not, by the time an Ohio State possession ticks down to 29, the junior guard Kelsey Mitchell, a 5-foot-8 flash of distilled hoop skills, will have crossed midcourt.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Simply the Best, or Not

title: Paperback Row
description: Seven new paperbacks to check out this week.

title: Dynasty: Three New Books About Englands Tudors
description: THE PRIVATE LIVES OF THE TUDORSUncovering the Secrets of Britains Greatest DynastyBy Tracy Borman448 pp. Grove, $27.

title: In Trying Times, the Balm of Jane Austen
description: There are grim passages in our lives when each day begins and ends with dread, when endurance is a form of victory. In one such time, when the life of someone I loved was hanging in the balance, I turned to reading for solace. The diagnosis was grave, the treatment arduous and life-threatening in itself. My days and nights were kaleidoscopes of terror: weekslong hospitalizations, middle-of-the-night sprints to emergency rooms, daylong drug infusions at clinics, beeping monitors, doctors verdicts.

title: Lessons on How to Live, in 26 Books
description: BOOKS FOR LIVINGBy Will Schwalbe272 pp. Alfred A. Knopf. $25.95.

title: Ariel Dorfman on an American Martyr: El Salvador, 1980
description: A RADICAL FAITHThe Assassination of Sister MauraBy Eileen MarkeyIllustrated. 320 pp. Nation Books. $26.99.

title: Daily Report: Apple Hurls the Patent Troll Insult at Nokia
description: Among the many terrible things you can call someone in the tech industry, one of the most damning is patent troll.

title: The Year in Illustration
description: A selection of notable art created for the Opinion section in 2016.

title: Brothers Holding Up Each Other, in the Wake of a Crushing Loss
description: The brothers enjoy their endless little debates. They could be over something of importance, but then again, maybe not. Just the other week, they got at it over how many Batman movies there had been. Why, obviously there had been four, according to Andre Steinberg. What is wrong with you, there were seven, Jamal Perry insisted.

title: The Art of the Selective Dropbox Sync
description: Q. I keep a ton of stuff in my Dropbox account, which is fine for my desktop computer with its spacious hard disk. I installed the Dropbox app on my ultrabook (instead of just logging in on the web), but its nearly filling up my laptops available drive space. Is there a way to link to just some of the files  and not everything in the Dropbox folder?

title: Vina Pulido and Anthony Nguyen: Putting Aside a Harvard-Yale Rivalry
description: Dr. Vina Zhu Pulido and Dr. Anthony Tuan Nguyen were married Dec. 23 at the Richard Nixon Library in Yorba Linda, Calif. The Rev. Jon Olson, a minister of the Conservative Baptist Association, officiated at a nondenominational ceremony.

title: What to Cook This Weekend
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: The Story Behind This Weeks Best Sellers
description: Criminy: Turbo Twenty-Three, the latest entry in Janet Evanovichs long-running series about the New Jersey bounty hunter Stephanie Plum, is No.9 in its fifth week on the hardcover fiction list. Evanovich keeps herself busy, James Patterson style: Besides the salty Plum novels, which she writes on her own, she also hit the hardcover list in 2016 with two thrillers she co-wrote  The Pursuit, written with Lee Goldberg as part of the Fox and OHare series, and Curious Minds, written with Phoef Sutton as the debut of the Knight and Moon series. All three share Evanovichs boisterous humor, but one thing separating the protagonists is their vocabulary, as the website MyCentralJersey.com observed in an interview last summer: Your newest heroine, Riley Moon, despite two professional degrees from Harvard, never swears, the reporter Tricia Vanderhoof pointed out. (You have to love that despite.) Instead she says Crikes, Holy Moly, Crikey. ... Why this quirk?

title: Small Luxuries for the New Years Eve Plate
description: For eons, the high-end solution for New Years Eve entertaining has been to offer an assortment of fabulous comestibles  Champagne, caviar, smoked salmon, truffles. Like diamonds, these luxury goods never go out of style.

title: Rebuffing Israel, U.S. Allows Censure Over Settlements
description: UNITED NATIONS  Defying extraordinary pressure from President-elect Donald J. Trump and furious lobbying by Israel, the Obama administration on Friday allowed the United Nations Security Council to adopt a resolution that condemned Israeli settlement construction.

title: A Struggling Theme Park Asks: Do You Still Believe in Santa?
description: NORTH POLE, N.Y.  On a snowy shoulder of Whiteface Mountain in the Adirondacks, beyond hand-painted signs advertising North Pole, N.Y. and Rides, Shops, Shows, several parking attendants pushed a sedan, its tires spinning, into a packed lot. The cars occupants spilled out, joining other families who high-stepped through snowdrifts  just about everyone smiling, some tossing snowballs  toward the entrance to Santas Workshop, a theme park from another era.

title: Buy an Extended Warranty? Generally, Theres No Need
description: AS shoppers make last-minute purchases for holiday gifts or snap up items at postholiday sales, they are likely to be asked a question at checkout: Would you like to buy an extended warranty?

title: N.F.L. Schedule: Who We Think Will Win in Week 16
description: The N.F.L. playoffs are two weeks away, and so much remains scribbled in pencil, easily erased.

title: 9 New Books We Recommend This Week
description: THANK YOU FOR BEING LATE: An Optimists Guide to Thriving in the Age of Accelerations, by Thomas L. Friedman. (Farrar, Straus & Giroux, $28.) The Times columnist offers a readable and cohesive explanation of the forces upending our world.

title: Deutsche Bank the Winner in Late Flurry of Mortgage Settlements
description: European lenders end-of-year fines for troubled mortgage securities have confounded market expectations and left a clear winner: Deutsche Bank.

title: Worst Annual Death Toll Ever: Mediterranean Claims 5,000 Migrants
description: GENEVA  The number of people who have died trying to reach Europe by crossing the Mediterranean in 2016 is one-third higher than in any other year, the United Nations said on Friday.

title: Dont Count on Vitamins for Better Sleep
description: Q. Are decreasing levels of vitamin B12 in old age related to the insomnia from which so many older people suffer?

title: U.S. Push for South Sudan Arms Embargo Falls Short at U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS  The United States failed on Friday to gain the votes in the United Nations needed to impose targeted sanctions and an arms embargo on South Sudan, the worlds newest country, which has plunged into an ethnic conflict in which officials from the world body warn of the risks of genocide.

title: Where to Watch Cable Movie Marathons on Christmas Weekend
description: The presents have been opened and the ripped-up wrapping paper is off the floor. Maybe theres been a little gingerbread and adult-flavored eggnog involved  maybe more than a little. Now what? Let cable TV do the entertaining with several holiday movie marathons over Christmas weekend, including a 24-hour marathon of A Christmas Story on TNT and TBS, starting at 8 p.m. on Christmas Eve.

title: After a Robust 2016, Jazzs Center Is Up for Grabs
description: This was a strong year in jazz, especially in the genres various avant-garde wings, with outstanding releases from Henry Threadgill, the Mary Halvorson Octet, Steve Lehman, and Wadada Leo Smith. And Joey Alexander performed a duet with Kelsea Ballerini!

title: U.N. Security Council Draft Resolution on the Middle East Peace Process
description: A United Nations Security Council draft resolution condemning Israels settlement building.

title: Refugees Welcome
description: Moral choices. Awkward interactions. Family transformations. A year inside Canadians quests to adopt Syrian refugees.

title: Celebrating a Rugged Vision of Landscape Architecture
description: A waterfall flows in downtown Portland, Ore., ribbons and rivulets of water cascading over slabs of rough, reddish concrete into pools filled with wading children in the summer. Down a tree-lined path, great planted hills pop from the sidewalk. A stepped basin opens up between buildings, looking like a natural spring bursting through the pavement.

title: Where Trash Makes a Stop in Brooklyn, Neighbors Want It Gone
description: When Diamond Torres was growing up in North Brooklyn four decades ago, drug dealers and prostitutes walked the streets at night and crime was endemic.

title: Where Are New Yorks Three-Bedroom Rentals?
description: Of the nearly 24,783 New York City rentals recently listed on The New York Times Find a Home site, just 3,145 were three-bedroom apartments. Where are you most likely to find them? These are the five neighborhoods in the city with the most three-bedrooms.

description: For an Italy worn out after a year that included deadly earthquakes, political turmoil and a slow-motion banking crisis, the news that two Italian police officers helped stop one of the worlds most wanted terrorists came as a relief.

title: 10 Things to Do Now in NYC
description: Its a big city, with plenty to do, see, hear and watch. This guide is a sampling of cultural highlights taking place in New York this weekend and over the week ahead. And theres much more where these came from.

description: To the Editor:

title: Sherlock Opens Up the Old Boys Club to Women
description: LONDON  Sherlock, the world-conquering BBC television adaptation of Arthur Conan Doyles famous stories, has always been a male duo, an awkward bromance that helped make international stars of Benedict Cumberbatch as the hero and Martin Freeman as Dr. John Watson. But the introduction of Mary Morstan, Dr. Watsons fiance-to-be, turned the show into something more like a three-hander.

description: To the Editor:

description: The chef Mark Ladner, who has led the kitchen of the opulent Italian restaurant Del Posto since it opened in 2005, will leave at the end of January.

description: Every Friday, pop critics for The New York Times weigh in on the weeks most notable new songs and videos  and anything else that strikes them as intriguing. You can listen to this playlist on Spotify here. Like this Playlist? Let us know at theplaylist@nytimes.com, and sign up for our Louder newsletter (coming soon!) here.

description: Within hours of confirming plans to appear at the inauguration of Donald J. Trump, the Radio City Rockettes were plunged into a maelstrom of social media outrage on Friday amid reports that the performers were contractually obligated to dance at the ceremony or lose their jobs.

description: ROB McLANE has nearly 1,000 relatives. That makes an annual gathering of fellow descendants of Charles Pratt, one of the eight founding members of the Standard Oil Trust, a bit difficult to organize.

description: QARAQOSH, Iraq  On Sunday, 17-year-old Ismael Al Kanon will celebrate his favorite holiday, Christmas, for the first time since 2014.

description: Since the election, stock prices have risen sharply on hopes that a wave of pro-growth policies under Donald J. Trump will drive up equity prices even further.

description: The 2016 Giants, 15 games into their season, are still trying to find themselves. But that is not a surprise. Nor is it a criticism.

title: Growth, Not Forced Equality, Saves the Poor
description: Anger about economic inequality in the United States dominated the presidential election. But while polemics about the issue have flourished across the political spectrum, clarity has not.

title: To Stop Price Spikes on Prescription Drugs, a Widening Radar
description: Congressional reports can be a snooze. But that is not how Id characterize Wednesdays in-depth account of price gouging among prescription drug makers. The 130-page narrative prepared by the United States Senate Special Committee on Aging was juicy, detailing how four pharmaceutical companies have taken advantage of our health care system to enrich themselves and their executives, harming patients and taxpayers.

title: Solstice Serenades in New York City for Make Music Winter
description: Asked by the prankster Sacha Baron Cohen, on a 2003 episode of Da Ali G Show, what the most popular thing in the world was, Donald J. Trump had a one-word reply: Music.

title: A Physicist of Online Groceries
description: Emmanuel Turlay, 32, is a technical lead manager at Instacart in San Francisco.

title: Tips for Your Post-Holiday Clutter Purge
description: With the year winding down and New Years resolutions just around the corner, its time to gear up for that post-holiday clutter purge. But the thought of tackling the kitchen junk drawer  or even taking down the decorations  can be overwhelming. So to help motivate you, several organizing professionals offered tips on how to streamline your closets, beat back the toys taking over the living room and, yes, finally deal with that junk drawer.

title: Streamline the Closets, Organize the Junk Drawer
description: Experts offer tips on purging the possessions you dont need and storing the rest efficiently.

title: Cornerstone: The Rise and Fall of a Health Care Experiment
description: HIGH POINT, N.C.  Cornerstone Health Care, a large physician group here, made a big bet a few years back: It would get paid based not on how many procedures its doctors performed, but on how effectively they treated their patients.

title: Too Much Tuna: Dinner for One Unlucky Guest in Oh, Hello
description: Adam Pally ate some tuna. Chelsea Handler swallowed a mouthful. Chris Pratt attacked the sandwich and took three huge bites before the meal ultimately got the better of him. It was still too much tuna, the comedian Nick Kroll said.

title: Friday Night Music: Warpaint
description: I guess Im supposed to do something Christmasy, but for obvious reasons Im even more bah humbuggy than usual. Meanwhile, still being surprised at the range of stuff I find myself enjoying at my age. (Young relative: You like Warpaint?!?!) Theres a deep coolness to this performance

title: A&E Says It Will Rework and Retitle Its Ku Klux Klan Series
description: In response to social media outcry, A&E is reworking its coming documentary series about the Ku Klux Klan, changing the title and adding segments designed to provide further context for the show.

title: Voyeur | Christmas Trees
description: A symbol of the season exerts a nostalgic pull.

title: Battle Lines Turn North Carolinas Moderation Into a Distant Memory
description: RALEIGH, N.C.  Political chaos has become as much a fixture of life here as the basketball rivalry between Duke and the University of North Carolina: four years of battles, boycotts, protests and standoffs over voting, gerrymandering, anti-discrimination ordinances, bathroom access and the ability of Republicans to strip power from the governors office as soon as a Democrat wins it.

title: Voyeur | Christmas Trees
description: Christmas jams at the tunnel / Chop through hustle and bustle / Snow and lights make wonderland / Out of this concrete jungle.

description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: I.O.C. Starts Proceedings Against 28 Russian Athletes Over Sochi Doping
description: The International Olympic Committee has begun disciplinary proceedings against 28 Russian athletes who competed at the 2014 Winter Games in Sochi, Russia, acting on evidence that their urine samples were tampered with, and making it all but certain that Russia will lose its first-place standing in the medals table from those Games.

title: In a North Carolina Town, Terrorism Abroad Raises Apprehension
description: HENDERSONVILLE, N.C.  Jeff Miller, a dry cleaner owner who serves on the City Council here, was driving his green truck late Monday afternoon when news of the Christmas market attack in Berlin came on the radio.

title: Marion Pritchard, Who Risked Her Life to Rescue Jews From Nazis, Dies at 96
description: Marion Pritchard, a gentile whose shock at watching Nazi soldiers storm a home for Jewish children in Amsterdam and load them into a truck for deportation inspired her to enter a clandestine world of rescuing Jews, died on Dec. 11 at her home in Washington. She was 96.

title: Jets Coach Todd Bowles Is Hospitalized
description: Jets Coach Todd Bowles was hospitalized Friday afternoon with an illness, casting his availability into question for Saturdays road game against the New England Patriots. The team did not disclose the nature of Bowless issue but did not rule out the possibility that he would coach the team.

title: Reward Is Doubled as Authorities Seek Leads in July Blast in Central Park
description: More than five months after a mysterious substance exploded in Central Park, blowing off the lower part of a 19-year-old mans left leg, many questions about the episode persist.

title: Flurry of Settlements Over Toxic Mortgages May Save Banks Billions
description: European banks have rushed to cut deals with prosecutors over longstanding claims that they pushed toxic mortgage securities in the years before the financial crisis.

title: Businesses Near Trump Tower Say Security Is Stealing Their Christmas
description: Craning over his shoulder, Douglas Tully slowly, cautiously maneuvered his 60-foot delivery truck down a block of West 56th Street in Midtown Manhattan  in reverse.

title: Carrie Fisher in Intensive Care After Medical Episode on Plane
description: The actress Carrie Fisher, best known for her portrayal of Princess Leia in the Star Wars movies, was hospitalized in intensive care on Friday night after a medical episode aboard a flight to Los Angeles from London, The Associated Press reported.

title: President Gorbachevs Last Phone Call
description: WASHINGTON  Less than two hours before announcing his resignation as president of the Soviet Union on Dec. 25, 1991, Mikhail S. Gorbachev placed a telephone call to President George H. W. Bush, who was celebrating Christmas with his grandchildren at Camp David.

title: Trump, Promising Arms Race, Could Set World on Uncertain Path
description: If President-elect Donald J. Trump meant what he said, then the world may one day look back to recall that the first superpower nuclear arms race since the Cold War was announced by two pajama-clad talk show hosts.

title: Humanizing Jesus
description: Early in my Christian pilgrimage, as a young man struggling to understand the implications of a story I had only a surface knowledge of, I stumbled onto a theological insight. For followers of Jesus, salvation was based not on his life so much as his death. Jesus could have been incarnated as a man and been crucified within days. Thats all that was needed for his death to serve as an atonement, but thats not what happened. God clearly wanted to instruct us about how we should live in this life, too.

title: Ukraines Egg Producers
description: The plight of the Ukraines largest egg producer has come to encapsulate a wider disenchantment in Ukraine with a trade agreement with the European Union.

title: Ukrainian Farmers, Poised for Growth, Stumble After E.U. Deal
description: SADKI-STROYEVKA, Ukraine  A cold wind whips through the streets. Vehicles that enter must drive through a foot-deep, moatlike bath of disinfectant, lest their tires track in disease. Computers raise and lower the levels of light to match circadian rhythms.

title: After Coming Up Short, Indians Open Wallet to Add Edwin Encarnacion
description: The Cleveland Indians, a small-market team that came within one victory of a World Series title last month, have now added significant firepower to their lineup. And they did it, in what probably amounts to a surprise, by finding a way to reach an agreement with the right-handed slugger Edwin Encarnacion, one of the top free agents this winter.

title: A Hoop Dreams Sequel, Written by Gun Violence
description: CHICAGO  The first truly great American sports documentary, its universally agreed, was Hoop Dreams. Released in 1994, it garnered immediate critical acclaim; Roger Ebert later called it the best film of the decade and one of the great moviegoing experiences of my lifetime. Its failure to be nominated for an Academy Award caused such an outcry that the process for nominating Oscar-worthy documentaries was eventually revamped.

title: For Obama and Netanyahu, a Final Clash After Years of Conflict
description: JERUSALEM  When President Obama and Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel met in September for the last time before Mr. Obama leaves office, the session was marked by forced smiles and strained jokes about playing golf in retirement, as if bygones were bygones after nearly eight years of clawing conflict.

title: Obama, Trump and the Turf War That Has Come to Define the Transition
description: WASHINGTON  President-elect Donald J. Trump and President Obama have been unfailingly polite toward each other since the election. But with Mr. Trump staking out starkly different positions from Mr. Obama on Israel and other sensitive issues, and the president acting aggressively to protect his legacy, the two have become leaders of what amounts to dueling administrations.

title: Mr. Trump Flirts With an Arms Race
description: One day after sending shock waves around the globe with an alarming tweet about how the United States must greatly strengthen and expand its nuclear capability, President-elect Donald Trump elaborated, and managed only to deepen the worlds fears.

title: After Terror, Berlin Finds Comfort and Joy in a Soccer Clubs Ritual
description: BERLIN  They matched Santa hats with soccer scarves. They sang hymns in cherubic voice and screamed sports chants at the top of their lungs. They held ceremonial white candles and swigged mulled wine from plastic cups.

title: Republicans Are in Denial on Health Care
description: Republican critics of the Affordable Care Act have long described it as a house of cards on the verge of collapse. And they continue to be wrong. A record number of people have signed up for health insurance for 2017 on the federal exchanges created by the 2010 law.

title: A Female Afghan Pilot Soars and Gives Up
description: Perhaps no Afghans story better embodied Americas aspirations for Afghanistan than that of Capt. Niloofar Rahmani, the first female fixed-wing pilot in the fledgling Afghan Air Force.
