description: To the Editor:

title: Donald Trump, Race and Identity Politics
description: To the Editor:

title: Lets Think About the Future of Driverless Cars
description: To the Editor:

title: Receiving Help After a Devastating Loss
description: Maria Brunos strength and her desire to give back to her community were inspired by her mother, Laura Andrews. She was a wonderful person, Ms. Bruno said. When you were down and you spoke to her, she had the power to lift you up. Her home was a safe haven for other children in their Brooklyn neighborhood. When Ms. Andrews suddenly died two years ago at the age of 50, Ms. Bruno fell into a deep depression. At the time, she was attending college and working as a counselor for people living with H.I.V., but all of that became overwhelming. She lost her job and dropped out of school. Her three young children were struggling to cope as well.

title: A Letter to Donald Trump About Health Care
description: Dear Mr. President-elect:

title: How a Budget Chief Can Wreak Havoc
description: Mick Mulvaney, the Republican congressman and fiscal hawk nominated by Donald Trump to head the White House Office of Management and Budget, will, if confirmed, be in charge of creating and promoting Mr. Trumps federal budgets, a position that would put him at the center of debates within the administration and with Congress over the presidents priorities. As the O.M.B. director, Mr. Mulvaney would also have power to advance or impede federal regulation, because many proposed rules have to pass muster at O.M.B. before they are issued.

title: What Is Bariatric Surgery, and How Does It Work?
description: Bariatric surgery is an option that obesity medicine specialists say is too often ignored or dismissed. Yet it is the only option that almost always works to help very heavy people lose a lot of weight and that also can mysteriously make some chronic conditions vanish. Here are some answers about bariatric surgery and what it does.

title: Duck Dynasty vs. Modern Family: 50 Maps of the U.S. Cultural Divide
description: Americans have been clustering themselves into cultural bubbles just as they have clustered in political bubbles.

title: My Year After Gastric Bypass
description: Jessica Shapiro tells of her weight loss and her changing relationship with food in the months after gastric bypass surgery  her last resort to combat severe obesity.

title: After Weight-Loss Surgery, a Year of Joys and Disappointments
description: It was Oct. 11, 2015, and a middle-aged man and a young woman, both severely obese, were struggling with the same lump-in-the-throat feeling. The next day they were going to have an irreversible operation. Were they on the threshold of a new beginning or a terrible mistake?

title: Saudi Royal Family Is Still Spending in an Age of Austerity
description: TANGIER, Morocco  Behind a tall perimeter wall, studded with surveillance cameras and guarded by Moroccan soldiers, a sprawling new palace for King Salman of Saudi Arabia rose on the Atlantic coast here last summer.

title: Democratic Spaces in La Paz Street Parades
description: Experience the diversity of the Aymara culture on the streets of Bolivia. La Paz is host to more than 1000 street festivals a year, and participants describe them as a safe space to express themselves.

title: Nearly 30 Christians in Pakistan Die After Drinking Toxic Alcohol on Christmas
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  At least 27 Christians died and dozens more were sickened in a small city in Pakistan after drinking toxic alcohol on Christmas, officials said on Tuesday.

title: How Jukin Media Built a Viral-Video Empire
description: The Jukin Media headquarters, in Culver City, Calif., checks off all the clichs of the modern millennial workplace. The floor plan is cubicle-free and open, with skateboards  well, longboards  leaned insouciantly against more than a few desks. There is a Ping-Pong table, and the kitchen, of course, offers up a bottomless supply of Monster Energy drinks; a selfie stick hangs near a peanut-allergy warning near a fridge stocked with all manner of alternative milks and Greek yogurts. And yes, as you would expect, there is a keg of craft beer, which employees may drink from whenever they please, even at 10 in the morning  though Ive been assured this has never happened, not even once in roughly seven years of operation. Jukin Media is, after all, a place of business, and as at any other business, there is work to be done.

title: Finding Inspiration for Art in the Betrayal of Privacy
description: Last month, a Berlin nonprofit group called the Tactical Technology Collective took over a gallery in Lower Manhattan. They installed wall-size screens and display cases and arranged glossy tablets on large tables. The walls were white, and the dcor was minimalist. If you squinted, you could mistake it for an Apple Store. That was the point. The exhibit, which Mozilla helped produce, lured people in with the visual language of high-tech consumption. But instead of housing cool new devices, each display contained an artifact or a piece of art intended to school and shock visitors on how much (or little) we know about privacy and data security.

title: Thinking in the Deep: Inside the Mind of an Octopus
description: OTHER MINDSThe Octopus, the Sea, and the Deep Origins of ConsciousnessBy Peter Godfrey-SmithIllustrated. 255 pp. Farrar, Straus & Giroux. $27.

title: A History of U.S. Foreign Affairs in Which Grandiose Ambitions Trump Realism
description: THE TRAGEDY OF U.S. FOREIGN POLICYHow Americas Civil Religion Betrayed the National InterestBy Walter A. McDougall408 pp. Yale University Press. $30.

title: Should the U.S. Embassy Be Moved From Tel Aviv to Jerusalem?
The Problem With Self-Investigation in a Post-Truth Era
description: No one would argue that Edgar Welch, the 28-year-old North Carolina man who loaded his car with weapons in early December and drove 350 miles to liberate the children he believed were being held in the basement of a Washington pizzeria, was a model citizen or even necessarily sane. But after a tragedy had been averted and he was in police custody, Welch transformed himself into something of an unlikely sage, stumbling on a surprisingly resonant explanation for the misguided quest that sent him ricocheting from internet conspiracy theories to armed vigilantism: He had decided, he said, to self-investigate.

title: Abandoned in New Jersey, Chris Christie Returns to a Changed Landscape
description: Chris Christies job approval is at a career low.

title: Toshiba Could Lose Billions From Troubled U.S. Nuclear Power Deal
description: TOKYO  Toshiba, the Japanese technology conglomerate, has spent a decade and billions of dollars building itself into one of the largest players in the global nuclear power industry by buying up rivals.

title: Donald Trump, Pearl Harbor, George Michael: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Hotels Have Year-Round Plans for Fitness Resolutions
description: A new year, a new opportunity to get healthy: Resolutions to exercise more and eat right are popular come Jan. 1. With all of these intentions in mind, hotels typically offer limited-time fitness- and nutrition-themed packages to attract guests for stays during the first few months of the year. This year, however, some properties are changing their approach by introducing wellness programs and packages that travelers can take advantage of at any time.

title: An American in France Finds Adventures in the Day-to-Day
description: The other night at dinner, with moving boxes and packing tape covering every surface of the house, Riley, our 6-year-old daughter, looked up from eating and, after more than two years of going to school in France and playing in France and growing up in France and learning to speak French, suddenly asked, ever so earnestly, Daddy, why did we come to France?

title: How Rogue One Brought Back Familiar Faces
description: Warning: This article contains spoilers about Rogue One: A Star Wars Story.

title: The Year in Beauty
description: From dyed dreadlocks to gothic lips, this years hair and makeup trends were anything but subtle.

title: New York Today: Lee Gabay, a New Yorker of the Year
description: Updated, 8:30 a.m.

title: Planned Hong Kong Museum Will Showcase Chinas Imperial Relics
description: BEIJING  In a sign of growing cultural ties between mainland China and Hong Kong, officials in Hong Kong have announced plans to build a museum to serve as a permanent display space for objects from Beijings Palace Museum, home to some of Chinas most treasured imperial artifacts.

title: Dying in Police Custody in India
description: Nearly 600 people died in police custody in India between 2010 and 2015, yet not one police official was convicted during this period. A report released by Human Rights Watch last week examines 17 cases in which families have sought accountability. Their stories reveal, in searing detail, why there have been so many deaths, starting with police contempt for proper procedures, a cavalier attitude toward the torture of detainees and near total impunity for wrongful deaths.

title: For Russians, Bleak Realities at Home
description: MOSCOW  Russian hackers have been making front pages recently in the United States and Europe, but few people in Russia seem to care or even notice. The Russia of international media and the Russia that we, Russians, know from the inside could not be further apart.

title: Chinas Cybersecurity Efforts Could Pose New Challenge for Foreign Firms
description: HONG KONG  It has been a tough year in China for Americas technology companies.

title: Without Obama, Shinzo Abes Approach to U.S.-Japan Ties May Be Tested
description: TOKYO  Since becoming prime minister for the second time in 2012, Shinzo Abe has made it a centerpiece of his foreign policy to steer Japan closer to the United States.

title: California Today: And the Californian of the Year Is
description: Good morning.

title: Favorites From Douthat, Kristof and Rosenthal
description: We continue today with more Times columnists selecting a favorite column from 2016 and saying a few words about it. Along with those words, Ive listed the column written by each that attracted the largest online audience among Times subscribers.

title: As Hopes for European Unity Dim, New E.U. Headquarters Are Glowing
description: BRUSSELS  A giant glowing orb is about to become the new home of the European Union.

title: A New Champagne for the New Year
description: In making Champagne, the dominant grapes are chardonnay and pinot noir, but the unsung hero is pinot meunier, often contributing fruit and freshness to the wine. Arlaux is one of the few wineries that depend on the grape, which accounts for about a third of the plantings in the Champagne region. A family-run estate on property farmed since the 12th century, Arlaux has made Champagne since 1826 but only now is exporting to the United States. The house makes eight Champagnes, all premier cru, notably the Brut Grande Cuve, which is lovely, straightforward and yeasty, with lively acidity: Arlaux Brut Grande Cuve nonvintage, $43 for 750 milliliters, Vintry Fine Wines, 230 Murray Street (West Street), 888-686-8767, vintryfinewines.com.

title: Denvers Gritty Back Door Could Become Its New Gateway
description: DENVER  A checkerboard of low-slung buildings and vacant parcels, the River North Art District in this fast-growing city has developed a funky vibe over the last few years.

title: Midwest Cheeses With a French Pedigree
description: Among the cheeses made by Jacobs & Brichford is a stunner, Briana with truffles. Its semisoft, almost lacy, and has an alluringly funky edge. The farm in Connersville, Ind., specializes in French cattle breeds whose milk results in cheeses like the prizewinning Everton Premium Reserve, spicy and fairly sharp, with a craggy texture. Other varieties ripen to satin creaminess, like the fruity Ameribella and the mushroomy JQ: Jacobs & Brichford Farmstead Cheeses, $5.75 to $6.75 per quarter pound, jandbcheese.com.

title: Entertaining Shortcut From a Jar
description: Store shelves are lined with sauces and spreads galore, and newcomers show up all the time. This unusual aioli and a dusky blend of mushrooms and black truffles from a new company, Delicious & Sons, get a thumbs up. Use the orange-scented aioli straight from the jar with seafood or a paella. Toss pappardelle in the mushroom-truffle mix, thinned with a little pasta water: Delicious & Sons, 6.35-ounce jars, deliciousandsons.com, garlic aioli with saffron and orange, $8.95; black truffle and mushroom sauce, $12.35, amazon.com.

title: Good, Bad and Mad: Andrew Rosenthal on the News of the Year
description: Times Insider delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how news, features and opinion come together at The New York Times. In this podcast, Andrew Rosenthal, a Times Op-Ed columnist, talks about the news of 2016  the good, the bad and that which makes him mad.

title: The Calzones Cousin Comes to Greenwich Village
description: New York has every kind of food, but no place that sells panzerotti, said Christian Francone, who has filled the gap with a sliver of a shop selling the Southern Italian turnovers. Theyre very popular in Italy. His family is originally from Barletta, in Apulia, home of the fried half-moon snack his shop offers. Twelve fillings are available, including three sweet choices; the savory options, especially those with tomato and mozzarella with or without sausage or pepperoni, taste something like fried pizza. Smoked chicken with pesto and mozzarella, and spinach with ricotta offer a nice change of pace. For now he makes only 100 per day and closes the shop once they are sold. But soon he expects to stay open as late as 3 a.m. on weekends: Mr. Panzerotto, 124 Macdougal Street (Minetta Lane), 646-964-5035, mrpanzerotto.com.

title: Splatter Away With These Pollock Place Mats
description: Messy eaters? Not a problem when the table is set with these vinyl place mats in a dense Jackson Pollock pattern from the Museum of Modern Art. No drip will show. The only question is, what took the museum so long to come up with the idea? There is also a handsome table runner, 14 by 60 inches, with swaths of white, gray and black on a taupe ground. Theyre based on Pollocks Number 1A, 1948 and Number 7, 1950: Jackson Pollock place mats, $24, table runner $65, momastore.org.

title: Giving Up Mostly Everything to Care for His Wife
description: Dont scratch it.

title: Tariffs and the Trade Balance (Wonkish) (Updated)
description: Before the election, I wrote that I intended to spend the time after in an orgy of serious policy analysis  because I thought we were going to have a president serious about policy. Sad! And in some ways its hard to stay motivated about economic analysis when were in fact going to have a government that is completely uninterested in analysis, evidence, or truth of any kind.

title: 1891: Two Englishmen Found Guilty on Charges of Espionage
description: SAINT ETIENNE  John Samuel Cooper and Walter Bednell, the alleged English spies, were brought up for trial before the St. Etienne police magistrates yesterday. The court was crowded, the case having touched a very sensible chord of the French national character.

title: Trump Picks Thomas Bossert as Top Counterterrorism Adviser
description: WEST PALM BEACH, Fla.  President-elect Donald J. Trump has named Thomas P. Bossert, a top national security aide under President George W. Bush, to be his homeland security adviser, the Trump transition team announced Tuesday morning.

title: Chocolate Made With Olive Oil
description: The chef and restaurateur Thomas Keller is now in the chocolate business: a bean-to-bar partnership with Armando Manni, a Tuscan olive oil producer. The idea was born five years ago, when the men were discussing the antioxidant properties of dark chocolate and olive oil. The results, called K & M Extravirgin Chocolate (they say it K plus M), are made in a former warehouse in Napa, Calif., where the cacao undergoes a special, gentler process to preserve the beans antioxidant properties. Mr. Mannis olive oil is used in place of cocoa butter. The 75 percent cacao bars come in three varieties, according to the source of the chocolate. The Peruvian bar has coffeelike depth, the bar from Ecuador is smooth with woodsy hints of chestnut, and the Madagascar bar is spicy with notes of pineapple and passion fruit. You do not taste the olive oil: K & M Extravirgin Chocolate, $14.95 for 2.5 ounces at Williams-Sonoma stores, williams-sonoma.com, $120 for eight bars from kellermannichocolate.com.

title: Mindy Kaling, Sterling K. Brown, Thomas Middleditch and Bob Odenkirk on Their Favorite TV of 2016
description: We asked some of this years notable authors, actors and showrunners about the TV they enjoyed most in 2016. Their responses will run over the next two weeks. Come back to Watching, The New York Timess TV and movie recommendation site, to read them all.

title: Shining Light on a Windows 10 Search
description: Q. The search box in Windows XP was friendly and found things. The search function on Windows 10 is basically useless because it rarely finds anything I seek, including documents I worked on the day before. Is there a way to get reliable search results using Windows 10?

title: Marriage May Help You Survive a Stroke
description: Your marriage status may be a good predictor of whether you survive a stroke.

title: Trump Inauguration Security Planners Brace for Wave of Protesters
description: WASHINGTON  Security surrounding the inauguration of Donald J. Trump is proving to be the most challenging in recent history, according to senior officials involved in its planning, largely because of the same forces of political rancor that shaped the race for the presidency.

title: Daily Report: Inside Snopes, a Fighter of Fake News
description: Since the presidential election, fake news has been in the spotlight for how its spread online may have influenced the American electorate. So what is it like to be one of the fighters of this scourge?

title: How Cuomos Signature Economic Growth Project Fell Apart in Utica
description: In Utica, a former industrial hub in upstate New York where the near collapse of manufacturing has made for a scarcity of jobs and a rarity of good news, the announcement in August 2015 that an Austrian chip maker had decided to put down roots in a fabrication plant built by the state was cause for jubilation.

title: Pentatonix Climbs to No. 1 and George Michaels Streams Soar
description: In the music charts this week, Pentatonix reaches No. 1 with its latest holiday album, and streams of George Michaels music grew by nearly 3,200 percent after news of his death emerged on Christmas Day.

title: As U.K. Tightens Voting Rules, Critics Say Labour and the Poor Will Suffer
description: LONDON  The British government announced plans on Tuesday to crack down on voter fraud by requiring voters to show official identification at polling stations, tightening rules on absentee ballots and preventing political activists from handling absentee ballots.

title: Buffalo Bills Fire Coach Rex Ryan, Slamming Door on a Boisterous Presence
description: Rex Ryan needed just one more win  against the faltering Jets, no less  to become the first Buffalo Bills head coach in 16 years to post back-to-back .500 seasons.

title: Clean Tech Rises Again, Retooling Nature for Industrial Use
description: BERKELEY, Calif.  A decade ago, a group of biologists, venture capitalists and computer whizzes gathered under the name clean tech. They hoped to overturn polluting industries with microorganisms cheerily excreting industrial chemicals through the miracle of reprogramming natures genetic code.

title: School Parade in Taiwan Featuring Swastikas and Nazis Unleashes Uproar
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan  A high school parade in Taiwan in which students dressed as Nazi soldiers and carried swastika banners has created a storm of criticism in one of Asias most open societies.

title: Taiwan Student's Nazi Costumes Spark Outrage
description: A parade on Friday in which high school students dressed as Nazi soldiers and carried swastika banners in Taiwan was met with strong condemnation. The parade was part of Hsinchu Kuang-Fu High School's anniversary celebration.

title: Carrie Fisher
description: Carrie Fisher, the actress, author and screenwriter, became a film star with the release of Star Wars in 1977.

title: Carrie Fisher, Child of Hollywood and Star Wars Royalty, Dies at 60
description: Carrie Fisher, the actress, author and screenwriter who brought a rare combination of nerve, grit and hopefulness to her most indelible role, as Princess Leia in the Star Wars movie franchise, died on Tuesday morning. She was 60.

title: Workplace Deaths
description: To the Editor:

title: China Deploys Aircraft Carrier to Disputed South China Sea
description: BEIJING  The Chinese military, in a move analysts described as a challenge to President-elect Donald J. Trumps strident criticism of China, has deployed an aircraft carrier to patrol the contested South China Sea, officials said on Tuesday.

title: Richard Adams, Whose Novel Watership Down Became a Phenomenon, Dies at 96
description: Richard Adams, the British novelist who became one of the worlds best-selling authors with his first book, Watership Down, a tale of rabbits whose adventures in a pastoral realm of epic perils explored Homeric themes of exile, courage and survival, died on Saturday. He was 96.

title: Best of The Timess Live Interactive Journalism on Facebook Live in 2016
description: Since April, The New York Times has been creating a new type of content: live interactive journalism. While streaming on Facebook, our journalists have explored stories hand in hand with the viewer. Here are some of our audience favorites from the year: live concerts, live reporting, live drawing, and more. Please send us questions and comments here: LIJTeam@nytimes.com.

title: United Nations, Donald Trump, Shinzo Abe: Your Morning Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Watch These Movies and TV Shows Before They Leave Netflix on Jan. 1
description: At the end of every month, movies and TV shows expire from various streaming services. Here are the most interesting titles leaving Netflix at the end of December.

title: The U.N. Resolution Against Israeli Settlements
description: To the Editor:

title: A Flock in Need
description: Cheesemakers love sheeps milk, but the animals inability to produce the volume of milk needed for profitability is putting strains on some dairies.

title: Sheeps Milk Cheeses in U.S. Earn Ribbons but Little Profit
description: Seated with hundreds of colleagues at the American Cheese Society awards ceremony in Des Moines this past July, Rebecca Williams heard her farms name announced not once but twice, for its acclaimed sheeps milk cheeses.

title: Record Rainfall Closes Australian National Park
description: Meteorologists say this type of weather event only happens twice a century.

title: After 15 Big Mall Fights, Police See a Culprit: Teenage Boredom
description: Officer Tamara Valle of the Fort Worth Police Department received a call on Monday: A fight had broken out in the food court of the nearby Hulen Mall, and 200 teenagers were running, screaming and fighting. Shopkeepers were going into lockdown, slamming their gates shut with customers still inside.

title: Recent Commercial Real Estate Transactions
description: $2.3 MILLION

title: The Public Domain: An Afternoon Too Hot to Sing. Or So I Thought.
description: When I first heard that David Lang was composing a piece for a thousand voices, professional and amateur, to be performed outdoors around the fountain in Lincoln Center Plaza, the idea seemed a little gimmicky. Still, I was curious about the piece, titled the public domain.

title: How Donald J. Trump Could Promote Long-Term Economic Growth
description: Despite hand-wringing before the election that a Trump presidency would presage near-term and long-term calamity, giddy equity markets responded to a Republican sweep of the White House and Congress with a more sanguine view. Such a response makes sense if a pro-growth policy is indeed much more likely, but it also lays bare steps the new administration and its economic team need to take to justify that optimism.

title: Death of a Red Carpet Reporter
description: Jeffrey Slonim didnt shout. While the other red carpet reporters tried to get the attention of celebrities by yelling their names, he usually waited for them to come to him. And they usually did.

title: Plundering the Classics for Children
description: To the Editor:

title: The Start of a New Arms Race?
description: To the Editor:

title: The Stone Announces Its End Date
description: The Stone, an influential East Village performance space owned by the composer-improviser John Zorn, appears to have announced its end date  in February of 2018. The clubs calendar for that month, which includes a Farewell to the Stone celebration, was singled out on Monday in the Twitter feed of Destination: Out, a two-person team of advocates of avant-garde jazz.

title: Walmart Slowly Makes Strides in E-Commerce
description: Walmart Stores tortoise-like digital pace may yet pay off.

title: The Odeon
description: A downtown landmark still hits the spot.

title: The Odeons Not-So-Bright Lights Still Beckon
description: Why do I keep going back to the Odeon?

title: Houses of Worship Poised to Serve as Trump-Era Immigrant Sanctuaries
description: PHILADELPHIA  Tucked one floor below the majestic Gothic sanctuary of Arch Street United Methodist Church, Javier Flores Garcia sleeps on a cot in a basement Sunday-school classroom that church members have outfitted with a microwave, a compact refrigerator and a television.

title: Questions About George Michaels Death Remain as His Inner Circle Mourns
description: The body of George Michael, the British pop star who died on Sunday at 53, was discovered on Christmas Day by his boyfriend, Fadi Fawaz, at the singers home in the village of Goring-on-Thames, according to an account published on Tuesday by The Daily Telegraph.

title: Mehdi Karroubi, Iranian Cleric Under House Arrest, Quits Political Party
description: Mehdi Karroubi, an Iranian cleric who ran for president in 2009 in an election that was followed by protests and a brutal crackdown, has resigned from his political party, according to the Iranian news media.

title: Dressing Up as Princess Leia: Share Your Photos
description: Did you or a family member ever dress up as Princess Leia? Wed like to see your photos and the story behind them.

title: At Salons and Spas, Membership Plans Catch On
description: Every few weeks, on the way home from her downtown Manhattan office, Rebecca Weinreich stops in at a club in TriBeCa. The airy space is outfitted with comfortable velvet sofas and a large crystal chandelier. Upon arrival, members like Ms. Weinreich are offered a flute of chilled prosecco or a freshly prepared latte.

title: Dont Let Trump Speak for Workers
description: I am your voice, President-elect Donald J. Trump declared at the Republican National Convention. In another campaign speech, he told his supporters, I alone can fix it.

title: Review: Ocean Waves, a Tale of Young Love, Ghibli Style
description: Studio Ghibli is revered by animation lovers the world over. During the companys 31-year existence, its output has been relatively small, because the artists who founded it  Hayao Miyazaki, director of films including Spirited Away and The Wind Rises, is the most famous  are never less than painstaking.

title: In Bahrain, Arabs and Jews Gather (and Dance) at a Hanukkah Celebration
description: Orthodox Jews in black coats and skullcaps danced with Arabs in flowing robes and checkered kaffiyehs at a Hanukkah celebration over the weekend in Bahrain, a Muslim-majority monarchy whose king has sanctioned celebrations of the Jewish holiday.

title: Whitney Houston, Cher, Tina Turner and Donna Summer: The Musicals
description: Fans of shimmery miniskirts, hands-in-the-air choruses and beefcake backup dancers are in for a treat, as theater producers are turning to some of pop musics biggest divas for their latest musical projects (and potential cash cows). News this month of a coming Tina Turner bio-musical is making it clear that producers Believe demand for such shows is Strong Enough. (Couldnt help it, Cher.)

title: Russians No Longer Dispute Olympic Doping Operation
description: MOSCOW  Russia is for the first time conceding that its officials carried out one of the biggest conspiracies in sports history: a far-reaching doping operation that implicated scores of Russian athletes, tainting not just the 2014 Winter Olympics in Sochi but also the entire Olympic movement.

title: Baci e Vendetta Brings Old-World Elegance to the East Village
description: Heres a stunning bar and trattoria with Old World bronze-trimmed elegance that outclasses its East Village location. Its the work of the Church Group, which creates themed bars, several in the same neighborhood. Nearby, the groups Kingston Hall is Jamaican, Shoolbreds is as Scottish as its hot toddies, and Ninth Ward, which is closed temporarily, showcases the food and drink of New Orleans. (The group has opened another Ninth Ward in London.) Nic Ratner and Robert Morgan, a former Hollywood agent, are the partners. At the new Italian venture, a menu of small plates like crostini, panini, burrata, a chicken parm sandwich and meatballs is expanded for weekend brunch with the addition of egg dishes, a burger and French toast. The drinks  wine based, not spirits  are Italian-accented, with cocktails including a Bellini and a creditable Bloody Mary made with sake: 131 Avenue A (St. Marks Place), 646-275-0461, bacievendetta.com.

title: Review: A Guitarist Rejects Her. But She Knows How to Be Cruel.
description: Noche Flamenca, the beloved flamenco troupe, can eschew spectacle and concepts for a simple presentation, because it can rely on its dependably thrilling star, Soledad Barrio. In recent years, though, the group has grown a little more theatrically ambitious, and a new pattern has emerged: longer works that take a season or two to find their footing.

title: Fans and Friends Pay Tribute to Carrie Fisher
description: Celebrities and fans paid tribute to the actress Carrie Fisher, who died on Tuesday at the age of 60. Her death came days after a heart attack on a flight from London to Los Angeles. She was known for playing Princess Leia in the "Star Wars" films.

title: What Were Reading
description: Get recommendations from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. What Were Reading emails are sent twice a week. Sign up

title: Report on Bronx Teacher's Relationship With a Student
description: The details of Isaac Durans relationship with Felicia Barahona, when he was a student and she was a teacher, are recounted in a four-page memorandum written by the office of the special commissioner of investigation for the New York City School District.

title: A Nutcracker Dream: The Role of Dewdrop
description: #SpeakingInDance: a new weekly visual exploration of dance. Follow us on Instagram: @nytimes.

title: Review: With The Correspondence, a New Contender in the Ring
description: Dont make your books any shorter, please, Graham Greene begged his friend Muriel Spark in a 1974 letter, or youll disappear like Beckett.

title: Review: 1 Teenage Boy and 3 Mothers in 20th Century Women
description: Love and loss go hand in hand in 20th Century Women, a funny, emotionally piercing story about a teenager and the women who raise him. It opens in 1979, when cool kids danced to Talking Heads (This aint no party, this aint no disco) and President Carter bummed everyone out talking about our crisis of confidence. Theres something in the air  or so it seems, although the California light here tends to blot out the shadows. When a car bursts into flames soon after the movie opens, it looks about as threatening as an art installation. Apocalypse later, man.

title: An Evening of Ronald K. Brown Lifts Alvin Aileys Season
description: There was one night (at least) this season  Dec. 14, to be exact  when everything came together for Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater. Movement melted off shoulders and fingertips without effort. Power emanated from the inside and then flowed out with searing swiftness, the rare sort that isnt ostentatious. The men found strength in suppleness; the women were softer still, plush yet never weak.

title: Grading the Big Deals of 2016: Low and Incomplete Marks Abound
description: Its time to call an end to 2016 and hand out grades for good and bad deal-making. In a fitful and contentious year, it is perhaps no surprise that this year there were more bad grades than good.

title: Carrie Fisher's 'Star Wars' Legacy
description: Manohla Dargis, a film critic for The New York Times, remembers Carrie Fisher, whose career was defined  for better or for worse  by her role as Princess Leia in the Star Wars films.

title: Shinzo Abe at Pearl Harbor: Rest in Peace, Precious Souls of the Fallen
description: The following is a transcript of Prime Minister Shinzo Abes remarks on Tuesday at Pearl Harbor, Hawaii, based on an advance text of his speech.

title: Japanese Leader Offers Condolences in Visit to Pearl Harbor
description: PEARL HARBOR, Hawaii  Seventy-five years after Imperial Japanese warplanes destroyed the Pacific fleet here and drew the United States into World War II, Prime Minister Shinzo Abe of Japan on Tuesday stood next to President Obama at the site of the attack and offered repentance but did not apologize.

title: Review: In Jim Jarmuschs Paterson, a Meditative Flow of Words Into Poetry
description: Poems slip across the screen like water in Paterson, Jim Jarmuschs wonderful new dispatch from Jarmusch-land. Sometimes they appear over water, too, surfacing word by word on images of the Great Falls along the Passaic River in Paterson, N.J. No pen or pencil directly spells out these words, no clattering keyboard or banging typewriter. Instead, the words  in a neat, cramped hand  appear onscreen as they are read aloud by their author, Paterson (Adam Driver), a soulful bus driver and basement poet. Its as if he were beaming his heart-song straight from his head into yours.

title: The Dark (and Often Dubious) Art of Forecasting Food Trends
description: Remember when wraps seemed revolutionary? Maybe you had one on your way home from an Alanis Morissette concert in 1996.

title: Carl Paladino, a Trump Ally, Says Racist Remarks About Obamas Were Sent in Error
description: Carl Paladino said on Tuesday that he had not intended to send racist remarks about President and Michelle Obama, which were roundly denounced as viciously offensive, to a Buffalo newspaper for publication.

title: National Biotechnology Panel Faces New Conflict of Interest Questions
description: The National Academies of Sciences, Engineering and Medicine are assigned by Congress to provide policy guidance to the government. The group describes itself as advisers to the nation. The advice often comes through written reports from scientific committees organized by the group.

title: Bubble Tea? So 2002. A Sampling of Food-Trend Predictions
description: Some food-trend predictions flourish and some fizzle, but they offer a glimpse of how our cravings have (or havent) changed. Here is a sampling, from various sources.

title: Shinzo Abe, Obama, Carrie Fisher: Your Tuesday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Bob Bradley Is Out at Swansea. Round Up the Usual Replacements.
description: There was a telltale line in the statement Huw Jenkins, the chairman of Swansea City, released Tuesday to confirm that Bob Bradleys career as a Premier League manager was over after 85 days.

title: Senators Reassure Wary Baltic Nations That U.S. Wont Abandon NATO
description: LONDON  Three American senators arrived in Tallinn, Estonia on Tuesday to reassure the Baltic nations that the United States remained committed to their defense and to the NATO alliance.

title: A New Day for Gay Plays?
description: No one would argue that gay men and women continue to face the kind of discrimination they did back in 1968, when Mart Crowleys The Boys in the Band cracked open the closet door onstage, shining a stark light on what was then a topic rarely explored in popular culture.

title: North Koreas Nuclear Hopes Have Surged, Defector Says
description: SEOUL, South Korea  A senior North Korean official who defected to the South told reporters on Tuesday that the North viewed 2017 as the best time to advance its nuclear program because it could take advantage of leadership changes in the United States and South Korea.

title: Carrie Fisher, a Princess, a Rebel and a Brave Comic Voice
description: Carrie Fisher was the child of a show-business family. The daughter of famous parents, she wrote in her memoir Wishful Drinking, which originated as a one-woman show. One an icon, the other a consort to icons.

title: After Uncertain Year, New Administration Portends Shift in Wall Street Scrutiny
description: The Scottish poet Robert Burns once wrote there is no such uncertainty as a sure thing. There seemed to be any number of sure things this past year, from the outcome of the presidential election to how the Supreme Court would cut back on insider trading.

title: Vera Rubin, 88, Dies; Opened Doors in Astronomy, and for Women
description: Vera Rubin, who transformed modern physics and astronomy with her observations showing that galaxies and stars are immersed in the gravitational grip of vast clouds of dark matter, died on Sunday in Princeton, N.J. She was 88.

title: Art Thats Disposable, but by No Means Throwaway
description: Claude Monet found inspiration in haystacks and water lilies, Pablo Picasso in African masks and Edvard Munch in a poem he himself had written.

title: A Song for Bill de Blasio Sounds a Sour Note for Watchdogs
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio posted a video on his City Hall Twitter account on Tuesday that featured two Broadway actors singing his praises and promoting his accomplishments, drawing criticism from government watchdog groups who said that it was an inappropriate use of public money and was too much like a campaign ad.

title: 3 Men Made Millions by Hacking Merger Lawyers, U.S. Says
description: Law firms that advise on mergers once had to worry about a rogue employee trading on deal tips. Now, they have to worry about hackers doing the same.

title: Carrie Fisher: A Look at Her Life Beyond Star Wars
description: Carrie Fisher was known worldwide for her portrayal of Princess Leia, the heroine and rebel leader at the heart of four Star Wars films, but she was quick to point out that she was much more than her creatively coifed character.

title: Former Student Is Charged in Killings of Ex-Teacher and Their Son
description: It was a minor tabloid scandal: a Bronx high school teacher caught having a sexual relationship with a student. She was 32. He was in high school, 17 or 18. Soon, they moved in together and she was pregnant. They bought wedding bands.

title: Romanias President Rejects First Female Candidate for Prime Minister
description: BUCHAREST, Romania  President Klaus Iohannis of Romania on Tuesday rejected a candidate for prime minister put forward by the countrys largest political party, a decision likely to increase a rift between the president and the parliamentary majority.

title: Rick Perry, as Energy Secretary, May Be Pressed to Resume Nuclear Tests
description: President-elect Donald J. Trumps Twitter post last week that the United States must greatly strengthen and expand its nuclear capability provoked confusion and anxiety that intensified the next day when he added, in a television interview, Let it be an arms race. We will outmatch them at every pass and outlast them all.

title: A Grand Central Dancer, Interrupted
description: Dear Diary:

title: Alabama Win in 1926 Rose Bowl Put Southern Stamp on College Football
description: The first time Alabama played Washington, in the 1926 Rose Bowl, the Crimson Tide arrived in Pasadena, Calif., more than a week early. The Huskies, by contrast, did not come down from Seattle until the day before the game, because their officials had determined, according to a New York Times article from Dec. 26, 1925, that experience has proved that the Huskies play better when they have not been exposed to the enervating Southern breezes for any length of time.

title: Gordie Tapp, Hee Haw Regular of Pfft! You Was Gone Fame, Dies at 94
description: Gordie Tapp, a regular for more than 20 years on the long-running television variety series Hee Haw, died on Dec. 18 in Burlington, Ontario. He was 94.

title: Cristina Fernndez de Kirchner Indicted Again on Corruption Charges
description: BUENOS AIRES  Cristina Fernndez de Kirchner, the Argentine former president who with her late husband dominated the countrys politics for most of this century, was indicted Tuesday on fraud and corruption charges involving huge public works projects. It was her second indictment since she left office last year.

title: John Kerry, in a Final, Pointed Plea, Will Outline a Vision of Mideast Peace
description: WASHINGTON  In a last-chance effort to shape the outlines of a Middle East peace deal, Secretary of State John Kerry plans to describe in a speech on Wednesday the Obama administrations vision of a final Israeli-Palestinian accord based on bitter lessons learned from an effort that collapsed in 2014.

title: Choir in Plane Crash Projects Russian Pride and Soft Power
description: Confusion has flooded the web since it was announced that dozens of members of the Alexandrov Ensemble, a famed army choir and orchestra, were among the 92 killed when a Russian military passenger plane headed for Syria crashed into the Black Sea on Sunday.

title: Corrections: December 28, 2016
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Trump Revives Defense of Charitable Foundation Amid Inquiry
description: Donald J. Trump has renewed his defense of his charitable foundation, insisting on Twitter that all of the money raised by the organization has gone to charity even as the New York attorney general continues to investigate claims to the contrary.

title: Sell the Business, Not the Presidency, Mr. Trump
description: In recent days, the Trump family has announced some steps that it says are intended to address the truckload of conflicts of interest that Donald Trump could bring to the White House next month, and that it is considering further measures. But so far, these steps fall well short of what Mr. Trump must do to protect his presidency from damaging accusations of corruption.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: His approval rating is at 4 percent. So that gives Christie something to shoot for.

title: If You Build It, They Will Come
description: WEDNESDAY PUZZLE  Plenty of people play fantasy sports, but have you ever put together a fantasy musical group? With a group of people who are not musicians and whose raison dtre has nothing to do with music?

title: Fans Tweet About Mental Illness to Honor Carrie Fisher
description: The actress Carrie Fisher, who spoke openly about her struggles with mental illness, once joked that she wanted to start a Bipolar Pride Day to help erase the stigma of the disease.

title: Sluggish Rangers Rediscover Their Fight, Ending Senators Winning Streak
description: Ottawa Senators forward Chris Neil has amassed more than 2,500 penalty minutes in his 15-year N.H.L. career because he is not bashful about throwing around all of his 209 pounds. He did so again in the second period Tuesday, driving the rookie Rangers defenseman Brady Skjei into the boards and to the ice.

title: H.I.V. Cases Surpass a Million in Russia, but Little Is Done
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Russia  Quietly, the number of Russians who have received a positive H.I.V. diagnosis passed the one million mark this year. There is, however, little indication that the government will commit adequate resources to stem the acceleration of the virus from high-risk groups into the general population.

title: Carrie Fisher, Russia, Shinzo Abe: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Five Places to Shop in Copenhagen
description: The Vesterbro neighborhood of Copenhagen was once a seedy part of town that was full of brothels and was not to be ventured into at night. But in the last several years, it has become home to both fledgling and established entrepreneurs who are opening quirky boutiques with interesting back stories. Many of the locally owned shops are on or near a busy thoroughfare called Istedgade, and what they sell varies from childrens clothes to home goods.

title: Phil Jackson of Knicks and Jeanie Buss of Lakers Announce Their Breakup
description: Phil Jackson and Jeanie Buss, one of the N.B.A.s longest-running power couples, announced their breakup Tuesday night via social media.

title: Whats on TV Wednesday: Captain America and Swan Lake
description: Captain America: Civil War, a superhero film with relatively low stakes but suggestions of political commentary, is streaming on Netflix. And Rudolf Nureyevs 1984 staging of Swan Lake, performed by the Paris Opera Ballet, is on medici.tv.

title: For the Trumps, Made in U.S.A. May Be a Tricky Label to Stitch
description: At Saks Off Fifth recently, an Ivanka Trump white polyester and spandex blouse made in Indonesia was marked down to $34.99, from $69. A few racks over, her black and white jacket came from Vietnam, while several blocks away, at Macys, her leather bootee manufactured in China sold for more than $100.

title: Hospitals in Safety Net Brace for Health Care Laws Repeal
description: PHILADELPHIA  Jason Colston Sr. went to the emergency room at Temple University Hospital last month with his calf swollen to twice its normal size. A bacterial infection had entered his bloodstream, requiring him to spend nine days at Temple, where patients are overwhelmingly poor.

title: Photographing Climate Change Refugees, by Drone and on Foot
description: Josh Haner has photographed eight stories across five countries this year on the effects of climate change.

title: Life on a Small California Farm
description: The work is grueling at Oya Organics, an 18-acre vegetable farm in Hollister.

title: Europe Takes a Braver Stance on Gun Control
description: The European Union, to its credit, has agreed on a series of proposals for tighter gun controls as a timely response to the growing threat of terrorism and mass shootings. The proposals, which are headed toward a final vote by members next year, would extend bans on semiautomatic assault weapons to more models, institute medical checks for gun buyers, tighten sales on the internet and track the resale of guns to foil black-market dealers.

title: Fix Immigration. Its What Voters Want.
description: Donald J. Trump smashed many orthodoxies on his way to victory, but immigration was the defining issue separating him from his primary opponents and Hillary Clinton. President-elect Trump now has a clear mandate not only to stop illegal immigration, but also to finally cut the generation-long influx of low-skilled immigrants that undermines American workers.

title: The Trump Matrix
description: Anyone who tells you, with perfect confidence, what a Trump administration will do is either bluffing or a fool. We have a prospective cabinet and a White House staff, but we havent got the first idea how the two will fit together or relate to Congress, or how the man at the top will preside over it all.

title: Where Secret Arrests Were Standard Procedure
description: For a shocking glimpse of whats been happening in the name of criminal justice in America, look no further than a Justice Department report last week on police behavior in Louisiana. Officers there have routinely arrested hundreds of citizens annually without probable cause, strip-searching them and denying them contact with their family and lawyers for days  all in an unconstitutional attempt to force cooperation with detectives who finally admitted they were operating on a mere hunch or feeling.

title: How Donald Trumps Health Secretary Pick Endangers Women
description: LOS ANGELES  With the selection of Representative Tom Price as secretary of health and human services, President-elect Donald J. Trump has taken a giant step toward undermining the health of American women.

title: Chinese Prosecutors Ask Court for More Time in Detained Tibetans Case
description: The case of a Tibetan entrepreneur who was detained after being featured in an article and video by The New York Times has taken an unusual turn, with Chinese prosecutors asking a court for more time to investigate as the judges were weighing a trial.

title: Photographing Climate Change Refugees, by Drone and on Foot
description: Josh Haner has photographed eight stories across five countries this year about the effects of climate change, often employing drones to get unique vantage points. Mr. Haner is a staff photographer and a senior editor for photo technology at The New York Times. He talked with James Estrin about finding new ways to visualize climate change. The conversation has been edited for clarity and brevity.

title: And a Thinner New Year: Five New Books About Food and Diets
description: Ive never understood why January is diet season. Dont people realize they still have many months during which they can layer their layers? Every diet book should come out on May 1. Thats when you realize you have less than two months before someone, somewhere, is going to force you to go to the beach. But O.K., fine, new year, new you and all that. Lets get a jump-start on the panic, shall we?

title: Vivek Murthy Thinks We Need to Learn How to Deal With Stress
description: Why does the surgeon general wear a uniform? I wear the uniform of the U.S. Public Health Service Commissioned Corps, which evolved from a Marine hospital system headed by a supervising surgeon, later given the title of surgeon general. I like the uniform: There was a time when my friends wouldnt let me leave the apartment without somebody first checking to make sure I wasnt going to embarrass the group with what I was wearing, so having the uniform is helpful.

title: Your Sister Wont Vaccinate Her Son. Can You Help Him?
description: My sister and her ex are against vaccinating their kids, and I completely disagree with them. Vaccines have helped usher in the modern age; our life spans have been lengthened by the eradication or suppression of smallpox, polio, measles, flu, and so on. Recently, my 12-year-old nephew told me out of the blue that he wasnt vaccinated and wanted to be. He got swine flu a year or two ago. He was very sick and has no desire to repeat anything like that again.

title: The Fighter
description: Sam Siatta was deep in a tequila haze, so staggeringly drunk that he would later say he retained no memory of the crime he was beginning to commit.

title: 11 Ways to Be a Better Person in 2017
description: Live like Bill, pay attention and learn how to iron a shirt.

title: Berlin Attraction Reveals an Uneasy Phenomenon: Hitler Sells
description: What do you do about the buildings associated with Hitlers life and death? In Austria, they are hitting the delete key, but in Germany, its more like copy and paste.

title: How a Fish That Hatches in Coral Reefs Finds Its Way Home
description: The larvae of fish that live in coral reefs are tiny, and they are not very good swimmers. They are pushed by currents away from the reefs on which they were hatched for days or weeks until they learn to swim. Then, somehow, around 60 percent of them make their way back to their birthplaces, where they spend the rest of their lives.

title: Manhattan Valley: A Diverse Neighborhood Bordering Central Park
description: The view was the first thing to grab Nicole Anaseness attention when she entered a 10th-floor apartment facing Central Park in 2007.

title: Take a Ride With the Flying Scotsman
description: The Flying Scotsman, a beloved British steam engine, was recently renovated and came out of retirement.

title: Should Foreign Language Classes Be Mandatory in College?
A Zika Vaccine, but for Whom?
description: The race for a Zika vaccine, one of the most pressing priorities in global health, is at full throttle. More than a dozen companies and government institutions are working to unlock the secrets of the virus, and a vaccine could be available as early as 2018.

title: John Kerry, Russia, Carrie Fisher: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.

title: Five Resolutions to Simplify Your Tech Life
description: In 2017, why not try a new kind of New Years resolution? Instead of just hitting the gym and dropping some pounds, consider changing some personal habits to simplify the tech in your life.

title: Your New Vacation Photographer: A Drone
description: Vacation photography is hitting new heights.

title: My Mexico City Is Everyones Now
description: In the hourlong traffic jam from Mexico City International Airport, on a road clogged with cars, buses and trucks, I keep glancing out the window, looking for familiar signposts, streets, neighborhoods, name places, threads of childhood memories.

title: Work. Walk 5 Minutes. Work.
description: Stuck at your work desk? Standing up and walking around for five minutes every hour during the workday could lift your mood, combat lethargy without reducing focus and attention, and even dull hunger pangs, according to an instructive new study.

title: 28 Creative Geniuses Who Defined Culture in 2016
description: From their studios, ateliers, film sets and kitchens  and even the White House  these are the people whose inventive spirits shaped the conversation this year.

title: New York Today: Valerie Goldfein, a New Yorker of the Year
description: Updated, 10:46 a.m.

title: 2016: Worst. Year. Ever?
description: LONDON  Some of you may have noticed that it has not been a great year. Disasters of disease and disruption; disasters violently compounded by our inability to temper our wishes and tolerate our differences; and, finally, death upon death of treasured talismans of better times.

title: Christmas Revelers Leave 16 Tons of Trash on Australian Beach
description: SYDNEY, Australia  Christmas and New Year in Australia typically involve barbecues, beaches and beer.

title: Israel Postponed Vote on New Housing Before Speech by John Kerry
description: JERUSALEM  Israeli leaders postponed plans on Wednesday to move ahead with new housing in East Jerusalem, just hours before Secretary of State John Kerry delivered a much-anticipated speech outlining an American vision for peace with the Palestinians.

title: Faster Growth? Two Things Trump Supporters Wont Like
description: Donald J. Trump wants us to dream bigger about the economic future. We shouldnt be content with the roughly 2 percent annual growth that has been the norm this century, he has said. And he thinks he can bring about the kind of robust growth of 4 percent or more that was commonplace in decades past.

title: Why Are We Doing This to Ourselves? Readers Respond to the Threat of Automation
description: How do we deal with the job losses caused by automation? Offer a universal basic income? Halt the march of technology? Shorten the workweek? Get more education  or a different kind of it? Raise the minimum wage  or lower it?

title: Tunisian Detained as Possible Accomplice in Berlin Attack
description: BERLIN  A 40-year-old Tunisian man has been detained as a possible accomplice of Anis Amri, the man identified as the terrorist who carried out the truck attack on a Berlin Christmas market that killed 12 people, German officials said on Wednesday.

title: California Today: A Battle Over the San Joaquin River
description: Good morning.

title: A Five-Bedroom Villa on the Caribbean in Aruba
description: The house, built in the 1960s on the islands northwest coast, is on the market for $1.46 million.

title: House Hunting in ... Aruba
description: A FIVE-BEDROOM VILLA ON THE CARIBBEAN SEA IN ARUBA

title: London Nutcrackers Defy Logic, and Still Delight
description: LONDON  It hasnt always been an inevitable truth here that The Nutcracker plays during the holiday season. But things seem to be changing, perhaps influenced by the belt-tightening in British arts funding and the moneymaking powers of this ballet: For the past few years, the English National Ballet and the Royal Ballet have both had long December-into-January runs of The Nutcracker.

title: Near Mexico City, Cable Car Lets Commuters Glide Over Traffic
description: ECATEPEC DE MORELOS, Mexico  Coasting above Mexico Citys infernal congestion is normally a prerogative of the well-heeled, who take helicopters or pay to use the upper deck of two-tier highways to avoid the chaos below.

title: Adam Driver Takes the Wheel
description: Typically during filming, Adam Driver explained, cast and crew members receive a sheet of short descriptions of the days scenes  snippets like man argues with woman, man runs into road and the perhaps inevitable man gets hit by car.

title: Willa Kim, Designer of Fanciful Costumes, Dies at 99
description: Willa Kim, the petite and unfailingly elegant theatrical costume designer whose exuberant, sometimes over-the-top designs brought her two Tony Awards and a solid reputation for innovation in the dance world, died on Friday on Vashon Island, Wash. She was 99.

title: Megan Abbott on Her Favorite TV of 2016: Better Things
description: We asked some of this years notable authors, actors and showrunners about the TV they enjoyed most in 2016. Come back to Watching, The New York Timess TV and movie recommendation site, to read them all.

title: The Scope of Hate in 2016
description: How many hate crimes have been committed since the election? The short answer is, we dont know.

title: Trump Takes Credit for Sprint Plan to Add 5,000 Jobs in U.S.
description: President-elect Donald J. Trump took credit on Wednesday for a decision by Sprint to add 5,000 jobs in the United States as he tried to deliver on his promise to force corporate America to focus on job creation at home rather than abroad.

title: Restraint Can Wait
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: Voter Conversations:
description: A Trump backer and a Clinton supporter sit down in Colorado to try to bridge the voter divide.

title: Lets Talk: A Clinton and Trump Supporter Together in Colorado
description: FRUITA, Colo.  There was no screaming or insults when Anne Keller and Jason Brown sat down at a coffee shop to talk politics from opposite sides of a table. They didnt shout over each other like cable talking heads. They didnt fire off nasty tweets. One liberal, one conservative, talking and listening to each other while a fresh glaze of snow melted outside.

title: Trump Tower False Alarm Causes Real Evacuation, and Headache
description: Hundreds of suspicious packages in Midtown Manhattan were reported to the New York Police Department this year, but its response to one discovered at Trump Tower on Tuesday underscored the challenges and headaches that come with protecting the home of the president-elect.

title: Homeland Security Bribe Documents
description: A review by The New York Times of thousands of court records and internal agency documents showed that over the last 10 years more than 200 employees of the Department of Homeland Security have taken nearly $15 million in bribes while being paid to protect the nations borders and enforce immigration laws. Here are some of cases we have highlighted from that investigation.

title: The Enemy Within: Bribes Bore a Hole in the U.S. Border
description: WASHINGTON  In 2012, Joohoon David Lee, a federal Homeland Security agent in Los Angeles, was assigned to investigate the case of a Korean businessman accused of sex trafficking.

title: Greed Springs Eternal
description: Jonathan Chait catches Larry Kudlow praising the Orange One for choosing a cabinet of billionaires, because rich men are incorruptible  after all, they dont need even more money. As Chait says, this is ludicrous on its face; consider, for example, Russias oligarchs.

title: 1966: U.S. Admits Bombing Damaged Civilian Areas in North Vietnam
description: WASHINGTON  The Pentagon has acknowledged that civilian areas in North Vietnam have been damaged during U.S. air raids, but declared that only military targets had been scheduled for attack.

title: Text Messaging Takes More Apps Into a Chattier Realm
description: WHETHER its by iMessage, WhatsApp, Snapchat, or Facebooks Messenger or Instagram, we collectively send billions of text messages daily. This fast-paced method of communication has become so ingrained that other apps have borrowed the chat format for different purposes.

title: The xx Lets the Sunshine In
description: MARFA, Tex.  On a mid-October night, a few dozen people clustered near one end of the Lost Horse Saloon here: a small video crew, some Texas locals and tourists including visitors from New York City like me. Deer heads and skulls gazed down from the walls; a sign announced Open Mic Night.

title: Chief of Dentsu, Japanese Ad Agency, to Resign Over Employees Suicide
description: TOKYO  In the months before she jumped to her death from a company dormitory last Christmas, a young employee at a Japanese advertising agency told friends on Twitter of enduring harassment and grueling long hours on the job.

title: Shopping for Android Apps on the Web
description: Q. I sometimes look at apps on the Google Play website with my computer. When I am on an app description page, it sometimes says the app is not compatible with my device, and sometimes the page incorrectly says I dont have any devices. Where does it get this information?

title: A Sydney Resident Shows Beach Trashed By Revelers
description: Cyn Coco said she filled more than a dozen garbage bags with trash after thousands of Christmas revelers in Australia celebrated on suburban Coogee Beach.

title: Kerry Rebukes Israel, Calling Settlements a Threat to Peace
description: WASHINGTON  Secretary of State John Kerry accused Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel on Wednesday of thwarting peace in the Middle East, speaking with a clarity and harshness almost never heard from American diplomats when discussing one of their closest and strongest allies.

title: Daily Report: A New Approach to Clean Technology
description: One of the biggest crazes consuming Silicon Valley entrepreneurs and venture capitalists late in the last decade was clean technology, the kinds of technologies that would cut down on pollutants and dirty fuels.

title: Berlin Cancels Rare Show of Modern Art from Tehran Museum
description: An exhibition in Berlin of artworks from the Tehran Museum of Contemporary Art was canceled after the museum authority in Berlin said Iran had not granted export permits for any of the works to be shipped to Germany. The Tehran Museums collection of Western modern art is widely considered to be the most important outside of North America and Europe, and this was the first time that a show of these works was to be staged outside of Iran.

title: The Restless Quest for a Good Nights Sleep
description: If you are reading this at 3 a.m., chances are that James Proud wants to put you in a deep slumber.

title: She Lost Years to Addiction and Depression. Now 54, She Has Work to Do
description: At a time when Robin Thompson said she should have been at home being an attentive mother, she was hanging out with the itinerant father of her three children on neighborhood exploits.

title: As the Carnegie Deli Serves Its Last Pastrami on Rye
description: To the Editor:

title: That Broadway Baby, Now in In Transit
description: When Margo Seibert joined the cast of the Broadway show In Transit this past fall and learned that the script called for an infant, she knew whod be perfect for the part: the theater veteran Twan Baker.

title: Hester Street to Be Adapted for the Stage
description: The playwright Sharyn Rothstein is writing a stage adaptation of the 1975 film Hester Street, which starred Carol Kane in a breakout Oscar-nominated performance and is the latest in a wave of classic films to move to the stage.

title: How to Have a Mindful New Years Kiss
description: A kiss can be a blissful and heartfelt connector, a reminder about who and what matters most. A mindful kiss can make time stand still. Whether youre with a long time partner or a new friend, allow yourself to be in it for all of the beauty and connection that a kiss holds.  JoAnna Harper, Los Angeles-based Guiding Teacher, Against the Stream Buddhist Meditation Society.

title: Review: In Travelers, Some Serious Time-Sharing
description: Proposed slogan for a substantial chunk of television in 2016: Better Living Through Time Travel. Everywhere you looked last year, characters were jumping about in time, generally hoping to improve their own lot or the worlds, and generally failing.

title: A Terrapin From Connecticut Gets Her Shot at UConn
description: Kiah Gillespie grew up in the shadow of the countrys most dominant womens basketball program but commanded her own spotlight by becoming the best high school girls player in Connecticut.

title: John Kerry, Israel, Dentsu: Your Morning Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: A Year When Death Loomed in the Laughter
description: In 2016, death killed.

title: Suffolk County Opioid Deaths
description: Fentanyl, an anesthetic commonly used for surgery, has surpassed heroin to become the deadliest drug on Long Island. In Suffolk County, it has killed at least 126 people in 2016, according to records compiled by the medical examiner.

title: Fentanyl Outpaces Heroin as the Deadliest Drug on Long Island
description: An anesthetic commonly used for surgery has surpassed heroin to become the deadliest drug on Long Island, killing at least 220 people there in 2016, according to medical examiners records.

title: Nassau County Opioid Deaths
description: Fentanyl, an anesthetic commonly used for surgery, has surpassed heroin to become the deadliest drug on Long Island. In Nassau County, it killed at least 39 people in 2016, according to records compiled by the medical examiner.

title: Record Overdoses Expected in New York City
description: In New York City, more than 1,000 people are expected to die from drug overdoses in 2016  the first recorded four-digit death total in city history, according to statistics compiled by the Department of Health and Mental Hygiene. Nearly half of all unintentional drug overdose deaths in the city since July have involved fentanyl, the health department said.

title: $1,150,000 Homes in Georgia, California and Washington State
description: ATLANTA

title: What You Get for ... $1,150,000
description: A 1920s house in Atlanta, a contemporary in Topanga, Calif., and a lakeside condominium in Seattle.

description: We asked some of this years notable authors, actors and showrunners about the TV they enjoyed most in 2016. Their responses will run over the next two weeks. Come back to Watching, The New York Timess TV and movie recommendation site, to read them all.

description: There is no shortage of neutral foundations and lipsticks on the market, but for many shoppers, finding just the right nude is still a challenge.

description: Some of the best street style moments captured by our photographers in 2016.

description: Ambitious creators and binge-ready releases have turned series television into a medium of sprawling stories that stretch across entire seasons, or longer. But the fundamental TV unit is still the episode.

title: Obama and the Arctic Refuge

title: The Best Street Style Looks of 2016
description: Throughout the year, as the fashion tribe migrates from New York to London to Milan and Paris, and then repeats that same process six months later, many of the most eye-catching looks are found not only on the runways, but also on the streets outside. Some are worn by familiar faces, like Anna Dello Russo and Giovanna Engelbert, but others are donned by relative unknowns, all hoping to grab the attention of the ever-present photographers and perhaps become a street style star.

title: Stephen Petronio Company Buys a New Home in the Catskills
description: The Stephen Petronio Company, which has spent the last year fund-raising for a permanent home for its nascent choreographic residency program, has bought a 175-acre property in the Catskill Mountains.
