title: Pop Quiz: Do You Know the Biggest Songs of 2016?
description: The years pop hits have been streamed hundreds of millions of times: Can you name them?

title: A Flashback to My Soviet Childhood
description: EAST WINDSOR, N.J.  The gas masks given to me and other Soviet first graders in 1987 were hand-me-downs from World War II, made of stiff rubber and too big for our faces. They trapped moisture and reduced the world to two blurry circles bouncing in front of my face. Our teacher didnt tell us about the gas mask drill ahead of time  she simply handed out the masks, and we blindly paraded around the school before going back to our lessons. None of us bothered to ask why we were training. There was no need.

title: Dutch Fertility Clinic Investigates Possible Sperm Mix-Up
description: AMSTERDAM  Twenty-six couples in the Netherlands are waiting to find out if the sperm that was used to fertilize their eggs at a reproductive technology clinic might have come from the wrong men.

title: Israeli Mystery of Lost Babies Gets New Chapter: 200,000 Secret Records
description: JERUSALEM  Some Israeli families received army call-up papers and voter registration notices for children who had been declared dead as babies. Many others were never given an official cause of death by health officials, never saw the bodies of their infants and were never able to locate their graves.

title: The Modern Love Podcast: Emmy Rossum Reads A Millennials Guide to Kissing
description: On this weeks podcast, were reprising the actress Emmy Rossums reading of A Millennials Guide to Kissing.

title: Online Petitions Take Citizen Participation to New Levels. But Do They Work?
description: Online petitions are all over the place.

title: Watch These Movies Before They Leave HBO on Dec. 31
description: At the end of every month, movies and TV shows expire from various streaming services. Here are the most interesting titles leaving HBO at the end of December.

title: A Brothers Crimes and a Sisters Betrayal Make Judas a Dutch Best Seller
description: AMSTERDAM  When he read the 40-page sample of Astrid Holleeders memoir, Judas, in the spring, the Dutch publisher Oscar van Gelderen said he knew he had sensational material in his hands.

title: 5 New Years Resolutions You Can Buy
description: These cool new products and collections will make sticking to your resolutions a little less daunting.

title: A Mens Wear Store Made for Men
description: The fact that mens interest in fashion is now taken as a given, not a rare treat, cuts both ways. On the one hand, it is no longer easy to condescend to a consumer who has curiosity, access to information and capital. But a different sort of condescension has replaced the old one: selling mildly glamorous versions of the old unglamorous garments, and passing it off as an achievement all the way around.

title: For Heart Health, the Most Dangerous Time of the Year
description: The rate of heart attack increases during the holiday season, but not just because of cold weather or the exertions of snow shoveling.

title: Franois Hollande Pardons French Woman Who Killed Abusive Husband
description: PARIS  In an unexpected move, President Franois Hollande of France granted a full pardon on Wednesday to a woman who had been sentenced to prison for murdering her husband after decades of domestic abuse.

title: 10 Engaging Proposals, From the Rooftop to the Subway
description: Will you marry me?

title: A Bullet Could Hit Me and My Kids Anytime
description: For thousands of children in Chicago, walking to school can be treacherous. One father, Victor Bloomingberg, explains why.

title: Times Staff Member Gets All Choked Up
description: Times Insider shares historic insights from The New York Times.

title: Taking Fish Oil During Pregnancy Is Found to Lower Childs Asthma Risk
description: Women who took fish oil during the last three months of pregnancy significantly lowered the risk that their children would develop asthma, a study in Denmark has found.

title: Digitizing Radio Unnameable, a Free-Form 1960s Crossroads
description: When the counterculture swept through America in the 1960s, few places were closer to the action than the studios of WBAI in Manhattan, where Bob Fass manned the microphone at midnight for his show, Radio Unnameable.

title: Language at the Speed of Sight Fights to Reopen Our Closed Book on Literacy
description: A few weeks ago, while we were all looking the other way, the triennial survey comparing the worlds educational systems came out. For America, the news wasnt good. Math scores dropped, while reading numbers werent much different from last time. Neither finding puts us on course to lap Singapore anytime soon.

title: In Falsettos, an Affecting Echo of AIDS Anxiety
description: I felt like I had the wind knocked out of me, a sensation I had not experienced in decades  maybe even since I was a kid playing soccer (terribly).

title: Last-Minute New Years Eve Looks
description: Need a last-minute New Years Eve look? Head to the Armarium pop-up at the Plaza Hotel before the clock strikes 12. There, fashion fairy godmothers (a.k.a. Armarium stylists) have entrance-making options like a Sonia Rykiel sequin dress ($500 rental, $4,050 retail) and a gold Roberto Cavalli gown ($1,000 rental, $11,000 retail) at the ready. At 768 Fifth Avenue

title: In Hip-Hop, Inspiration Arrived by Way of Kirk Franklin
description: Kirk Franklin first came to crossover prominence in the mid-to-late 1990s as part of the first wave of gospel artists to take the sound and attitude of hip-hop seriously and incorporate them into their work. During that era, those worlds seemed to be miles apart. But time has a way of softening all barriers, and of late, the gospel impulse has firmly entrenched itself into hip-hops mainstream.

title: Melina Matsoukas Touched Nerves From Behind the Camera
description: We take music videos for granted. In about 35 years, theyve gone from an alleged scourge on the musical imagination to a form of oxygen. Every so often, one comes along that touches a nerve or causes a scandal. Back in February, on the eve of the Super Bowl, Formation stopped the nation. It was another Beyonc sneak attack, but also a statement piece and a work of art. And for a month, the intent of its imagery  Beyonc atop a sinking New Orleans Police Department cruiser; the witchiness of her wide-brimmed hat and her seemingly spiritually possessed head bob on the porch of a manse; a young black boy dancing before a phalanx of militarized cops  was deconstructed, debated and defended.

title: Wadada Leo Smith, Raising Issues With a Horn
description: The trumpeter and composer Wadada Leo Smith made not one but two of this years standout jazz releases. Americas National Parks, a suite on two discs, features his Golden Quintet, made up of longtime associates like the pianist Anthony Davis and the drummer Pheeroan akLaff. A Cosmic Rhythm With Each Stroke is a duo session with another colleague, the pianist Vijay Iyer, inspired by the art of the Indian modernist Nasreen Mohamedi.

title: How Toni Erdmann Became an Unexpected Comedy
description: PARIS  The German director Maren Ades breakout film, Toni Erdmann, has won over audiences and racked up awards across Europe. An uncharacterizable father-daughter story thats also about neoliberal economic reforms in Romania and the clash between the generation of 1968 and its capitalist children, the film is exceptional for another reason: Its hilarious.

title: Obama Designates Two New National Monuments, Protecting 1.65 Million Acres
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama designated two new national monuments on Wednesday, protecting 1.35 million acres of federal land surrounding the Bears Ears Buttes in southeastern Utah and about 300,000 acres around Gold Butte in Nevada, northeast of Las Vegas.

title: On Small Screens at Years End: Weird Stuff Worth a Look
description: Its the busy holiday season, so of course you havent had time to keep up with the weird, the obscure and the underappreciated in the small-screen-viewing universe. Here are a few things that have caught my roving eye lately, if youre feeling adventurous:

title: Cable News Networks Have Banner Year in 2016
description: For cable television stalwarts like TBS, ESPN, Discovery and Univision, 2016 was not a great year. Cord cutting remained a threat as viewership totals declined by double digits on a percentage basis, and the ratings for programs, including scripted dramas and sports, on cable and broadcast TV proved, yet again, that fewer people are watching live.

title: Carrie Fisher, Trump, Israel: Your Wednesday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Lella Vignelli, a Designer With a Spare, Elegant Style, Dies at 82
description: Lella Vignelli, a designer who, with her husband, Massimo Vignelli, introduced a spare, elegant style to a wide range of products and corporate brands, attracting an international clientele, died on Dec. 22 at her home in Manhattan. She was 82.

title: Celtics and Grizzlies Are Good. In This N.B.A., Thats a Problem.
description: BOSTON  Isaiah Thomas, the starting point guard for the Boston Celtics, was ice skating with his young children on Monday when he learned that he had been named the N.B.A.s Eastern Conference player of the week. His father, he said, had texted him to share the news.

title: Hans Tietmeyer, Banker Who Led German Transition to Euro, Dies at 85
description: FRANKFURT  Hans Tietmeyer, the central banker who led Germanys transition from the deutsche mark to the euro despite reservations about a single European currency, died on Tuesday. He was 85.

title: With Star, Lee Daniels Tries to Expand an Empire
description: DOUGLASVILLE, Ga.  Caliente! the director Lee Daniels howled toward Naomi Campbell, across the waiting room of a decommissioned county jail. Wonderful, Naomi, wonderful  I love it!

title: When Finding the Right Lawyer Seems Daunting, Crowdsource One
description: To resolve a legal dispute, the first thing many do is try to hire a lawyer. Too often, that is easier said than done.

title: Video Blogger Who Tested Singapores Limits Seeks U.S. Asylum
description: Americans who identify with President-elect Donald J. Trumps message of anti-political correctness may have a new, unlikely ally: a Singaporean teenager who is seeking asylum in the United States and calls himself a poster boy for free speech.

title: A Long Wait for the Second Avenue Subway, but Worth It
description: Construction workers who dug the tunnels. Leaders who pushed for funding. East Siders who yearned for an easier commute.

title: Alphonse Mouzon, Jazz and Fusion Drummer, Dies at 68
description: Alphonse Mouzon, a powerful jazz drummer who made his greatest contributions with a funk backbeat, forging a standard for 1970s fusion, died on Dec. 25 at his home in the Granada Hills neighborhood of Los Angeles. He was 68.

title: This Weeks Movies: Dec. 29, 2016
description: The New York Times film critics review Paterson, 20th Century Women and  Julieta.

title: 2016: The Year in Visual Stories and Graphics
description: Selected Times graphics, visualizations and multimedia stories from 2016.

title: Carrie Fisher Put Pen and Voice in Service of Bipolar Pride
description: She was all there, all the time: exuberant in describing her mania, savage and tender when recalling her despair.

title: 20 Nickels Exactly at the Automat
description: Dear Diary:

title: 85-Year-Old Marathoner Is So Fast That Even Scientists Marvel
description: MILTON, Ontario  It was a day for talking, not running. Snow was piled along the streets. The driveway was icy. Ed Whitlocks shoulder hurt. His face had been puffy. He did not feel well enough for the cemetery.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: Its essentially the serial killer of drugs. Its not something you can use for any kind of duration and survive.

title: Religious Police Officers in New York Will Be Able to Wear Beards and Turbans
description: In a nod to the growing number of South Asian Sikhs in New York City, the Police Department said on Wednesday that it would allow officers who belong to the religion to wear beards and turbans while in uniform  as long as the turbans are blue.

title: Vesna Vulovic, Flight Attendant Who Survived Jetliner Blast, Dies at 66
description: Vesna Vulovic, a flight attendant who alone, and miraculously, survived the midair explosion of a jetliner over Czechoslovakia in 1972 after plummeting thousands of feet onto a snowy hill, was reported dead on Saturday in Belgrade. She was 66.

title: As Chinas Largest Freshwater Lake Shrinks, Solution Faces Criticism
description: HONG KONG  Long celebrated as Chinas largest freshwater lake, Poyang reaches more than three times the expanse of Los Angeles in the summer wet season. It is home to the rare Yangtze finless porpoise, and its mud flats are the primary winter feeding grounds for thousands of birds that fly south each autumn to escape Siberias chill, including the critically endangered Siberian crane.

title: Tillerson Led Exxons Shift on Climate Change; Some Say It Was All P.R.
description: In January 2009, Rex W. Tillerson, the chief executive of Exxon Mobil, gave a speech in Washington that might have seemed impossible even a few years before. He announced that his company supported a carbon tax to help fight climate change.

title: Kerrys Blunt Words for Israel Denounced by Lawmakers in Both Parties
description: Secretary of State John Kerrys rebuke of the Israeli government on Wednesday set off a wave of criticism from lawmakers in both parties. Republicans denounced what they said was the Obama administrations harsh treatment of a steadfast ally and Democrats signaled that they were uneasy with Mr. Kerrys pressure on Israel, even as they praised the effort to promote Middle East peace.

title: A Maple Leafs Museum and Man Cave, All in One Basement
description: TORONTO  It is a dark and rainy night when about a dozen members of the Conacher family descend the steps into Mike Wilsons basement.

title: Is Israel Abandoning a Two-State Solution?
description: Over the past week, differences between Israel and the United States have boiled over into a scalding diplomatic confrontation between these closest of allies. The dispute reflects not any change in American policy, but a dangerous evolution in Israeli policy, under the government of Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, away from an acceptance of a negotiated two-state resolution to Israels conflict with the Palestinians. The dispute also arises from Mr. Netanyahus lamentable practice of making his government a more nakedly partisan player in American politics than any foreign government in memory, save Russia.

title: The Honesty of Carrie Fisher
description: Oh, Carrie Fisher, gone way too soon. And now your mother, Debbie Reynolds. The startling loss this week of one of Hollywoods great mother-daughter pairs was another blow in an unnerving year. You could call it a Hollywood ending, if by that you mean one that is larger and weirder than real life, and that tugs mightily at strong emotions.

title: Debbie Reynolds, Wholesome Ingnue in 1950s Films, Dies at 84
description: Debbie Reynolds, the wholesome ingnue in 1950s films like Singin in the Rain and Tammy and the Bachelor, died on Wednesday, a day after the death of her daughter, the actress Carrie Fisher. She was 84.

title: Edwin Goldwasser, Physicist Who Co-Founded Fermilab, Dies at 97
description: Edwin Goldwasser, a physicist who co-founded the Fermi National Accelerator Laboratory in Batavia, Ill., and helped build one of the worlds most powerful particle accelerators, died on Dec. 14 at his home in Urbana, Ill. He was 97.

title: As Chicago Murder Rate Spikes, Many Fear Violence Has Become Normalized
description: CHICAGO  The nations third-largest city will end 2016 with a surging murder rate, a demoralized and distrusted police force and a weary populace that has become inured to daily reports of shootings.

title: In John Kerrys Mideast Speech, a Clash of Policies and Personalities
description: JERUSALEM  Even before Secretary of State John Kerry issued his scathing critique of Israeli policies on Wednesday, President-elect Donald J. Trump essentially told Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to ignore it.

title: Justin Jackson Carries Northwestern to Victory in Pinstripe Bowl
description: Northwestern running back Justin Jackson was so difficult to tackle in the Wildcats 31-24 victory over Pittsburgh in the Pinstripe Bowl on Wednesday that he was asked afterward if he might reconsider his decision to return for his last year of college eligibility.

title: This Puzzles Subject
description: THURSDAY PUZZLE  The royal family in Britain has a lot more to remember than just who last wore the crown jewels. On top of everything else, they are saddled with a slew of honorary titles that would give anyones memory a run for its money.

title: Bibi Netanyahu Makes Trump His Chump
description: For those of you confused over the latest fight between President Obama and Prime Minister Bibi Netanyahu of Israel, let me make it simple: Barack Obama and John Kerry admire and want to preserve Israel as a Jewish and democratic state in the Land of Israel. I have covered this issue my entire adult life and have never met two U.S. leaders more committed to Israel as a Jewish democracy.

title: Debbie Reynoldss Fans Join Celebrities in Mourning Actresss Death
description: Celebrities and fans went on Twitter in an outpouring of grief on Wednesday after Debbie Reynolds died one day after the death of Carrie Fisher, her daughter and fellow actress.

title: Watch Debbie Reynolds in Her Greatest Roles
description: Debbie Reynolds, who died on Wednesday at 84, had a career that started during the golden age of movie musicals and continued through the seen-it-all present. Here is a look at six notable films for which Ms. Reynolds will be remembered.

title: Debbie Reynolds, Wholesome Ingnue in 1950s Films, Dies at 84
description: Scenes from a career and life of a renowned actress.

title: Bid for Access to Amazon Echo Audio in Murder Case Raises Privacy Concerns
description: In a move that promises to raise new questions about electronic privacy, detectives investigating a murder in Arkansas are seeking access to audio that may have been recorded on an Amazon Echo electronic personal assistant.

title: Trump Weighs Letting Veterans Opt Out of V.A. Medical Care
description: WEST PALM BEACH, Fla.  President-elect Donald J. Trump is considering a plan to allow military veterans to opt out of medical care at Veterans Affairs hospitals and instead see private doctors of their choosing, a senior transition official told reporters here on Wednesday.

title: Ed Reinecke, Lieutenant Governor Ensnared by Watergate, Dies at 92
description: Ed Reinecke, a former California congressman and lieutenant governor under Ronald Reagan whose political career was derailed by a 1974 perjury conviction in a case pressed by a Watergate prosecutor, died on Saturday in Laguna Hills, Calif. He was 92.

title: U.S. Womens National Team Fires Its Unions Leader
description: The union for the United States womens national team abruptly dismissed its general counsel on Wednesday, announcing the decision in a curt news release three days before its collective bargaining agreement with U.S. Soccer was scheduled to end.

title: Corrections: December 29, 2016
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Alaska, Reliant on Air Transit, Faces Pilot Shortage. Are Drones an Answer?
description: FAIRBANKS, Alaska  Never climb into an airplane cockpit in winter without your best military-grade arctic boots, rated to minus 60 degrees Fahrenheit. Green, cocky pilots fresh from the lower 48 tend to forget that rule just once. Knowing when not to climb aboard the plane at all is harder, and comes only with deeper experience.

title: Debbie Reynolds, Israel, Jacqueline Sauvage: Your Thursday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: With Carmelo Anthony Ejected, Knicks Show Defensive Grit but Fall in Overtime
description: ATLANTA  There were a number of pronouncements this week that the Knicks needed to be more assertive and defensive. And after Carmelo Anthony asserted himself with an elbow that got him ejected on Wednesday night, it became all the more necessary for the Knicks to play better defense.

title: Whats on TV Thursday: Carrie Fisher in Star Wars: The Force Awakens
description: Remember the Star Wars star Carrie Fisher, who died on Tuesday at 60, by revisiting Episode VII of the franchise, The Force Awakens, on Starz. And laugh your way through the IFC series Comedy Bang! Bang!, whose fifth season is now on Netflix.

title: Debbie Reynolds: Americas Sweetheart
description: The actress died after suffering a stroke on Wednesday, a day after her daughter Carrie Fisher's death.

title: Genocides Legacy: Its True, the Germans Killed Us
description: More than 100 years after a genocide of the Herero people in Namibia, Germany is acknowledging its role. Listen to a Herero elder recounting the story he heard from his forefathers.

title: Germany Grapples With Its African Genocide
description: WATERBERG, Namibia  In this faraway corner of southern Africa, scores of German soldiers lie in a military cemetery, their names, dates and details engraved on separate polished tombstones.

title: How China Built iPhone City With Billions in Perks for Apples Partner
description: ZHENGZHOU, China  A vast, boxy customs center acts as a busy island of commerce deep in central China.

title: An iPhones Journey, From the Factory Floor to the Retail Store
description: The iPhone is Apples most profitable and best-selling product. More than a billion have been sold since the first one was released.

title: The Devotion of an Old-Fashioned Doctor in Romania
description: Iona Moldovan photographed the daily life of a family doctor in rural southwestern Romania.

title: Years End Quiz
description: Lets take a look back on 2016 and see how much of the silliness you remember.

title: Can Donald Trump Hire Ivanka Trump?
description: Donald J. Trumps daughter Ivanka and her husband, Jared Kushner, are said to be  interested in working in the White House  and the president-elect is looking for a way to have them. There are rumors that Mr. Kushner may work out of the West Wing, including advising the president on foreign policy, while Ms. Trump may host White House events and play a role in policies affecting working mothers.

title: A Peek Inside the Strange World of Fake Academia
description: The caller ID on my office telephone said the number was from Las Vegas, but when I picked up the receiver I heard what sounded like a busy overseas call center in the background. The operator, John, asked if I would be interested in attending the 15th World Cardiology and Angiology Conference in Philadelphia next month.

title: Does Empathy Guide or Hinder Moral Action?
The Devotion of an Old-Fashioned Doctor in Romania
description: As a little girl, Ioana Moldovan eagerly awaited her vacations at her grandfathers house in southwestern Transylvania. He lived in a steel mill town, where he raised rows of tomatoes, cucumbers, strawberries, cranberries and cherries, which Ms. Moldovan would eat directly from the trees. While her grandfather, Ion Ciugudean, did not talk much about his work as a radiologist, he did seem to know everyone in the village. Whenever he would go to the market, shopkeepers and customers would say hello and treat him with the same respect he treated his patients.

title: China Warmly Welcomes a Giant Rooster With Trumpian Characteristics
description: HONG KONG  President-elect Donald J. Trumps golden quiff, bushy eyebrows and preening gestures were immortalized this week in China  though perhaps not in a way that he would like.

title: Letter of Recommendation: Not Breathing
description: A few years ago I went snorkeling with my sister, and she startled a sea lion. Rather, I was snorkeling, and my sister was free diving  that is, diving much deeper, and holding her breath much longer. She had swum down to the ocean floor to inspect something, and as she glided up from the depths, the sea lion approached from out in the hazy blue. It was moving casually, but casual for a waterborne marine creature is still pretty fast. When it finally noticed my sister cruising through a space where humans normally are not, it pulled up, coming to a sudden halt, vertical in the water. The sea lion looked amazed and delighted  at least, thats how it looked to me, looking at my sister  and at that moment, the thing I wanted most in the world was to learn how to hold my breath and dive deep long enough so that I might also startle and amaze someone, or something, like a sea lion.

title: Judge John Hodgman on Forced Friendships
description: Taylor writes: I believe that my roommate Zoe and I could be friends. But even though she lives in my house, I dont know how to approach her. Its a big house, and we live at opposite ends. Still, she seems cool and Id like to get to know her better. I think she would be more convinced if you told her to give it a try. Please order Zoe to be my friend.

title: The Evangelical Scion Who Stopped Believing
description: One morning in the summer of 2011 Bart Campolo left his house in Cincinnati for a long bicycle ride. Goateed and bald, but still trim and fit at 48, Campolo was the envy of his generation of evangelical pastors. That morning, Campolo was, as usual, a little self-conscious about his attire. I feel ridiculous in my spandex, he says. Years of pickup basketball had wrecked his ankles, leaving regular bicycle treks as his only form of exercise. But he was excited to do 30 or 40 miles through the rolling southern Ohio hills.

title: On Your Way to Your New Years Self
description: Maybe you have some ideas about the new year, as I do, and youve dedicated substantial minutes considering what version of yourself youd like to cultivate in the coming months. You think youd like to eat better. To have more adventures. Take more risks. Maybe you are moving to Canada and want to learn to speak French. In any case, you resolve that you are going to wake up on New Years Day, invigorated by the fresh start laid out in front of you like new snow on a school morning, and make some serious tracks.

title: Far From the Laundromat, but Such a Bargain
description: Spencer Frank, who grew up primarily on the Upper East Side, left the city for four years at Syracuse University and later roomed with a friend in Midtown East. He rode the 4 or 5 train to his office in the financial district, where he works in mobile advertising technology.

title: 36 Hours in Amman, Jordan
description: Amman is often a pit stop on the way to Petra, but there are enough old and new flavors to keep visitors satisfied for a weekend.

title: The Biggest Digital Map of the Cosmos Ever Made
description: On the summit of Haleakala, a dormant volcano on the island of Maui in Hawaii, a telescope began clicking pictures of the night sky in 2010. Over the next four years, Pan-Starrs, short for Panoramic Survey Telescope and Rapid Response System, photographed the entire sky, as seen from Hawaii, 12 times in five colors of visible and infrared light.

title: De Blasio and Big City Mayors Try Pooling Their Power Against Trump
description: A year into his term, Mayor Bill de Blasio of New York City circulated a memo that made clear his desire to use a newly formed coalition of mayors, whose purpose was to push for immigration reform, to go further and nudge lawmakers in a progressive direction.

title: A Majority Agreed She Was Raped by a Stanford Football Player. That Wasnt Enough.
description: At Stanford University, in a conference room above a Starbucks and other shops, a panel of five gathered in June 2015 to decide whether a sexual assault had occurred on campus. Several months later, after a process marred by procedural errors, five different panelists convened to rule on the matter again.

title: London Rolls Out the Blood-Red Carpet for Kleptocrats
description: LONDON  Six years ago, the government of Kurmanbek Bakiyev nearly killed me. I remember it well, because it killed a man standing near me. It wasnt specifically me, or him, they were trying to kill. They were simply firing live rounds at protesters.

title: Shanghais Move to Curb International Programs in Schools Worries Parents
description: BEIJING  For the past two years, Wu Dongmeis 14-year-old son has been attending a private school in Shanghai that offers an international program that prepares students for higher education abroad. All had proceeded smoothly  until recently, she said.

description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: How to Have a Better Flight
description: Its no secret that flying these days can be a headache, with long security lines, delays and a growing list of pared-down amenities. While passengers dont have a say over most factors that can make flying unpleasant, there are ways for them to have a better experience, according to a flight attendant who has worked for a major United States airline for more than three decades who requested anonymity to protect her job. Here, she shares her insights:

title: An Orangutan Expert Says Now Is the Time to Visit Indonesia
description: It was the orangutans eyes that first struck Birut Mary Galdikas. They look very human, said Dr. Galdikas, an anthropologist and the president of Orangutan Foundation International. They have a very strong gaze that will penetrate you, she said. Its almost hypnotic.

description: With hippie staples, New Age tools and peaceful practices, the last 12 months have grounded us firmly into the earth.
